posts.title: Differences of Being in Love and Really Loving Someone: Are You Experiencing This?
posts.markdown:
**By [Kate Rae](http://katerae.wordpress.com)**  
 Ever since I was a little girl I wanted to be in love. I grew up on old romantic movies and novels, I couldn’t wait to ***fall***. So, when I got older I tried to fall in love…a lot and very quickly. I wanted novel-like love, fairy-tale love, a love like Hollywood portrays. I thought love was an obsession with someone, not a commitment to them.

My unhealthy addiction with a delusional and false portrayal of love stems from a childhood of wanting to be loved. From being severely bullied to coming from a divorced family, I quickly and mistakenly learned to believe I could not be loved and if someone did love me, I did not believe them. I still hoped a ‘perfect’ and crazy kind of love existed, just not for me. It took a lot of heartbreak and stupid choices for me to understand the differences of being in love and *really *loving someone.

I’m sharing this with you so you can connect with my humble journey of learning what it’s like to really love someone, to sacrifice an idea and a part of yourself to experience *real* love.

***Falling In Love.***

Oh, gosh. It’s so sweet isn’t it? The first stages of wooing someone or being wooed. The all-consuming thoughts, manic energy and the feeling that maybe and finally you have met *the one*.  All you can think about is this mysterious human being, it is all you want to talk about. You feel you could move mountains, or at least climb one. You want it right now, there is no time to waste.

Those feelings and emotions are overwhelming aren’t they? That first kiss that is brought to a halt due to a smile or a bashful giggle. You think to yourself, this person is everything I have ever wanted and I *need* them. Eventually, you come back to reality and realize this person too, has faults. They are not super-human, but just human.

*Owning *someone or at least wanting to own a part of them to make yourself temporarily happy, is not actually loving someone. Own yourself and your identity, and you won’t *need* anyone.

Falling ‘in love’ with someone is literally altering chemicals in your brain. In a matter of seconds after locking eyes with this person, your body starts to fall in love. In the first stages of being infatuated, all anyone talks about is how attractive the person they met is and you start to crave them like a drug. Hormones increase, pupils dilate, you become nauseous with anxiety just from thinking about them or the fact they just text you again…sound familiar?

Don’t let your body chemistry trick you, everyone eventually comes down and then you are left there…wondering if this person is *really* right for you. Enjoy falling in love, but know that eventually you will start to feel different or fall right out of love with that person.

***Loving Someone.***

This is a choice. Falling lead to real feeling and you chose to start a life with this wonderful person. By this point, you’ve met some of their flaws and probably have been annoyed with them a time or two, three, okay maybe four times. Loving this person means accepting them for their flaws and selflessly giving a part of yourself to them because you want them to be loved and for them to love you in return, despite your own issues.

Loving someone doesn’t mean you won’t experience thoughts of immense love you have for this person, it just becomes more realistic. It may be a fleeting thought or racing heart thinking to yourself “I can’t believe this person loves me the way that they do, no matter what.” To me, that’s better than an endless stream of wild what ifs and anxiety-filled nights.

You will never own someone you truly love, you won’t want to. You want them to feel free and better themselves on a daily basis, to be confident in you and themselves. Jealousy is natural, but obsessive and controlling behavior is not real love. Everyone goes through it and everyone is guilty of being obsessive at least once. I don’t care if you hide it, the point is… you still do it. When you actually love someone, you won’t feel the need to act like this.

It’s not a chemical romance, it is real. You don’t need the constant high to remind you that you love them, it’s just there. You aren’t really searching for happiness elsewhere, you are content. Every decision you make, every hardship you face, and when you just need someone to listen, they are always there. You know that no matter what, you will always and forever love them.

There is no battle, there is only **love. **  
**About the Author: **

[**Kate Rae**](http://katerae.wordpress.com) is an intuitive writer discussing the world of mental illness and how healthy living and a little humor can greatly improve your well being. Kate recently started an uplifting [**blog about anxiety**](http://katerae.wordpress.com), relationships, and holistic living that you can follow **[here](http://katerae.wordpress.com)**. Also her daily lifestyle can be followed on her instagram **[here](http://instagram.com/katerae222)**.
posts.html:
By Kate Rae
Ever since I was a little girl I wanted to be in love. I grew up on old romantic movies and novels, I couldn’t wait to fall. So, when I got older I tried to fall in love…a lot and very quickly. I wanted novel-like love, fairy-tale love, a love like Hollywood portrays. I thought love was an obsession with someone, not a commitment to them.

My unhealthy addiction with a delusional and false portrayal of love stems from a childhood of wanting to be loved. From being severely bullied to coming from a divorced family, I quickly and mistakenly learned to believe I could not be loved and if someone did love me, I did not believe them. I still hoped a ‘perfect’ and crazy kind of love existed, just not for me. It took a lot of heartbreak and stupid choices for me to understand the differences of being in love and *really *loving someone.

I’m sharing this with you so you can connect with my humble journey of learning what it’s like to really love someone, to sacrifice an idea and a part of yourself to experience real love.

Falling In Love.

Oh, gosh. It’s so sweet isn’t it? The first stages of wooing someone or being wooed. The all-consuming thoughts, manic energy and the feeling that maybe and finally you have met the one.  All you can think about is this mysterious human being, it is all you want to talk about. You feel you could move mountains, or at least climb one. You want it right now, there is no time to waste.

Those feelings and emotions are overwhelming aren’t they? That first kiss that is brought to a halt due to a smile or a bashful giggle. You think to yourself, this person is everything I have ever wanted and I need them. Eventually, you come back to reality and realize this person too, has faults. They are not super-human, but just human.

Owning *someone or at least wanting to own a part of them to make yourself temporarily happy, is not actually loving someone. Own yourself and your identity, and you won’t *need anyone.

Falling ‘in love’ with someone is literally altering chemicals in your brain. In a matter of seconds after locking eyes with this person, your body starts to fall in love. In the first stages of being infatuated, all anyone talks about is how attractive the person they met is and you start to crave them like a drug. Hormones increase, pupils dilate, you become nauseous with anxiety just from thinking about them or the fact they just text you again…sound familiar?

Don’t let your body chemistry trick you, everyone eventually comes down and then you are left there…wondering if this person is really right for you. Enjoy falling in love, but know that eventually you will start to feel different or fall right out of love with that person.

Loving Someone.

This is a choice. Falling lead to real feeling and you chose to start a life with this wonderful person. By this point, you’ve met some of their flaws and probably have been annoyed with them a time or two, three, okay maybe four times. Loving this person means accepting them for their flaws and selflessly giving a part of yourself to them because you want them to be loved and for them to love you in return, despite your own issues.

Loving someone doesn’t mean you won’t experience thoughts of immense love you have for this person, it just becomes more realistic. It may be a fleeting thought or racing heart thinking to yourself “I can’t believe this person loves me the way that they do, no matter what.” To me, that’s better than an endless stream of wild what ifs and anxiety-filled nights.

You will never own someone you truly love, you won’t want to. You want them to feel free and better themselves on a daily basis, to be confident in you and themselves. Jealousy is natural, but obsessive and controlling behavior is not real love. Everyone goes through it and everyone is guilty of being obsessive at least once. I don’t care if you hide it, the point is… you still do it. When you actually love someone, you won’t feel the need to act like this.

It’s not a chemical romance, it is real. You don’t need the constant high to remind you that you love them, it’s just there. You aren’t really searching for happiness elsewhere, you are content. Every decision you make, every hardship you face, and when you just need someone to listen, they are always there. You know that no matter what, you will always and forever love them.

There is no battle, there is only *love. *
*About the Author: *

Kate Rae is an intuitive writer discussing the world of mental illness and how healthy living and a little humor can greatly improve your well being. Kate recently started an uplifting blog about anxiety, relationships, and holistic living that you can follow here. Also her daily lifestyle can be followed on her instagram here.

posts.title: People React to Being Told They're Beautiful, Their Reaction Will Make You Cry
posts.markdown:
It’s the strangest phenomena to me, and I can admit that I am not outside of it.  I, generally-speaking, do not think that I am a very attractive person.  I boast of confidence and act as though not much bothers me, but that’s only because it’s easier to find happiness once you’ve accepted the reality of your life and start being yourself. Have you ever told someone that they’re beautiful?  I probably think it to myself at least a handful of times everyday when watching and interacting with the various people in my life, but I rarely ever voice it.  In both men and women I am able to look at them and find something attractive and beautiful about them. How could you not?  Every single person on this planet is a unique, beautiful, stunning, miraculous bundle of tissue, nerves and consciousness.  And while I (and I assume many others) am able to see the beauty inherent within every person, I’d venture to guess that most of us don’t view ourselves that way. An 18-year-old student from Chicago embarked on a high school project that would quickly become much larger than she had anticipated.  **[Shea Glover](https://www.instagram.com/gloverfull/)** invited students and teachers to pose for portraits; some of whom she knew, some of whom were total strangers. As these people were standing in front of her camera, she would tell them the purpose of the project: “I’m taking pictures of things I find beautiful.” The following video documented the beautiful, raw emotion that is expressed when people are caught a tiny bit off guard by being told they’re beautiful.  It is truly amazing the power that one word holds.  Watch and remember that you are just as beautiful as the next person, in your own, unique, perfect way.
![](http://images5.aplus.com/uc-up/411f2a0a-dede-475d-b91e-2e1656778695/411f2a0a-dede-475d-b91e-2e1656778695.inline_yes)**Photo credit: Shea Glover**
![](http://images5.aplus.com/uc-up/f84b813f-0302-4e9d-8fd7-7703be11767f/f84b813f-0302-4e9d-8fd7-7703be11767f.inline_yes)**Photo credit: Shea Glover**
![](http://images5.aplus.com/uc-up/2097d008-801d-4324-8c4c-72b0e539c6bf/2097d008-801d-4324-8c4c-72b0e539c6bf.inline_yes)**Photo credit: Shea Glover**
![](http://images5.aplus.com/uc-up/3585ee7a-99d2-41fb-97a6-eb6f0d9d0145/3585ee7a-99d2-41fb-97a6-eb6f0d9d0145.inline_yes)**Photo credit: Shea Glover**
![](http://images5.aplus.com/uc-up/4dbbd4d1-aba6-4b6e-a565-e1742aa43769/4dbbd4d1-aba6-4b6e-a565-e1742aa43769.inline_yes)**Photo credit: Shea Glover**

posts.title: 8 Reasons to Choose a Leo as Your Next Partner
posts.markdown: Ah, yes, **[the Leo](http://zodiac-signs-astrology.com/zodiac-signs/leo.htm)**.  The King of the Jungle.  What is there to say really?  Other than that they’re intelligent, kind, compassionate, handsome, beautiful, wise beings that know exactly how to love you right.  They’re full of personality and charm, and being a fire sign, are fiery and full of affection.  You’re lucky if you snag yourself a Leo, and here are eight reasons why: **A Leo will love you passionately – **Leos wear their hearts on their sleeves and long for the highs and lows that accompany a passionate romance.  A Leo will always leave you feeling loved and are one of the most passionate signs. **This passion is also exhibited in the bedroom – **Making love to a Leo is certainly an experience to remember.  Their passion comes out tenfold in the bedroom, leaving their partners breathless and eager for more.  Their playful nature might tease a bit, but you won’t mind. **The Leo will give you everything they can – **The Leo is one of the most generous signs of the Zodiac.  They want to spoil those special people in their lives.  They’re always there when you need support, whether it’s getting soup and supplies during a rough bout with the flu or just listening and giving advice during a tricky situation. **The Leo always goes after what it wants – **Leos often know what they want and are determined to obtain it.  This applies in all aspects of life, whether it’s seeking out a better job or a partner, they’ll do whatever it takes.  Their ambition will take them places. **Leos are faithful – **The Leo is both prideful and loyal, so once you’ve won over your lion, expect them to be completely devoted to you.  However, do not forget that they expect the same in return. **Leos are incredibly supportive – **Leos are your biggests fans.  Whatever you’re trying to do, they support it. **Leos expect a lot from their significant others – **Leos aren’t interested in people who aren’t themselves.  They’ll encourage you to be the best *you* that you can be; please do not interpret this as the Leo wanting to change you, it’s simply that they recognize your potential. **The Leo will always tell you how they feel – **The Leo will never be afraid to tell you how much you mean to them. So, if you haven’t already, do yourself a favor and find a Leo for your next partner, you won’t regret it.
posts.html:
Ah, yes, the Leo.  The King of the Jungle.  What is there to say really?  Other than that they’re intelligent, kind, compassionate, handsome, beautiful, wise beings that know exactly how to love you right.  They’re full of personality and charm, and being a fire sign, are fiery and full of affection.  You’re lucky if you snag yourself a Leo, and here are eight reasons why:

*A Leo will love you passionately – *Leos wear their hearts on their sleeves and long for the highs and lows that accompany a passionate romance.  A Leo will always leave you feeling loved and are one of the most passionate signs.

*This passion is also exhibited in the bedroom – *Making love to a Leo is certainly an experience to remember.  Their passion comes out tenfold in the bedroom, leaving their partners breathless and eager for more.  Their playful nature might tease a bit, but you won’t mind.

*The Leo will give you everything they can – *The Leo is one of the most generous signs of the Zodiac.  They want to spoil those special people in their lives.  They’re always there when you need support, whether it’s getting soup and supplies during a rough bout with the flu or just listening and giving advice during a tricky situation.

*The Leo always goes after what it wants – *Leos often know what they want and are determined to obtain it.  This applies in all aspects of life, whether it’s seeking out a better job or a partner, they’ll do whatever it takes.  Their ambition will take them places.

*Leos are faithful – *The Leo is both prideful and loyal, so once you’ve won over your lion, expect them to be completely devoted to you.  However, do not forget that they expect the same in return.

*Leos are incredibly supportive – *Leos are your biggests fans.  Whatever you’re trying to do, they support it.

*Leos expect a lot from their significant others – *Leos aren’t interested in people who aren’t themselves.  They’ll encourage you to be the best you that you can be; please do not interpret this as the Leo wanting to change you, it’s simply that they recognize your potential.

*The Leo will always tell you how they feel – *The Leo will never be afraid to tell you how much you mean to them.

So, if you haven’t already, do yourself a favor and find a Leo for your next partner, you won’t regret it.

posts.title: 5 Things That Happen When You Become a Lightworker
posts.markdown: Are you a lightworker?  You might be one without even knowing it.  A lightworker is a being who has dedicated itself to the growth and promotion of the inner presence and awareness in the self and in others.  They are advocates of healing, and like to think that they are capable of detecting healing energies.  They oftentimes have had some form of spiritual awakening, be it in this life or a past life. These people will come off as having a heart of gold; they’re full of warmth and love.  Here are five things that happen when you become a lightworker: **Your empathy becomes empowered – **While everyone in the world demonstrates some level of empathy, certain individuals are inherently more empathetic than others.  Lightworkers are those who have an incredible sense of empathy toward others.  They are more capable when it comes to detecting emotions in others, as it is part of their yearning to heal those who are damaged. **You lose conformity – **You become indifferent toward the labels that people give you.  Rather than subscribe to any one social identity, lightworkers do not feel the need to label the aspects of their lives.  You don’t dress like a certain group of people, you don’t act in a certain way to give off a certain message; even racial and sexual identities fall away.  You simply exist in your being. **You feel on a deeper level – **The world of a lightworker is fraught with emotion and feeling.  They are empaths in a very true sense of the word: they are capable of fully experiencing what others are feeling as if you had somehow become that person in that moment.   **People become drawn to you – **Lightworkers are beacons of light in a world full of dark.  People are attracted to them because of the way light emanates from them.  It’s easy to spot a lightworker because they’ll come off as an old friend; someone that’s known you for years. **You do not fear death – **Lightworkers lack a fear of death, as they understand that death has it’s place in the world, just as everything else does.  It is inevitable and natural.
posts.html:
Are you a lightworker?  You might be one without even knowing it.  A lightworker is a being who has dedicated itself to the growth and promotion of the inner presence and awareness in the self and in others.  They are advocates of healing, and like to think that they are capable of detecting healing energies.  They oftentimes have had some form of spiritual awakening, be it in this life or a past life.

These people will come off as having a heart of gold; they’re full of warmth and love.  Here are five things that happen when you become a lightworker:

*Your empathy becomes empowered – *While everyone in the world demonstrates some level of empathy, certain individuals are inherently more empathetic than others.  Lightworkers are those who have an incredible sense of empathy toward others.  They are more capable when it comes to detecting emotions in others, as it is part of their yearning to heal those who are damaged.

*You lose conformity – *You become indifferent toward the labels that people give you.  Rather than subscribe to any one social identity, lightworkers do not feel the need to label the aspects of their lives.  You don’t dress like a certain group of people, you don’t act in a certain way to give off a certain message; even racial and sexual identities fall away.  You simply exist in your being.

*You feel on a deeper level – *The world of a lightworker is fraught with emotion and feeling.  They are empaths in a very true sense of the word: they are capable of fully experiencing what others are feeling as if you had somehow become that person in that moment.  

*People become drawn to you – *Lightworkers are beacons of light in a world full of dark.  People are attracted to them because of the way light emanates from them.  It’s easy to spot a lightworker because they’ll come off as an old friend; someone that’s known you for years.

*You do not fear death – *Lightworkers lack a fear of death, as they understand that death has it’s place in the world, just as everything else does.  It is inevitable and natural.

posts.title: 5 Laws of Karma
posts.markdown: The Laws of **[Karma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karma)** can viewed as the Buddhist and Hindu version of the Golden Rule, which is basically that you should do unto others as you would have them do unto you.  This Golden Rule is stated by practically every religion in the world, as it teaches us that we are responsible for our actions.   Buddhism goes a bit further, incorporating intention and thought, as well as spoken word and action.  Everything we feel, say, do, and every choice we make ripples through time, and these choices are our karma, whether they be good or bad.  Check out these five Laws of Karma: **Law of Neutrality – **In the same way that gravity acts as neutral and constant force, the Laws of Karma apply to all beings equally, without exception.  It exists without favorite ones, without cursed ones; there are only the divine beings manifested by the Creator, and all of these beings are loved and cared for equally, deeply, and completely. **Law of Lessons – **When we **[reincarnate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reincarnation)** we do so to learn what is and is not like love.  When moving through worlds of duality, we learn from experiencing the extreme opposites: good-bad, problem-solution, etc. until we are able to evolve into **[divine love](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_of_God)**, joy and awareness.  One walks the divine circle until their lessons are learned. **Law of Balance – **The objective in learning lessons is to achieve a sense of balance.  Imbalances are what drive your personal cycle of reincarnation.  For example, whatever you bring hate to, is what you reincarnate to, so that you might have the opportunity to achieve balance.  Because you can only truly understand a thing when you become that thing; ceasing judgement and the harboring of unrealistic expectations. **Law of Expansion – **Because everything in the universe is energy, the universe is constantly expanding from lower to higher vibrational levels.  And due to this constant expansion, change and growth are all but certain.  The universe grows by weaving its way through chaos, reorganization, and order in one long endless cycle of change and growth, executed in hopes of continuous improvement. **Law of Love – **Karma comes full circle with love.  The entire purpose of Karma is to propel your soul on a personal journey of reincarnation through the universe, eventually bringing all of us into a state of divine love, joy and awareness.  Karma ceases when you have perfected your ability to love unconditionally.
posts.html:
The Laws of Karma can viewed as the Buddhist and Hindu version of the Golden Rule, which is basically that you should do unto others as you would have them do unto you.  This Golden Rule is stated by practically every religion in the world, as it teaches us that we are responsible for our actions.  

Buddhism goes a bit further, incorporating intention and thought, as well as spoken word and action.  Everything we feel, say, do, and every choice we make ripples through time, and these choices are our karma, whether they be good or bad.  Check out these five Laws of Karma:

*Law of Neutrality – *In the same way that gravity acts as neutral and constant force, the Laws of Karma apply to all beings equally, without exception.  It exists without favorite ones, without cursed ones; there are only the divine beings manifested by the Creator, and all of these beings are loved and cared for equally, deeply, and completely.

Law of Lessons – *When we *reincarnate we do so to learn what is and is not like love.  When moving through worlds of duality, we learn from experiencing the extreme opposites: good-bad, problem-solution, etc. until we are able to evolve into divine love, joy and awareness.  One walks the divine circle until their lessons are learned.

*Law of Balance – *The objective in learning lessons is to achieve a sense of balance.  Imbalances are what drive your personal cycle of reincarnation.  For example, whatever you bring hate to, is what you reincarnate to, so that you might have the opportunity to achieve balance.  Because you can only truly understand a thing when you become that thing; ceasing judgement and the harboring of unrealistic expectations.

*Law of Expansion – *Because everything in the universe is energy, the universe is constantly expanding from lower to higher vibrational levels.  And due to this constant expansion, change and growth are all but certain.  The universe grows by weaving its way through chaos, reorganization, and order in one long endless cycle of change and growth, executed in hopes of continuous improvement.

*Law of Love – *Karma comes full circle with love.  The entire purpose of Karma is to propel your soul on a personal journey of reincarnation through the universe, eventually bringing all of us into a state of divine love, joy and awareness.  Karma ceases when you have perfected your ability to love unconditionally.

posts.title: Soulmate or Life Partner, Do You Know the Difference?
posts.markdown: **[Longing to find one’s soulmate](http://foreverconscious.com/why-do-we-seek-companionship)** is often the tale of many Disney films, romantic films, and fairy tales.  But the idea is so inherently good-natured and lovable.  Doesn’t everyone like to think that there is one person out there who is just absolutely perfect for them in every way?  It’s what keeps many of us chasing after true love, even after our hearts have been broken over and over again. What is a soulmate, though?  According to **[ForeverConscious](http://foreverconscious.com/the-difference-between-soulmates-and-life-partners)**, a soulmate is one who is aligned with your soul and is sent to challenge, awaken and stir different parts of your in order for your soul to transcend to higher levels of consciousness and awareness, and once the lesson has been learned, the two beings physically separate. A life partner is a companion and friend, a stable person who you can always rely on, trust, and depend on to help you through the trials of life.  You share a mutual love and respect for one another, always in sync, satisfying each others needs and desires. Soulmates appear in our lives at the exact moment when we need them.  When we are ready to learn one of the grand lessons in life, our soulmates are there to guide us toward the destiny we were meant to live.  Soulmate relationships typically do not stand the test of time, as they are typically too intense and possess a certain karmic energy necessary to close relationships once the lessons have been learned. They are not always romantic partners, they can be friends or relatives.  You will, however, always feel a strong connection to these individuals, as you have a shared energy or a past life history with one another. On the other hand, a life partner is someone who acts more as companion or friend.  While you might not feel that deep, soulful connection that you would normally with a soulmate, but a life partner provides a mutual trust and understanding of one another.  They respect your desires and needs and love and care for you. Manifesting a life partner in your life is not a spiritual process like with our soulmates.  They are there to provide support and guidance as you continue on your own journey through life, just as you are there for them in the same way.  Meeting your life partner happens when you are both emotionally and mentally prepared, putting yourself into the world with confidence in your being. **[It is not impossible for a soulmate to become a life partner](http://foreverconscious.com/why-you-may-not-want-to-marry-your-soulmate)** and life partners are fully capable for developing deep, soulful connections, it all depends on the specific people and circumstances. Check out the different characteristics of each type of relationship: **Soulmate Relationship** - You feel a deep, spiritual connection to this person almost like you have known them for a long time. - You have flashbacks or deja vu moments where you feel that you have been together before. - You seem to understand each other and have a similar way of thinking. - You may have similar flaws or habits, or you both had similar challenges during childhood. - Your connection is intense and so too is the relationship. Often it can move from extreme highs to extreme lows. - You feel in sync with each other even when you are not physically together. There may be a feeling of having to team up together to conquer something. - You know intuitively what the other is thinking or feeling. You feel very in-tune and connected with their thoughts and actions. - Your relationship is emotional, challenging and can bring things out in you that you didn’t know existed. - You may experience huge shifts and changes in your life when you first meet this person. - Your relationship may not last forever but the love is always there. **Life Partner Relationship** - You feel attracted to each other physically and resonate with each others values. - You enjoy getting to know each other and learn about your differences and similarities- everything about each other feels new and exciting. - You get along like best friends- your relationship does not suffer from extremes. - Your relationship is based on logical or intellectual decisions. - You resonate with each others beliefs, ideas or religion/philosophy. - You both feel a sense of financial and emotional stability by being together. - Your relationship is based on being physically present and creating new memories. - You feel the need to marry or start a family in order to ‘cement’ your relationship. (h/t [**Forever Conscious**](http://foreverconscious.com/the-difference-between-soulmates-and-life-partners))

A life partner is a companion and friend, a stable person who you can always rely on, trust, and depend on to help you through the trials of life.  You share a mutual love and respect for one another, always in sync, satisfying each others needs and desires.

Soulmates appear in our lives at the exact moment when we need them.  When we are ready to learn one of the grand lessons in life, our soulmates are there to guide us toward the destiny we were meant to live.  Soulmate relationships typically do not stand the test of time, as they are typically too intense and possess a certain karmic energy necessary to close relationships once the lessons have been learned.

They are not always romantic partners, they can be friends or relatives.  You will, however, always feel a strong connection to these individuals, as you have a shared energy or a past life history with one another.

On the other hand, a life partner is someone who acts more as companion or friend.  While you might not feel that deep, soulful connection that you would normally with a soulmate, but a life partner provides a mutual trust and understanding of one another.  They respect your desires and needs and love and care for you.

Manifesting a life partner in your life is not a spiritual process like with our soulmates.  They are there to provide support and guidance as you continue on your own journey through life, just as you are there for them in the same way.  Meeting your life partner happens when you are both emotionally and mentally prepared, putting yourself into the world with confidence in your being.

It is not impossible for a soulmate to become a life partner and life partners are fully capable for developing deep, soulful connections, it all depends on the specific people and circumstances.

Check out the different characteristics of each type of relationship:

Soulmate Relationship

  • You feel a deep, spiritual connection to this person almost like you have known them for a long time.
  • You have flashbacks or deja vu moments where you feel that you have been together before.
  • You seem to understand each other and have a similar way of thinking.
  • You may have similar flaws or habits, or you both had similar challenges during childhood.
  • Your connection is intense and so too is the relationship. Often it can move from extreme highs to extreme lows.
  • You feel in sync with each other even when you are not physically together. There may be a feeling of having to team up together to conquer something.
  • You know intuitively what the other is thinking or feeling. You feel very in-tune and connected with their thoughts and actions.
  • Your relationship is emotional, challenging and can bring things out in you that you didn’t know existed.
  • You may experience huge shifts and changes in your life when you first meet this person.
  • Your relationship may not last forever but the love is always there.

Life Partner Relationship

  • You feel attracted to each other physically and resonate with each others values.
  • You enjoy getting to know each other and learn about your differences and similarities- everything about each other feels new and exciting.
  • You get along like best friends- your relationship does not suffer from extremes.
  • Your relationship is based on logical or intellectual decisions.
  • You resonate with each others beliefs, ideas or religion/philosophy.
  • You both feel a sense of financial and emotional stability by being together.
  • Your relationship is based on being physically present and creating new memories.
  • You feel the need to marry or start a family in order to ‘cement’ your relationship.

(h/t Forever Conscious)

posts.title: Mom Puts Zip Ties On Her Baby's Stroller, The Reason? Genius!
posts.markdown: Being a parent is probably one of the hardest things a person will ever do.  It’s a lot of work, and you can’t just call in sick whenever you don’t feel like being a parent.  Not only do you have a living, breathing being that you are now entirely responsible for, but this newborn creature comes with a ton of baggage: from toys to snacks to diapers, your average load for even just a walk around town just got a lot heavier. One thing that almost every parent invests in upon hearing their joyous news is a baby stroller.  Where there are new parents, there are new baby strollers.  I mean, what else are you going to use to haul around your newborn and all of their stuff Parents have been toting around their children since the dawn of time.  The baby carriage wasn’t created until 1733, eliminating the need for people to somehow strap their children to their chest or back in order to become mobile.  Since then, this invention has seen *a lot* of innovation.  Strollers come in all shapes and sizes now, from the**[luxury stroller that costs $4,000](http://www.albeebaby.com/silver-cross-balmoral-classic-pram-black.html?utm_medium=shoppingengine&utm_source=shoppingdotcom&gdftrk=gdfV21377_a_7c623_a_7c12148_a_7cSX637_d_US&gclid=CMjo-be6rcsCFQsPaQod-e0GTQ)**, to the tricycle, off-road design for **[the parent that enjoys going on runs](http://www.target.com/p/bob-ironman-single-jogger/-/A-13300132?ref=tgt_adv_XS000000&AFID=google_pla_df&CPNG=PLA_Baby%2BShopping&adgroup=SC_Baby&LID=700000001170770pgs&network=g&device=c&location=1014437&gclid=CJL7qtS6rcsCFZY1aQodyQwMaQ&gclsrc=aw.ds)** with their little ones. Regardless of what style of stroller your kids are cruising in, the video below will show every parent a couple tips and tricks that will maximize your stroller’s potential:

posts.title: Julia Roberts Has a Powerful Message to Humanity That Will Leave You Speechless
posts.markdown: As evidence of global warming and major climate-shift builds, many of those with star status are using their influence to reach as many people as possible, hoping to encourage mankind to **[conserve the planet that 14 million different species call home](http://www.conservation.org/Pages/default.aspx)**.  Leonardo DiCaprio even touched on the subject **[during his Oscar Award-winning speech](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lDtC14yf054)**. Oftentimes we forget that we are not the only ones on this magnificent Earth.  Just as we call it home, so do millions of others forms of life; will we be the ones responsible for its downfall?  Deforestation and contamination of water and food supplies leave a lasting impact on wildlife that inhabit both the land and sea. The video below features Julia Roberts telling a powerful narrative about our planet and how it *doesn’t need man.*  Watch and think critically about our reality:

posts.title: The #1 Reason Why Your Soul Mate Is Still Out of Reach
posts.markdown: By [**Andrea Schulman**](https://www.facebook.com/raiseyourvibrationtoday/?fref=ts) | **[Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/03/10/your-soul-mate-out-of-reach/)** Are you still waiting to claim your soul mate? Do any of the following scenarios strike a chord with you? 1. You’ve been stuck with a string of Mr. or Mrs. Wrongs, one after another. 2. You think you may have found your soul mate, but he or she just isn’t interested in committing or the timing has been off. 3. You’ve been stuck with the same Mr. or Mrs. Wrong for a long time, and can’t seem to get out of the relationship. 4. There don’t appear to be any Mr. or Mrs. Rights OR Wrongs anywhere, and you’ve been stuck with Mr. or Mrs. Nonexistent for a long time. If any of those scenarios speak to you, listen up.  I’m going to tell you the #1 reason why you haven’t yet landed your soul mate, if you’ve been wanting to.  Those who are single and lovin’ it don’t really apply here. So the reason is? Self-love. Yep, that’s all. Self-love.  Or rather, I should say, *the absence of self-love. *Here’s why: We live in a universe that is governed by something called the ***[Law of Attraction](http://www.raiseyourvibrationtoday.com "Raise Your Vibration Today: Law of Attraction Education")***.  With the Law of Attraction, we get more of whatever we focus on and believe in, and less of what we don’t.  We attract our expectations and beliefs about reality, and this is why the rich get richer, the poor get poorer and when it rains it pours. When we don’t love ourselves, we make it impossible for the universe to deliver someone to us who loves us fully, and in the way we want to be loved. When we don’t love ourselves, we project a message out into the universe that screams “I am unlovable!” and thus the universe responds by bringing back to us a reality where we feel unloved. Instead of attracting a partner who fulfills us as a soul mate, we attract the wrong partner, or a partner who won’t commit, or no partner at all. ***Related Article:** “**[Can I Get My Ex Back With the Law of Attraction?](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/02/10/can-i-get-my-ex-back-with-the-law-of-attraction/)**“* So, if you’ve been struggling to find your soul mate, my suggestion would be to invest in loving yourself more.  Look for things you like about yourself, build yourself up, and be your biggest cheerleader in life.  Be kind to yourself, and treat yourself exactly the way you would expect the perfect mate to treat you. Send a message to the universe that you are lovable and the Law of Attraction will respond in turn. It is law. XO, Andrea ## Are you hung-up on a breakup or feeling rejected? It’s time to get over the pain and get back to feeling happy.  After all, your happiness is what will guide you to true love. Sign up here for my free ebook: [“**Move on FAST: 10 Simple Law of Attraction Tips**”](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/heartbreak-recovery-free-ebook/ "Move on FAST free ebook") and start feeling better* today.* ***Source:** This article was republished with permission by**[ Raise Your Vibration Today](http://raiseyourvibrationtoday.com/2016/03/10/your-soul-mate-out-of-reach/)**.*
posts.html:
By Andrea Schulman | Raise Your Vibration Today

Are you still waiting to claim your soul mate? Do any of the following scenarios strike a chord with you?

  1. You’ve been stuck with a string of Mr. or Mrs. Wrongs, one after another.
  2. You think you may have found your soul mate, but he or she just isn’t interested in committing or the timing has been off.
  3. You’ve been stuck with the same Mr. or Mrs. Wrong for a long time, and can’t seem to get out of the relationship.
  4. There don’t appear to be any Mr. or Mrs. Rights OR Wrongs anywhere, and you’ve been stuck with Mr. or Mrs. Nonexistent for a long time.

If any of those scenarios speak to you, listen up.  I’m going to tell you the #1 reason why you haven’t yet landed your soul mate, if you’ve been wanting to.  Those who are single and lovin’ it don’t really apply here.

So the reason is?

Self-love.

Yep, that’s all. Self-love.  Or rather, I should say, *the absence of self-love. *Here’s why:

We live in a universe that is governed by something called the Law of Attraction.  With the Law of Attraction, we get more of whatever we focus on and believe in, and less of what we don’t.  We attract our expectations and beliefs about reality, and this is why the rich get richer, the poor get poorer and when it rains it pours.

When we don’t love ourselves, we make it impossible for the universe to deliver someone to us who loves us fully, and in the way we want to be loved.

When we don’t love ourselves, we project a message out into the universe that screams “I am unlovable!” and thus the universe responds by bringing back to us a reality where we feel unloved.

Instead of attracting a partner who fulfills us as a soul mate, we attract the wrong partner, or a partner who won’t commit, or no partner at all.

Related Article: “Can I Get My Ex Back With the Law of Attraction?“

So, if you’ve been struggling to find your soul mate, my suggestion would be to invest in loving yourself more.  Look for things you like about yourself, build yourself up, and be your biggest cheerleader in life.  Be kind to yourself, and treat yourself exactly the way you would expect the perfect mate to treat you.

Send a message to the universe that you are lovable and the Law of Attraction will respond in turn. It is law.

XO, Andrea

Are you hung-up on a breakup or feeling rejected?

It’s time to get over the pain and get back to feeling happy.  After all, your happiness is what will guide you to true love. Sign up here for my free ebook: “Move on FAST: 10 Simple Law of Attraction Tips” and start feeling better* today.*

Source: This article was republished with permission by Raise Your Vibration Today.

posts.title: What Your Zodiac Sign Says About Your Needs in a Relationship
posts.markdown: Relationships are no walk in the park, especially when it comes to navigating the differences between signs.  Every relationship needs to have that spark or special quality that keeps the passion and love fueled and burning.  See what your Zodiac sign has to say about your needs in a relationship: **Aries** The Aries needs someone who is direct and up-front about things, as they don’t like to be waiting around on people.  They crave spontaneity and are impatient, so be up-front with them, never hide things from them and you’ll do just fine. **Taurus** A Taurus appreciates a gentle lover.  They’re looking for a civilized being who has taste and tact.  Rude words and an uninviting edge will quickly turn them off. **Gemini** The Gemini needs to have contact with their lover at least a little bit everyday.  Regardless of medium, communication is key to a lasting relationship with a Gemini.  Don’t be afraid to shoot a quick text over to them for no other reason than you’re thinking about them. **Cancer** The Cancer’s needs revolve around protection.  They enjoy feeling that they themselves are protected by their partner and that their partners feel protected by them.  Being greeted with dedication, protection and security is the thing most Cancers want to come home to. **Leo** The Leo likes to maintain a balance between freedom and extreme affection.  They need to be able to do what they want to do in order to love fully.  They’re playful creatures by nature, having certain childlike ways about them.  But they’re also highly passionate and loving. **Virgo** The Virgo doesn’t waste time with anyone who is not legitimately kind.  Competence and kindness rank high in the Virgo’s world, so if you’re trying to get on their good side, take the time to be the caring person they want you to be.  Showing compassion for less fortunate people or creatures goes a long way. **Libra** The Libra enjoys smooth sailing and steady waters.  Peace and harmony are valued above all else, meaning their partner needs to be patient and accepting.  A Libra is quick to forgive as they appreciate all attempts and see past most shortcomings. **Scorpio** The Scorpio values honesty and integrity in their partners.  They’re also drawn toward those they can feel keep a secret.  Also, as they are highly sexual beings, being good in bed also helps lure in a Scorpio. **Sagittarius** The Sagittarius is huge on generosity.  They love people who love to give and receive on a grand scale.  This is true when it comes to good sex as well, always be able to give and receive.   **Capricorn** The Capricorn is attracted to respect, a strong work ethic and those who are not lazy because they understand that a loving relationship is something that takes time and effort.  They don’t enjoy being taken for granted, but also don’t enjoy being praised too often. **Aquarius** The Aquarius loves exciting and experimental things, but what they value even more is someone who is fair and open-minded.  If their partner complains about petty things in life then there is no chance for them.  They like when their partner agrees with what they have to say. **Pisces** Possibly the most sensitive of all the Zodiac signs, the Pisces needs a lover who is both open and sensitive.  They don’t enjoy people whose feelings are constantly hurt and they respond best to the lover that comforts them during times of duress.
posts.html:
Relationships are no walk in the park, especially when it comes to navigating the differences between signs.  Every relationship needs to have that spark or special quality that keeps the passion and love fueled and burning.  See what your Zodiac sign has to say about your needs in a relationship:

Aries

The Aries needs someone who is direct and up-front about things, as they don’t like to be waiting around on people.  They crave spontaneity and are impatient, so be up-front with them, never hide things from them and you’ll do just fine.

Taurus

A Taurus appreciates a gentle lover.  They’re looking for a civilized being who has taste and tact.  Rude words and an uninviting edge will quickly turn them off.

Gemini

The Gemini needs to have contact with their lover at least a little bit everyday.  Regardless of medium, communication is key to a lasting relationship with a Gemini.  Don’t be afraid to shoot a quick text over to them for no other reason than you’re thinking about them.

Cancer

The Cancer’s needs revolve around protection.  They enjoy feeling that they themselves are protected by their partner and that their partners feel protected by them.  Being greeted with dedication, protection and security is the thing most Cancers want to come home to.

Leo

The Leo likes to maintain a balance between freedom and extreme affection.  They need to be able to do what they want to do in order to love fully.  They’re playful creatures by nature, having certain childlike ways about them.  But they’re also highly passionate and loving.

Virgo

The Virgo doesn’t waste time with anyone who is not legitimately kind.  Competence and kindness rank high in the Virgo’s world, so if you’re trying to get on their good side, take the time to be the caring person they want you to be.  Showing compassion for less fortunate people or creatures goes a long way.

Libra

The Libra enjoys smooth sailing and steady waters.  Peace and harmony are valued above all else, meaning their partner needs to be patient and accepting.  A Libra is quick to forgive as they appreciate all attempts and see past most shortcomings.

Scorpio

The Scorpio values honesty and integrity in their partners.  They’re also drawn toward those they can feel keep a secret.  Also, as they are highly sexual beings, being good in bed also helps lure in a Scorpio.

Sagittarius

The Sagittarius is huge on generosity.  They love people who love to give and receive on a grand scale.  This is true when it comes to good sex as well, always be able to give and receive.  

Capricorn

The Capricorn is attracted to respect, a strong work ethic and those who are not lazy because they understand that a loving relationship is something that takes time and effort.  They don’t enjoy being taken for granted, but also don’t enjoy being praised too often.

Aquarius

The Aquarius loves exciting and experimental things, but what they value even more is someone who is fair and open-minded.  If their partner complains about petty things in life then there is no chance for them.  They like when their partner agrees with what they have to say.

Pisces

Possibly the most sensitive of all the Zodiac signs, the Pisces needs a lover who is both open and sensitive.  They don’t enjoy people whose feelings are constantly hurt and they respond best to the lover that comforts them during times of duress.

posts.title: Only 1 in 4 People Can See Every Color in This Box, How Many Do You See?
posts.markdown: It’s interesting to think that there are 7 billion people on this planet, each living a unique life, filled with unique experiences, senses, thoughts, beliefs.  And not a single one of us will ever know what it’s like to be someone else.  You can’t even try to imagine what it would be like because you just *don’t know*.   So, what if I told you that the sky is green?  I’m sure you’d vehemently deny my claim and suggest that it’s actually blue, but what if for me it actually was green?  Maybe my greens are your blues and my yellows are your reds. Remember the heart-attack that **[the internet had over the color of a dress](http://www.littlethings.com/what-colors-are-this-dress/)** not too long ago?  Half the population said the dress was white and gold, the other half said it was blue and black.   Well, it turns out that it all has to do with how many color receptors you have in your eyeballs.  [Diana Derval](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/25-people-have-4th-cone-see-colors-p-prof-diana-derval), a neuro-marketing expert, has developed a little test to determine how color-sensitive your eyes are. How many of the colors can you find in the box below? **Count the colors in the box** ![To take the test, count the colors you see in this spectrum:](http://cdn6.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/05/d45f74fc-9a3a-48e9-89e2-7f6816afd066-600x315.jpg) **So, how many were you able to count?** **Fewer than 20 colors – **This number represents people who only have two cones in the eye, meaning you’re a dichromat.  Dichromats make up 25 percent of the population, and all dogs are dichromats.  Dichromats like to dress in black, beige and blue colors. **Between 20 and 32 different colors – **This group is the trichromats.  You have three types of cones in your eyes, all in the purple/blue, green and red areas.  Derval notes that trichromats see different colors, and that about half of the population are trichromats. **Between 32 and 39 different colors – **You guessed it, these people have four cones in their eyes and are known as tetrachromats.  About a fourth of the population has four cones and they cannot stand the color yellow. **More than 39 different colors – **Think you’re pretty cool, eh?  Try counting again, as there are only 39 colors in the box and Derval says only about 35 of them are translated well enough by the computer screen to see.
posts.html:
It’s interesting to think that there are 7 billion people on this planet, each living a unique life, filled with unique experiences, senses, thoughts, beliefs.  And not a single one of us will ever know what it’s like to be someone else.  You can’t even try to imagine what it would be like because you just don’t know.  

So, what if I told you that the sky is green?  I’m sure you’d vehemently deny my claim and suggest that it’s actually blue, but what if for me it actually was green?  Maybe my greens are your blues and my yellows are your reds.

Remember the heart-attack that the internet had over the color of a dress not too long ago?  Half the population said the dress was white and gold, the other half said it was blue and black.  

Well, it turns out that it all has to do with how many color receptors you have in your eyeballs.  Diana Derval, a neuro-marketing expert, has developed a little test to determine how color-sensitive your eyes are.

How many of the colors can you find in the box below?

Count the colors in the box

So, how many were you able to count?

*Fewer than 20 colors – *This number represents people who only have two cones in the eye, meaning you’re a dichromat.  Dichromats make up 25 percent of the population, and all dogs are dichromats.  Dichromats like to dress in black, beige and blue colors.

*Between 20 and 32 different colors – *This group is the trichromats.  You have three types of cones in your eyes, all in the purple/blue, green and red areas.  Derval notes that trichromats see different colors, and that about half of the population are trichromats.

*Between 32 and 39 different colors – *You guessed it, these people have four cones in their eyes and are known as tetrachromats.  About a fourth of the population has four cones and they cannot stand the color yellow.

*More than 39 different colors – *Think you’re pretty cool, eh?  Try counting again, as there are only 39 colors in the box and Derval says only about 35 of them are translated well enough by the computer screen to see.

posts.title: 3 Marriage Mistakes Everyone Makes
posts.markdown: For those of us who are in committed relationships or who are striving to find that special someone to call our own, happiness is at the top of the priority list.  The thing is, being in a relationship where you both have intense feelings for one another often causes us to act and think in ways that we normally wouldn’t.   So, we’re in love and we’re striving to build a lasting happiness with our significant other, but at the same time we’re also acting a bit crazy because of these strong emotions, and this is where problems arise.  And more often than not, these problems arise because one partner is unknowingly doing things that the other partner doesn’t like.  Because if you knew that you were doing something hurtful toward your significant other, you’d stop right? Here are three mistakes that everyone makes when they’re deep into a relationship: **Failing to take ownership of problems – **Working hard at a relationship often leads us to believe that things are going well, so when problems comes up or when fights occur, we tend to be left scratching our heads as to what happened.  And then we usually shift blame to our partners, because we’re trying hard, so it can’t be us.  Wrong. Blaming your partner is the easiest thing to do, but also the absolute worst.  If you find yourself thinking this, take a step back and reflect on the entire situation for a while.  Think critically about what’s really happening and how you play a part in it. **Taking too much ownership – **On the other hand, you shouldn’t feel the need to take responsibility for every little thing that goes wrong in the relationship.  Wanting to fix things and bring your relationship back to its former glory is natural, but taking on more than your fair share of the blame is unhealthy and will quickly lead your relationship down a dark path. Be sure that your relationship is balanced, and that both people are able to recognize when they should be taking responsibility. **Failing to understand the difference between the two – **The key to finding this balance in your relationship is know when to stand up for yourself and accept the blame, and knowing when to stand up for yourself when you’re not to blame.   There are going to be many situations during the relationship in which you’re going to want to attack your partner and blame everything on them, but you know that isn’t wise.  But you also recognize that your significant other can’t be consistently getting away with crappy behavior. Talk with your partner about where you think each of you falls within this spectrum, and really listen to what they have to say.  It might shed some light on a problems you’ve been dealing with.
posts.html:
For those of us who are in committed relationships or who are striving to find that special someone to call our own, happiness is at the top of the priority list.  The thing is, being in a relationship where you both have intense feelings for one another often causes us to act and think in ways that we normally wouldn’t.  

So, we’re in love and we’re striving to build a lasting happiness with our significant other, but at the same time we’re also acting a bit crazy because of these strong emotions, and this is where problems arise.  And more often than not, these problems arise because one partner is unknowingly doing things that the other partner doesn’t like.  Because if you knew that you were doing something hurtful toward your significant other, you’d stop right?

Here are three mistakes that everyone makes when they’re deep into a relationship:

*Failing to take ownership of problems – *Working hard at a relationship often leads us to believe that things are going well, so when problems comes up or when fights occur, we tend to be left scratching our heads as to what happened.  And then we usually shift blame to our partners, because we’re trying hard, so it can’t be us.  Wrong.

Blaming your partner is the easiest thing to do, but also the absolute worst.  If you find yourself thinking this, take a step back and reflect on the entire situation for a while.  Think critically about what’s really happening and how you play a part in it.

*Taking too much ownership – *On the other hand, you shouldn’t feel the need to take responsibility for every little thing that goes wrong in the relationship.  Wanting to fix things and bring your relationship back to its former glory is natural, but taking on more than your fair share of the blame is unhealthy and will quickly lead your relationship down a dark path.

Be sure that your relationship is balanced, and that both people are able to recognize when they should be taking responsibility.

*Failing to understand the difference between the two – *The key to finding this balance in your relationship is know when to stand up for yourself and accept the blame, and knowing when to stand up for yourself when you’re not to blame.  

There are going to be many situations during the relationship in which you’re going to want to attack your partner and blame everything on them, but you know that isn’t wise.  But you also recognize that your significant other can’t be consistently getting away with crappy behavior.

Talk with your partner about where you think each of you falls within this spectrum, and really listen to what they have to say.  It might shed some light on a problems you’ve been dealing with.

posts.title: Ex-Lovers Sit in Silence When They See Each Other for the First Time In 30 Years
posts.markdown: Love.  That one thing that most of us have longed for, discovered, lost, found again, lost again.  It’s one of the most complicated things in the world, and many people spend their entire lives trying to figure it all out.  It causes us to act in ways that we wouldn’t normally act, causes us to do things we wouldn’t normally do, and leaves such a lasting mark on us that entire wars have been waged over this idea of love. The love between two people manifests uniquely each time.  A sign resting on my former girlfriend’s dresser used to remind me of this each time I awoke in her room; painted on this wooden plank was F. Scott Fitzgerald’s musing, “There are all kinds of love in this world but never the same love twice.” Meet artists Marina Abramovic and her ex-lover, Ulay.  In the 1970s, Marina and Ulay were lovers, but could not stay together.  The end of their relationship was just as powerful and unique as had been the rest of their affair.  Remaining true to the artist within both of them, they chose to end their relationship in a symbolic fashion.  They went to opposite ends of the Great Wall of China and then walked toward each other, meeting in the middle.  Once they met in the middle, they gave one final embrace and then parted ways, never to see each other again. More than 30 years later, Marina was holding a live art performance during which she spent one minute in silence with the complete strangers that were attending.  After staring at many people from the audience, one man in particular seemed to have captured Marina’s being.  The moment they shared was different from the others.  Because the man sitting in front of her, sharing Marina’s tearful expression, was that man she had left on the Great Wall of China more than 30 years ago. Watch this charged moment between Marina and Ulay, the lovers who parted ways never knowing if they’d see one another again.
posts.html:

The love between two people manifests uniquely each time.  A sign resting on my former girlfriend’s dresser used to remind me of this each time I awoke in her room; painted on this wooden plank was F. Scott Fitzgerald’s musing, “There are all kinds of love in this world but never the same love twice.”

Meet artists Marina Abramovic and her ex-lover, Ulay.  In the 1970s, Marina and Ulay were lovers, but could not stay together.  The end of their relationship was just as powerful and unique as had been the rest of their affair.  Remaining true to the artist within both of them, they chose to end their relationship in a symbolic fashion.  They went to opposite ends of the Great Wall of China and then walked toward each other, meeting in the middle.  Once they met in the middle, they gave one final embrace and then parted ways, never to see each other again.

More than 30 years later, Marina was holding a live art performance during which she spent one minute in silence with the complete strangers that were attending.  After staring at many people from the audience, one man in particular seemed to have captured Marina’s being.  The moment they shared was different from the others.  Because the man sitting in front of her, sharing Marina’s tearful expression, was that man she had left on the Great Wall of China more than 30 years ago.

Watch this charged moment between Marina and Ulay, the lovers who parted ways never knowing if they’d see one another again.

posts.title: The Hidden Meaning of Your Birthstone
posts.markdown: Did you know that each month of the year is associated with a specific birthstone?  A precious stone that says a lot more about you than you might think.  Birthstones showed up quite some time ago, with ancient Indian tribes wearing them in hopes of gaining certain powers and for protection. Birthstones are shrouded in mystery and full of symbolism; here is each month’s birthstone and its meaning: **January – Garnet** The garnet occurs naturally in all colors except for blue.  This stone is believed to protect you from snakebites and nightmares.  Wearing the garnet increases self-esteem, power, and energy levels.  It also calms anxious nerves. ![garnet-665472_960_720](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/03/garnet-665472_960_720-300x201.jpg) **February – Purple Amethyst** This stone is worn because it is believed to protect people from darkness.  It is associated with peace, temperance, royalty and serenity, making it both majestic and calming. ![amethyst-265348_960_720](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/03/amethyst-265348_960_720-300x200.jpg) **March – Pale Blue Aquamarine Gemstones** These precious blue gems are correlated with good health.  Those who wear this stone are filled with hope, love and youth.  It improves happiness, builds courage, and makes loving easier. ![apatite-669484_960_720](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/03/apatite-669484_960_720-300x205.jpg) **April – Diamonds** As the popular saying goes, ‘diamonds are forever.’  They symbolize eternity, love, and invincibility, and come in many different colors. ![diamond-807979_960_720](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/03/diamond-807979_960_720-300x300.jpg) **May – Green Emeralds** The green emerald is stunning, representing health, faithfulness, fertility and improved eyesight.  It is often used in fashion, but many who wear it do not know its true meaning. ![](http://www.angara.com/media/catalog/product/images/gemstones/Emerald-Emerald-Light-Green-5.7-cts.-11.4-X-10.9-MM_EME0215_Reg.jpg) **June – Cool Pearls or Moonstones** It’s widely believed that the energy of these stones goes entirely into protecting marriage.  People who wear these typically enjoy happy and calm relationships.  They come in a few different colors. ![silver-jewelry-334068_960_720](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/03/silver-jewelry-334068_960_720-300x225.jpg) **July – Red Rubies** July’s red ruby is a stunningly beautiful token of peace and harmony. **August – Light Green Peridot** This sparkling green gem keeps out evil, depression, and enchantments. **September – Sapphires** These precious blue gems represently loyalty.  Sapphires give people the strength to be loyal, dignified, faithful, wise and pure. **October – Opals** These stones are associated with hope, creativity and innocence, with those who wear them believing that it will keep away bad people with bad intentions. **November – Yellow Topaz and Citrine** These warm-colored gems are associated with healing.  Their powers are able to heal the body and the mind, providing good mental health. ![](https://images.blogthings.com/whatshouldyourbirthstonereallybequiz/topaz.jpg) **December – Tanzanite, Turquoise, & Blue Topaz (Zircon)** These beautiful blue stones are linked to happy lives; those who wear them believe they are fulfilled and happy.  They have been said to rid people of headaches, and the turquoise has the ability to change color when you’re not feeling well or if you’re in danger.
posts.html:
Did you know that each month of the year is associated with a specific birthstone?  A precious stone that says a lot more about you than you might think.  Birthstones showed up quite some time ago, with ancient Indian tribes wearing them in hopes of gaining certain powers and for protection.

Birthstones are shrouded in mystery and full of symbolism; here is each month’s birthstone and its meaning:

January – Garnet

The garnet occurs naturally in all colors except for blue.  This stone is believed to protect you from snakebites and nightmares.  Wearing the garnet increases self-esteem, power, and energy levels.  It also calms anxious nerves.

February – Purple Amethyst

This stone is worn because it is believed to protect people from darkness.  It is associated with peace, temperance, royalty and serenity, making it both majestic and calming.

March – Pale Blue Aquamarine Gemstones

These precious blue gems are correlated with good health.  Those who wear this stone are filled with hope, love and youth.  It improves happiness, builds courage, and makes loving easier.

April – Diamonds

As the popular saying goes, ‘diamonds are forever.’  They symbolize eternity, love, and invincibility, and come in many different colors.

May – Green Emeralds

The green emerald is stunning, representing health, faithfulness, fertility and improved eyesight.  It is often used in fashion, but many who wear it do not know its true meaning.

June – Cool Pearls or Moonstones

It’s widely believed that the energy of these stones goes entirely into protecting marriage.  People who wear these typically enjoy happy and calm relationships.  They come in a few different colors.

July – Red Rubies

July’s red ruby is a stunningly beautiful token of peace and harmony.

August – Light Green Peridot

This sparkling green gem keeps out evil, depression, and enchantments.

September – Sapphires

These precious blue gems represently loyalty.  Sapphires give people the strength to be loyal, dignified, faithful, wise and pure.

October – Opals

These stones are associated with hope, creativity and innocence, with those who wear them believing that it will keep away bad people with bad intentions.

November – Yellow Topaz and Citrine

These warm-colored gems are associated with healing.  Their powers are able to heal the body and the mind, providing good mental health.

December – Tanzanite, Turquoise, & Blue Topaz (Zircon)

These beautiful blue stones are linked to happy lives; those who wear them believe they are fulfilled and happy.  They have been said to rid people of headaches, and the turquoise has the ability to change color when you’re not feeling well or if you’re in danger.

posts.title: 5 Sign You're On the Right Path (Even If It Doesn't Feel Like It)
posts.markdown: The ebb and flow of life is something that we all learn to move with as we get older.  Maintaining the understanding that we will all experience highs and lows as a natural part of life will serve you well.  When we find ourselves in the midst of crisis or turmoil, it means that we’re that much closer to revelation and clarity.  One rarely grows as much during times of prosperity as one does during times of adversity. Here are five signs of difficulty that mean your life is on its way to becoming better: **You’re starting to recognize what you don’t want in life – **Knowing what you want out of life can be one of the hardest things to successfully ponder.  An easier thing to do might be to figure out what it is that you don’t want in life.  These can be subtle things that might not be immediately recognizable, like how much you dread going to work everyday, or how drained you feel after hanging out with your friends, or how you don’t feel like your normal self.  If you don’t like a certain aspect of your life, strive to change it. **The cliches you hear all the time start to make sense – **We hear these phrases and notions all the time, but we typically shrug them off, hearing them, but not really internalizing them.  People always tell you that there’s no substitution for hard work, that you need to live in the moment as much as possible, and that positivity is a mindset.   You start understanding that you *really* are in control of your life, and that all of those little wisdoms and proverbs that are spoken of generally actually *do* mean something. **You reach a new levels of self-awareness – **Becoming more self-aware allows one to reach deeper understandings of his or herself.  Realizations about both the positive and negative traits and characteristics that you possess start to become routine; you no longer embellish or try to justify details of either, you simply are. **Changes in life start to center around you becoming more like yourself, and not less – **We all enjoy fantasizing about the life we want to live to some extent, right?  We take steps in the direction that we want our lives to go, but there are certain things we cannot change.  Dreaming about being stunningly beautiful or filthy rich are indicators that we’re feeling kind of crappy about ourselves.  Finding your center allows you to align more with who you are, rather than who you want to be, and this is good for the mind and soul. **You start viewing adversity in life as opportunity to better understand yourself – **One of the things I strive to do most in life is take away lessons and understanding from all of the random experiences that happen to me.  From each relationship, a better understanding of how to love.  From each friendship, a better understanding of how to be a true friend.  Things that cause us great pain and despair often provide a deeper understanding of ourselves.
posts.html:
The ebb and flow of life is something that we all learn to move with as we get older.  Maintaining the understanding that we will all experience highs and lows as a natural part of life will serve you well.  When we find ourselves in the midst of crisis or turmoil, it means that we’re that much closer to revelation and clarity.  One rarely grows as much during times of prosperity as one does during times of adversity.

Here are five signs of difficulty that mean your life is on its way to becoming better:

*You’re starting to recognize what you don’t want in life – *Knowing what you want out of life can be one of the hardest things to successfully ponder.  An easier thing to do might be to figure out what it is that you don’t want in life.  These can be subtle things that might not be immediately recognizable, like how much you dread going to work everyday, or how drained you feel after hanging out with your friends, or how you don’t feel like your normal self.  If you don’t like a certain aspect of your life, strive to change it.

*The cliches you hear all the time start to make sense – *We hear these phrases and notions all the time, but we typically shrug them off, hearing them, but not really internalizing them.  People always tell you that there’s no substitution for hard work, that you need to live in the moment as much as possible, and that positivity is a mindset.  

You start understanding that you really are in control of your life, and that all of those little wisdoms and proverbs that are spoken of generally actually do mean something.

*You reach a new levels of self-awareness – *Becoming more self-aware allows one to reach deeper understandings of his or herself.  Realizations about both the positive and negative traits and characteristics that you possess start to become routine; you no longer embellish or try to justify details of either, you simply are.

*Changes in life start to center around you becoming more like yourself, and not less – *We all enjoy fantasizing about the life we want to live to some extent, right?  We take steps in the direction that we want our lives to go, but there are certain things we cannot change.  Dreaming about being stunningly beautiful or filthy rich are indicators that we’re feeling kind of crappy about ourselves.  Finding your center allows you to align more with who you are, rather than who you want to be, and this is good for the mind and soul.

*You start viewing adversity in life as opportunity to better understand yourself – *One of the things I strive to do most in life is take away lessons and understanding from all of the random experiences that happen to me.  From each relationship, a better understanding of how to love.  From each friendship, a better understanding of how to be a true friend.  Things that cause us great pain and despair often provide a deeper understanding of ourselves.

posts.title: Husband Finds Wife Crying While Doing Laundry, She Finally Tells Him the Shocking Truth
posts.markdown: When it comes to true love, the lengths that people are willing to go for their significant others are limitless.  When you’re in love, something about you changes.  You start thinking in different ways, you start prioritizing your world differently.  All because of this one person that has your heart and mind twisted up into one big ball of love. Seeing a loved one suffer can be one of the greatest sorrows in this world.  And this sorrow is even greater when there is nothing you can do to help or fix the problem.   One husband started following his wife every morning after they parted ways for work, not out of distrust for his partner, but out of deep love and admiration.  This short, 8-minute film by the Jubilee Project tells the tale of a loving couple that experiences one of life’s greatest pains, and it’s told from both the perspective of the wife and the husband. Watch and be touched by the power of love:
