Find your birth year on the chart above to see which animal is associated with your birth year, then read below to see which characteristics you inherit from your Chinese Zodiac sign:

*Rats – *Rats are charming and thoughtful individuals, touting strong and vivid imaginations, and generosity in relationships that are important to them.  They can be quick-tempered and critical, but are typically at ease when in company and social settings.  They’re usually quite intellectual and enjoy notable popularity.

*Ox – *The Ox is known for being stoic and strong.  They face adversity head on and inspire confidence in others.  They handle their responsibilities methodically and often garner respect because of it.  They can come off as arrogant at times because they defend their interests with extreme determination, but this same determination is admirable as it founded in a sense of duty.

*Tigers – *The Tiger is highly sensitive and often turns to its emotions, allowing it to love deeply.  The Tiger needs to find the balance between their need for love, their strong competitive spirit, and their desire to dominate.  They’re well-suited for leadership, as they courageously face any and all challenges.

*Rabbits / Hare – *Rabbits are well-liked people because of their affectionate and courteous nature.  They dislike drama, preferring to stay out of it.  They focus mainly on pursuits that make them happy, and would never deliberately hurt anyone.  Despite their fun-loving nature, they are usually quiet and reserved.

*Dragons – *Dragons are vibrant with energy and demonstrate a great charismatic presence, which can often come off as boisterous and loud occasionally.  They’re very talented people due to their high intelligence.  They enjoy demanding situations that provide them with opportunity to use all of their energies and talents to succeed.

*Snakes – *Snakes are known for their wisdom and ability for profound thought.  They’re also quite charming and romantic.  Despite this quality for love, they are often loners and prefer secrecy.  This leads many snakes to be less socially popular than their peers, but that’s ok because the snake prefers its own company.

*Horses – *Horse people prefer independence and hard work, which is often revealed in their characteristic egotism.  They possess great verbal acuity and a high intellectual capacity, however, providing them with the opportunity to be quite popular.  They will commit to hard work and success as long as the work they are doing is not seen as beneath them.

*Sheep – *Sheep are charming and likable folks, even if they are reserved.  A sheep person possesses a love for nature, art, and culture, and often commands a great deal of creativity themselves.  They can be timid, but are generally self-confident.  They are most fulfilled when in a relationship that provides security.

*Monkeys – *Intelligent and energetic, the Monkey touts a magnetic personality that draws people in.  They are often viewed as eccentric due to their quick wit and easy talent for finding humor in every situation.  

*Roosters – *Roosters are known for their inclination toward industry and hard work, as well as their ability to easily express their views.  They do not like to share the spotlight with others, as they view their own opinions, and their right to share them, as highly important.  They can be very true and loyal in relationships, and have potential for success in their careers due to their high standards.

*Dogs – *Dog people are notorious for their honesty and loyalty in relationships.  When they choose to tackle a new pursuit, they give it their all, whether it be in their career or their hobbies.  Dogs have sharp tongues that feel the need to criticize often, partly due to the fact that they adhere strongly to principles of justice and fairness.

*Pigs – *Pig people make wonderful companions because of their ability to be sincere, kind, and tolerant.  They use their intellect to set high goals and then achieve them.  They have great sense of humor and possess great wit.  Their desire for social harmony allows them to overlook the faults in people, but this is also their greatest vulnerability, as they expect others to do the same.

posts.title: 5 Things You Ought to Know Before Dating the Aries
posts.markdown: So, you’ve fallen for an Aries.. You poor, troubled soul.   Just kidding.  Aries are usually amazing people that have an tremendous zest for life that is second to none.  They’re probably going to drive you up the wall every now and then, because well, they’re a fire sign, but they understand they’re crazy and they more than make up for it. Check out these five things about the Aries before agreeing to any long-term commitments: **They’re incredibly feisty – **Remember when I said that Aries was a fire sign?  Well, they’re the *first *fire sign.  This means that they’re hot, passionate and impulsive with just about everything they do.  The Aries draw attention from everyone in a room because they put out such a vibrant energy (good or bad). **They’re adventurous – **The Aries is the type of person to try anything at least once.  However, if they don’t enjoy it or don’t seem to be good at it, they’re not likely to do it ever again.  They have a lust for life that is contagious, making it easy for them to pull others into their adventures and schemes. **They need personal space – **While the Aries is a natural leader to others, they absolutely despise people who cling onto them.  Be sure to have your own life and hobbies that do not depend entirely on the Aries; continue to be yourself while also pursuing the Aries. **They get bored easily – **Keeping an Aries attention is like pulling teeth.  They’re always looking to be engaged in something interesting, whether it’s great sex or intelligent conversation.  If you don’t bring something to the table, they’ll be polite about it, but don’t expect them to stick around.  But, at least you’ll always know when an Aries is getting bored with you. **They’re loyal (and a bit over-protective) – **Aries are definitely the all or nothing type of partners.  Their inner circle is exclusive, and they protect anyone who’s made it in there.  Confrontation is their thing, so if someone is hurting their friend they’ll be sure to get physical, or at the very least, lay a verbal beat down.
posts.html:
So, you’ve fallen for an Aries.. You poor, troubled soul.  

Just kidding.  Aries are usually amazing people that have an tremendous zest for life that is second to none.  They’re probably going to drive you up the wall every now and then, because well, they’re a fire sign, but they understand they’re crazy and they more than make up for it.

Check out these five things about the Aries before agreeing to any long-term commitments:

*They’re incredibly feisty – *Remember when I said that Aries was a fire sign?  Well, they’re the first fire sign.  This means that they’re hot, passionate and impulsive with just about everything they do.  The Aries draw attention from everyone in a room because they put out such a vibrant energy (good or bad).

*They’re adventurous – *The Aries is the type of person to try anything at least once.  However, if they don’t enjoy it or don’t seem to be good at it, they’re not likely to do it ever again.  They have a lust for life that is contagious, making it easy for them to pull others into their adventures and schemes.

*They need personal space – *While the Aries is a natural leader to others, they absolutely despise people who cling onto them.  Be sure to have your own life and hobbies that do not depend entirely on the Aries; continue to be yourself while also pursuing the Aries.

*They get bored easily – *Keeping an Aries attention is like pulling teeth.  They’re always looking to be engaged in something interesting, whether it’s great sex or intelligent conversation.  If you don’t bring something to the table, they’ll be polite about it, but don’t expect them to stick around.  But, at least you’ll always know when an Aries is getting bored with you.

*They’re loyal (and a bit over-protective) – *Aries are definitely the all or nothing type of partners.  Their inner circle is exclusive, and they protect anyone who’s made it in there.  Confrontation is their thing, so if someone is hurting their friend they’ll be sure to get physical, or at the very least, lay a verbal beat down.

posts.title: 5 Negative Thought Patterns To Get Rid Of
posts.markdown: Negative thought patterns can easily turn a good day into an absolutely terrible day, especially for those of us with anxiety.  I try my hardest to avoid any negative thoughts, whether they’re directed at me or at others, because I recognize that thinking negatively affects me on both a physical and emotional level. But it can be hard at times and a lot of us fall into these patterns of negativity without even realizing it.  Here are five negative thought patterns that you should probably get out of your life, and fast: **Catastrophizing** This happens when we perceive a tiny mistake or misfortune in our lives as being the one thing that will ultimately ruin *everything* for us.  Not only does this exaggeration not help us, it fosters anxiety, fear, stress and helplessness.  Don’t believe that the worst has happened before it’s happened. **Generalizing** I think that everyone, somewhere deep inside of them, knows that when they say ‘blanket’ statements that unfairly group individuals together without a second glance, that there’s some element of dishonesty in what they’re saying.  Stating that everything is either ‘this way’ or ‘that way’ is a poor way of viewing the world.  Don’t make it a habit. **Personalizing** As much as we would like to think that we are at the center of the universe, we are not.  The world does not belong to you just as much as it does not belong to me.  Always acknowledge that people will act the way they act because they’re sorting through issues of their own, and that it probably doesn’t have anything to do with you (don’t take things so personally).   **Filtering** Filtering is something that we all do.  Shockingly, people only like to hear things that resonate positively with what they believe or understand.  Try to avoid only hearing what you want to hear.  Take the good with the bad, because if you only have one side of the picture, how you can fully understand it?   **“Should”-ing** Constantly telling yourself that you *should* have done this or *should *have done that is bad for one’s view of him or herself.  The word ‘should’ denotes that we’re incapable or lacking in certain areas.  You’re basically telling yourself you’re not good enough or didn’t do well enough.  If you truly think you *should* be doing something then make the effort to make it happen.  If it’s not worth doing, then don’t bother with it, and certainly don’t stress over it.
posts.html:
Negative thought patterns can easily turn a good day into an absolutely terrible day, especially for those of us with anxiety.  I try my hardest to avoid any negative thoughts, whether they’re directed at me or at others, because I recognize that thinking negatively affects me on both a physical and emotional level.

But it can be hard at times and a lot of us fall into these patterns of negativity without even realizing it.  Here are five negative thought patterns that you should probably get out of your life, and fast:

Catastrophizing

This happens when we perceive a tiny mistake or misfortune in our lives as being the one thing that will ultimately ruin everything for us.  Not only does this exaggeration not help us, it fosters anxiety, fear, stress and helplessness.  Don’t believe that the worst has happened before it’s happened.

Generalizing

I think that everyone, somewhere deep inside of them, knows that when they say ‘blanket’ statements that unfairly group individuals together without a second glance, that there’s some element of dishonesty in what they’re saying.  Stating that everything is either ‘this way’ or ‘that way’ is a poor way of viewing the world.  Don’t make it a habit.

Personalizing

As much as we would like to think that we are at the center of the universe, we are not.  The world does not belong to you just as much as it does not belong to me.  Always acknowledge that people will act the way they act because they’re sorting through issues of their own, and that it probably doesn’t have anything to do with you (don’t take things so personally).  

Filtering

Filtering is something that we all do.  Shockingly, people only like to hear things that resonate positively with what they believe or understand.  Try to avoid only hearing what you want to hear.  Take the good with the bad, because if you only have one side of the picture, how you can fully understand it?  

“Should”-ing

Constantly telling yourself that you should have done this or should have done that is bad for one’s view of him or herself.  The word ‘should’ denotes that we’re incapable or lacking in certain areas.  You’re basically telling yourself you’re not good enough or didn’t do well enough.  If you truly think you should be doing something then make the effort to make it happen.  If it’s not worth doing, then don’t bother with it, and certainly don’t stress over it.

posts.title: 5 Scientifically Proven Methods to Fall Asleep Faster
posts.markdown: Ever find yourself tossing and turning at night, unable to fall asleep no matter how hard you try?  You’re not the only one.  Insomnia is a very real problem; **[the National Institutes of Health](http://nihseniorhealth.gov/sleepandaging/insomnia/01.html)** report that almost half of U.S. adults aged 60 and older suffer from the condition. Liza Meltzer, education scholar for the National Sleep Foundation and associate professor of pediatrics at National Jewish Health in Denver, says that unless there are specific medical conditions or medications that are keeping you awake at night, the most likely cause of your sleeplessness is anxiety.   So, if you’re interested in hibernating for a few days and want to do it easily, try these five scientifically-proven methods of falling asleep: **Get out of bed and do something for at least 10 minutes** If you ever find yourself lying awake in bed unable to fall asleep for at least 15 minutes, try getting out of bed and doing something for 10 minutes or so.  Preferably, do an activity that requires the use of your hands and your head, and avoid using any digital screens, as their blue light has been shown to inhibit melatonin production, which is a sleep-inducing hormone.   **[Richard Wiseman](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cpGoWPrTJho),** professor for the Public Understanding of Psychology at the University of Hertfordshire, says “the key is to avoid associating your bed with being awake.” **Hide the clock** Watching every second of time slowly tick down as you lie awake in bed increases stress levels, which in turn makes it more difficult for your nervous system to relax into a slumber.  Easy solution?  Hide your clock and make sure you can’t see what time it is.  Constantly looking to see what time it is only makes things worse. **Make sure your room is a bit chilly** **[According to the Harvard Medical School](http://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/science/what/characteristics)**, our bodies dip to lower temperatures when we’re falling asleep, which is believed to help speed up the process of falling asleep.  Having a cooler room makes it easier for your body to fall into the sleep cycle.  Meltzer says the best conditions for falling asleep are “cool, dark, comfortable bedrooms.” **Take a hot shower before bedtime** A nice hot shower before your bedtime helps you fall asleep due to the rapid change in body temperature, from high to low.  Studies have found that because you’re going from a higher temperature to a lower temperature so quickly, your metabolism slows faster and your body preps for sleep more rapidly. **Wear socks to bed** A study published **[in the journal ](http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v401/n6748/abs/401036a0.html)****[*Nature*](http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v401/n6748/abs/401036a0.html)** found that warm feet and hands were indicative of the fast onset of sleep.  The study had participants place a heated water bottle on their feet, effectively widening the blood vessels on the surface of the skin, which allowed for more rapid heat loss.
posts.html:
Ever find yourself tossing and turning at night, unable to fall asleep no matter how hard you try?  You’re not the only one.  Insomnia is a very real problem; the National Institutes of Health report that almost half of U.S. adults aged 60 and older suffer from the condition.

Liza Meltzer, education scholar for the National Sleep Foundation and associate professor of pediatrics at National Jewish Health in Denver, says that unless there are specific medical conditions or medications that are keeping you awake at night, the most likely cause of your sleeplessness is anxiety.  

So, if you’re interested in hibernating for a few days and want to do it easily, try these five scientifically-proven methods of falling asleep:

Get out of bed and do something for at least 10 minutes

If you ever find yourself lying awake in bed unable to fall asleep for at least 15 minutes, try getting out of bed and doing something for 10 minutes or so.  Preferably, do an activity that requires the use of your hands and your head, and avoid using any digital screens, as their blue light has been shown to inhibit melatonin production, which is a sleep-inducing hormone.  

Richard Wiseman, professor for the Public Understanding of Psychology at the University of Hertfordshire, says “the key is to avoid associating your bed with being awake.”

Hide the clock

Watching every second of time slowly tick down as you lie awake in bed increases stress levels, which in turn makes it more difficult for your nervous system to relax into a slumber.  Easy solution?  Hide your clock and make sure you can’t see what time it is.  Constantly looking to see what time it is only makes things worse.

Make sure your room is a bit chilly

According to the Harvard Medical School, our bodies dip to lower temperatures when we’re falling asleep, which is believed to help speed up the process of falling asleep.  Having a cooler room makes it easier for your body to fall into the sleep cycle.  Meltzer says the best conditions for falling asleep are “cool, dark, comfortable bedrooms.”

Take a hot shower before bedtime

A nice hot shower before your bedtime helps you fall asleep due to the rapid change in body temperature, from high to low.  Studies have found that because you’re going from a higher temperature to a lower temperature so quickly, your metabolism slows faster and your body preps for sleep more rapidly.

Wear socks to bed

A study published in the journal Nature found that warm feet and hands were indicative of the fast onset of sleep.  The study had participants place a heated water bottle on their feet, effectively widening the blood vessels on the surface of the skin, which allowed for more rapid heat loss.

posts.title: You've Been Using Post-It Notes Incorrectly This Entire Time
posts.markdown: While Post-It Notes do not require a great deal of intellect to use, most people have been using them all wrong for as long as they’ve been alive. ![You've Definitely Been Using Post-Its Wrong Your Entire Life](http://thumbs.mic.com/NjliMTQ3MDNiOCMvYURscUV2YjdoYmZiNmZzNy1JdDFQdWZibERZPS8yMHgwOjc4MHgyNjQvNzYweDI2NC9maWx0ZXJzOnF1YWxpdHkoNzApL2h0dHA6Ly9zMy5hbWF6b25hd3MuY29tL3BvbGljeW1pYy1pbWFnZXMvY2ZtenJuYjhkaWZyaW5ldzB4c3RkcGxva2dyY2plMjg2em1waGpwazVvdXZ6emdycGoxcDljZm1wcmV4MnZwYy5qcGc.jpg) Typically, when you go to unstick a new post-it note, you grab from the bottom and peel upward, yes?  And you usually get a bent-out-of-shape note that rarely hangs flat on the surface that you stick it to, yes?  Well here’s the solution to the air pocket that sits between the note and the surface! **Peel each note from the side, just underneath the sticky part** ![You've Definitely Been Using Post-Its Wrong Your Entire Life](http://thumbs.mic.com/NzZjYWY3OGY4OCMvNzlsNUVyRXZudkk2UGpzaFhyX0plLWJCRWYwPS8yMHgwOjc4MHgyNjQvNzYweDI2NC9maWx0ZXJzOnF1YWxpdHkoNzApL2h0dHA6Ly9zMy5hbWF6b25hd3MuY29tL3BvbGljeW1pYy1pbWFnZXMvbW5vamtubXV4cjRtMmZtdGloYWlteXp2MHp4emo0YThzbWJsNW01cmI3ZmIwdW13NW84YnRka2xlcGlrMWJldS5qcGc.jpg) This technique will give you a note that rests perfectly flat on the surface, just like you wanted in the first place. This tutorial and life-changing tip was highlighted by blogger **[Martin Schapendonk](http://blog.whitehorses.nl/2013/05/17/how-to-stick-a-sticky-note/)**.
posts.html:
While Post-It Notes do not require a great deal of intellect to use, most people have been using them all wrong for as long as they’ve been alive.

Typically, when you go to unstick a new post-it note, you grab from the bottom and peel upward, yes?  And you usually get a bent-out-of-shape note that rarely hangs flat on the surface that you stick it to, yes?  Well here’s the solution to the air pocket that sits between the note and the surface!

Peel each note from the side, just underneath the sticky part

This technique will give you a note that rests perfectly flat on the surface, just like you wanted in the first place.

This tutorial and life-changing tip was highlighted by blogger Martin Schapendonk.

posts.title: 5 Great Alternatives to Wearing a Bra
posts.markdown: While recent movements like #[FreeTheNipple](http://freethenipple.com/) and #[NoBraDay](https://www.awarenessdays.co.uk/awareness-days-calendar/national-no-bra-day/) are meant to empower women all over the world, it turns out that a lot of women actually *like* the function and purpose of the bra.   While most of us are for women gaining equality on the topless front, and [there’s even been some research into why you shouldn’t even be wearing a bra](http://www.iflscience.com/health-and-medicine/no-bra-day-special-are-bras-bad-you), a lot of women feel that going without one is impractical. Women use bras for all sorts of different reasons, from simply keeping them stationary to relieving back pressure to hiding the occasional erect nipple.   If you’re looking to try out something new, something different from your standard bra, check out these five great alternatives: **The Pasty!**![seashell pasties](http://rack.1.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzLzZlL3NlYXNoZWxscGFzLmE4MmRiLmpwZwpwCXRodW1iCTEyMDB4OTYwMD4/4688dd5e/aa8/seashell-pasties.jpg "seashell pasties") ![MTV Video Music Awards At The Metropolitan Opera House At Lincoln Center](http://rack.0.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzL2I4L2xpbGtpbTEuNDA0ODYuanBnCnAJdGh1bWIJMTIwMHg5NjAwPg/356039d9/f48/lil-kim1.jpg "MTV Video Music Awards At The Metropolitan Opera House At Lincoln Center") Maybe you want the coverage on your nipples, but also like to feel free and uninhibited.  Pasties come in a variety of different designs, shapes and colors, and use a light adhesive to keep them in place.  They’re also quite festive, meaning you can bust them out for those nights when you need to get creative with a costume. **Use some tape** ![breast life tape](http://rack.0.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzL2ZmL2JyZWFzdGxpZmV0LjI5MzVhLmpwZwpwCXRodW1iCTEyMDB4OTYwMD4/b498a33f/f70/breast-life-tape.jpg "breast life tape") This bra alternative provides all of the benefits of your standard bra, but with 100% more freedom.  Disposable stickers and tapes can lift and support while keeping them in place for hours, and the strips come with a guarantee of being able to hold cup sizes A through D. **No wardrobe malfunctions** ![double sided](http://rack.1.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzLzAyL2RvdWJsZXNpZGVkLjZlNDliLmpwZwpwCXRodW1iCTEyMDB4OTYwMD4/7ce59e55/af6/double-sided.jpg "double sided") This special, double-sided tape can be used when you want to wear something that lets the girls breathe, but you also don’t want to them to pop out unexpectedly.  Low-cut necklines and the gap that forms between shirt buttons can be solved by using this type of bra alternative. **Sew in some cups** ![Sew in cups](http://rack.3.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzL2Y0L1Nld2luY3Vwcy5hZjUxZS5qcGcKcAl0aHVtYgkxMjAweDk2MDA-/9e4900d2/7b4/Sew-in-cups.jpg "Sew in cups") Sometimes you just want to ditch the bra for the day.  Stitching in these molded cups to a dress or a top are a great way to give you an extra bit of emphasis on your boobs while also keeping them smooth and shapely. **Grab a swimsuit top** ![swim top](http://rack.1.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzL2ZiL3N3aW10b3AuNGZiYTUuanBnCnAJdGh1bWIJMTIwMHg5NjAwPg/c06da270/532/swim-top.jpg "swim top") ![H&M](http://rack.3.mshcdn.com/media/ZgkyMDE1LzEwLzEzLzM2L0hNLmRiNzliLmpwZwpwCXRodW1iCTEyMDB4OTYwMD4/b932b776/68a/HM.jpg "H&M") Swimsuit tops come in a variety of different designs, and not all of them look like bathing suits.  Trading in your bra for a stylish swim top can be the perfect solution for women with larger breasts or for those who simply don’t like using tape.  Lined, full-coverage styles are perfect for this look. http://mashable.com/2015/10/17/bra-alternatives/#4wH.INn4Eaq0

While recent movements like #FreeTheNipple and #NoBraDay are meant to empower women all over the world, it turns out that a lot of women actually like the function and purpose of the bra.  

While most of us are for women gaining equality on the topless front, and there’s even been some research into why you shouldn’t even be wearing a bra, a lot of women feel that going without one is impractical.

Women use bras for all sorts of different reasons, from simply keeping them stationary to relieving back pressure to hiding the occasional erect nipple.  

If you’re looking to try out something new, something different from your standard bra, check out these five great alternatives:

The Pasty!

Maybe you want the coverage on your nipples, but also like to feel free and uninhibited.  Pasties come in a variety of different designs, shapes and colors, and use a light adhesive to keep them in place.  They’re also quite festive, meaning you can bust them out for those nights when you need to get creative with a costume.

posts.title: 5 Signs Your Child is Hiding Anxiety
posts.markdown: Children are typically pretty up front and vocal about the things that are going on in their lives, so you usually don’t have to worry about them stressing over much.  They like to tell you their fears and it’s easy to tell when they’re scared.  Maybe they like to grab hold of you during new or stressful situations. While it might seem like you know your child like the back of your hand, they don’t always like to display their anxieties.  Sometimes they’ll keep their fears and anxieties hidden. Here are five signs to look for if you think your child might be anxious and not telling you: **Physical Symptoms** ![Anxiety isn't just in the mind, it can be felt in the body as well.](http://blogs.psychcentral.com/anxious-kids/files/2016/03/image.jpeg) Anxiety has just as much of an effect on the mind as it does the body.  Some common symptoms in anxious children include nauseated stomachs, gastrointestinal problems, chest pains, headaches, and cheek biting to name a few on the long list.  If you’ve taken your child to medical professionals in search of an answer to their ailments, but have found nothing, it might be anxiety. **They suddenly don’t like school** If your child is suddenly disinterested in school and you’re struggling to even get them there without resistance, anxiety might be to blame.  If they’re consistently feigning sickness only to be completely fine not long after you’ve let them play hookey, anxiety might be to blame.  Look for signs of them being totally fine during the weekends, and symptoms showing up right when school is back in session. **Anger** While kids typically experience anger for a variety of different reasons, which can make identifying the sole cause difficult, it could be anxiety that is causing them to reach their boiling point quicker than usual.  If they’re coming home from school with their fuse already lit or bedtime starts becoming a huge hassle, anxiety might be at the root of the issue.  Be observant of when and why they are getting angry. **They’re avoiding their normal activities** If they’re always trying to stay home instead of going to restaurants or to stores or they’re avoiding activities and situations that they’ve enjoyed in the past, take some time to look into why.  It’s possible that they’ve simply moved on from certain things, but remember that the most common method of coping with anxiety in children is ‘avoidance’.   **Routines and rituals** If your child is practicing rituals or seeks out certain behaviors from others, like needing to be told “I love you” a certain way or a certain number of times before doing something, then they could be harboring anxiety.  While routines are often comforting and predictable, rituals need to be done to perfection, and need to be redone if they are not done correctly the first time.  Routines can be seen as healthy, while rituals are indicative of anxiety. If you think your child might be anxious, the sooner they receive help for the better off they will be.   (h/t **[Psychcentral](http://blogs.psychcentral.com/anxious-kids/2016/03/missed-signs-child-anxiety/)**)
posts.html:
Children are typically pretty up front and vocal about the things that are going on in their lives, so you usually don’t have to worry about them stressing over much.  They like to tell you their fears and it’s easy to tell when they’re scared.  Maybe they like to grab hold of you during new or stressful situations.

While it might seem like you know your child like the back of your hand, they don’t always like to display their anxieties.  Sometimes they’ll keep their fears and anxieties hidden.

Here are five signs to look for if you think your child might be anxious and not telling you:

Physical Symptoms

Anxiety has just as much of an effect on the mind as it does the body.  Some common symptoms in anxious children include nauseated stomachs, gastrointestinal problems, chest pains, headaches, and cheek biting to name a few on the long list.  If you’ve taken your child to medical professionals in search of an answer to their ailments, but have found nothing, it might be anxiety.

They suddenly don’t like school

If your child is suddenly disinterested in school and you’re struggling to even get them there without resistance, anxiety might be to blame.  If they’re consistently feigning sickness only to be completely fine not long after you’ve let them play hookey, anxiety might be to blame.  Look for signs of them being totally fine during the weekends, and symptoms showing up right when school is back in session.

Anger

While kids typically experience anger for a variety of different reasons, which can make identifying the sole cause difficult, it could be anxiety that is causing them to reach their boiling point quicker than usual.  If they’re coming home from school with their fuse already lit or bedtime starts becoming a huge hassle, anxiety might be at the root of the issue.  Be observant of when and why they are getting angry.

They’re avoiding their normal activities

If they’re always trying to stay home instead of going to restaurants or to stores or they’re avoiding activities and situations that they’ve enjoyed in the past, take some time to look into why.  It’s possible that they’ve simply moved on from certain things, but remember that the most common method of coping with anxiety in children is ‘avoidance’.  

Routines and rituals

If your child is practicing rituals or seeks out certain behaviors from others, like needing to be told “I love you” a certain way or a certain number of times before doing something, then they could be harboring anxiety.  While routines are often comforting and predictable, rituals need to be done to perfection, and need to be redone if they are not done correctly the first time.  Routines can be seen as healthy, while rituals are indicative of anxiety.

If you think your child might be anxious, the sooner they receive help for the better off they will be.  

(h/t Psychcentral)

posts.title: 5 Reasons to Never Take a Leo For Granted
posts.markdown: Leos are a unique breed.  They’re the fifth sign of the Zodiac and many people see them as feisty, over-the-top kind of people.  This is typically due to the highly positive vibes they enjoy putting out, which are often misinterpreted as misplaced energy.  This is not the case, as Leos are some of the strongest and most intelligent individuals you will meet. The Leo is highly selective of who they spend their time with, so if you’re one of the lucky few who gets this opportunity, try not to take advantage of it.  Here are five reasons to never take the Leo for granted: **Leos never chase someone unless they know they’re important – **The Leo doesn’t like to date just anyone and they’ll never beg you to stick around.  Having to fight for your attention is not something they enjoy doing.  Once they realize they don’t need you, they’ll stop wasting any time or energy on the relationship. **When the Leo loves someone, they’re determined and humble – **Leos are some of the most passionate people in the world, and they crave love.  Once they feel that they have secured the loyalty and devotion from their partner they are quick to reciprocate in full.  Trust is always number one on a Leo’s list, so once you’ve gained it, you’ll only receive the same in return. **Speaking of love, the Leo is highly romantic underneath their strong and independent exterior – **The Leo loves to love and loves being loved.  They tend to feel more strongly than their Zodiac peers.  They like their relationships to be meaningful, so they appreciate the small things and spoil those who they care about. **Leos have an amazing sense of humor – **Leos are often known as the life of the party.  They know exactly how to make people laugh and are excellent at brightening the days of their friends and loved ones.  They enjoy the spotlight and enjoy the positive attention they receive even more. **Their positivity will soon become your positivity – **Being around a Leo makes people just feel good.  Their positive attitude and nothing-is-impossible attitude boosts even the lowest of spirits.  They command great influence on those around them, because their outlook on life is something that everyone strives for.
posts.html:
Leos are a unique breed.  They’re the fifth sign of the Zodiac and many people see them as feisty, over-the-top kind of people.  This is typically due to the highly positive vibes they enjoy putting out, which are often misinterpreted as misplaced energy.  This is not the case, as Leos are some of the strongest and most intelligent individuals you will meet.

The Leo is highly selective of who they spend their time with, so if you’re one of the lucky few who gets this opportunity, try not to take advantage of it.  Here are five reasons to never take the Leo for granted:

*Leos never chase someone unless they know they’re important – *The Leo doesn’t like to date just anyone and they’ll never beg you to stick around.  Having to fight for your attention is not something they enjoy doing.  Once they realize they don’t need you, they’ll stop wasting any time or energy on the relationship.

*When the Leo loves someone, they’re determined and humble – *Leos are some of the most passionate people in the world, and they crave love.  Once they feel that they have secured the loyalty and devotion from their partner they are quick to reciprocate in full.  Trust is always number one on a Leo’s list, so once you’ve gained it, you’ll only receive the same in return.

*Speaking of love, the Leo is highly romantic underneath their strong and independent exterior – *The Leo loves to love and loves being loved.  They tend to feel more strongly than their Zodiac peers.  They like their relationships to be meaningful, so they appreciate the small things and spoil those who they care about.

*Leos have an amazing sense of humor – *Leos are often known as the life of the party.  They know exactly how to make people laugh and are excellent at brightening the days of their friends and loved ones.  They enjoy the spotlight and enjoy the positive attention they receive even more.

*Their positivity will soon become your positivity – *Being around a Leo makes people just feel good.  Their positive attitude and nothing-is-impossible attitude boosts even the lowest of spirits.  They command great influence on those around them, because their outlook on life is something that everyone strives for.

posts.title: 10 Signs That a Deceased Loved One is With You
posts.markdown: When our loved ones pass over the other side, they are not lost to us.  They like to give us signs that they are still around, watching over us.  While they might be busy in their newly discovered world, they’re never too busy to drop in and let us know they’re doing their best to help us out. Here are ten signs that a loved one who has crossed over is nearby: 1. **You notice their scent, whatever it may be.  The smell of perfume, cologne, cigarettes, certain foods or flowers–any scent that you associated with them.** 2. **You happen across items or coins that have dates on them corresponding to the year that they were born or the year they passed.** 3. **Finding license plates that have their initials or significant numbers on them.** 4. **Certain songs will start playing at times when you need them.** 5. **Flickering lights can mean that they’re nearby.** 6. **Significant words, phrases or messages communicated to us by other people, often influenced by our loved ones.** 7. **When your pets or animals seem to see something when there is nothing. They’ll bark, meow and lick at nothing when your loved ones are nearby.** 8. **If you have frequent visits from wildlife, like birds, butterflies, or even bigger animals like deer and elk, your loved one is with you.** 9. **Telephone numbers, numbers on the clock, and even receipts are used by our loved ones to communicate with us.** 10. **If they like to visit you in your dreams, it’s no coincidence.  90 percent of the time these are real experiences.** While our passed loved ones might not always be there for us, we can look for them in these ways.  They have lives to lead on the other side, so they cannot be us with all the time, but they will never leave us for too long.  Be aware of what’s happening around you and keep a keen eye for signs that they’re with you.
posts.html:
When our loved ones pass over the other side, they are not lost to us.  They like to give us signs that they are still around, watching over us.  While they might be busy in their newly discovered world, they’re never too busy to drop in and let us know they’re doing their best to help us out.

Here are ten signs that a loved one who has crossed over is nearby:

  1. You notice their scent, whatever it may be.  The smell of perfume, cologne, cigarettes, certain foods or flowers–any scent that you associated with them.
  2. You happen across items or coins that have dates on them corresponding to the year that they were born or the year they passed.
  3. Finding license plates that have their initials or significant numbers on them.
  4. Certain songs will start playing at times when you need them.
  5. Flickering lights can mean that they’re nearby.
  6. Significant words, phrases or messages communicated to us by other people, often influenced by our loved ones.
  7. When your pets or animals seem to see something when there is nothing. They’ll bark, meow and lick at nothing when your loved ones are nearby.
  8. If you have frequent visits from wildlife, like birds, butterflies, or even bigger animals like deer and elk, your loved one is with you.
  9. Telephone numbers, numbers on the clock, and even receipts are used by our loved ones to communicate with us.
  10. If they like to visit you in your dreams, it’s no coincidence.  90 percent of the time these are real experiences.

While our passed loved ones might not always be there for us, we can look for them in these ways.  They have lives to lead on the other side, so they cannot be us with all the time, but they will never leave us for too long.  Be aware of what’s happening around you and keep a keen eye for signs that they’re with you.

posts.title: 5 Signs You've Found the Right Relationship
posts.markdown: Sometimes it’s easy to tell when a relationship just isn’t heading in the right direction.  Sometimes things are going great when a sudden patch of roughness turns things upside down, leaving the two of you reeling and confused.  It can be hard to tell if you should stick it out or decide to part ways.  But there are little things that let you know the two of you are doing things right. Here are five ways to tell that you’re in a relationship that’s right for you: **You have the support of others** Friends and family are the ones we turn to for acceptance of our choice in partner because we trust that they only want the best for us, and because they’re outside of the relationship so they can see things a little more clearly.  If your friends and family want to see you and your partner together, there’s something to be said about that.  Don’t get too caught up with what others think, but it is a good sign. **You guys fight fairly** It’s a good thing if the two of you can have conflicts that do not resort to personal attacks and/or insults.  If your arguments are focused mainly on resolving known issues while still considering each other’s feelings and desires, then it’s a good sign that the two of you are good for each other. **You’re growing together** Any great relationship is great because there is growth by both people involved.  When the two of you do not inhibit one another’s emotional, mental and spiritual growth, then it’s a good sign that you’re meant to be together. **You view each other as life partners** When you can’t imagine a life without your significant other it’s very telling of how deeply you care about them.  If you struggle to imagine a world where the two of you aren’t together in some form or another, and know that your partner feels the same way, you’re in the right relationship. **You’re not interested in another love** While there are all types of love in this world, each of them different, you can’t imagine yourself loving anyone but your partner.  Physical attractions will come and go harmlessly as long as we acknowledge them for what they are, and then let them go.   When you’re positive that no other bond in the world can compare to the connection the two of you have, it’s a good sign you’ve found the right relationship.
posts.html:
Sometimes it’s easy to tell when a relationship just isn’t heading in the right direction.  Sometimes things are going great when a sudden patch of roughness turns things upside down, leaving the two of you reeling and confused.  It can be hard to tell if you should stick it out or decide to part ways.  But there are little things that let you know the two of you are doing things right.

Here are five ways to tell that you’re in a relationship that’s right for you:

You have the support of others

Friends and family are the ones we turn to for acceptance of our choice in partner because we trust that they only want the best for us, and because they’re outside of the relationship so they can see things a little more clearly.  If your friends and family want to see you and your partner together, there’s something to be said about that.  Don’t get too caught up with what others think, but it is a good sign.

You guys fight fairly

It’s a good thing if the two of you can have conflicts that do not resort to personal attacks and/or insults.  If your arguments are focused mainly on resolving known issues while still considering each other’s feelings and desires, then it’s a good sign that the two of you are good for each other.

You’re growing together

Any great relationship is great because there is growth by both people involved.  When the two of you do not inhibit one another’s emotional, mental and spiritual growth, then it’s a good sign that you’re meant to be together.

You view each other as life partners

When you can’t imagine a life without your significant other it’s very telling of how deeply you care about them.  If you struggle to imagine a world where the two of you aren’t together in some form or another, and know that your partner feels the same way, you’re in the right relationship.

You’re not interested in another love

While there are all types of love in this world, each of them different, you can’t imagine yourself loving anyone but your partner.  Physical attractions will come and go harmlessly as long as we acknowledge them for what they are, and then let them go.  

When you’re positive that no other bond in the world can compare to the connection the two of you have, it’s a good sign you’ve found the right relationship.

posts.title: 5 Things to Know Before Falling For a Cancer
posts.markdown: Ah, the crab sign.  The hard outer shell with the soft inner core.  Full of love, contradictions and emotions.  Here are five things to know before getting involved with the Cancer: **They’re incredibly loyal – **Cancers are passionate when it comes to love, so when they’ve chosen someone, they give that person their all.  The same goes for their friends.  They thrive when they’re in the company of like-minded people, but they typically keep their circle small. **They’re sensitive – **Cancers are probably mostly known for how sensitive they are and their seemingly spontaneous moods.  When feeling conflicted, the Cancer will usually become withdrawn rather than wanting to open up and talk about things.  They can easily get lost in the negative energy that comes with a bad day or a disagreement.  All they ask is for your patience and understanding. **They have insecurities too – **One of the Cancer’s greatest fears is rejection, especially from those they care about the most.  They’re also hard-fought to let go of the past, which often gets in the way of the Cancer’s ability to give someone/something a chance.  They’re skeptical; earning their trust isn’t easy. **They’re highly intuitive – **That tough outer shell is fortified by the Cancer’s keen intuition.  They’re guarded and mindful of everything that can go wrong in any situation.  They rely on their intuition for much of their decision-making processes, and this usually leads them down the right  path.  So, don’t give off a bad vibe, cause the Cancer will pick up on it. **They’re persistent and dedicated workers – **The Cancer takes pride in his or her work, whatever it is they do.  They’re highly tenacious, and prideful of the position that they have worked so hard to get to.  Relationships with coworkers are a nice balance between familial and professional. posts.title: 4 Things to Remember if You Want Your Relationship to Last
posts.markdown: There are many people in this world who have never had a relationship last longer than 6 months.  There are others who consistently find themselves in a long-term relationship; one after another after another.  And then there are those who have been with the same person since high school, their relationship lasting decades. For those of us who are looking for a partner to build a life with, there certain things one should remember when it comes to your significant other and how the two of you will construct the relationship that you want.   Maybe you’ve fallen out love with your spouse or maybe you just need a refresher course, but here are four things to remember when trying to make a relationship last: **You don’t have to spend time together every day** Those who find themselves newly married or who have kids who have recently moved out of their homes, the amount of time these couples have to spend with each other is plentiful.  This is not necessarily the case for the couple who has just started building their family, raising little ones.   Acknowledge that the amount of time you have will be limited occasionally, and that you might not get to spend time together that much for a little while.  You can have a successful relationship while being apart from each other. **You should try to spend time together on a regular basis** While you don’t have to spend every waking moment together, you should also plan to see each other on a consistent basis.  When you’re apart from one another, the two of you are at greater risk for troubles, including the spark in your relationship fading, more frequent conflicts, and being more open to an affair.  The two of you *must* spend time together.  Maybe not every day, but more often than not. **Remember how the two of you fell for each other** Those early stages when the two of you had no clue about one another, just that you were interested and willing to see where things went are crucial to remember, as those were moments when your love was first developing.  As you got to know one another, the two of you chose to love, rather than not to love.  Your love grows when you share time with one another. **Finding time for each other can be easy** Do little things that show your partner you care.  Try things like taking a minute or two in the mornings to have a conversation with one another, texting each other every now and then throughout the day, or just walking down to the park together.
posts.html:
There are many people in this world who have never had a relationship last longer than 6 months.  There are others who consistently find themselves in a long-term relationship; one after another after another.  And then there are those who have been with the same person since high school, their relationship lasting decades.

For those of us who are looking for a partner to build a life with, there certain things one should remember when it comes to your significant other and how the two of you will construct the relationship that you want.  

Maybe you’ve fallen out love with your spouse or maybe you just need a refresher course, but here are four things to remember when trying to make a relationship last:

You don’t have to spend time together every day

Those who find themselves newly married or who have kids who have recently moved out of their homes, the amount of time these couples have to spend with each other is plentiful.  This is not necessarily the case for the couple who has just started building their family, raising little ones.  

Acknowledge that the amount of time you have will be limited occasionally, and that you might not get to spend time together that much for a little while.  You can have a successful relationship while being apart from each other.

You should try to spend time together on a regular basis

While you don’t have to spend every waking moment together, you should also plan to see each other on a consistent basis.  When you’re apart from one another, the two of you are at greater risk for troubles, including the spark in your relationship fading, more frequent conflicts, and being more open to an affair.  The two of you must spend time together.  Maybe not every day, but more often than not.

Remember how the two of you fell for each other

Those early stages when the two of you had no clue about one another, just that you were interested and willing to see where things went are crucial to remember, as those were moments when your love was first developing.  As you got to know one another, the two of you chose to love, rather than not to love.  Your love grows when you share time with one another.

Finding time for each other can be easy

Do little things that show your partner you care.  Try things like taking a minute or two in the mornings to have a conversation with one another, texting each other every now and then throughout the day, or just walking down to the park together.

posts.title: Waking Up At The Same Time Every Night? This Might Be Why
posts.markdown: If you’ve noticed that you’re waking up at a specific time every night, it could mean that your body is trying to tell you something.  The energy meridians of the body have been said to be connected to a clock system that stimulates different parts of the body at different times of the day. The time at which you find yourself waking up (or having trouble sleeping) can mean a variety of different things: **Between 9pm and 11pm** If you struggle to fall asleep during what is considered bedtime for most people it is a sign that you’re still carrying the stresses and anxieties of the day with you.  Meditation, positive mantras, and practicing relaxation techniques or exercises can help you fall asleep and stay asleep. **Between 11pm and 1am** Ancient Chinese medicine would say that between these hours the energy meridian of the gallbladder is stimulated.  If you’re waking up at this time, you might be suffering from emotional disappointment.  Try to promote self-love and forgiveness to get back to sleeping normally. **Between 1am and 3am** Waking up during this interval of time is associated with the body clock and our livers.  It can mean that you’re harboring emotions of anger or that you have an excess of yang energy.  Taking responsibility of the events that caused the anger can help you to sleep better through the night. **Between 3am and 5am** Struggling to sleep between 3am and 5am is correlated with the energy meridian that flows through the lungs and can be because of emotional sadness.  Slow, deep breathing exercises and expressions of faith in your higher being will help you fall back asleep. **Between 5am and 7am** Waking during this time is associated with the energies in the intestines.  Stretching your muscles and taking a bathroom break can help clear emotional blockages and get you back to sleep. Remember to listen to your body and what it has to say to you.  It is often during the sleep cycle that we are most likely to experience spiritual events and messages.  Just as our thoughts manifest physical side effects on the body, our spirituality does the same.
posts.html:

Struggling to sleep between 3am and 5am is correlated with the energy meridian that flows through the lungs and can be because of emotional sadness.  Slow, deep breathing exercises and expressions of faith in your higher being will help you fall back asleep.

Between 5am and 7am

Waking during this time is associated with the energies in the intestines.  Stretching your muscles and taking a bathroom break can help clear emotional blockages and get you back to sleep.

Remember to listen to your body and what it has to say to you.  It is often during the sleep cycle that we are most likely to experience spiritual events and messages.  Just as our thoughts manifest physical side effects on the body, our spirituality does the same.

posts.title: 5 Tips for Communicating Telepathically with Animals
posts.markdown: While it might seem far-fetched at first, Dr. Linda Bender says that telepathy between yourself and animals is possible and she’ll help you do it.  In order to create the space in which one communicates telepathically with an animal, one must first quiet the mind, focus on living presently, and open the heart.  Once you’ve done this, practice doing one or more of the practices below for at least a few minutes a day. Animals mainly think in pictures and emotions.  So, when they’re trying to connect with you, they’ll often create a mental image or some type of emotion.  Communicating with animals isn’t like talking to a friend over the phone.  You will not ‘hear’ their words, necessarily, but rather different words will manifest in your own mind spontaneously as you receive their thoughts or feelings. Here are five practices for telepathy with animals: **Pictorial Messages** When trying to get your animal companion to do something for you, next time try forming a mental image of the action that you want them to do, and then focus on sending that image to them via ‘telepathic airwaves’.   Like in those old beer commercials, where the dog fetches a beer for his master out of the fridge, picture them doing whatever it is you want them to do.  You’ll start to notice that they respond to these mental messages. **Sending Feelings** Similar to the last practice, you’ll be trying to send your emotions or feelings to your animal companion.  To try this, instead of exclaiming ‘good boy!’, practice focusing more on the actual feeling of being happy or satisfied with your companion. Once you’ve really built up this emotion of being pleased inside of you, send it off to them.  Practicing this will help you both send and receive messages from animals. **Make a Metaphor** Being able to create different metaphors is vital to understanding metaphors that you might receive from an animal.  Metaphors are mental images that symbolically represent certain feelings, emotions, or ideas.   For example, if I’m feeling overwhelmed in life, an image of Atlas holding the Earth on his shoulders might pop into my mind.  Practice creating different mental images of metaphors for the feelings you experience, as animals will often use these to try to speak to you. **Send Comfort** In the same way that you would send a mental image or a feeling, sending comfort is one of the best ways to get through to an animal telepathically.  Focus on the animal’s suffering and then brainstorm all of the ways you can offer it comfort. You can send feelings of being loved or pictures of you soothing them or petting them.  If the animal is near death you might send them images of how happy they’ll be in their new afterlife animal sanctuary.  Gather these thoughts and feelings, prepare them to be sent and then shoot them over to the animal in need. **Requests for Help** While animals have no way of interpreting any sort of spoken message, they’re very apt at picking up on the emotions and feelings that lie behind them.  When a person asks for help, they typically expect a solution to be given in the form of a spoken answer, “you need to do this.”  Animals will not be able to answer questions like this.   Instead, focus on a current problem or concern that you have and then navigate your way through all of the different feelings and emotions that have motivated the question.  Use these feelings to build a statement instead of a question, acknowledge any images that come with it, and then telepathically send that statement (along with any emotions or pictures) to an animal, to yourself, to another person, or to your God.     (h/t **[OM Times](http://omtimes.com/2015/06/telepathy-with-animals/4/)**)
posts.html:
While it might seem far-fetched at first, Dr. Linda Bender says that telepathy between yourself and animals is possible and she’ll help you do it.  In order to create the space in which one communicates telepathically with an animal, one must first quiet the mind, focus on living presently, and open the heart.  Once you’ve done this, practice doing one or more of the practices below for at least a few minutes a day.

Animals mainly think in pictures and emotions.  So, when they’re trying to connect with you, they’ll often create a mental image or some type of emotion.  Communicating with animals isn’t like talking to a friend over the phone.  You will not ‘hear’ their words, necessarily, but rather different words will manifest in your own mind spontaneously as you receive their thoughts or feelings.

Here are five practices for telepathy with animals:

Pictorial Messages

When trying to get your animal companion to do something for you, next time try forming a mental image of the action that you want them to do, and then focus on sending that image to them via ‘telepathic airwaves’.  

Like in those old beer commercials, where the dog fetches a beer for his master out of the fridge, picture them doing whatever it is you want them to do.  You’ll start to notice that they respond to these mental messages.

Sending Feelings

Similar to the last practice, you’ll be trying to send your emotions or feelings to your animal companion.  To try this, instead of exclaiming ‘good boy!’, practice focusing more on the actual feeling of being happy or satisfied with your companion.

Once you’ve really built up this emotion of being pleased inside of you, send it off to them.  Practicing this will help you both send and receive messages from animals.

Make a Metaphor

Being able to create different metaphors is vital to understanding metaphors that you might receive from an animal.  Metaphors are mental images that symbolically represent certain feelings, emotions, or ideas.  

For example, if I’m feeling overwhelmed in life, an image of Atlas holding the Earth on his shoulders might pop into my mind.  Practice creating different mental images of metaphors for the feelings you experience, as animals will often use these to try to speak to you.

Send Comfort

In the same way that you would send a mental image or a feeling, sending comfort is one of the best ways to get through to an animal telepathically.  Focus on the animal’s suffering and then brainstorm all of the ways you can offer it comfort.

You can send feelings of being loved or pictures of you soothing them or petting them.  If the animal is near death you might send them images of how happy they’ll be in their new afterlife animal sanctuary.  Gather these thoughts and feelings, prepare them to be sent and then shoot them over to the animal in need.

Requests for Help

While animals have no way of interpreting any sort of spoken message, they’re very apt at picking up on the emotions and feelings that lie behind them.  When a person asks for help, they typically expect a solution to be given in the form of a spoken answer, “you need to do this.”  Animals will not be able to answer questions like this.  

Instead, focus on a current problem or concern that you have and then navigate your way through all of the different feelings and emotions that have motivated the question.  Use these feelings to build a statement instead of a question, acknowledge any images that come with it, and then telepathically send that statement (along with any emotions or pictures) to an animal, to yourself, to another person, or to your God.  

(h/t OM Times)

posts.title: The 4 Types of Negative People To Avoid At All Cost
posts.markdown: As we progress through this journey called life we will allow a number of different people to come into our lives, whether it be as friends, business partners, lovers, or whatever else.  And there will also be those that enter our lives and immediately start causing trouble.   You don’t have time to keep these types of people around, as they’ll only hold you back in life.  You need people in your life who are going to help you grow, help you love, help you flourish.   Here are four types of negative people that you don’t need in your life: **The User** A person with this type of personality is highly egotistical.  They’re masters of manipulation and deception and have zero remorse for those that they afflict.  They’re quick to feed on people who are kind and sensitive, as they’re the easiest to use and abuse.  They’ll often leave your life in ruins, as if they were some sort of natural catastrophe. To deal with this type of person, do not engage with their drama-creating antics, be assertive and don’t be afraid to say ‘no’ with confidence. **The Gossiper** If you’ve ever had to deal with a person who gossips and spreads rumors, then you’ve met a person with extremely low self-esteem and plenty of insecurities.  They like to twist context, omit certain details, and embellish the truth for a variety of reasons, including popularity, revenge, control, power and just plain boredom. Do your best to avoid getting caught up in their stories, and don’t be afraid to call them out when they start gossiping. **The Blamer** The Blamer is a person who feels largely victimized every time something undesirable happens.  They hate taking responsibility for anything and are quick to pass off the blame to someone else, even if it means going to extreme measures.  This shows their innate lack of self-control and self-esteem. When dealing with this type of person be sure to control the conversation.  Question everything and be sure that they know they’re going to be held accountable. **The Complainer** The Complainer is the person you always see moping about feeling sorry for themselves.  And they like to divert attention to themselves by spreading negativity.  These people can be hard to deal with because of their strange demeanor. The best thing to do is to be supportive while abstaining from any engagement of the issue or story that they’re pushing.  Completely detach yourself from the situation while acknowledging their plight.
posts.html:
As we progress through this journey called life we will allow a number of different people to come into our lives, whether it be as friends, business partners, lovers, or whatever else.  And there will also be those that enter our lives and immediately start causing trouble.  

You don’t have time to keep these types of people around, as they’ll only hold you back in life.  You need people in your life who are going to help you grow, help you love, help you flourish.  

Here are four types of negative people that you don’t need in your life:

The User

A person with this type of personality is highly egotistical.  They’re masters of manipulation and deception and have zero remorse for those that they afflict.  They’re quick to feed on people who are kind and sensitive, as they’re the easiest to use and abuse.  They’ll often leave your life in ruins, as if they were some sort of natural catastrophe.

To deal with this type of person, do not engage with their drama-creating antics, be assertive and don’t be afraid to say ‘no’ with confidence.

The Gossiper

If you’ve ever had to deal with a person who gossips and spreads rumors, then you’ve met a person with extremely low self-esteem and plenty of insecurities.  They like to twist context, omit certain details, and embellish the truth for a variety of reasons, including popularity, revenge, control, power and just plain boredom.

Do your best to avoid getting caught up in their stories, and don’t be afraid to call them out when they start gossiping.

The Blamer

The Blamer is a person who feels largely victimized every time something undesirable happens.  They hate taking responsibility for anything and are quick to pass off the blame to someone else, even if it means going to extreme measures.  This shows their innate lack of self-control and self-esteem.

When dealing with this type of person be sure to control the conversation.  Question everything and be sure that they know they’re going to be held accountable.

The Complainer

The Complainer is the person you always see moping about feeling sorry for themselves.  And they like to divert attention to themselves by spreading negativity.  These people can be hard to deal with because of their strange demeanor.

The best thing to do is to be supportive while abstaining from any engagement of the issue or story that they’re pushing.  Completely detach yourself from the situation while acknowledging their plight.
