posts.title: 5 Reasons Why You'll Want to Love a Taurus For Life
posts.markdown: True love is one thing that I’d say *most* people are looking for as they move forward with their lives.  And why not?  Being in love is fun, exciting, and heartwarming, as well as terrifying, confusing, and crazy.   You start doing things you wouldn’t normally do, start acting in ways you wouldn’t normally act, and you start thinking about the couple, rather than the individual. But before a person can truly fall in love, there are five things a person needs to accept: **To find the right person for you, you need to be the right person for you** Before you can dive into a deep, meaningful and loving relationship with someone, you must first become the person that you yourself love.   You don’t *always* need to be in a relationship; take the necessary time to figure out who you are, what things you love in life, what you ultimately want out of life–the more whole you can become, the more likely you are to find someone who wants to share their wholeness with your own.   **Figure out your boundaries and how far you can be pushed** Knowing where you stand when it comes to different aspects of a relationship is important because it also helps your partner to have a better sense of what they can and cannot get away with. What are you willing to put up with?  Hard drugs?  Alcohol abuse?  Infidelity?  Lying?  Know how far you’re willing to go and then stick to your guns.   **Healthy communication is key** Talking to your partner is something that takes practice, as each person is somewhat afraid of what the other is going to say or think.  Being in a relationship has implications, and communication helps put things out in the open when certain expectations or implications are not met.   If your relationship ever starts to feel like a game or puzzle that you’re constantly trying to figure out, it’s probably not the relationship for you. **Love is about chasing your own goals and desires, and the goals and desires of the couple** Continue chasing the goals and milestones that you have set for yourself, but also recognize that you and your partner should have goals for your relationship as well.   Be sure that both you and your partner are capable of and willing to support one another.  You should be happy, they should be happy, you should be happy together. **True love is about accepting your partner for who they are, and vice versa** You’ll know when you’ve found true love because the person you’ve fallen for loves you for the person you are, not the person they expect you to become or hope you’ll turn into.   If a person ever tells you to give up certain aspects of your life that you enjoy, whether it’s a hobby, a friend or a job, it’s unhealthy and you should reconsider being with that person.  Never sacrifice who you are for another person, but also be sure to make time for both yourself and your partner.
posts.html:
True love is one thing that I’d say most people are looking for as they move forward with their lives.  And why not?  Being in love is fun, exciting, and heartwarming, as well as terrifying, confusing, and crazy.  

You start doing things you wouldn’t normally do, start acting in ways you wouldn’t normally act, and you start thinking about the couple, rather than the individual.

But before a person can truly fall in love, there are five things a person needs to accept:

To find the right person for you, you need to be the right person for you

Before you can dive into a deep, meaningful and loving relationship with someone, you must first become the person that you yourself love.  

You don’t always need to be in a relationship; take the necessary time to figure out who you are, what things you love in life, what you ultimately want out of life–the more whole you can become, the more likely you are to find someone who wants to share their wholeness with your own.  

Figure out your boundaries and how far you can be pushed

Knowing where you stand when it comes to different aspects of a relationship is important because it also helps your partner to have a better sense of what they can and cannot get away with.

What are you willing to put up with?  Hard drugs?  Alcohol abuse?  Infidelity?  Lying?  Know how far you’re willing to go and then stick to your guns.  

Healthy communication is key

Talking to your partner is something that takes practice, as each person is somewhat afraid of what the other is going to say or think.  Being in a relationship has implications, and communication helps put things out in the open when certain expectations or implications are not met.  

If your relationship ever starts to feel like a game or puzzle that you’re constantly trying to figure out, it’s probably not the relationship for you.

Love is about chasing your own goals and desires, and the goals and desires of the couple

Continue chasing the goals and milestones that you have set for yourself, but also recognize that you and your partner should have goals for your relationship as well.  

Be sure that both you and your partner are capable of and willing to support one another.  You should be happy, they should be happy, you should be happy together.

True love is about accepting your partner for who they are, and vice versa

You’ll know when you’ve found true love because the person you’ve fallen for loves you for the person you are, not the person they expect you to become or hope you’ll turn into.  

If a person ever tells you to give up certain aspects of your life that you enjoy, whether it’s a hobby, a friend or a job, it’s unhealthy and you should reconsider being with that person.  Never sacrifice who you are for another person, but also be sure to make time for both yourself and your partner.

posts.title: This Drink Will Soothe Your Migraine in Minutes!
posts.markdown: One of my former partners used to suffer from the absolute worst migraines.  They would leave her bed-ridden, incapacitated, and reeling from the sudden, sharp jolts of pain in her head.  While her migraines were undoubtedly a bit more severe than your average, she is not alone in her suffering.   Over 36 million people in the United States are affected by migraines, which is close to one out of every ten people! While a migraine might give you an excuse to get out of certain responsibilities for the day, the intense pain doesn’t let you enjoy much of anything.  The constant throbbing and pain can push even the most grounded people off of their game, as their duration can change wildly; they can last anywhere from four to seventy-two hours. Symptoms include nausea, vomiting, numbness, tingling sensations, dizziness and sensitivity to lights, noises and smells. Migraines are believed to be caused by a wide variety of different factors, including stress, alcohol consumption, allergies and deficiencies in the body.  However, it has been seen that the biggest indicator of migraines is dehydration and an electrolyte imbalance. Electrolytes support and regulate nerve function, they regulate the cardiovascular system, and they regulate muscle function, making them pretty important to a healthy body.  As migraines are an inflammatory response, Magnesium can also be beneficial when seeking relief from a migraine. The recipe to soothe your aching head is actually pretty simple: - 1 Cup of Water - Lemon Juice from One Whole Lemon - Two Teaspoons of Sea Salt Try to obtain high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt.  This incredibly pure salt has more than eighty different trace minerals, including the aforementioned Magnesium.  When you ingest these minerals quickly, the serotonin levels in your body increase, which directly helps relieve pain and inflammation. While there isn’t a ton of research that readily proves this recipe 100% effective, electrolyte solutions are often used by medical professionals when treating patients suffering from migraines. It might be an old remedy, but there’s a reason that people use it.  It works.
posts.html:
One of my former partners used to suffer from the absolute worst migraines.  They would leave her bed-ridden, incapacitated, and reeling from the sudden, sharp jolts of pain in her head.  While her migraines were undoubtedly a bit more severe than your average, she is not alone in her suffering.  

Over 36 million people in the United States are affected by migraines, which is close to one out of every ten people!

While a migraine might give you an excuse to get out of certain responsibilities for the day, the intense pain doesn’t let you enjoy much of anything.  The constant throbbing and pain can push even the most grounded people off of their game, as their duration can change wildly; they can last anywhere from four to seventy-two hours.

Symptoms include nausea, vomiting, numbness, tingling sensations, dizziness and sensitivity to lights, noises and smells.

Migraines are believed to be caused by a wide variety of different factors, including stress, alcohol consumption, allergies and deficiencies in the body.  However, it has been seen that the biggest indicator of migraines is dehydration and an electrolyte imbalance.

Electrolytes support and regulate nerve function, they regulate the cardiovascular system, and they regulate muscle function, making them pretty important to a healthy body.  As migraines are an inflammatory response, Magnesium can also be beneficial when seeking relief from a migraine.

The recipe to soothe your aching head is actually pretty simple:

  • 1 Cup of Water
  • Lemon Juice from One Whole Lemon
  • Two Teaspoons of Sea Salt

Try to obtain high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt.  This incredibly pure salt has more than eighty different trace minerals, including the aforementioned Magnesium.  When you ingest these minerals quickly, the serotonin levels in your body increase, which directly helps relieve pain and inflammation.

While there isn’t a ton of research that readily proves this recipe 100% effective, electrolyte solutions are often used by medical professionals when treating patients suffering from migraines.

It might be an old remedy, but there’s a reason that people use it.  It works.

posts.title: This Is What Happens To Your Sleep Cycle If You Share Your Bed With A Pet
posts.markdown: Sleep makes up about a third of our entire lives, yet a lot of us struggle when it comes to doing it well.  **[The Better Sleep Council reports](http://bettersleep.org/better-sleep/the-science-of-sleep/sleep-statistics-research/starving-for-sleep-americas-hunger-games/)** that 8 out of every 10 Americans say that they would “feel better and more prepared for the day if they had an extra hour of sleep.”   I’ve had numerous friends gawk at me when I tell them that I regularly get about 8 hours of sleep each night.  Why?  Because they tend to only get 6 hours a night on average simply due to how busy they are. But a recent study by researchers at the **[Mayo Clinic](http://www.mayoclinic.org/patient-visitor-guide/arizona)** have found that many of our traditional problems with sleep can be remedied by sleeping with our furry companions.   Of the 150 patients surveyed on sleep habits, 56 percent of them said they shared their bed (or bedroom) with their pets.  Out of these people, 20 percent said that their pets kept them from sleeping, while 41 percent said that having them nearby actually helped them to sleep better. Single people in particular reported improved sleeping ability when sharing their bed with their pet.   The researchers wrote: “*Respondents described feeling secure, content and relaxed when their pet slept nearby. The value of these experiences, although poorly understood, cannot be dismissed because sleep is dependent on a state of physical and mental relaxation.”* So, if you’re struggling to fall asleep or have been suffering from a taxing case of insomnia, try cuddling up next to your favorite furry companion and see if they’ll help you doze off into la-la land.
posts.html:
Sleep makes up about a third of our entire lives, yet a lot of us struggle when it comes to doing it well.  The Better Sleep Council reports that 8 out of every 10 Americans say that they would “feel better and more prepared for the day if they had an extra hour of sleep.”  

I’ve had numerous friends gawk at me when I tell them that I regularly get about 8 hours of sleep each night.  Why?  Because they tend to only get 6 hours a night on average simply due to how busy they are.

But a recent study by researchers at the Mayo Clinic have found that many of our traditional problems with sleep can be remedied by sleeping with our furry companions.  

Of the 150 patients surveyed on sleep habits, 56 percent of them said they shared their bed (or bedroom) with their pets.  Out of these people, 20 percent said that their pets kept them from sleeping, while 41 percent said that having them nearby actually helped them to sleep better.

Single people in particular reported improved sleeping ability when sharing their bed with their pet.  

The researchers wrote:

“Respondents described feeling secure, content and relaxed when their pet slept nearby. The value of these experiences, although poorly understood, cannot be dismissed because sleep is dependent on a state of physical and mental relaxation.”

So, if you’re struggling to fall asleep or have been suffering from a taxing case of insomnia, try cuddling up next to your favorite furry companion and see if they’ll help you doze off into la-la land.

posts.title: Find Out Which Prince Song Describes Your Life Best
posts.markdown: Prince Rogers Nelson, the multi-platinum-selling music icon and rockstar, passed away on Wednesday, sending much of the music world reeling from the unexpected and tragic loss. Prince’s widespread popularity and success in the music industry is largely attributed to his seemingly effortless ability to tie together multiple genres of music, including pop, funk, folk and rock.  His constant experimentation with music led to a remarkable growth in both style and musical diversity over the years. From ‘1999’ to ‘Purple Rain,’ find out which Prince song best describes your life!
posts.html:
Prince Rogers Nelson, the multi-platinum-selling music icon and rockstar, passed away on Wednesday, sending much of the music world reeling from the unexpected and tragic loss.

Prince’s widespread popularity and success in the music industry is largely attributed to his seemingly effortless ability to tie together multiple genres of music, including pop, funk, folk and rock.  His constant experimentation with music led to a remarkable growth in both style and musical diversity over the years.

From ‘1999’ to ‘Purple Rain,’ find out which Prince song best describes your life!

posts.title: Find Out Your Best Qualities, Based On Your Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: Believing in the stars is something that might seem a bit far fetched for some, but for those of us who look to them for wisdom and guidance, they’re more than just dazzling lights in the night sky.  Our astrological place in the world helps us reflect on who we are and where we’re headed. They’re also great little reminders of the infinite amount of potential we each possess; check out which qualities are your best, based on your sign: **Aries – **The natural born leader.  Highly ambitious and creative, the Aries is almost always thrusted into a position of leadership.  You’re also very spontaneous and never miss an opportunity to adventure with those you care about. **Taurus – **The practical artist.  The Taurus is known for its loyalty, which is why their friendships will last a lifetime.  You’ve seen your BFFs through the darkest of times and never leave people hanging.  Your artistic side of you comes out in your work. **Gemini – **The firecracker.  Geminis are the free spirits that are unforgettable.  Your laughter is contagious and you never let anyone tone you down.  You’re good at adapting to new environments and are not afraid to voice your opinion. **Cancer – **You have the biggest of hearts.  Crabs tend to have an icy, hard outer layer, but are known for their love.  When you give love, you give it all, showering your partner with respect and admiration because you see the best in them.  You’re also very empathetic and in tune with your emotions. very blunt sometimes, but it’s necessary.  Telling your friends what they need to hear when they need to hear it is a good thing. **Virgo – **The intelligent introvert.  Virgos are highly observant, allowing them to read people like the Sunday newspaper.  Your friends count on you in a variety of different situations because of how reliable and resourceful you are.  You don’t like to show off Scorpio is bold.  Unafraid of failure, the Scorpio takes risks without fear.  They’re good decision-makers because of their intuitive nature.  Getting work done on time is not hard because of how well you focus. **Sagittarius – **You’re the adventurous one.  Being timid is not your thing, as Sagittariuses are brave adventurers.  Spontaneous backpacking trips through foreign countries aren’t unusual and you have a heart for people, which is when you show your compassion. **Capricorn – **The wise alpha.  Capricorns are highly ambitious, which is where the alpha trait derives from.  There is no fear when it comes to making those big leaps in life.  Go for it and give it your best.   **Aquarius – **The old soul.  Aquarians gain their notoriety from their sentimental friendliness, meaning, like the Taurus, they make lasting friendships.  Your big imagination contributes to your unique way of thinking and your nerdy sense of humor. **Pisces – **The compassionate one.  Pisces can get a bad rep because of their highly sensitive nature, but it’s definitely not a bad thing.  It’s an essential part of your personality because you’re always there to help when someone needs it.  You have a kind heart and a creative mind, leading you to inspire others.

They’re also great little reminders of the infinite amount of potential we each possess; check out which qualities are your best, based on your sign:

*Leo – *The energy and passion of the sun.  Leos radiate positive vibes, lifting the moods and energies of those around them.  You’re always on board for a good time with friends.  You can also be very blunt sometimes, but it’s necessary.  Telling your friends what they need to hear when they need to hear it is a good thing.

*Virgo – *The intelligent introvert.  Virgos are highly observant, allowing them to read people like the Sunday newspaper.  Your friends count on you in a variety of different situations because of how reliable and resourceful you are.  You don’t like to show off because overachieving comes naturally to you.

*Libra – *The charming peacemaker.  Libras are infamous for being the most dateable of the zodiac because of their highly romantic nature.  They put a lot of thought and effort into showing their significant others that they care.  Libras listen and give advice, which is why their friends come to them for help with their problems.

*Scorpio – *The Scorpio is bold.  Unafraid of failure, the Scorpio takes risks without fear.  They’re good decision-makers because of their intuitive nature.  Getting work done on time is not hard because of how well you focus.

*Sagittarius – *You’re the adventurous one.  Being timid is not your thing, as Sagittariuses are brave adventurers.  Spontaneous backpacking trips through foreign countries aren’t unusual and you have a heart for people, which is when you show your compassion.

*Capricorn – *The wise alpha.  Capricorns are highly ambitious, which is where the alpha trait derives from.  There is no fear when it comes to making those big leaps in life.  Go for it and give it your best.  

*Aquarius – *The old soul.  Aquarians gain their notoriety from their sentimental friendliness, meaning, like the Taurus, they make lasting friendships.  Your big imagination contributes to your unique way of thinking and your nerdy sense of humor.

posts.title: 5 Tips to Live By if You're a Highly Sensitive Person
posts.markdown: Oftentimes in cultures and societies around the world, sensitive people are tagged with labels like ‘weak’ or ‘unworthy,’ which I think is a very flawed way of thinking.  Being capable of deep, sincere emotion and thought cannot be described as a weakness or vice.   We should never be afraid to say what we are feeling, whether it be bad or good.  And bottling up emotions isn’t good for anyone.  It leads to isolation and thoughts that you are alone.  You’re not alone.   Psychotherapist and researcher, Dr. Elaine Aron, says that 15 to 20 percent of people have nervous systems that process stimuli more intensely than the average.  Not only do they feel more, but they think more deeply, leading to quick overstimulation. Here are five tips for the highly sensitive person: **There is nothing that will ‘fix’ you** Sensitivity is largely a trait of one’s temperament, not some sort of medical condition.  Because of this, you can’t really say that anything is wrong with you.   While many doctors and medical professionals might say otherwise, processing sensitivity research is young and undeveloped. Sensitive people that achieve great things do so because they understand that they are not ‘flawed.’ **Look for other sensitive people like yourself** Being highly sensitive often makes you feel like you’re alone in your struggles, when that notion couldn’t be further from the truth.   Look for other sensitive people who are already succeeding in their endeavors, as they can offer firsthand knowledge of the things you deal with regularly. **Strive to find positivity in every encounter or situation you find yourself in** Highly sensitive people are much more capable of soaking up the energy of their surroundings, meaning negative environments promote negativity and positive environments promote positivity.   One of the best tactics a sensitive person can learn is how to acknowledge negativity and then let go of it. **Give yourself the same compassion that you give others** Highly sensitive people are known for their immense passion.  This often takes the form of them putting the needs and desires of others over their own, while also being highly critical of themselves.   Always be willing to give yourself the same leniency and compassion that you want others to have. **Do your best not to suffocate your sensitivity** One of the easiest things to do is tune out the overwhelming amount of stimuli so that you can appear as though it doesn’t affect you on a deeper level, and this is a very unhealthy practice.  While it might trick your mind for a short time, your sensitive self knows better.   The sensitive person needs to learn how to free themselves of the constant need for control, so that you can use this energy on other things, like creativity, empathy and happiness.
posts.html:
Oftentimes in cultures and societies around the world, sensitive people are tagged with labels like ‘weak’ or ‘unworthy,’ which I think is a very flawed way of thinking.  Being capable of deep, sincere emotion and thought cannot be described as a weakness or vice.  

We should never be afraid to say what we are feeling, whether it be bad or good.  And bottling up emotions isn’t good for anyone.  It leads to isolation and thoughts that you are alone.  You’re not alone.  

Psychotherapist and researcher, Dr. Elaine Aron, says that 15 to 20 percent of people have nervous systems that process stimuli more intensely than the average.  Not only do they feel more, but they think more deeply, leading to quick overstimulation.

Here are five tips for the highly sensitive person:

There is nothing that will ‘fix’ you

Sensitivity is largely a trait of one’s temperament, not some sort of medical condition.  Because of this, you can’t really say that anything is wrong with you.  

While many doctors and medical professionals might say otherwise, processing sensitivity research is young and undeveloped.

Sensitive people that achieve great things do so because they understand that they are not ‘flawed.’

Look for other sensitive people like yourself

Being highly sensitive often makes you feel like you’re alone in your struggles, when that notion couldn’t be further from the truth.  

Look for other sensitive people who are already succeeding in their endeavors, as they can offer firsthand knowledge of the things you deal with regularly.

Strive to find positivity in every encounter or situation you find yourself in

Highly sensitive people are much more capable of soaking up the energy of their surroundings, meaning negative environments promote negativity and positive environments promote positivity.  

One of the best tactics a sensitive person can learn is how to acknowledge negativity and then let go of it.

Give yourself the same compassion that you give others

Highly sensitive people are known for their immense passion.  This often takes the form of them putting the needs and desires of others over their own, while also being highly critical of themselves.  

Always be willing to give yourself the same leniency and compassion that you want others to have.

Do your best not to suffocate your sensitivity

One of the easiest things to do is tune out the overwhelming amount of stimuli so that you can appear as though it doesn’t affect you on a deeper level, and this is a very unhealthy practice.  While it might trick your mind for a short time, your sensitive self knows better.  

The sensitive person needs to learn how to free themselves of the constant need for control, so that you can use this energy on other things, like creativity, empathy and happiness.

posts.title: Accepting These 5 Things is Vital for Finding True Love
posts.markdown: True love is one thing that I’d say *most* people are looking for as they move forward with their lives.  And why not?  Being in love is fun, exciting, and heartwarming, as well as terrifying, confusing, and crazy.   You start doing things you wouldn’t normally do, start acting in ways you wouldn’t normally act, and you start thinking about the couple, rather than the individual. But before a person can truly fall in love, there are five things a person needs to accept: **To find the right person for you, you need to be the right person for you** Before you can dive into a deep, meaningful and loving relationship with someone, you must first become the person that you yourself love.   You don’t *always* need to be in a relationship; take the necessary time to figure out who you are, what things you love in life, what you ultimately want out of life–the more whole you can become, the more likely you are to find someone who wants to share their wholeness with your own.   **Figure out your boundaries and how far you can be pushed** Knowing where you stand when it comes to different aspects of a relationship is important because it also helps your partner to have a better sense of what they can and cannot get away with. What are you willing to put up with?  Hard drugs?  Alcohol abuse?  Infidelity?  Lying?  Know how far you’re willing to go and then stick to your guns.   **Healthy communication is key** Talking to your partner is something that takes practice, as each person is somewhat afraid of what the other is going to say or think.  Being in a relationship has implications, and communication helps put things out in the open when certain expectations or implications are not met.   If your relationship ever starts to feel like a game or puzzle that you’re constantly trying to figure out, it’s probably not the relationship for you. **Love is about chasing your own goals and desires, and the goals and desires of the couple** Continue chasing the goals and milestones that you have set for yourself, but also recognize that you and your partner should have goals for your relationship as well.   Be sure that both you and your partner are capable of and willing to support one another.  You should be happy, they should be happy, you should be happy together. **True love is about accepting your partner for who they are, and vice versa** You’ll know when you’ve found true love because the person you’ve fallen for loves you for the person you are, not the person they expect you to become or hope you’ll turn into.   If a person ever tells you to give up certain aspects of your life that you enjoy, whether it’s a hobby, a friend or a job, it’s unhealthy and you should reconsider being with that person.  Never sacrifice who you are for another person, but also be sure to make time for both yourself and your partner.
posts.html:
True love is one thing that I’d say most people are looking for as they move forward with their lives.  And why not?  Being in love is fun, exciting, and heartwarming, as well as terrifying, confusing, and crazy.  

You start doing things you wouldn’t normally do, start acting in ways you wouldn’t normally act, and you start thinking about the couple, rather than the individual.

But before a person can truly fall in love, there are five things a person needs to accept:

To find the right person for you, you need to be the right person for you

Before you can dive into a deep, meaningful and loving relationship with someone, you must first become the person that you yourself love.  

You don’t always need to be in a relationship; take the necessary time to figure out who you are, what things you love in life, what you ultimately want out of life–the more whole you can become, the more likely you are to find someone who wants to share their wholeness with your own.  

Figure out your boundaries and how far you can be pushed

Knowing where you stand when it comes to different aspects of a relationship is important because it also helps your partner to have a better sense of what they can and cannot get away with.

What are you willing to put up with?  Hard drugs?  Alcohol abuse?  Infidelity?  Lying?  Know how far you’re willing to go and then stick to your guns.  

Healthy communication is key

Talking to your partner is something that takes practice, as each person is somewhat afraid of what the other is going to say or think.  Being in a relationship has implications, and communication helps put things out in the open when certain expectations or implications are not met.  

If your relationship ever starts to feel like a game or puzzle that you’re constantly trying to figure out, it’s probably not the relationship for you.

Love is about chasing your own goals and desires, and the goals and desires of the couple

Continue chasing the goals and milestones that you have set for yourself, but also recognize that you and your partner should have goals for your relationship as well.  

Be sure that both you and your partner are capable of and willing to support one another.  You should be happy, they should be happy, you should be happy together.

True love is about accepting your partner for who they are, and vice versa

You’ll know when you’ve found true love because the person you’ve fallen for loves you for the person you are, not the person they expect you to become or hope you’ll turn into.  

If a person ever tells you to give up certain aspects of your life that you enjoy, whether it’s a hobby, a friend or a job, it’s unhealthy and you should reconsider being with that person.  Never sacrifice who you are for another person, but also be sure to make time for both yourself and your partner.

posts.title: Gaslighting: The Mind Game Everyone Should Know About
posts.markdown: If you’ve ever been the victim or subject of the manipulation tool known as ‘gaslighting,’ then you know just how awful it can truly be.  While this tactic is largely described as “sophisticated,” it only takes on this label because of how truly insane it really is.  It is used by malicious personality types to manifest fear and doubt in the minds of others.   Here are the people that use it, how it works and what you should be looking out for: The term ‘gaslighting’ actually **[comes from a 1930s film](http://www.theearthchild.co.za/gaslighting-as-a-manipulation-tactic-what-it-is-who-does-it-and-why/)** in which a scheming husband tries to get rid of his wife by slowly making subtle changes to her environment (including dimming the flame on a gas lamp slightly over time) to make her think that she’s losing her mind.   It is now used to describe a similar process often practiced by sociopaths, narcissists and psychopaths who seek to build up so much doubt in a person’s mind that this victim starts to believe that they cannot trust their own judgments, decisions or thoughts anymore, and thus starts to look to the psychopath for answers. Gaslighting is often paired with other destructive tactics, like guilting and shaming.  It is achieved in a variety of different ways, like when a person states a major lie with such conviction that the victim questions their perception of reality.  Similarly, they’ll often deny events or experiences ever happened with an intense and determined fervor.  They like to use historical facts that sound accurate, but then tweak them slightly to favor their argument or to seem credible. The types of people that use these tactics are mainly focused on establishing and maintaining a position of leverage or advantage over their victims.  And this is achieved when the victim starts doubting their own perception of reality as they continue to be unable to find strong evidence that the psychopath is purposely disadvantaging them. Hopefully this information helps you to recognize when someone is trying to gaslight you so you can put an end to it as soon as you can.  Remember that there is no room in your life for toxic people, the last thing you want is someone who constantly makes you second-guess yourself and makes you feel like the world around you is not actually as it seems.
posts.html:

The term ‘gaslighting’ actually comes from a 1930s film in which a scheming husband tries to get rid of his wife by slowly making subtle changes to her environment (including dimming the flame on a gas lamp slightly over time) to make her think that she’s losing her mind.  

It is now used to describe a similar process often practiced by sociopaths, narcissists and psychopaths who seek to build up so much doubt in a person’s mind that this victim starts to believe that they cannot trust their own judgments, decisions or thoughts anymore, and thus starts to look to the psychopath for answers.

Gaslighting is often paired with other destructive tactics, like guilting and shaming.  It is achieved in a variety of different ways, like when a person states a major lie with such conviction that the victim questions their perception of reality.  Similarly, they’ll often deny events or experiences ever happened with an intense and determined fervor.  They like to use historical facts that sound accurate, but then tweak them slightly to favor their argument or to seem credible.

The types of people that use these tactics are mainly focused on establishing and maintaining a position of leverage or advantage over their victims.  And this is achieved when the victim starts doubting their own perception of reality as they continue to be unable to find strong evidence that the psychopath is purposely disadvantaging them.

Hopefully this information helps you to recognize when someone is trying to gaslight you so you can put an end to it as soon as you can.  Remember that there is no room in your life for toxic people, the last thing you want is someone who constantly makes you second-guess yourself and makes you feel like the world around you is not actually as it seems.

posts.title: You Need To Read This Teenager’s Empowering Message About Self-Acceptance
posts.markdown: Sometimes we find ourselves in the company of toxic people.  They make their way into our lives, grab hold and can be difficult to get to let go.  Once they’re finally gone, you’re left wondering, “what the hell was I thinking?” A teenager named Brittaney found herself in just such a situation.  She was in a relationship with a person who loved highlighting all of her flaws, and even allowed him authority over what hairstyles she could wear, what her makeup should look like, and even how heavy she should be. This person would use hurtful words like ‘ridiculous,’ ‘tacky,’ and ‘ugly’ to describe Brittaney’s physical appearance.   Why not just leave this person, right?  Sometimes it’s harder than you think, especially when your self-confidence is nonexistent. Brittaney finally lost all of her confidence when she was dumped for a girl who was “prettier,” as she blamed herself for it happening.   But this was also a turning point for Brittaney, who, instead of continuing down the harmful path of self-hate and self-harm, as so many others do, decided to use Facebook as her platform for a powerful and inspiring message. Her message is now going viral with tens of thousands of likes and comments, as so many people can relate with and empathize with the pain that this teen was experiencing. Read her message below: “You always told me I didn’t look good with long hair and that you preferred girls with short hair. So I kept my hair cut above my shoulders at all times. You laughed at me and told me I looked ridiculous when I dyed my hair red when we were together. So a week later I dyed it back blonde.” ![](http://cdn8.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2016/01/10357268_10202458732455222_527141989_o-600x800.jpg) “You would always point out if I was wearing too much makeup. (Winged eyeliner and mascara most of the time) So I just stopped wearing it. You told me tattoos and piercings were tacky and ugly. And would try to take out my belly button ring every time you saw it. So I took out my piercings and didn’t get any more tattoos. You pointed out my stretch marks every chance you got. So I did my best to keep them hidden.” ![](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2016/01/fdfe-600x375.jpg) “You pointed out every time I looked like I had gained weight. So I started eating less every day. You pointed out every single flaw I had. So I lost every bit of confidence I had. I did everything I could to be what you wanted. I did everything you told me to do. It still wasn’t good enough. You left me for a younger prettier girl. Someone you could mold and shape into what you wanted. Like you tried to do with me. And up until a few months ago I blamed myself for everything that happened. You blamed me too. But finally I started to see the truth.” ![](http://cdn6.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2016/01/12345430_992020954197252_7998749501399407_n-600x536.jpg) “You weren’t out of my league. I was out of yours. I wasn’t the one who wasn’t good enough for you. You were the one who wasn’t good enough for me. You couldn’t accept me for who I was. When I took you the way you were.” ![](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2016/01/Screen-Shot-2016-01-26-at-3-600x447.jpg) “So now here I am a few months later. My hair is past my shoulders. My hair is bright red. I’ve got a new tattoo. New piercings. Started wearing makeup again. I eat whatever I want whenever I want and weigh 135 pounds. I still have my stretch marks. And I’ve finally gotten my confidence back. I finally see myself looking back at me when I look in the mirror. It’s so hard for me to come out about this and admit that I became so vulnerable because of one guy. Something I always said would never happen. It’s humiliating to even think about how low I got. But what gives me the guts to come out about this is the fact that I overcame it and I’m finally back to who I really am.” What do you think of Brittaney’s message?  Have you ever broken out of a terrible situation, feeling empowered and strong, as you came out on the other side?
posts.html:
Sometimes we find ourselves in the company of toxic people.  They make their way into our lives, grab hold and can be difficult to get to let go.  Once they’re finally gone, you’re left wondering, “what the hell was I thinking?”

A teenager named Brittaney found herself in just such a situation.  She was in a relationship with a person who loved highlighting all of her flaws, and even allowed him authority over what hairstyles she could wear, what her makeup should look like, and even how heavy she should be.

This person would use hurtful words like ‘ridiculous,’ ‘tacky,’ and ‘ugly’ to describe Brittaney’s physical appearance.  

Why not just leave this person, right?  Sometimes it’s harder than you think, especially when your self-confidence is nonexistent.

Brittaney finally lost all of her confidence when she was dumped for a girl who was “prettier,” as she blamed herself for it happening.  

But this was also a turning point for Brittaney, who, instead of continuing down the harmful path of self-hate and self-harm, as so many others do, decided to use Facebook as her platform for a powerful and inspiring message.

Her message is now going viral with tens of thousands of likes and comments, as so many people can relate with and empathize with the pain that this teen was experiencing.

Read her message below:

“You always told me I didn’t look good with long hair and that you preferred girls with short hair. So I kept my hair cut above my shoulders at all times. You laughed at me and told me I looked ridiculous when I dyed my hair red when we were together. So a week later I dyed it back blonde.”

“You would always point out if I was wearing too much makeup. (Winged eyeliner and mascara most of the time) So I just stopped wearing it. You told me tattoos and piercings were tacky and ugly. And would try to take out my belly button ring every time you saw it. So I took out my piercings and didn’t get any more tattoos.

You pointed out my stretch marks every chance you got. So I did my best to keep them hidden.”

“You pointed out every time I looked like I had gained weight. So I started eating less every day. You pointed out every single flaw I had. So I lost every bit of confidence I had.

I did everything I could to be what you wanted. I did everything you told me to do. It still wasn’t good enough. You left me for a younger prettier girl. Someone you could mold and shape into what you wanted. Like you tried to do with me. And up until a few months ago I blamed myself for everything that happened. You blamed me too.

But finally I started to see the truth.”

“You weren’t out of my league. I was out of yours. I wasn’t the one who wasn’t good enough for you.

You were the one who wasn’t good enough for me. You couldn’t accept me for who I was. When I took you the way you were.”

“So now here I am a few months later. My hair is past my shoulders. My hair is bright red. I’ve got a new tattoo. New piercings. Started wearing makeup again. I eat whatever I want whenever I want and weigh 135 pounds. I still have my stretch marks.

And I’ve finally gotten my confidence back. I finally see myself looking back at me when I look in the mirror. It’s so hard for me to come out about this and admit that I became so vulnerable because of one guy. Something I always said would never happen. It’s humiliating to even think about how low I got. But what gives me the guts to come out about this is the fact that I overcame it and I’m finally back to who I really am.”

What do you think of Brittaney’s message?  Have you ever broken out of a terrible situation, feeling empowered and strong, as you came out on the other side?

posts.title: This is What Happens to Your Body When You Put a Clothespin on Your Ear
posts.markdown: Being in control of one’s body is highly sought after by those who suffer from chronic aches, pains, mental illnesses, and other debilitating conditions.  It can be hard to acknowledge that your body is doing something you don’t want it to do, and the most stubborn of people will hold out, thinking they can fix whatever is wrong by using sheer willpower.   While simply wishing something away will likely not work, there are **[alternatives](http://www.littlethings.com/pain-relief-stretches/?&utm_source=LTcom)** to pharmaceuticals and modern medicine, some of which have been around for centuries.  One of these is the method of pinching a clothespin to various different spots on your ears. I know it sounds strange at first, the idea of your ear being able to affect other parts of your body, but as certified **[reflexologist Helen Chin Lui](http://healingplacemedfield.com/reflexology-what-is/reflexology-what-is-ear-reflexology/#axzz3n9Xwj1Mg?&utm_source=LTcom)** writes, “each ear contains a complete reflex map of the body, rich with nerve endings and multiple connectors to the central nervous system.” While this method should never take the place of professional medical advice, the ear reflexology method is worth a try, whether it’s done with just your fingers, or an actual clothespin. **Each one of these six points is connected to pain and soreness in a specific part of the body; applying pressure to each spot will help relieve pain and aches for that part of the body.** **Scroll through and see which points might work for you!** ![ear](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/05/ear-285x300.jpg) The most upper part of your ear is directly connected to your back and shoulders; applying pressure to this spot for about a minute should help reduce built-up tension.  Practice several times a day to relieve back and shoulder pain. The next spot down is connected to the body’s organs.  If you suffer from severe internal pain, see a doctor, but for minor internal discomfort, try your fingers or a clothespin on this spot. The upper-middle portion of the ear is the most closely associated with pain and stiffness in the joints.  Pressure on this spot will provide relief in the jointed areas.  Chronic joint pain is worth going to a doctor for, but this method is worth a shot. The fourth, lower-middle part of the ear is associated with the sinuses and throat.  Pressure here can help with relief from a cold or sinus infection and throat soreness. The fifth position, just above the lobe, is connected to the digestive processes of the body.  A clothespin here will help relieve digestive issues and minor stomach problems.  This method can be done in advance as a preventative measure. The lowest point on the ear, the lobe, is connected to the two most important parts of our body: the head and the heart.  Pressure on this spot will promote a healthy heart and can relieve unwanted pressure in the head.  It is great for relieving pressure headaches. Give them a try!
posts.html:
Being in control of one’s body is highly sought after by those who suffer from chronic aches, pains, mental illnesses, and other debilitating conditions.  It can be hard to acknowledge that your body is doing something you don’t want it to do, and the most stubborn of people will hold out, thinking they can fix whatever is wrong by using sheer willpower.  

While simply wishing something away will likely not work, there are alternatives to pharmaceuticals and modern medicine, some of which have been around for centuries.  One of these is the method of pinching a clothespin to various different spots on your ears.

I know it sounds strange at first, the idea of your ear being able to affect other parts of your body, but as certified reflexologist Helen Chin Lui writes, “each ear contains a complete reflex map of the body, rich with nerve endings and multiple connectors to the central nervous system.”

While this method should never take the place of professional medical advice, the ear reflexology method is worth a try, whether it’s done with just your fingers, or an actual clothespin.

Each one of these six points is connected to pain and soreness in a specific part of the body; applying pressure to each spot will help relieve pain and aches for that part of the body.

Scroll through and see which points might work for you!

The most upper part of your ear is directly connected to your back and shoulders; applying pressure to this spot for about a minute should help reduce built-up tension.  Practice several times a day to relieve back and shoulder pain.

The next spot down is connected to the body’s organs.  If you suffer from severe internal pain, see a doctor, but for minor internal discomfort, try your fingers or a clothespin on this spot.

The upper-middle portion of the ear is the most closely associated with pain and stiffness in the joints.  Pressure on this spot will provide relief in the jointed areas.  Chronic joint pain is worth going to a doctor for, but this method is worth a shot.

The fourth, lower-middle part of the ear is associated with the sinuses and throat.  Pressure here can help with relief from a cold or sinus infection and throat soreness.

The fifth position, just above the lobe, is connected to the digestive processes of the body.  A clothespin here will help relieve digestive issues and minor stomach problems.  This method can be done in advance as a preventative measure.

The lowest point on the ear, the lobe, is connected to the two most important parts of our body: the head and the heart.  Pressure on this spot will promote a healthy heart and can relieve unwanted pressure in the head.  It is great for relieving pressure headaches.

Give them a try!

posts.title: What You Need To Know Before Eating Himalayan Salt
posts.markdown: Maybe you’ve never heard of pink Himalayan salt before, maybe you use it religiously, either way, the benefits of this magnificent mineral are astounding and everyone deserves to be educated on the matter.  The Himalayan mountains stretch all the way across Asia, and pass through China, Nepal, Myanmar, Pakistan, Bhutan, Afghanistan, and India.  Mount Everest also rests in this mountain range as the highest peak in the world. Approximately 200 million years ago, beds of crystallized sea salts, now deep within the Himalayan mountains, were covered by lava.  The cover from the lava kept the whole area in pristine condition, even through seasons of snow and ice.  But perhaps the best thing about this preservation is that the salts have been kept pollution free, leading many to believe that Himalayan Pink salt is the purest salt on Earth. The various hues of pink, red, and white are all indicative of the salt’s rich and varied mineral and energy-rich content.  The health benefits of this pink salt are plentiful, check out this list before seeking some out for yourself: **Less sodium per serving – **While this salt is made from the same components as regular salt, the crystal structure is larger **[than refined salt](http://www.bodymindsoulspirit.com/benefits-of-himalayan-pink-rock-salt-versus-table-salt/)**, meaning that these sea salt crystals and flakes take up less room on a teaspoon. **Contains 80+ minerals and elements – **Himalayan pink salt is packed with mineral content, being made up of 85.62% sodium chloride, while 14.38% is made up by trace minerals that include sulphate, magnesium, calcium, potassium, bicarbonate, bromide, borate, strontium, and fluoride. These minerals help to: - Establish an electrolyte balance - Increase hydration - Balance pH, help to reduce acid reflux - Prevent muscle cramps - Lower blood pressure - Improve circulation - Strengthen bones It has even been said to help support the libido, reduce signs of aging, and detoxify the body from heavy metals.
posts.html:

The various hues of pink, red, and white are all indicative of the salt’s rich and varied mineral and energy-rich content.  The health benefits of this pink salt are plentiful, check out this list before seeking some out for yourself:

Less sodium per serving – *While this salt is made from the same components as regular salt, the crystal structure is larger *than refined salt, meaning that these sea salt crystals and flakes take up less room on a teaspoon.

*Contains 80+ minerals and elements – *Himalayan pink salt is packed with mineral content, being made up of 85.62% sodium chloride, while 14.38% is made up by trace minerals that include sulphate, magnesium, calcium, potassium, bicarbonate, bromide, borate, strontium, and fluoride.

  • Establish an electrolyte balance

posts.title: 5 Signs You're Gluten Intolerant
posts.markdown: It seems like the term “gluten-free” randomly popped into mainstream culture not that long ago, with many people claiming that a sensitivity to gluten, a protein that is found in wheat, barley, and rye, causes them to suffer gastrointestinal problems, joint pain, fatigue, and even depression. While some have written the condition off as simply a new fad among dieters and nutritionists, it is very real.  In fact, celiac disease, which is the most serious type of gluten intolerance, **[occurs in 1 out of every 100 people](https://celiac.org/celiac-disease/what-is-celiac-disease/)** across the globe. Here are five signs that you have a gluten intolerance: **Unexpected weight gain** If you’ve suddenly packed on some pounds without any changes to diet or exercise, you might be gluten intolerant.  Weight gain from a gluten intolerance happens because of two reasons: malabsorption and gut permeability (two side effects of gluten intolerance), and the onset of systemic inflammation, which is caused by gluten. Avoid gluten for a while and see if your weight goes back to normal. **Headaches and Migraines** Migraines and headaches have been found to be much more common in those who are gluten intolerant.  In fact, a study looking at a gluten sensitive group of people found that 56 percent of them suffered from chronic headaches and migraines, compared to 14 percent of the control group. **Fatigue / Exhaustion** While research regarding the effect that gluten has on fatigue and exhaustion is scarce, many medical professionals believe that a gluten intolerance can cause these effects through inflammation and de-allocation of the body’s energy reserves. **Skin Problems** Skin problems can arise from a gluten intolerance because of its aforementioned malabsorption traits that affect various different areas of our bodies.   **[Gluten has been correlated](http://www.coreonehealth.com/gluten-sensitivity-and-female-hormones)**with acne, psoriasis, eczema, and dermatitis herpetiformis (DH).  Symptoms can include burning sensations, redness, rashes, itchiness and sometimes blistering. **Dental Problems** A study published in *BMS Gastroenterology* found a link between gluten sensitivity and “aphthous stomatitis,” which is a condition that exhibits recurring mouth ulcers and canker sores.   Additionally, because of gluten’s malabsorption properties, calcium levels are often lowered, resulting in poor dental health.
posts.html:
It seems like the term “gluten-free” randomly popped into mainstream culture not that long ago, with many people claiming that a sensitivity to gluten, a protein that is found in wheat, barley, and rye, causes them to suffer gastrointestinal problems, joint pain, fatigue, and even depression.

While some have written the condition off as simply a new fad among dieters and nutritionists, it is very real.  In fact, celiac disease, which is the most serious type of gluten intolerance, occurs in 1 out of every 100 people across the globe.

Here are five signs that you have a gluten intolerance:

Unexpected weight gain

If you’ve suddenly packed on some pounds without any changes to diet or exercise, you might be gluten intolerant.  Weight gain from a gluten intolerance happens because of two reasons: malabsorption and gut permeability (two side effects of gluten intolerance), and the onset of systemic inflammation, which is caused by gluten.

Avoid gluten for a while and see if your weight goes back to normal.

Headaches and Migraines

Migraines and headaches have been found to be much more common in those who are gluten intolerant.  In fact, a study looking at a gluten sensitive group of people found that 56 percent of them suffered from chronic headaches and migraines, compared to 14 percent of the control group.

Fatigue / Exhaustion

While research regarding the effect that gluten has on fatigue and exhaustion is scarce, many medical professionals believe that a gluten intolerance can cause these effects through inflammation and de-allocation of the body’s energy reserves.

Skin Problems

Skin problems can arise from a gluten intolerance because of its aforementioned malabsorption traits that affect various different areas of our bodies.  

Gluten has been correlatedwith acne, psoriasis, eczema, and dermatitis herpetiformis (DH).  Symptoms can include burning sensations, redness, rashes, itchiness and sometimes blistering.

Dental Problems

A study published in BMS Gastroenterology found a link between gluten sensitivity and “aphthous stomatitis,” which is a condition that exhibits recurring mouth ulcers and canker sores.  

Additionally, because of gluten’s malabsorption properties, calcium levels are often lowered, resulting in poor dental health.

posts.title: Relieve Sinus Pressure in Under 30 Seconds With This Simple Method
posts.markdown: With us working our way through Spring and heading into Summer with full force, allergy season is upon us.  These are the times when most of our allergies start to flare up, causing us tremendous amounts of agony and suffering at the hands of congested airways, itchy eyes and sinuses full of pressure. If you’re rife with allergies like myself, then you know just how horrible it can be. But you can prepare yourself at least a little bit by adding this simple method to your arsenal of allergy relief solutions.  And while it might not fix your sinus problems in a permanent way, it will at least relieve some of that sinus congestion that you’re experiencing at the time. If you’re trying to keep sinus congestion to a minimum, spicy foods and drinking a ton of water are other great ways to help keep pressure from building up. **The Method** When you do this technique, your sinuses will most likely drain almost instantly.  This method works due to the movement of the vomer bone, which rests in your nasal passage.  This bone is capable of swinging back and forth with the pressure, which in turn loosens up the phlegm and grossness stuck in your sinuses. 1. Press your tongue to the roof of your mouth and apply pressure (not too much). 2. Press your thumb between your eyebrows 3. Press your thumb down for 30 seconds while applying a fair amount of pressure Pretty sweet, right?  Remember this method the next time you or your friend’s sinuses are chock-full of phlegm and you find yourself hating life!
posts.html:
With us working our way through Spring and heading into Summer with full force, allergy season is upon us.  These are the times when most of our allergies start to flare up, causing us tremendous amounts of agony and suffering at the hands of congested airways, itchy eyes and sinuses full of pressure.

If you’re rife with allergies like myself, then you know just how horrible it can be.

But you can prepare yourself at least a little bit by adding this simple method to your arsenal of allergy relief solutions.  And while it might not fix your sinus problems in a permanent way, it will at least relieve some of that sinus congestion that you’re experiencing at the time.

If you’re trying to keep sinus congestion to a minimum, spicy foods and drinking a ton of water are other great ways to help keep pressure from building up.

The Method

When you do this technique, your sinuses will most likely drain almost instantly.  This method works due to the movement of the vomer bone, which rests in your nasal passage.  This bone is capable of swinging back and forth with the pressure, which in turn loosens up the phlegm and grossness stuck in your sinuses.

  1. Press your tongue to the roof of your mouth and apply pressure (not too much).
  2. Press your thumb between your eyebrows
  3. Press your thumb down for 30 seconds while applying a fair amount of pressure

Pretty sweet, right?  Remember this method the next time you or your friend’s sinuses are chock-full of phlegm and you find yourself hating life!

posts.title: This Is What Rosemary Does to Your Brain
posts.markdown: Research Shows Smelling Rosemary Increase Memory Function by 75% Boost Your Memory Function by 75% by Smelling Rosemary **[Rosemary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary)**is a great herb to have around at pretty much all times.  It’s the woody herb that has the pungent, evergreen, needle-like leaves that are typically accompanied by white, pink, purple or blue flowers.  It’s a member of the mint family and its name, translated from Latin, means “dew of the sea.” It’s an herb that has been used in traditional medicines over the generations and now one study has found out a few reasons why: Rosemary contains **[carnosic acid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carnosic_acid)**which is known for combating free radical damage in our brains and in our DNA. Additionally, researchers found the chemical compound **[1,8-cineole](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eucalyptol)**, which is largely responsible for enhanced memory function. The study, which has been published in ***[Therapeutic Advances in Psychopharmacology](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/27/rosemary-brain-memory-18-cineole_n_1304250.html)***, discovered that rosemary can actually improve memory function by up to 75 percent, simply by smelling it! So, if you’ve never been savvy to the benefits of rosemary, now is the perfect time to pick some up or plant some in your garden!
posts.html:
Research Shows Smelling Rosemary Increase Memory Function by 75%

Boost Your Memory Function by 75% by Smelling Rosemary

Rosemaryis a great herb to have around at pretty much all times.  It’s the woody herb that has the pungent, evergreen, needle-like leaves that are typically accompanied by white, pink, purple or blue flowers.  It’s a member of the mint family and its name, translated from Latin, means “dew of the sea.”

It’s an herb that has been used in traditional medicines over the generations and now one study has found out a few reasons why:

Rosemary contains carnosic acidwhich is known for combating free radical damage in our brains and in our DNA.

Additionally, researchers found the chemical compound 1,8-cineole, which is largely responsible for enhanced memory function.

The study, which has been published in Therapeutic Advances in Psychopharmacology, discovered that rosemary can actually improve memory function by up to 75 percent, simply by smelling it!

So, if you’ve never been savvy to the benefits of rosemary, now is the perfect time to pick some up or plant some in your garden!

posts.title: 5 Subtle and Surprising Ways That Your Dog is Saying 'I Love You'
posts.markdown: If you’re a dog owner then you know just how rewarding it can be.  Dogs are known as “man’s best friend” for a reason, because they’ve been our trusted sidekicks for as long as we can remember.  And as it turns out, all of the time that we’ve spent together over the centuries has led to dogs developing unique and subtle ways of expressing their love for us. While we might not be able to communicate with them like Doctor Dolittle, we will at least know when they’re feeling loved and want to give some love back.   The ways that they express their love are not always obvious, but we’ll discuss at least five different practices they like to do to show their human companions love and support: **Staring straight into your eyes** According to a *60 Minutes *segment featuring well-known dog expert, Brian Hare, when dogs look you in the eye, they’re actually “hugging you with [their] eyes.”   When you and your buddy are playing together or having a nice cuddle session, the same hormone that helps mothers and babies bond, oxytocin, is released in the dog’s brain.   Try keeping eye consistent eye contact with them as you go about your normal daily routine with them, but do not actively stare them down, as it will only make them feel uncomfortable. **Sharing yawns** We all know that yawning is one of the most contagious things in the world, but what you might not have known is that it’s not limited to humans.   Dogs have been bred by humans to understand humans, so when you yawn, your doggy companion will likely reciprocate the gesture. **Leaning on you** Dogs like to lean on their companions for a variety of reasons, like anxiety or wanting you to do something or take them somewhere, but it is also used to express affection. Even if anxiety is the sole reason they’re leaning on you, they’re doing this because they recognize you as a source of protection and safety. **Sleeping in your room** Take note of where your buddy likes to sleep.  If your dog likes to catch his Z’s in your bed, even when you’ve told him numerous times that he’s not allowed up there, it’s only because he loves you.   According to Gregory Berns, a dog sleeping in your bed is indicative of a strong sense of loyalty, as they fear being separated from the pack. **Bringing you their favorite toy** Even though wanting to play is a sign of affection in and of itself, many dogs aren’t bringing you their prized toy because they want to play.   It’s usually because they want to please you and think that you’ll enjoy it just as much as they do! Share this information with all of your friends and family members who love dogs so they can recognize when they’re being loved on by their poochy companions!
posts.html:
If you’re a dog owner then you know just how rewarding it can be.  Dogs are known as “man’s best friend” for a reason, because they’ve been our trusted sidekicks for as long as we can remember.  And as it turns out, all of the time that we’ve spent together over the centuries has led to dogs developing unique and subtle ways of expressing their love for us.

While we might not be able to communicate with them like Doctor Dolittle, we will at least know when they’re feeling loved and want to give some love back.  

The ways that they express their love are not always obvious, but we’ll discuss at least five different practices they like to do to show their human companions love and support:

Staring straight into your eyes

According to a 60 Minutes segment featuring well-known dog expert, Brian Hare, when dogs look you in the eye, they’re actually “hugging you with [their] eyes.”  

When you and your buddy are playing together or having a nice cuddle session, the same hormone that helps mothers and babies bond, oxytocin, is released in the dog’s brain.  

Try keeping eye consistent eye contact with them as you go about your normal daily routine with them, but do not actively stare them down, as it will only make them feel uncomfortable.

Sharing yawns

We all know that yawning is one of the most contagious things in the world, but what you might not have known is that it’s not limited to humans.  

Dogs have been bred by humans to understand humans, so when you yawn, your doggy companion will likely reciprocate the gesture.

Leaning on you

Dogs like to lean on their companions for a variety of reasons, like anxiety or wanting you to do something or take them somewhere, but it is also used to express affection.

Even if anxiety is the sole reason they’re leaning on you, they’re doing this because they recognize you as a source of protection and safety.

Sleeping in your room

Take note of where your buddy likes to sleep.  If your dog likes to catch his Z’s in your bed, even when you’ve told him numerous times that he’s not allowed up there, it’s only because he loves you.  

According to Gregory Berns, a dog sleeping in your bed is indicative of a strong sense of loyalty, as they fear being separated from the pack.

Bringing you their favorite toy

Even though wanting to play is a sign of affection in and of itself, many dogs aren’t bringing you their prized toy because they want to play.  

It’s usually because they want to please you and think that you’ll enjoy it just as much as they do!

Share this information with all of your friends and family members who love dogs so they can recognize when they’re being loved on by their poochy companions!

posts.title: 5 Reasons Why You'll Want to Love a Taurus For Life
posts.markdown: The Taurus is known for fighting for the things it values and desires, meaning that if they’ve chosen you, they’re entirely dedicated.  They’re the perfect partners in a relationship, and here are five reasons why: **Their love is like no other love you’ve ever experienced** You’ll quickly learn that you’ll have a hard time trying not to fall for the Taurus fast and hard.  Their passion and sympathy shows how colorful and caring they are, illustrating their deep commitment to the people they choose to keep in their life.  They always go the extra mile to make their partners feel loved. **They want to really *****know***** you** The Taurus excels in figuring out what makes people get excited, whatever it may be.  They’re genuinely interested in what’s happening in your life, meaning it can be hard to hide things as they are very observant.  If you’re having an off day, they’ll pick up on it instantly. **They’re beyond loyal** Once a Taurus finds his or herself in a committed relationship, they’re in it for the long haul.  Devotion is no trouble for the Taurus and they’re the best at following through on promises.  Their passion comes out once they feel safe and secure in a relationship, so give and you shall receive. **They feel *****everything*** Taurus are not typically fake or phony people, as they value being genuine to those around them.  They often love deeply, meaning they’ll show their love interest tremendous kindness and generosity.  However, taking advantage of the Taurus’ love and kindness will quickly give them reason to leave.  They can get sensitive at times, but reassuring them that things will turn out alright will rest their troubled minds. **They love intimate relationships** For the Taurus, love is a powerful thing.  And they love to attach meaning and significance to the events that happen in their life.  If you find yourself loving a Taurus, know that they’ll likely want to see how far you two can go.  They want to build a lasting and memorable bond that revolves around loving and being loved.
posts.html:
The Taurus is known for fighting for the things it values and desires, meaning that if they’ve chosen you, they’re entirely dedicated.  They’re the perfect partners in a relationship, and here are five reasons why:

Their love is like no other love you’ve ever experienced

You’ll quickly learn that you’ll have a hard time trying not to fall for the Taurus fast and hard.  Their passion and sympathy shows how colorful and caring they are, illustrating their deep commitment to the people they choose to keep in their life.  They always go the extra mile to make their partners feel loved.

They want to really *know you*

The Taurus excels in figuring out what makes people get excited, whatever it may be.  They’re genuinely interested in what’s happening in your life, meaning it can be hard to hide things as they are very observant.  If you’re having an off day, they’ll pick up on it instantly.

They’re beyond loyal

Once a Taurus finds his or herself in a committed relationship, they’re in it for the long haul.  Devotion is no trouble for the Taurus and they’re the best at following through on promises.  Their passion comes out once they feel safe and secure in a relationship, so give and you shall receive.

They feel *everything*

Taurus are not typically fake or phony people, as they value being genuine to those around them.  They often love deeply, meaning they’ll show their love interest tremendous kindness and generosity.  However, taking advantage of the Taurus’ love and kindness will quickly give them reason to leave.  They can get sensitive at times, but reassuring them that things will turn out alright will rest their troubled minds.

They love intimate relationships

For the Taurus, love is a powerful thing.  And they love to attach meaning and significance to the events that happen in their life.  If you find yourself loving a Taurus, know that they’ll likely want to see how far you two can go.  They want to build a lasting and memorable bond that revolves around loving and being loved.

posts.title: One Easy Trick to Eliminate Gross and Annoying Blackheads Forever
posts.markdown: Blackheads can be some of the most annoying and painful things to deal with, and what’s worse is that most of the products that have been designed to get rid of them, like facial scrubs and adhesive strips, are expensive and only solve the problem temporarily. If you want a highly-effective method that provides lasting effects, all you need is **lemon and salt mixed with some warm water**. Using a small bowl, mix together 1 tablespoon of sea salt, ½ a teaspoon of lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of warm water.  Once you have the ingredients thoroughly mixed, apply the mixture thoroughly to your entire face, with special attention paid to your blackheads. Using a warm, wet washrag in a circular motion, work the solution into your skin.  For 5 minutes, massage and rub your skin with the washrag.  If you notice it starting to cool off, reheat it, and allow the mixture to set on your skin for another 5 minutes before washing your face with cold water. Using this method a few times each week will net you noticeable results as blackheads continue to break down and stay away. **Why does this happen?** Salt has natural antibacterial properties that help cleanse our pores and unclog them.  Lemon juice is natural acidic, helping to fight off germs and bacteria as well.  The warm water helps this entire process by opening up the pores, allowing the other cleaning agents to do their jobs.   Combine the three together and you get the same result of a chemical peel, but without all of the terrible side effects. Check out the video below for more information and instructions on how to create your own facial cleanse mixture!
posts.html:
Blackheads can be some of the most annoying and painful things to deal with, and what’s worse is that most of the products that have been designed to get rid of them, like facial scrubs and adhesive strips, are expensive and only solve the problem temporarily.

If you want a highly-effective method that provides lasting effects, all you need is lemon and salt mixed with some warm water.

Using a small bowl, mix together 1 tablespoon of sea salt, ½ a teaspoon of lemon juice, and 1 teaspoon of warm water.  Once you have the ingredients thoroughly mixed, apply the mixture thoroughly to your entire face, with special attention paid to your blackheads.

Using a warm, wet washrag in a circular motion, work the solution into your skin.  For 5 minutes, massage and rub your skin with the washrag.  If you notice it starting to cool off, reheat it, and allow the mixture to set on your skin for another 5 minutes before washing your face with cold water.

Using this method a few times each week will net you noticeable results as blackheads continue to break down and stay away.

Why does this happen?

Salt has natural antibacterial properties that help cleanse our pores and unclog them.  Lemon juice is natural acidic, helping to fight off germs and bacteria as well.  The warm water helps this entire process by opening up the pores, allowing the other cleaning agents to do their jobs.  

Combine the three together and you get the same result of a chemical peel, but without all of the terrible side effects.

Check out the video below for more information and instructions on how to create your own facial cleanse mixture!

posts.title: 5 Reasons the Aquarius is Never Satisfied
posts.markdown: Being in your 20s is crazy enough as it is, but for Aquarians, it can be particularly hectic.  We’re restless in a world of change; nothing seems to make sense, and if the world could slow down just a little bit for us, we’d appreciate it. Being sick and tired of everything is only made worse by our stubborn and detached nature.  But at least we’re clever, we’re independent, and we know what we want and how we’re going to get it.  So why do we never feel satisfied?  Here are five reasons: **Structure makes us feel trapped – **Falling into that normal routine of life is fine for some, but for us it’s a nightmare.  Waking up and doing the same thing day in and day out scares us; we don’t like rules, office jobs, or anything that tries to tell us what to do. **We need complete independence – **While we love our friends and the people we spend time with dearly, we also don’t like having people depend on us.  When people start getting clingy then we might ask for some space. **We thrive on new things, new situations and new ways of doing – **Constant newness is a must in the Aquarian’s life.  Shopping sprees, channel surfing, pub crawling, and serial dating are all things that the Aquarius will enjoy doing.   **We’re the biggest dreamers – **There’s a specific way that the world should work according to us.  Our dreams are grand, and our will to achieve is strong, so when the world doesn’t adhere to our guidelines, it makes us a bit crazy. **We can be the most impatient people in the world – **Patience is most definitely a virtue that we do not possess.  Not only are we not patient with others, we’re even less patient with ourselves, which only further perpetuates our feelings of being forever unsatisfied.
posts.html:

*Structure makes us feel trapped – *Falling into that normal routine of life is fine for some, but for us it’s a nightmare.  Waking up and doing the same thing day in and day out scares us; we don’t like rules, office jobs, or anything that tries to tell us what to do.

*We need complete independence – *While we love our friends and the people we spend time with dearly, we also don’t like having people depend on us.  When people start getting clingy then we might ask for some space.
