posts.title: This Wolf Has Been Suffering for Years, When She Puts Her Hands On Neck...I'm In Tears!
posts.markdown: More and more people are turning to alternative forms of medicine and healing as traditional pharmaceutical methods become increasingly dangerous and toxic to our bodies.   There are definitely pharmaceuticals that work without side effect or danger, but for serious illness and chronic conditions, many drugs that prescribed to treat them leave the afflicted feeling cured of one ailment, but suffering from another. The wolf is a majestic being.  Hardwired through millennia of evolution to be great predatory beasts full of cunning and grace. This particular wolf suffers from a crippling neurological condition that left her spine gnarled and twisted.  Her posture and everything else suffered as a result.  The people who ran this nature reserve, which serves as home to this great creature, decided to skip traditional medicines and give the wolf therapy from an energy healer. The wolf trusted the energy healer after a short amount of time, letting her place her hands all over the wolf’s body in an effort to heal and soothe the animal’s suffering.  Shortly after a few sessions with the energy healer, Apricot the wolf was feeling significantly better. The video below shows the three healing sessions with the wolf and the energy worker, providing great evidence that this wolf benefited greatly from the alternative form of treatment.
posts.html:
More and more people are turning to alternative forms of medicine and healing as traditional pharmaceutical methods become increasingly dangerous and toxic to our bodies.  

There are definitely pharmaceuticals that work without side effect or danger, but for serious illness and chronic conditions, many drugs that prescribed to treat them leave the afflicted feeling cured of one ailment, but suffering from another.

posts.title: Teen Takes Little Sister with Cancer to His First High School Dance
posts.markdown: The bond between siblings has been and always will be one of the strongest connections that two people can share.  As F. Scott Fitzgerald says, “there are all kinds of love in this world, but never the same love twice.”  The love you have for your parents is different from the love you have for your dog, which is different from the love you have for your sibling. I know that the love I have for my younger brother is nothing short of unconditional and enduring, and I think the same goes for AJ Spader, the 15-year-old South Dakota teen that decided his first high school dance was going to be spent with his 10-year-old sister, Rebekah. Rebekah suffers from **[myelodysplastic syndrome](http://www.cancer.gov/types/myeloproliferative/patient/myelodysplastic-treatment-pdq)**, which she was diagnosed with almost four years ago.  Since her diagnosis, multiple treatments, including a bone marrow transplant, have all failed. AJ’s mother said that he “came to us and said, ‘Rebekah might not get to go to her own dance’” acknowledging that his little sister most likely will not get to experience high school.  The family motto, “Unbroken, brave and blessed” was what AJ wrote on a big poster to ask his little sister to the dance. Rebekah even got to pose for pictures with her brother donning a formal dress and her tiara before her and her brother’s friends all went to dinner.  Stephanie Spader, their mom, said that “AJ and his friends embraced her and embraced the situation and didn’t blink twice that a little 10-year-old sister was going to hang out with them” and that that “was the most special thing [for her].”

posts.title: Change Your Life With This 5-Minute Morning Exercise
posts.markdown: Living in modern day society means that you most likely live by a certain schedule and routine.   Some of us undoubtedly live more according to time than others, but time is still nonetheless always present and dictating some aspect of our lives. Between showering, breakfast, coffee, brushing your teeth and having to be at work, finding time for exercise can be tough. Which makes this 5-minute exercise routine an absolute blessing for those who want to stimulate their bodies further than just preparing substances to consume in the morning.   This exercise has been dubbed the ‘Sun Salutation,’ or ‘Surya Hamaskara.’  It is a simple 5-minute yoga routine that you practice in the morning that gives you the needed energy and focus to take the challenges of your day head on. The best part? Anyone can do it. The video below provides a step-by-step guide on the Sun Salutation: Benefits of this exercise include: 1. Restores the nervous system 2. Strengthens the immune system 3. Promotes healthy lungs 4. Stimulates the digestive system 5. Reduces fat on the body 6. Improves kidney function 7. Encourages proper posture 8. Clears your mind of jumbled thoughts 9. Centers your energy 10. Prepares you perfectly for the day

posts.title: How Smart Are You? Can You Solve This Puzzle That Has the Internet Going Crazy?
posts.markdown: The image above is a quick test that can measure just how intelligent you are.  You might have already seen this–it’s been shared over three million times, and it continues to stump even the brightest of minds. The creators of the test say that the test measures a person’s IQ, claiming that if you have solved the puzzle and understand it well, your IQ is above 150.   Having an IQ of over 150 is pretty good, as it technically puts you in ‘genius’ territory.  About two-thirds of people have IQs between 85 and 115, and just over 5 percent of people reach numbers above 125. ### Ready? ![feature_image_templanumbte](http://dev.groupxondemand.com/content/images/2016/05/feature_image_templanumbte-300x194.jpg) Study the image, play with the numbers, see if you can find any patterns that pop out to you.  If you find yourself stumped and wanting the answer, watch the video below from MindYourDecisions, a YouTube channel that breaks down how this test works and what you can do to solve it. If you’ve already solved the puzzle, check out the video anyway, as it will ask you to test your understanding with a couple more problems similar to the ones in the test.   If you liked teasing your brain with this number puzzle, share with your friends and family to see how they stack up.  You might just be the smartest person in your family!
posts.html:
The image above is a quick test that can measure just how intelligent you are.  You might have already seen this–it’s been shared over three million times, and it continues to stump even the brightest of minds.

The creators of the test say that the test measures a person’s IQ, claiming that if you have solved the puzzle and understand it well, your IQ is above 150.  

Having an IQ of over 150 is pretty good, as it technically puts you in ‘genius’ territory.  About two-thirds of people have IQs between 85 and 115, and just over 5 percent of people reach numbers above 125.

Ready?

Study the image, play with the numbers, see if you can find any patterns that pop out to you.  If you find yourself stumped and wanting the answer, watch the video below from MindYourDecisions, a YouTube channel that breaks down how this test works and what you can do to solve it.

If you’ve already solved the puzzle, check out the video anyway, as it will ask you to test your understanding with a couple more problems similar to the ones in the test.  

If you liked teasing your brain with this number puzzle, share with your friends and family to see how they stack up.  You might just be the smartest person in your family!

posts.title: Ever Wonder What the Strange Floaty Things in Your Vision Are? THIS Is Why We Have Them
posts.markdown: Do you know what I’m talking about when I say eye-floaties?  They’re the squiggles and dots that are on our eyes that we see every now and then. Their scientific name is “muscae volitantes,” but they’re often referred to as ‘floaters’ or ‘flying flies.’   You’ve probably noticed them mostly when you’re shifting your eyes around a blank surface.  Most of the time, when we’re out and about and unconcerned with our vision, we don’t really notice eye-floaties. This unique phenomenon happens when proteins in the eye detach, resulting in shadows being cast in the retina.  You don’t need to really worry about them, as they’re not at all dangerous.   And the only times you notice them are when they come close to the retina because our brains naturally filter them out of our vision for us. The video below goes more in-depth about what muscae volitantes actually are and what they can mean for your overall health.  It’s definitely worth it to be educated on this matter!
posts.html:
Do you know what I’m talking about when I say eye-floaties?  They’re the squiggles and dots that are on our eyes that we see every now and then. Their scientific name is “muscae volitantes,” but they’re often referred to as ‘floaters’ or ‘flying flies.’  

You’ve probably noticed them mostly when you’re shifting your eyes around a blank surface.  Most of the time, when we’re out and about and unconcerned with our vision, we don’t really notice eye-floaties.

This unique phenomenon happens when proteins in the eye detach, resulting in shadows being cast in the retina.  You don’t need to really worry about them, as they’re not at all dangerous.  

And the only times you notice them are when they come close to the retina because our brains naturally filter them out of our vision for us.

The video below goes more in-depth about what muscae volitantes actually are and what they can mean for your overall health.  It’s definitely worth it to be educated on this matter!

posts.title: They Put a Pre-School in a Nursing Home, What Happened Next...I'm Speechless!
posts.markdown: While it makes sense to think that nursing homes are typically socially active places, it is not entirely uncommon for the elderly folks who occupy them to experience symptoms of depression and social isolation.   In an effort to combat this feeling of loneliness that their residents might feel, the Inter-Generational Learning Center in Providence Mount St. Vincent, Seattle, put a pre-school in their nursing home.  The effect that it had one everyone’s lives was noticeably immediate, and everyone was pleasantly surprised to see the incredible difference that it was making for both the seniors and the kids. Filmmaker Evan Briggs loved the idea of the this story so much that he decided to document the story and then turn it into a film, hoping to raise awareness about this unique and innovative project. **Present Perfect Trailer** I know when I was younger I loved hanging out with my grandpa; he was always showing me the tools in his garage and telling me crazy stories.  Hopefully more and more nursing homes will consider incorporating pre-school programs into their residents’ lives.
posts.html:
While it makes sense to think that nursing homes are typically socially active places, it is not entirely uncommon for the elderly folks who occupy them to experience symptoms of depression and social isolation.  

In an effort to combat this feeling of loneliness that their residents might feel, the Inter-Generational Learning Center in Providence Mount St. Vincent, Seattle, put a pre-school in their nursing home.  The effect that it had one everyone’s lives was noticeably immediate, and everyone was pleasantly surprised to see the incredible difference that it was making for both the seniors and the kids.

Filmmaker Evan Briggs loved the idea of the this story so much that he decided to document the story and then turn it into a film, hoping to raise awareness about this unique and innovative project.

Present Perfect Trailer

I know when I was younger I loved hanging out with my grandpa; he was always showing me the tools in his garage and telling me crazy stories.  Hopefully more and more nursing homes will consider incorporating pre-school programs into their residents’ lives.

posts.title: Video: Award-Winning Animated Film About a Soul That Meets Death
Which Psychic Gift is Strongest In You?
posts.markdown: All of us possess some level of psychic ability, whether we’re aware of it or not.  Maybe you’ve noticed that you have a subtle way of picking up on things before they happen or you’re a master at figuring out people’s true motives, or maybe you’re just really good at knowing when not to do something.   These are all signs that your psychic ability is in good health. The four most common psychic intuitions are: clairvoyance (seeing), clairaudience (hearing), clairsentience (feeling), and claircognizance (knowing). You’re probably gifted in all of these areas, but there is likely just one that is your strongest and most proficient.   Clairsentience and claircognizance tend to be the most heightened among people, but you can try these exercises to figure exactly which one you exhibit most: **To test your ‘clairvoyance’** Close your eyes and try to picture how your body appears as it is now.  For example, I’m sitting on my couch.  I’d try to think to think about as much detail as I could about how I exist right now.   Am I sitting down?  What kind of clothes do I have on?  Do I look happy, sad or indifferent?  The more crystal clear you can make this picture of yourself, the more clairvoyant you are said to be. **To test your ‘clairaudience’** Close your eyes again, but this time focus solely on all of the different noises and sounds that fill the air around you.  Then, slowly work to eliminate each sound from your head until you find the silence that lies underneath all of the sound.   Once you’ve found this low, universal vibration, listen to your heart beating and the sound of your lungs working.  This can take days to achieve, but if you can, then you are likely clairaudient. **To test ‘clairsentience’** This test requires that you take a photograph of a person that you do not personally know, but whom someone close to you knows.  Practice analyzing all of the different feelings and emotions you get when you look at the picture of this person.   Do you feel like you can trust them?  What kind of person do you think they are?  Good or bad, write down your thoughts and then discuss them with your friend.   If you find that your predictions or thoughts about the person were accurate or significant, you are probably clairsentient. **To test ‘claircognizance’** This exercise requires you to look inward, asking for guidance and direction from your higher being.  Once you’ve asked for this guidance, start by writing down a question onto the piece of paper.   Then start jotting down whatever thoughts begin flowing through your mind.  Simply write down the words as they come to you; try not to think about what the words or thoughts mean, simply let your thoughts flow and write them down as they come. If you remain consistent with this exercise, your claircognizant ability will eventually become quite prominent, and if you begin to receive messages that are specific or that seem important to you at that time, then you’re likely very claircognizant.
posts.html:
All of us possess some level of psychic ability, whether we’re aware of it or not.  Maybe you’ve noticed that you have a subtle way of picking up on things before they happen or you’re a master at figuring out people’s true motives, or maybe you’re just really good at knowing when not to do something.  

These are all signs that your psychic ability is in good health.

The four most common psychic intuitions are: clairvoyance (seeing), clairaudience (hearing), clairsentience (feeling), and claircognizance (knowing).

You’re probably gifted in all of these areas, but there is likely just one that is your strongest and most proficient.  

Clairsentience and claircognizance tend to be the most heightened among people, but you can try these exercises to figure exactly which one you exhibit most:

To test your ‘clairvoyance’

Close your eyes and try to picture how your body appears as it is now.  For example, I’m sitting on my couch.  I’d try to think to think about as much detail as I could about how I exist right now.  

Am I sitting down?  What kind of clothes do I have on?  Do I look happy, sad or indifferent?  The more crystal clear you can make this picture of yourself, the more clairvoyant you are said to be.

To test your ‘clairaudience’

Close your eyes again, but this time focus solely on all of the different noises and sounds that fill the air around you.  Then, slowly work to eliminate each sound from your head until you find the silence that lies underneath all of the sound.  

Once you’ve found this low, universal vibration, listen to your heart beating and the sound of your lungs working.  This can take days to achieve, but if you can, then you are likely clairaudient.

To test ‘clairsentience’

This test requires that you take a photograph of a person that you do not personally know, but whom someone close to you knows.  Practice analyzing all of the different feelings and emotions you get when you look at the picture of this person.  

Do you feel like you can trust them?  What kind of person do you think they are?  Good or bad, write down your thoughts and then discuss them with your friend.  

If you find that your predictions or thoughts about the person were accurate or significant, you are probably clairsentient.

To test ‘claircognizance’

This exercise requires you to look inward, asking for guidance and direction from your higher being.  Once you’ve asked for this guidance, start by writing down a question onto the piece of paper.  

Then start jotting down whatever thoughts begin flowing through your mind.  Simply write down the words as they come to you; try not to think about what the words or thoughts mean, simply let your thoughts flow and write them down as they come.

If you remain consistent with this exercise, your claircognizant ability will eventually become quite prominent, and if you begin to receive messages that are specific or that seem important to you at that time, then you’re likely very claircognizant.

posts.title: Twin That Was Pronounced Dead at Birth Responds to Mother and Father's Touch
posts.markdown: It’s not very often that you hear such a miraculous and uplifting story that you have to simply open your mouth and say, “wow”. While I will never be able to experience what it’s like to be pregnant, I can imagine that carrying around a little ball of love with you for nine months has to come with extreme attachment and bonding.  To be told that one of your newborn children isn’t going to make it to the morning is probably one of the most heartbreaking moments in a parent’s life. The video below details the truly magical tale of Kate and David Ogg, who, after trying for years to conceive, finally received the great news that Kate would be having twins.  The elation and anticipation for their unborn children was immeasurable. But at just six-and-a-half months pregnant, the twins were on their way out of their mother.  They were ready, even if their parents were not. They were told that they had been blessed with both a boy and a girl, but that their son, Jamie, was not going to make it through the premature pregnancy.  Kate quickly told her husband to take off all of his clothes and climb into bed with her and Jamie, wrapping him in their warmth. The two loving, but now sorrowful parents held their baby tightly in their arms, hoping that he might stir, ready to come into the world, when they suddenly felt him move. Doctors have no idea how to describe Jamie’s unlikely survival, but his mother knows: it was the warmth and touch of his loving parents that brought him into this world alive and happy.
posts.html:
It’s not very often that you hear such a miraculous and uplifting story that you have to simply open your mouth and say, “wow”.

While I will never be able to experience what it’s like to be pregnant, I can imagine that carrying around a little ball of love with you for nine months has to come with extreme attachment and bonding.  To be told that one of your newborn children isn’t going to make it to the morning is probably one of the most heartbreaking moments in a parent’s life.

The video below details the truly magical tale of Kate and David Ogg, who, after trying for years to conceive, finally received the great news that Kate would be having twins.  The elation and anticipation for their unborn children was immeasurable.

But at just six-and-a-half months pregnant, the twins were on their way out of their mother.  They were ready, even if their parents were not.

They were told that they had been blessed with both a boy and a girl, but that their son, Jamie, was not going to make it through the premature pregnancy.  Kate quickly told her husband to take off all of his clothes and climb into bed with her and Jamie, wrapping him in their warmth.

The two loving, but now sorrowful parents held their baby tightly in their arms, hoping that he might stir, ready to come into the world, when they suddenly felt him move.

Doctors have no idea how to describe Jamie’s unlikely survival, but his mother knows: it was the warmth and touch of his loving parents that brought him into this world alive and happy.

posts.title: Watch This Touching Story About a Lost Soul Who Meets Death
posts.markdown:
Coda is the short film that has people talking everywhere. Made by And Maps and Plans, an Ireland based production studio, this animated short film tells the tender story about a lost soul who “stumbles drunken through the city,” eventually being found by Death, whom shows him many different things.

The story is touching and deep, begging you to take a second to ponder and reflect on the dialectics of life and death.

This animated film has won over 20 international film awards and earned an Oscar shortlist nomination, if you need a bit more encouragement to watch it!

posts.title: The 5 Stages of Love & Why Everyone Stops at Stage 3
posts.markdown: Love is one of the most highly sought after things in the world, so much so that people often act crazy or entirely unlike themselves when they’ve fallen for someone.  People of all ages want to find love, yet we see an astonishing number of relationships and marriages that fall apart over time. Check out the five stages of love and why most people end up calling it quits after stage three: **Stage 1 – Falling in love** If you’ve never fallen in love before, give it a shot sometime.  It’s one of the craziest experiences that you’ll ever forget.  Falling in love is great for many reasons, but mostly because our brains get flooded with chemicals that are designed to make us feel amazing.   Dopamine, oxytocin, serotonin, testosterone and estrogen are all swirling together to give us butterflies.  When you’re in love, no one call to you otherwise, because you’re 100% certain of the way you’re feeling. **Stage 2 – Coming together as a couple** During stage two, the love between two individuals becomes deeper and a little more mature.  This is the stage when most people want to have children and rear them together, as their bond becomes strengthened.   The individuals start making decisions based around the couple, rather than the individual.  Most people feel that this is the love that will last a lifetime, and they are often the same people that are so taken aback by stage three. **Stage 3 – Becoming disillusioned** Stage three often throws people for a loop because this is the time when one or both people start feeling uncertain about the direction that their relationship is headed.   Stage three is when things start to feel wrong.  You become resentful and angry over the littlest things, you feel less loved and intimate, and you want out.  You want to bring back that spark or chemistry, but you’re unsure of how to do it.   Getting through stage three can be very difficult, but if the couple can survive it, they’ll come out on the other side stronger and more in love than ever. **Stage 4 – Building a real, lasting love** If you can make it through stage three, then stage four is your reward.  Stage four takes place after you’ve gotten to the core of all the pain and conflict and are now working to resolve it.  And part of resolving your issues is understanding that everyone is wounded on some level, and that these wounds play a large role in your relationships.   In fact, ongoing research by The Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) Study has shown that childhood trauma can affect our physical, emotional, and relational health in profound ways.   Building a lasting love means wanting to grow and help each other heal your wounds.  Once the two of you start to heal, you’ll notice the chemistry and feelings of true love start to flourish again. **Stage 5 – Using your love to take on the world** The world is often seen as a pretty terrible place and for the most part, it is.  Thinking about the endless amount of conflict and turmoil that plagues every region of the planet can be disheartening; it makes us feel like there’s really nothing we can do individually to help out.   Building a lasting love between just two people is incredibly hard as it is, how can we do that with 7 billion people?  But maybe finding true love and then building a lasting love is the first step in this process.  If we can do this, then maybe we can start looking outward, seeking ways to help the world come together in love.
posts.html:
Love is one of the most highly sought after things in the world, so much so that people often act crazy or entirely unlike themselves when they’ve fallen for someone.  People of all ages want to find love, yet we see an astonishing number of relationships and marriages that fall apart over time.

Check out the five stages of love and why most people end up calling it quits after stage three:

Stage 1 – Falling in love

If you’ve never fallen in love before, give it a shot sometime.  It’s one of the craziest experiences that you’ll ever forget.  Falling in love is great for many reasons, but mostly because our brains get flooded with chemicals that are designed to make us feel amazing.  

Dopamine, oxytocin, serotonin, testosterone and estrogen are all swirling together to give us butterflies.  When you’re in love, no one call to you otherwise, because you’re 100% certain of the way you’re feeling.

Stage 2 – Coming together as a couple

During stage two, the love between two individuals becomes deeper and a little more mature.  This is the stage when most people want to have children and rear them together, as their bond becomes strengthened.  

The individuals start making decisions based around the couple, rather than the individual.  Most people feel that this is the love that will last a lifetime, and they are often the same people that are so taken aback by stage three.

Stage 3 – Becoming disillusioned

Stage three often throws people for a loop because this is the time when one or both people start feeling uncertain about the direction that their relationship is headed.  

Stage three is when things start to feel wrong.  You become resentful and angry over the littlest things, you feel less loved and intimate, and you want out.  You want to bring back that spark or chemistry, but you’re unsure of how to do it.  

Getting through stage three can be very difficult, but if the couple can survive it, they’ll come out on the other side stronger and more in love than ever.

Stage 4 – Building a real, lasting love

If you can make it through stage three, then stage four is your reward.  Stage four takes place after you’ve gotten to the core of all the pain and conflict and are now working to resolve it.  And part of resolving your issues is understanding that everyone is wounded on some level, and that these wounds play a large role in your relationships.  

In fact, ongoing research by The Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) Study has shown that childhood trauma can affect our physical, emotional, and relational health in profound ways.  

Building a lasting love means wanting to grow and help each other heal your wounds.  Once the two of you start to heal, you’ll notice the chemistry and feelings of true love start to flourish again.

Stage 5 – Using your love to take on the world

The world is often seen as a pretty terrible place and for the most part, it is.  Thinking about the endless amount of conflict and turmoil that plagues every region of the planet can be disheartening; it makes us feel like there’s really nothing we can do individually to help out.  

Building a lasting love between just two people is incredibly hard as it is, how can we do that with 7 billion people?  But maybe finding true love and then building a lasting love is the first step in this process.  If we can do this, then maybe we can start looking outward, seeking ways to help the world come together in love.

posts.title: 4 Music-Loving Kittens Sit and Listen to a Street Performer Ignored by Everyone Else
posts.markdown: Whether you’re trying to make a living off of your music or are simply hanging out downtown playing for fun, it can be hard to please the crowds of people that you rely on for money.  This particular Malaysian busker was having a rough go one night, struggling to attract a crowd, when he suddenly saw that a crowd had finally arrived. But not the type of crowd that he was used to. Four 3-month-old kittens wandered over to where he was playing and plopped their furry bottoms down to listen to some tunes. “Suddenly, the kittens (3 months old) come and sit in front of him, he continued, it’s like [they] know his feeling and give him support,” the owner of the video wrote online. This musician continued his performance and thanked his new supporters for watching him play.  Watch the video below to see this unique occurrence, and keep an eye out for the kitten that’s bopping his head to the beat!
posts.html:
Whether you’re trying to make a living off of your music or are simply hanging out downtown playing for fun, it can be hard to please the crowds of people that you rely on for money.  This particular Malaysian busker was having a rough go one night, struggling to attract a crowd, when he suddenly saw that a crowd had finally arrived.

But not the type of crowd that he was used to.

Four 3-month-old kittens wandered over to where he was playing and plopped their furry bottoms down to listen to some tunes.

“Suddenly, the kittens (3 months old) come and sit in front of him, he continued, it’s like [they] know his feeling and give him support,” the owner of the video wrote online.

This musician continued his performance and thanked his new supporters for watching him play.  Watch the video below to see this unique occurrence, and keep an eye out for the kitten that’s bopping his head to the beat!

posts.title: 5 Main Reasons Why You Keep Attracting Toxic People
posts.markdown: Toxic people make their way into our lives for a variety of different reasons, and a lot of the time we’re completely unaware of these reasons.  You might be attracting toxic people without even knowing it. Here are five ways you might be unintentionally bringing toxic people into your life: **You like to be a good listener** Being a good listener is not a bad trait to have, but it invites toxic people into our lives when they see it as an opportunity to talk at us for hours about themselves.   They like to ignore the subtle gestures you give indicating that you’re done because they’re not too concerned with what you have to say or think in the first place.  Active listeners are often targets of the narcissistic. **You’re generous** Generosity is undoubtedly a good trait to have, but toxic people are very attracted to generous folks, mainly because they know that they can use you to their gain.   They like to hang around in your life because they know they can count on you to do the things they want you to do. **You’re open and trusting** When you soar like an eagle, you attract hunters.  Dreaming big and striving to achieve your goals is a simple way to gain the attention of toxic people.   They fear your success, and will do anything to inhibit it.  Never open up to people who have shown that they are close-minded or poisonous. **You have an easy-going personality** Easy-going people are fun to be around because they not aggressive, choosing patience and kindness during times of trouble of conflict.   An easy-going person is the perfect target for the malicious intent of a toxic person seeking to take that easy-going-ness away from them.  They see this way of being as weakness and something to be taken advantage of. **You strive to see the good in everyone** Giving people the benefit of the doubt is often a double-edged sword, but we do it anyway because we like to believe that people are inherently good.  And most of the time people live up to this expectation, but every so often we come across an individual that challenges our beliefs. Wanting to see only the good in people can lead us down dark paths, like when we hold onto relationships thinking that a toxic person will change, even though they continue to put us down and do things to hurt us.
posts.html:
Toxic people make their way into our lives for a variety of different reasons, and a lot of the time we’re completely unaware of these reasons.  You might be attracting toxic people without even knowing it.

Here are five ways you might be unintentionally bringing toxic people into your life:

You like to be a good listener

Being a good listener is not a bad trait to have, but it invites toxic people into our lives when they see it as an opportunity to talk at us for hours about themselves.  

They like to ignore the subtle gestures you give indicating that you’re done because they’re not too concerned with what you have to say or think in the first place.  Active listeners are often targets of the narcissistic.

You’re generous

Generosity is undoubtedly a good trait to have, but toxic people are very attracted to generous folks, mainly because they know that they can use you to their gain.  

They like to hang around in your life because they know they can count on you to do the things they want you to do.

You’re open and trusting

When you soar like an eagle, you attract hunters.  Dreaming big and striving to achieve your goals is a simple way to gain the attention of toxic people.  

They fear your success, and will do anything to inhibit it.  Never open up to people who have shown that they are close-minded or poisonous.

You have an easy-going personality

Easy-going people are fun to be around because they not aggressive, choosing patience and kindness during times of trouble of conflict.  

An easy-going person is the perfect target for the malicious intent of a toxic person seeking to take that easy-going-ness away from them.  They see this way of being as weakness and something to be taken advantage of.

You strive to see the good in everyone

Giving people the benefit of the doubt is often a double-edged sword, but we do it anyway because we like to believe that people are inherently good.  And most of the time people live up to this expectation, but every so often we come across an individual that challenges our beliefs.

Wanting to see only the good in people can lead us down dark paths, like when we hold onto relationships thinking that a toxic person will change, even though they continue to put us down and do things to hurt us.

posts.title: 10 Things Only the Person with the Overly Expressive Face Will Understand
posts.markdown: Yes yes, we’ve all heard of resting bitch face.  Those people who suffer from having a face with little to no facial cues or expressions, leaving them looking mean and upset pretty much all the time.  Well, just as they can’t help looking pissed off all the time, the person with the overly expressive face (or OEF) can’t help but show all of what they feel with their face, leaving them no room for secrets. These people constantly look shocked, confused, or intensely focused; more so than any normal person.  Check out these ten things that only the overly expressive faced person will understand: **You have no control over your eyebrows – **These guys shoot up or furrow on a consistent basis.  They’re always telling others what’s on your mind. ![dianna agron glee eyebrow raise](https://metrouk2.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/dianna-agron-raising-eyebrows-reaction.gif?w=620&h=357&crop=1) **You’re never quite sure what your face is actually saying – **Which is why you’re usually pretty confused when others start asking if you’re annoyed, confused or shocked, when you’re really just trying to sit their quietly and take in information. **Posed photos look awful, but candid shots are always hilarious – **A neutral smile isn’t default for you and you think you look terrible, but that photo of your face that was caught during one of your more expressive moments will always look stunning. ![kristen wiig frowning face](https://metrouk2.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/kristen-wiig-frowning-face.gif?w=620&h=294&crop=1) **People mistake you for being overly emotional – **Although your face says “EXTREME EMOTION,” you’re really just chilling.  Once those eyebrows drop, people know that it’s just your face. **Your face lands you in trouble – **When someone catches one of your looks and immediately recognizes that you’re either not interested in what they have to say or that you’ve become annoyed with them.   **You’ve got a reputation for having memorable reactions – **‘Your face is so funny sometimes’ isn’t really the compliment that you might think it is. ![olivia wilde eyebrow raise](https://metrouk2.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/olivia-wilde-eyebrow-raise.gif?w=620&h=310&crop=1) **Opening presents is impossible – **Those that are close to you have seen your genuine, “oh my god this is awesome” face, so when the gift they give you doesn’t elicit that reaction, they know immediately.  Sorry. **People like to watch you watch movies – **The gasps, the terrified looks, the scrunched up faces.  It’s pretty fun to watch, I guess. **You’re always being asked what’s wrong –** Your focused face can seem pretty intense at times, and occasionally you’ll have a moment of realization that sends out a ‘everything in the world is wrong’ kind of vibe.  This look tends to worry those around you, and they’ll ask about it. ![donald glover remembering something shocked face](https://metrouk2.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/donald-glover-remembering-something.gif?w=620&h=349&crop=1) **What is resting bitch face? – **This notion is entirely foreign to you.  There is no resting face.  You’re stuck in a constant cycle of varied emotions and feelings that get announced to the world via your face.  It might be bitchy some of the time, but it’s usually just stuck in that attractive, jaded grimace.
posts.html:
Yes yes, we’ve all heard of resting bitch face.  Those people who suffer from having a face with little to no facial cues or expressions, leaving them looking mean and upset pretty much all the time.  Well, just as they can’t help looking pissed off all the time, the person with the overly expressive face (or OEF) can’t help but show all of what they feel with their face, leaving them no room for secrets.

These people constantly look shocked, confused, or intensely focused; more so than any normal person.  Check out these ten things that only the overly expressive faced person will understand:

*You have no control over your eyebrows – *These guys shoot up or furrow on a consistent basis.  They’re always telling others what’s on your mind.

*You’re never quite sure what your face is actually saying – *Which is why you’re usually pretty confused when others start asking if you’re annoyed, confused or shocked, when you’re really just trying to sit their quietly and take in information.

*Posed photos look awful, but candid shots are always hilarious – *A neutral smile isn’t default for you and you think you look terrible, but that photo of your face that was caught during one of your more expressive moments will always look stunning.

*People mistake you for being overly emotional – *Although your face says “EXTREME EMOTION,” you’re really just chilling.  Once those eyebrows drop, people know that it’s just your face.

*Your face lands you in trouble – *When someone catches one of your looks and immediately recognizes that you’re either not interested in what they have to say or that you’ve become annoyed with them.  

*You’ve got a reputation for having memorable reactions – *‘Your face is so funny sometimes’ isn’t really the compliment that you might think it is.

*Opening presents is impossible – *Those that are close to you have seen your genuine, “oh my god this is awesome” face, so when the gift they give you doesn’t elicit that reaction, they know immediately.  Sorry.

*People like to watch you watch movies – *The gasps, the terrified looks, the scrunched up faces.  It’s pretty fun to watch, I guess.

You’re always being asked what’s wrong – Your focused face can seem pretty intense at times, and occasionally you’ll have a moment of realization that sends out a ‘everything in the world is wrong’ kind of vibe.  This look tends to worry those around you, and they’ll ask about it.

*What is resting bitch face? – *This notion is entirely foreign to you.  There is no resting face.  You’re stuck in a constant cycle of varied emotions and feelings that get announced to the world via your face.  It might be bitchy some of the time, but it’s usually just stuck in that attractive, jaded grimace.

posts.title: 5 Truths That Our Souls Wants Us to Never Forget
posts.markdown: The soul is often talked about like it’s something that is separate from the rest of our being, but the truth is that our souls are our true existence in this world.  When we forget that we are shadows of our souls, we forget what it means to truly be ourselves, where we truly come from and how to be all that we can be. When this happens, it’s okay, because our souls have got our backs, and they’ll always be there to guide us along by reminding us of these five simple life truths: **You are where you are supposed to be, do not fret** When you’re working your way through life, making big decisions, and choosing which paths to take at those monumental forks in the road, your soul knows that regardless of which choices you make, at the end of the day everything happens for a reason.   Embrace where you are at this moment in life and know that everything will work out in the end. **Acknowledge impermanence** One of the greatest lessons to be learned in life is that most everything in life has an expiration date on it.  Just as we are not permanent fixtures on this planet, pretty much everything else is not permanent either.  So, recognize when there is good in your life and when there is bad in your life, and know that neither one will stay with you forever. **To succeed, you only need look inward** People who meditate regularly will tell you that all of your problems can be solved by simply channeling your inner awareness.  When you are down on your luck or struggling to find your stride, look inside and listen to your soul.  It knows that you are strong enough, compassionate and loving enough, and courageous enough to take on any endeavor. **You’re perfectly okay as you are right now** Changing who you are for reasons that are not true to yourself is not healthy growth.  Transformation is a choice, but it must come to us organically and from a place of acceptance.  Be content with who you are and your transformative process will occur on its own. **Self worth is measured by the self** You can look to others for happiness through approval and validation, but true happiness does not lie within others.  Each one of the 7 billion people living on our planet today is unique and complex, and the people in your life are no different.   Striving to make each and every person happy just isn’t a possible goal.  Make yourself happy first and foremost, and then you can start to make others happy.
posts.html:
The soul is often talked about like it’s something that is separate from the rest of our being, but the truth is that our souls are our true existence in this world.  When we forget that we are shadows of our souls, we forget what it means to truly be ourselves, where we truly come from and how to be all that we can be.

When this happens, it’s okay, because our souls have got our backs, and they’ll always be there to guide us along by reminding us of these five simple life truths:

You are where you are supposed to be, do not fret

When you’re working your way through life, making big decisions, and choosing which paths to take at those monumental forks in the road, your soul knows that regardless of which choices you make, at the end of the day everything happens for a reason.  

Embrace where you are at this moment in life and know that everything will work out in the end.

Acknowledge impermanence

One of the greatest lessons to be learned in life is that most everything in life has an expiration date on it.  Just as we are not permanent fixtures on this planet, pretty much everything else is not permanent either.  So, recognize when there is good in your life and when there is bad in your life, and know that neither one will stay with you forever.

To succeed, you only need look inward

People who meditate regularly will tell you that all of your problems can be solved by simply channeling your inner awareness.  When you are down on your luck or struggling to find your stride, look inside and listen to your soul.  It knows that you are strong enough, compassionate and loving enough, and courageous enough to take on any endeavor.

You’re perfectly okay as you are right now

Changing who you are for reasons that are not true to yourself is not healthy growth.  Transformation is a choice, but it must come to us organically and from a place of acceptance.  Be content with who you are and your transformative process will occur on its own.

Self worth is measured by the self

You can look to others for happiness through approval and validation, but true happiness does not lie within others.  Each one of the 7 billion people living on our planet today is unique and complex, and the people in your life are no different.  

Striving to make each and every person happy just isn’t a possible goal.  Make yourself happy first and foremost, and then you can start to make others happy.

posts.title: 11 Reasons Why the Virgo Woman Is Perfect
posts.markdown: Virgo women aren’t like other women.  The Virgo woman is usually the one that is busy cleaning every aspect of her life, as she absolutely loves to solve problems.   Emotional trauma? She’s got the wisdom to help spur growth. Finances out of control? She knows how to manage them.    Virgo women have everything on lock, as they like to embrace their inner perfectionist. Here are 11 reasons Virgo women are some of the finest you will ever meet: Her house will never be dirty. Never ever. ![Her house will never be dirty. Never ever.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/her_house_will_never_be_dirty__never_ever_.gif "Her house will never be dirty. Never ever.") Just like her house, her clothes will always be neatly stacked up, washed and ironed. ![Just like house, her clothes will always be always perfect, neatly pressed and clean.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/just_like_house_her_clothes_will_always_be_always_perfect_neatly_pressed_and_clean_.gif "Just like house, her clothes will always be always perfect, neatly pressed and clean.") Just because she is prudish, don’t mistake her to be cold in bed. She will surprise you with her moves! ![Just because she is prudish, don_t mistake her to be an ice queen in bed.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/just_because_she_is_prudish_don_t_mistake_her_to_be_an_ice_queen_in_bed_.gif "Just because she is prudish, don_t mistake her to be an ice queen in bed.") She will remember everything you tell her. Absolutely everything. ![She will remember everything you tell her.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_will_remember_everything_you_tell_her_.gif "She will remember everything you tell her.") Reliable is the key word here. She is one of the best friends ever. ![Reliable, she is one of the best friends ever.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/reliable_she_is_one_of_the_best_friends_ever_.gif "Reliable, she is one of the best friends ever.") At first she might come across as quiet, but once she is at ease you’re your presence, she’ll make you smile every time you are with her. ![At first she might come across as the quiet one,](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/at_first_she_might_come_across_as_the_quiet_one_.gif "At first she might come across as the quiet one,") She is one of the wittiest women you will ever meet. Make her in charge of an event or give her a task, you can be assured that she will accomplish it with her seal of perfection. ![She is one of the wittiest women you will ever meet.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_is_one_of_the_wittiest_women_you_will_ever_meet_.gif "She is one of the wittiest women you will ever meet.") She is an ideal combination of beauty and brains. ![She is an elusive combination of beauty and brains as well.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_is_an_elusive_combination_of_beauty_and_brains_as_well_.gif "She is an elusive combination of beauty and brains as well.") Given her high standards, it’s not easy to please her. ![She is difficult to please and has really high standards. (2)](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_is_difficult_to_please_and_has_really_high_standards__2_.gif "She is difficult to please and has really high standards. (2)") She is practical and resourceful. She is not a dreamer. ![She is very practical and resourceful. She is not a dreamer.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_is_very_practical_and_resourceful__she_is_not_a_dreamer_.gif "She is very practical and resourceful. She is not a dreamer.") She may be practical but she also believes in fairy-tale romances and happily-ever-afters. ![She may be practical but she also believes in fairy-tale romances and happily-ever-afters.](http://mediaresources.idiva.com/media/content/2015/Jun/she_may_be_practical_but_she_also_believes_in_fairy-tale_romances_and_happily-ever-afters_.gif "She may be practical but she also believes in fairy-tale romances and happily-ever-afters.")

Emotional trauma? She’s got the wisdom to help spur growth. Finances out of control? She knows how to manage them.    Virgo women have everything on lock, as they like to embrace their inner perfectionist.

Here are 11 reasons Virgo women are some of the finest you will ever meet:

Her house will never be dirty. Never ever.

Just like her house, her clothes will always be neatly stacked up, washed and ironed.

Just because she is prudish, don’t mistake her to be cold in bed. She will surprise you with her moves!

She will remember everything you tell her. Absolutely everything.

Reliable is the key word here. She is one of the best friends ever.

At first she might come across as quiet, but once she is at ease you’re your presence, she’ll make you smile every time you are with her.

She is one of the wittiest women you will ever meet. Make her in charge of an event or give her a task, you can be assured that she will accomplish it with her seal of perfection.

She is an ideal combination of beauty and brains.

Given her high standards, it’s not easy to please her.

She is practical and resourceful. She is not a dreamer.

She may be practical but she also believes in fairy-tale romances and happily-ever-afters.

posts.title: 4 Things That Only the Extroverted Introvert Understands
posts.markdown: You always hear about people getting labeled as either ‘extroverted,’ meaning they’re outgoing, spontaneous, social-loving people, or ‘introverted,’ which means pretty much the exact opposite.  Introverts are the people who prefer alone-time to social-time. But, if you’re like me and feel that neither of those categories describe you, then you might fall somewhere in between.   Here are four things that only us introverted extroverts will truly understand: **Talking to strangers is fine, small talk is not** Holding a conversation hasn’t ever been a problem for you, but when the conversation lulls into anything other than deep and engaging stimulus, you’re quick steer it back in the right direction.  Small talk is fine and all, but you don’t get to know a person through small talk. **If you’re uncomfortable in a group, you quietly sink into the background** Being in a highly social setting with lots of people is fine for you, when you know them.  But being around a group of folks that are different than what you’re used to can make you feel awkward and anxious, so you tend to stay quiet and go with the flow rather than try to make an impact. **You’re constantly in your head** The introverted extrovert’s brain is constantly churning, thinking about seemingly random things that largely have nothing to do with what’s happening in the moment.  It could be something that’s happening next week or something you forgot to do at home, or even some other, entirely fantastical daydream. **Liking alone-time doesn’t mean you enjoy being lonely** Being alone by choice is a great thing. Being alone because you have no one who cares to spend time with you is not such a great thing.  Enjoying some ‘me time’ is always great.  You get to do the things you love and make you happy.  But you also love being with people who make you happy.  Which makes being lonely the worst, as you have neither of these things.
posts.html:

Here are four things that only us introverted extroverts will truly understand:

Holding a conversation hasn’t ever been a problem for you, but when the conversation lulls into anything other than deep and engaging stimulus, you’re quick steer it back in the right direction.  Small talk is fine and all, but you don’t get to know a person through small talk.

Being in a highly social setting with lots of people is fine for you, when you know them.  But being around a group of folks that are different than what you’re used to can make you feel awkward and anxious, so you tend to stay quiet and go with the flow rather than try to make an impact.

The introverted extrovert’s brain is constantly churning, thinking about seemingly random things that largely have nothing to do with what’s happening in the moment.  It could be something that’s happening next week or something you forgot to do at home, or even some other, entirely fantastical daydream.

posts.title: Family of Bears Enters the Backyard, When They Do THIS Everyone Is Shocked!
posts.markdown: This precious family of bears found itself in the backyard of a homeowner, and much to their delight, this family had a hammock.  One of the cubs can be seen trying his best to stay on the hammock as his sibling attempts to knock him off; initially, mom is trying to corral her youngsters, but she eventually joins in on the fun too. While these adorable cubs and their mom are cute and seemingly harmless when playing with a hammock, it should not be forgotten that bears are still very dangerous animals.  There are many different types of bears, and knowing which type you’re dealing with is important.  Can you tell what kind of bears these three are? Looking to be around 110 to 300 lbs., these bears appear to be **[Black Bears](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_black_bear)**.  They’re smaller than Grizzlies, have no hump-like shape to them, and have large pointed ears. Your average **[Grizzly Bear](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grizzly_bear)** ranges anywhere from 350 to 500 lbs., they have longer hair and have distinct shoulder humps.  Their ears are typically shorter and rounder and their claws are notoriously long, being 2 to 4 inches in length. Should you ever find yourself in the presence of a bear **[there are a few tips to follow](http://usparks.about.com/od/backcountry/a/Bear-Safety.htm)**: **Remain calm** and try not to make any sudden jolts or movements. **Make plenty of room** for the bear and let it continue doing whatever it’s doing.  If it stops its behavior, back away, as you’re too close. **If you notice the bear**, but it doesn’t notice you, head in a different direction, quietly. **If the bear spots you**, you want to get its attention while it’s a safe distance away from you; let it know you’re human by talking in a normal voice and waving your arms a bit. **Know that when bears stand** it is not always a gesture of aggression–they often stand simply to get a better view. **If a bear pursues you**, drop some sort of item on the ground, as it might distract them, giving you enough time to escape. **NEVER feed or throw food to a bear.**
posts.html:
This precious family of bears found itself in the backyard of a homeowner, and much to their delight, this family had a hammock.  One of the cubs can be seen trying his best to stay on the hammock as his sibling attempts to knock him off; initially, mom is trying to corral her youngsters, but she eventually joins in on the fun too.

While these adorable cubs and their mom are cute and seemingly harmless when playing with a hammock, it should not be forgotten that bears are still very dangerous animals.  There are many different types of bears, and knowing which type you’re dealing with is important.  Can you tell what kind of bears these three are?

Looking to be around 110 to 300 lbs., these bears appear to be Black Bears.  They’re smaller than Grizzlies, have no hump-like shape to them, and have large pointed ears.

Your average Grizzly Bear ranges anywhere from 350 to 500 lbs., they have longer hair and have distinct shoulder humps.  Their ears are typically shorter and rounder and their claws are notoriously long, being 2 to 4 inches in length.

Should you ever find yourself in the presence of a bear there are a few tips to follow:

Remain calm and try not to make any sudden jolts or movements.

Make plenty of room for the bear and let it continue doing whatever it’s doing.  If it stops its behavior, back away, as you’re too close.

If you notice the bear, but it doesn’t notice you, head in a different direction, quietly.

If the bear spots you, you want to get its attention while it’s a safe distance away from you; let it know you’re human by talking in a normal voice and waving your arms a bit.

Know that when bears stand it is not always a gesture of aggression–they often stand simply to get a better view.

If a bear pursues you, drop some sort of item on the ground, as it might distract them, giving you enough time to escape.

NEVER feed or throw food to a bear.

posts.title: 5 Signs You’re In An Emotionally Abusive Relationship
posts.markdown: When we enter into a relationship, abuse is the last thing on our mind.  Because we don’t expect this person, who has committed his or herself to a relationship, to want to damage it in any way.  But, for whatever reasons, we still find ourselves in both emotionally and physically abusive relationships. Unlike physical abuse, which leaves its mark on the body for all to see, emotional abuse wounds us in more profound ways, ways that often go unnoticed.  And it’s just as easy to be the abuser as it is to be the abused.  Recognizing emotionally abusive habits are key to stopping them altogether. Here are five signs that emotional abuse is taking place: **Being publicly shamed** In general, degrading someone’s worth is a poor and unacceptable behavior, and doing it in a public setting makes it that much worse.  Helpful criticism is one thing, but insulting a person due to shortcomings or mistakes is inhuman and wrong.   Being publicly shamed increases the emotional damage done tenfold.   **Constant Disapproval** If your partner is seemingly never satisfied (or visibly dissatisfied) with everything you do, this habit can quickly turn into a form of emotional abuse.  You start to question everything that you do, and even change your way of doing things to try to please your partner.   Eventually you will learn that there is nothing you can do or change to make them happy, leading to a degenerated sense of self-worth. **Using jokes to mask insults** I feel like most people have a friend or know someone who uses jokes and half-truths to subtly insult or demean others.  Being able to laugh at yourself is a good trait to have, but allowing someone to degrade you in a way that seems affable is not okay.   Sometimes they don’t even realize they’re doing it, however, that does not make it acceptable behavior. **Seeking retribution** Everyone makes mistakes and messes up every now and then, it’s part of being human.  So, actively seeking a form of ‘revenge’ for something that your partner did wrong is unhealthy.   Imposing guilt, lashing out, or simply ignoring your partner out of spite is not fair to either person.  Mistakes will be made, learn how to handle your emotions effectively. **Constant attempts at belittlement** This is easily one of the worst forms of emotional abuse.  If your partner always takes the time to belittle you and make you feel inferior to them, you should probably move on.   These people love to remind you just how lucky you are to even be with them, or how unworthy of their love you are.  This most likely happens because of insecurities; fearing that you will realize how terrible they truly are and leave.
posts.html:
When we enter into a relationship, abuse is the last thing on our mind.  Because we don’t expect this person, who has committed his or herself to a relationship, to want to damage it in any way.  But, for whatever reasons, we still find ourselves in both emotionally and physically abusive relationships.

Unlike physical abuse, which leaves its mark on the body for all to see, emotional abuse wounds us in more profound ways, ways that often go unnoticed.  And it’s just as easy to be the abuser as it is to be the abused.  Recognizing emotionally abusive habits are key to stopping them altogether.

Here are five signs that emotional abuse is taking place:

Being publicly shamed

In general, degrading someone’s worth is a poor and unacceptable behavior, and doing it in a public setting makes it that much worse.  Helpful criticism is one thing, but insulting a person due to shortcomings or mistakes is inhuman and wrong.  

Being publicly shamed increases the emotional damage done tenfold.  

Constant Disapproval

If your partner is seemingly never satisfied (or visibly dissatisfied) with everything you do, this habit can quickly turn into a form of emotional abuse.  You start to question everything that you do, and even change your way of doing things to try to please your partner.  

Eventually you will learn that there is nothing you can do or change to make them happy, leading to a degenerated sense of self-worth.

Using jokes to mask insults

I feel like most people have a friend or know someone who uses jokes and half-truths to subtly insult or demean others.  Being able to laugh at yourself is a good trait to have, but allowing someone to degrade you in a way that seems affable is not okay.  

Sometimes they don’t even realize they’re doing it, however, that does not make it acceptable behavior.

Seeking retribution

Everyone makes mistakes and messes up every now and then, it’s part of being human.  So, actively seeking a form of ‘revenge’ for something that your partner did wrong is unhealthy.  

Imposing guilt, lashing out, or simply ignoring your partner out of spite is not fair to either person.  Mistakes will be made, learn how to handle your emotions effectively.

Constant attempts at belittlement

This is easily one of the worst forms of emotional abuse.  If your partner always takes the time to belittle you and make you feel inferior to them, you should probably move on.  

These people love to remind you just how lucky you are to even be with them, or how unworthy of their love you are.  This most likely happens because of insecurities; fearing that you will realize how terrible they truly are and leave.

posts.title: The Meaning Behind The Feather Tattoo
posts.markdown: Tattoos are a great way to express yourself and everyone has a different reason for getting one.  Some people like to attach meaning to each of their tattoos, seeing as they become a permanent part of your body.  A lot of people just like to get tattoos because they think they look cool.   I personally have only one tattoo, and while its design may carry with it different meanings, it’s also a reminder of the difficult time I was going through when I got it.   Feather tattoos have become quite popular over the years.  Two of my close friends have them, and they mean different things for each of them.  If you’ve been thinking about getting a feather tattoo, this is a good place to start. Here are a few different meanings that feather tattoos take on: **Freedom** Birds have always been seen as creatures of absolute freedom, as they are highly capable on land and in the skies.  Thus, feather tattoos are often highly associated with someone who is celebrating (or searching for) freedom or liberation.  These people need your love and attention in ways that don’t suffocate them. **Spirituality** Feather tattoos are often indicative of a very spiritual person.  The feather tattoo for the spiritual person is a symbol of ascension to higher planes of awareness and spiritual growth. **Courage & Strength** Birds cover large distances, fighting their way through storms and arduous weather to reach their goals and destinations.  A feather tattoo means that this person is resilient and confident, able to withstand the toughest of hardships. **Beauty** Birds are some of the most magnificent creatures to live on our planet today.  They have multi-tonal colors in their feathers, penetrating eyes, and absolute grace when they dance through the air.  Feathers are often reminders of the beauty that is all around us.   **Intelligence** Birds are typically associated with wisdom and knowledge.  Their unique point of view from high in the skies is symbolic of higher planes of thought, as well as a reminder to always be looking at situations and problems from all different angles.
