posts.title: I Had No Idea THIS is What the Extra Shoelace Hole Was For...Good To Know!
posts.markdown: Growing up, every time I got a new pair of shoes, I noticed that there was always an extra top shoelace hole that rests behind that one that you actually use.  “Why would anyone want to lace their shoes all the way up here?” I always wondered.  Well, it turns out that that hole actually serves a function.  Yeah, it’s not simply another hole for you to get creative with your lacing. You’ll find that almost all running and hiking shoes have this extra mystery shoelace hole, and the video below will show you exactly how to utilize it.  They’re typically used to prevent blisters on your heels by stopping your foot from getting jammed at the toe. Tying your laces with this “heel lock” or “lace lock” method creates friction between the laces at the top of the shoe, closest to the ankle.  What this effectively does is tighten the heel/ankle area without you having to re-tighten the entire shoe.   To achieve this lacing technique, begin by inserting the lace in backwards through the top hole so that you have a small loop on either side of your shoe.  Then, cross your laces and insert them each into the loop on the opposite side and tighten them.  Remember to go down and not up, as cinching upward leaves the loop hanging out of the shoe, which you do not want.  Pulling downward creates that tight, locking feel that we want.  Finish by tying your shoe as your normally would and then you’re off! h/t **[Sun Gazing](http://www.sun-gazing.com/extra-shoelace-hole-used-wish-knew-earlier/)**
posts.html:
Growing up, every time I got a new pair of shoes, I noticed that there was always an extra top shoelace hole that rests behind that one that you actually use.  “Why would anyone want to lace their shoes all the way up here?” I always wondered.  Well, it turns out that that hole actually serves a function.  Yeah, it’s not simply another hole for you to get creative with your lacing.

You’ll find that almost all running and hiking shoes have this extra mystery shoelace hole, and the video below will show you exactly how to utilize it.  They’re typically used to prevent blisters on your heels by stopping your foot from getting jammed at the toe.

Tying your laces with this “heel lock” or “lace lock” method creates friction between the laces at the top of the shoe, closest to the ankle.  What this effectively does is tighten the heel/ankle area without you having to re-tighten the entire shoe.  

To achieve this lacing technique, begin by inserting the lace in backwards through the top hole so that you have a small loop on either side of your shoe.  Then, cross your laces and insert them each into the loop on the opposite side and tighten them.  Remember to go down and not up, as cinching upward leaves the loop hanging out of the shoe, which you do not want.  Pulling downward creates that tight, locking feel that we want.  Finish by tying your shoe as your normally would and then you’re off!

h/t Sun Gazing

posts.title: Silica Gel Bags: 5 Reasons Why You Shouldn't Throw Them Away
posts.markdown: “DO NOT EAT,” reads the little silica gel bag that just fell out of the pocket of the new jacket that you ordered.  Thanks for the heads up, little bag, because before I had read that, my initial instinct was to ingest a tiny white bag full of little plastic-looking beads.  Usually, a fade away jump-shot into the trashcan is the only time of day I’d give this little bag, but after reading a bit more about them, I’ve started holding onto the little guys. These bags aren’t inherently poisonous, which I’m sure many people suspect they are.  They’re simply filled with silicon dioxide, which you shouldn’t eat.  They’re there for you to use them, if you want, and you should.  Here are five good reasons to use them again and again: **Put them in your gym bag – **Toss a couple in your gym bag, they’ll absorb the extra moisture that causes that terrible stench.  But what’s even better is that they’ll prevent bacteria from thriving in the damp and moist environment that holds all of your dirty clothes. **Put them between towels – **A couple of these in the towel cabinet will keep them from getting damp and smelling like wet dog.  Easy solution. **They make your razors last longer – **Grab a plastic container, throw a couple silica bags in there and leave your razor in there after you’re done shaving.  This will help the razor to last longer. **Save old photos – **Even those pictures that you’ve preserved forever in time will decay, over time.  If you do not store them correctly they will surely perish.  Put a few silica bags in your box of old photos, and save them from dreaded moisture. **Save your makeup – **Ok, now that I have your attention. Just kidding.  A couple of these bags in your makeup purse or box will keep your powdery stuff powdery, rather than curdled.
posts.html:
“DO NOT EAT,” reads the little silica gel bag that just fell out of the pocket of the new jacket that you ordered.  Thanks for the heads up, little bag, because before I had read that, my initial instinct was to ingest a tiny white bag full of little plastic-looking beads.  Usually, a fade away jump-shot into the trashcan is the only time of day I’d give this little bag, but after reading a bit more about them, I’ve started holding onto the little guys.

These bags aren’t inherently poisonous, which I’m sure many people suspect they are.  They’re simply filled with silicon dioxide, which you shouldn’t eat.  They’re there for you to use them, if you want, and you should.  Here are five good reasons to use them again and again:

*Put them in your gym bag – *Toss a couple in your gym bag, they’ll absorb the extra moisture that causes that terrible stench.  But what’s even better is that they’ll prevent bacteria from thriving in the damp and moist environment that holds all of your dirty clothes.

*Put them between towels – *A couple of these in the towel cabinet will keep them from getting damp and smelling like wet dog.  Easy solution.

*They make your razors last longer – *Grab a plastic container, throw a couple silica bags in there and leave your razor in there after you’re done shaving.  This will help the razor to last longer.

*Save old photos – *Even those pictures that you’ve preserved forever in time will decay, over time.  If you do not store them correctly they will surely perish.  Put a few silica bags in your box of old photos, and save them from dreaded moisture.

*Save your makeup – *Ok, now that I have your attention. Just kidding.  A couple of these bags in your makeup purse or box will keep your powdery stuff powdery, rather than curdled.

posts.title: Watch What Happens When This Herd of Cows Is Saved From The Slaughterhouse
posts.markdown: As a human being, it’s always great getting to see other animals express joy and a love for life just as we do.  And nothing makes us feel more connected or more human than sharing that experience with others. The happy herd of cows seen in the video have rediscovered that passion for life after being saved from the slaughterhouse.   Back in 2012, these cows were destined to meet their end because the farmer who owned them was experiencing financial hardship, so much so that he was going to sell the cows for their meat.   Upon hearing about the farmer’s struggles, the friendly folks from their neighborhood, all of whom had grown to love the family of cows, decided that the cows needed a new home.  So, they started a foundation that would see to it that they got the land they needed to house them. Watch as these cows rejoice, kicking and skipping around their new pasture after being released from the slaughterhouse where they’d been held all winter. Be sure to share this video with friends and family members who would like to see these cows happy and safe!
posts.html:
As a human being, it’s always great getting to see other animals express joy and a love for life just as we do.  And nothing makes us feel more connected or more human than sharing that experience with others.

The happy herd of cows seen in the video have rediscovered that passion for life after being saved from the slaughterhouse.  

Back in 2012, these cows were destined to meet their end because the farmer who owned them was experiencing financial hardship, so much so that he was going to sell the cows for their meat.  

Upon hearing about the farmer’s struggles, the friendly folks from their neighborhood, all of whom had grown to love the family of cows, decided that the cows needed a new home.  So, they started a foundation that would see to it that they got the land they needed to house them.

Watch as these cows rejoice, kicking and skipping around their new pasture after being released from the slaughterhouse where they’d been held all winter.

Be sure to share this video with friends and family members who would like to see these cows happy and safe!

posts.title: 5 Signs You're In a Relationship With the Right Person
posts.markdown: Relationships are hard work, especially if you think you’ve found the right person.  Sometimes it’s blatantly obvious when the two of you aren’t meant to be, other times it feels right, but you’re just not sure.  I guess it all really comes down to what you’re looking for in a partner.   But there are also certain things that indicate you’ve found a healthy and happy relationship, regardless of what you think you’re looking for. Here are five signs that you’re in the right relationship: **There’s a lack of games being played by both people** Because love makes us act and think in rather dumb ways sometimes, we oftentimes get caught up turning seemingly mundane activities into games to be won.  Who says ‘I love you’ first?  Who texts the other one first or more often?  Making the other person jealous because you feel slighted.  The list goes on.   If your relationship is void of any game playing then it’s a good sign that you’re with the right person. **You’re both on the same page** Sometimes relationships start out as casual affairs, dating here and there, but never officially a thing.  If both people want a casual relationship, then it should be agreed upon that that’s what is going to happen.  Otherwise, things can get messy and fast.  Always be straightforward and clear with your partner as to what it is that you want from the relationship.   **You communicate with each other honestly and openly** One of the greatest things a couple can understand is that the other person will never be able to read your mind, so unless you communicate with them how you’re feeling or what you’re thinking, nothing will get done.   When you trust each other, communication comes easy. **You can balance freedom and teamwork** When both of you feel free while also being together, it is a good sign that you’re in the right relationship.  Feeling trapped in a relationship means the relationship doesn’t truly exist.   If the two of you can work together, by meeting halfway, you will achieve more than you could by yourself.  Be willing to adjust for one another when the situation calls for it. **You don’t let others influence your relationship** For whatever reasons, some people will find a problem with your relationship.  Sometimes they simply don’t make sense to people who are on the outside of it.  So, you’re occasionally going to run into some resistance, but never let anyone outside of your relationship ruin the relationship.   If you’re having problems with a partner, work it out with them, and only them.  Don’t worry what others think as long as the two of you are happy. (h/t **[Marc and Angel](http://www.marcandangel.com/2014/02/12/9-good-signs-youre-in-the-right-relationship/)**)
posts.html:
Relationships are hard work, especially if you think you’ve found the right person.  Sometimes it’s blatantly obvious when the two of you aren’t meant to be, other times it feels right, but you’re just not sure.  I guess it all really comes down to what you’re looking for in a partner.  

But there are also certain things that indicate you’ve found a healthy and happy relationship, regardless of what you think you’re looking for.

Here are five signs that you’re in the right relationship:

There’s a lack of games being played by both people

Because love makes us act and think in rather dumb ways sometimes, we oftentimes get caught up turning seemingly mundane activities into games to be won.  Who says ‘I love you’ first?  Who texts the other one first or more often?  Making the other person jealous because you feel slighted.  The list goes on.  

If your relationship is void of any game playing then it’s a good sign that you’re with the right person.

You’re both on the same page

Sometimes relationships start out as casual affairs, dating here and there, but never officially a thing.  If both people want a casual relationship, then it should be agreed upon that that’s what is going to happen.  Otherwise, things can get messy and fast.  Always be straightforward and clear with your partner as to what it is that you want from the relationship.  

You communicate with each other honestly and openly

One of the greatest things a couple can understand is that the other person will never be able to read your mind, so unless you communicate with them how you’re feeling or what you’re thinking, nothing will get done.  

When you trust each other, communication comes easy.

You can balance freedom and teamwork

When both of you feel free while also being together, it is a good sign that you’re in the right relationship.  Feeling trapped in a relationship means the relationship doesn’t truly exist.  

If the two of you can work together, by meeting halfway, you will achieve more than you could by yourself.  Be willing to adjust for one another when the situation calls for it.

You don’t let others influence your relationship

For whatever reasons, some people will find a problem with your relationship.  Sometimes they simply don’t make sense to people who are on the outside of it.  So, you’re occasionally going to run into some resistance, but never let anyone outside of your relationship ruin the relationship.  

If you’re having problems with a partner, work it out with them, and only them.  Don’t worry what others think as long as the two of you are happy.

(h/t Marc and Angel)

posts.title: These 10 Wayne Dyer Quotes Will Inspire You to Live the Best Possible Life You Can
posts.markdown: Last year, **[Dr. Wayne W. Dyer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wayne_Dyer)**, the man known for his dedication and passion for helping others with their personal development, passed away in his sleep, leaving behind a world forever changed by his work. Known as the “father of motivation,” Dyer is said to have changed the entire landscape of personal development with his largely successful book, **[*Your Erroneous Zones*](http://www.amazon.com/Your-Erroneous-Zones-Step-Step/dp/0060919760/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?tag=mind0a3-20)**, which was released in 1976.   An instant bestseller, Dyer’s book solidified his status as a positive force in the personal development industry, with philosophies that combined New Thought self-actualization theory and nondenominational spirituality. Here are 10 quotes from**[Dr. Dyer](http://www.drwaynedyer.com/)** that inspire and perpetuate happiness: 1. “If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.” 2. “How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.” 3. “When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.” 4. “Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.” 5. “Conflict cannot survive without your participation.” 6. “You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.” 7. “The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don’t know anything about.” 8. “When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It’s to enjoy each step along the way.” 9. “Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.” 10. “Abundance is not something we acquire. It is something we tune into.” Do any of these resonate with you?
posts.html:
Last year, Dr. Wayne W. Dyer, the man known for his dedication and passion for helping others with their personal development, passed away in his sleep, leaving behind a world forever changed by his work.

Known as the “father of motivation,” Dyer is said to have changed the entire landscape of personal development with his largely successful book, Your Erroneous Zones, which was released in 1976.  

An instant bestseller, Dyer’s book solidified his status as a positive force in the personal development industry, with philosophies that combined New Thought self-actualization theory and nondenominational spirituality.

Here are 10 quotes fromDr. Dyer that inspire and perpetuate happiness:

  1. “If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.”
  2. “How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.”
  3. “When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.”
  4. “Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.”
  5. “Conflict cannot survive without your participation.”
  6. “You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.”
  7. “The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don’t know anything about.”
  8. “When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It’s to enjoy each step along the way.”
  9. “Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.”
  10. “Abundance is not something we acquire. It is something we tune into.”

Do any of these resonate with you?

posts.title: 5 Old-Fashioned Relationship Habits We Should Practice Today
posts.markdown: It’s not every day that you see small romantic gestures take place.  An old man walking around to the other side of the car to open the door for his wife or pulling out a chair at the dinner table for her to sit down. Love is different nowadays.  And while that’s not a bad thing, the love of today could use a bit of old-fashioned inspiration. Here are five old-fashioned relationship habits we should bring back: **Spending quality time with one another without technology or any major plans** Some of the best moments we have with our partners are the ones that are spent doing absolutely nothing together.  The next time you’re with your partner try to avoid using any laptops or phones and do something simple, like going for a walk or having a fun conversation. You don’t have to make big plans to be together–just make sure that you’re spending time together as often as possible, face to face. **Being fully present and available in the moment** Have you ever started telling a story only to find that no one is listening to you just seconds into it?  It’s not a good feeling.  One of the best ways to show your partner that you care about them is by being fully attentive and focused on what they’re saying to you.   Your partners, friends, and family members will always remember how you made them feel by giving them the time of day. **A focus on inner beauty** It’s a funny thing, when you really get to know someone, on a deeper level than usual, their physical characteristics start to fade away when you look at them.  Their outward appearance is no longer important, as you’re focused on their energy, their scent, their intelligence.   This is why none of us are really capable of falling in love with physical attributes. **Apologizing at the right times** Being proud is a good trait to have, to an extent.  But never let your pride cloud your judgment.  If you’ve wronged someone and know that you’ve hurt them, apologize and seek out forgiveness.  Relationships that last a lifetime don’t do so by being stubborn.   Say you’re sorry and mean it. **Be loyal and never break promises** A trait that I’ve always admired in people is their ability to commit to things.  Those people that stand by their word and speak with meaning.  They follow through on their promises, sometimes even over-delivering, doing more than what’s required simply because they know it matters.   Be one of those people who goes above and beyond for their friends, family members and partners.
posts.html:
It’s not every day that you see small romantic gestures take place.  An old man walking around to the other side of the car to open the door for his wife or pulling out a chair at the dinner table for her to sit down.

Love is different nowadays.  And while that’s not a bad thing, the love of today could use a bit of old-fashioned inspiration.

Here are five old-fashioned relationship habits we should bring back:

Spending quality time with one another without technology or any major plans

Some of the best moments we have with our partners are the ones that are spent doing absolutely nothing together.  The next time you’re with your partner try to avoid using any laptops or phones and do something simple, like going for a walk or having a fun conversation.

You don’t have to make big plans to be together–just make sure that you’re spending time together as often as possible, face to face.

Being fully present and available in the moment

Have you ever started telling a story only to find that no one is listening to you just seconds into it?  It’s not a good feeling.  One of the best ways to show your partner that you care about them is by being fully attentive and focused on what they’re saying to you.  

Your partners, friends, and family members will always remember how you made them feel by giving them the time of day.

A focus on inner beauty

It’s a funny thing, when you really get to know someone, on a deeper level than usual, their physical characteristics start to fade away when you look at them.  Their outward appearance is no longer important, as you’re focused on their energy, their scent, their intelligence.  

This is why none of us are really capable of falling in love with physical attributes.

Apologizing at the right times

Being proud is a good trait to have, to an extent.  But never let your pride cloud your judgment.  If you’ve wronged someone and know that you’ve hurt them, apologize and seek out forgiveness.  Relationships that last a lifetime don’t do so by being stubborn.  

Say you’re sorry and mean it.

Be loyal and never break promises

A trait that I’ve always admired in people is their ability to commit to things.  Those people that stand by their word and speak with meaning.  They follow through on their promises, sometimes even over-delivering, doing more than what’s required simply because they know it matters.  

Be one of those people who goes above and beyond for their friends, family members and partners.

posts.title: How to Recognize the 4 Different Kinds of Soul Mates In Your Life
posts.markdown: A lot of people think that the term ‘soul mate’ refers to the one person that is right for them in every way, the one person that is their other half.  But the truth is that soul mates come in and out of our lives for numerous different reasons, and they’re not strictly romantic.   These spiritual partners find their way into your life at just the right time, helping you overcome certain obstacles or helping you reach certain realizations, so that you may continue forward on your life journey. Here are the four different kinds of soul mates that you should keep an eye out for: **Soul mates that heal** Healing soul mates are those that come into your life with purpose.  They typically mirror you, so that you might see any blocks in your path.  They push you forward, but usually only stick around so long as both of your purposes are in alignment. **To recognize one** Your relationship or friendship will move incredibly fast.  They appear in your life when you are trying to rid yourself of old patterns or when you are struggling with issues from the past. **Soul mates from past lives** These are people that you instantly connect with due to your relationship in a past life.  These relationships feel as though they will last through eternity, and they likely will, because you never feel the need to hide anything from them.  These relationships shape us, helping us grow into the people we’re meant to be. **To recognize one** These people show up when you’re busy just being yourself–carefree and doing your thing.  They only want the best for you and want to help you achieve your goals.   **Karmic soul mates** Karmic soul mates are linked to you through a past life as well.  Deep and karmic, these relationships can be painful because they’re largely focused on struggles of the ego.  But this pain is expected to be endured, as that is the point of the relationship.  The goal is to learn how to overcome suffering. **To recognize one** These soul mates have usually been reincarnated, so as to relive specific karma that will help break a negative cycle.  Because of this, you will often share an almost twin-like connection, feeling what they feel during times of extreme or intense emotion. **The Twin Flames** If you’ve found a person that you can talk to for hours, who thinks just like you do, who you do everything with, you might have found your twin flame.  Meeting your twin flame makes you feel good, as your relationship exudes wholeness.  These may or may not be romantic partners; either way, the relationship will last a lifetime and completely transcends ego. **To recognize one** This person feels entirely comfortable to you, as if you’ve known each other in numerous past lives.  You don’t like being apart and most of your decisions are made together, or with the other in mind.

To recognize one

These people show up when you’re busy just being yourself–carefree and doing your thing.  They only want the best for you and want to help you achieve your goals.  

Karmic soul mates

Karmic soul mates are linked to you through a past life as well.  Deep and karmic, these relationships can be painful because they’re largely focused on struggles of the ego.  But this pain is expected to be endured, as that is the point of the relationship.  The goal is to learn how to overcome suffering.

To recognize one

These soul mates have usually been reincarnated, so as to relive specific karma that will help break a negative cycle.  Because of this, you will often share an almost twin-like connection, feeling what they feel during times of extreme or intense emotion.

The Twin Flames

If you’ve found a person that you can talk to for hours, who thinks just like you do, who you do everything with, you might have found your twin flame.  Meeting your twin flame makes you feel good, as your relationship exudes wholeness.  These may or may not be romantic partners; either way, the relationship will last a lifetime and completely transcends ego.

To recognize one

This person feels entirely comfortable to you, as if you’ve known each other in numerous past lives.  You don’t like being apart and most of your decisions are made together, or with the other in mind.

posts.title: 5 Forgotten Truths to Remember During Hard Times
posts.markdown: The nature of life is simply that there will be good times and there will undoubtedly be bad times; it’s how we react, how we compose ourselves during these times that come to define our true character.   When we find ourselves in these unfortunate situations, we can let them take hold of us and destroy us, or we can use them to fortify ourselves, to bolster our being.   These five forgotten truths are empowering–they’ll help you remain strong and wise during troubled times. **Pain is a natural part of life, it helps you grow** It could be argued that pain is *the* most natural part of human life.  But without pain, we would not have growth.  Pain shows us what we are truly capable of overcoming, it wakes us up to our truest of feelings.   So, embrace pain, embrace your scars and wounds as you move forward and flourish into the truest version of yourself. **Change your perspective, change your world** If you believe life is good, then life is good.  If you believe life is bad, then life is bad.  You can be happy if you want to be, as being happy is a skill, one that many people learn to master slowly over their lives.   They take nothing for granted, treat every day as a gift, and never let anything bitter take away from anything sweet. **A large part of growth happens through experience** A great lesson in life is learning to never assume or expect anything, because life often has other plans.  And what you gain from these ‘other’ plans, is experience.   Experience is incredibly valuable, it gives us strength, wisdom, and courage.  Know that all of your experiences up to this point have prepared you for everything that has yet to come. **You only have to live in the present** While most of us often get caught up living in some idealistic future, or terrifying past, life is lived in the passing seconds of each moment of each day.  To achieve any sort of goal or vision of tomorrow, the work has to be put in today.   Don’t get caught up on where you think you should be–you are exactly where you need to be right now, and it’s going to take you to where you want to be in the future. **You will never find true validation from other people** One of the most empowering truths of life is that we do not exist in this world for other people.  You do not owe anyone anything, so never feel like you have to live your life according to anyone but yourself.   Whether you seek status, wealth and fame, or solitude, peace and quiet, it is your decision, no one else’s.  Define success for yourself, and then succeed.
posts.html:
The nature of life is simply that there will be good times and there will undoubtedly be bad times; it’s how we react, how we compose ourselves during these times that come to define our true character.  

When we find ourselves in these unfortunate situations, we can let them take hold of us and destroy us, or we can use them to fortify ourselves, to bolster our being.  

These five forgotten truths are empowering–they’ll help you remain strong and wise during troubled times.

Pain is a natural part of life, it helps you grow

It could be argued that pain is the most natural part of human life.  But without pain, we would not have growth.  Pain shows us what we are truly capable of overcoming, it wakes us up to our truest of feelings.  

So, embrace pain, embrace your scars and wounds as you move forward and flourish into the truest version of yourself.

Change your perspective, change your world

If you believe life is good, then life is good.  If you believe life is bad, then life is bad.  You can be happy if you want to be, as being happy is a skill, one that many people learn to master slowly over their lives.  

They take nothing for granted, treat every day as a gift, and never let anything bitter take away from anything sweet.

A large part of growth happens through experience

A great lesson in life is learning to never assume or expect anything, because life often has other plans.  And what you gain from these ‘other’ plans, is experience.  

Experience is incredibly valuable, it gives us strength, wisdom, and courage.  Know that all of your experiences up to this point have prepared you for everything that has yet to come.

You only have to live in the present

While most of us often get caught up living in some idealistic future, or terrifying past, life is lived in the passing seconds of each moment of each day.  To achieve any sort of goal or vision of tomorrow, the work has to be put in today.  

Don’t get caught up on where you think you should be–you are exactly where you need to be right now, and it’s going to take you to where you want to be in the future.

You will never find true validation from other people

One of the most empowering truths of life is that we do not exist in this world for other people.  You do not owe anyone anything, so never feel like you have to live your life according to anyone but yourself.  

Whether you seek status, wealth and fame, or solitude, peace and quiet, it is your decision, no one else’s.  Define success for yourself, and then succeed.

posts.title: 5 Things That People Regret the Most When They Are On Their Deathbed
posts.markdown: As human beings, we all come with an expiration date.  It’s a natural part of life, one that we’ve struggled to cope with for generations.  In fact, right now, somewhere in the world, there is probably a researcher or scientist who is entirely focused on prolonging the duration of human life. When we look at the grand scheme of things, mankind seems small.  We’re only here for a blink of the eye.  Which makes many people regretful of the life they lived up until their moment of passing.  Feeling as though they simply didn’t *do* enough during their time here. There is still time to live fully and happily, but you have to make the choice right now. Here are five of the most common regrets from people who are on their deathbeds: **I wish I had cared more for the people who mattered the most** We all know what it’s like to hurt the person you love the most in this world.  Even with good intentions, sometimes we fall short.  Many people regret not being there for the people who were the most important to them.  They wished they had said ‘I love you’ more often and to more people.   Always take the time out of your day to tell people you care about just how much you appreciate them. **I wish I had been a better parent, spouse, child, etc.** Family is one of the most common things people believe they take for granted.  Especially once they start (or do not start) to show tremendous care for you once you’re nearing death.  Familial relationships can easily be some of the most dysfunctional relationships you’ll have, but these people care about you when it comes down to it.   Always remember to tell your family how much you love them. **I wish I had spent less time working** Many of us know that we’re missing out on quality time with friends and family by working so much, but who’s going to pay the bills?  Maybe you shouldn’t be thinking this way because a great number of people expressed the sentiment that they worked way too much and missed out on some of the most important moments in life. Do your best to find a job that allows you to balance your time between work and life.  You won’t regret it. **I wish I had taken risks more often** Fear of failure can be one of the most debilitating things for a person.  I know it all too well.  And many people who are close to dying regret not taking risks more often.  They knew that they could have created a happier, more fulfilling life if they had gathered their courage and pulled the trigger.  Don’t wait to try new things, explore new places, or chase your dreams–do it now. **I wish I had lived life for myself** One of the biggest regrets that people have when they’re looking death in the eyes, is that they didn’t live their life the way they wanted to live it.  And that is heartbreaking.  Lifelong dreams and aspirations seemingly float down the drain when we start living our lives solely for the happiness of others.  Only you know what you want out of life, no one can tell you that, so live for today and live for yourself.

Here are five of the most common regrets from people who are on their deathbeds:

We all know what it’s like to hurt the person you love the most in this world.  Even with good intentions, sometimes we fall short.  Many people regret not being there for the people who were the most important to them.  They wished they had said ‘I love you’ more often and to more people.  

Always take the time out of your day to tell people you care about just how much you appreciate them.

I wish I had been a better parent, spouse, child, etc.

Family is one of the most common things people believe they take for granted.  Especially once they start (or do not start) to show tremendous care for you once you’re nearing death.  Familial relationships can easily be some of the most dysfunctional relationships you’ll have, but these people care about you when it comes down to it.  

Always remember to tell your family how much you love them.

Many of us know that we’re missing out on quality time with friends and family by working so much, but who’s going to pay the bills?  Maybe you shouldn’t be thinking this way because a great number of people expressed the sentiment that they worked way too much and missed out on some of the most important moments in life.

Do your best to find a job that allows you to balance your time between work and life.  You won’t regret it.

One of the biggest regrets that people have when they’re looking death in the eyes, is that they didn’t live their life the way they wanted to live it.  And that is heartbreaking.  Lifelong dreams and aspirations seemingly float down the drain when we start living our lives solely for the happiness of others.  Only you know what you want out of life, no one can tell you that, so live for today and live for yourself.

posts.title: 6 Reasons Empaths Shut Down When Interacting With Fake People
posts.markdown: Empaths are those who are prone to absorbing the emotions and feelings of those around them, meaning they have to take certain measures to protect themselves from negative energies that others might be projecting.  When empaths happen across an individual who is hiding behind fake behaviors, they feel their inner pain.   An experienced empath is highly aware of the different levels of falseness and the reasons behind it, while a less experienced empath might struggle to figure out why someone just feels naturally wrong to them. **Traits and behaviors in others that leave the empath feeling terrible:** - Wanting to be loved by everyone, a person acts overly nice or interested toward what people have to say - Someone who is visibly angry at the world, but strives to convince everyone otherwise - The person who acts tough because their emotionally damaged childhood has rendered them insecure and wounded - Someone who has constructed an entirely new, false identity to hide the one they fear will not be accepted by others - Someone who praises you often, but is entirely insincere in doing so - Someone who falsifies all of their stories to seem interesting **And the ways that empaths react…:** - Avoiding this person, even when they’ve done nothing to make you feel this way - Completely unable to speak to this person, asking only questions and saying things that really don’t make sense - Having a feeling of dread or gloom that rests in the pit of the stomach until the fake person is some distance away - Spending more than an hour with a fake person drains you or leaves you feeling sick - You feel guilty because you like the person, but hate how it feels when you are with them - You feel completely helpless and out of control of how you feel
posts.html:
Empaths are those who are prone to absorbing the emotions and feelings of those around them, meaning they have to take certain measures to protect themselves from negative energies that others might be projecting.  When empaths happen across an individual who is hiding behind fake behaviors, they feel their inner pain.  

An experienced empath is highly aware of the different levels of falseness and the reasons behind it, while a less experienced empath might struggle to figure out why someone just feels naturally wrong to them.

Traits and behaviors in others that leave the empath feeling terrible:

  • Wanting to be loved by everyone, a person acts overly nice or interested toward what people have to say
  • Someone who is visibly angry at the world, but strives to convince everyone otherwise
  • The person who acts tough because their emotionally damaged childhood has rendered them insecure and wounded
  • Someone who has constructed an entirely new, false identity to hide the one they fear will not be accepted by others
  • Someone who praises you often, but is entirely insincere in doing so
  • Someone who falsifies all of their stories to seem interesting

And the ways that empaths react…:

  • Avoiding this person, even when they’ve done nothing to make you feel this way
  • Completely unable to speak to this person, asking only questions and saying things that really don’t make sense
  • Having a feeling of dread or gloom that rests in the pit of the stomach until the fake person is some distance away
  • Spending more than an hour with a fake person drains you or leaves you feeling sick
  • You feel guilty because you like the person, but hate how it feels when you are with them
  • You feel completely helpless and out of control of how you feel

posts.title: 4 Things That Happen to the Body When You Quit Eating So Much Sugar
posts.markdown: Sugar has been a pretty hot topic in popular culture as the United States continues to be one of the most overweight and unhealthy countries in the world.  The **[National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/Pages/default.aspx)** reports that more than two in three adults are considered to be overweight or obese, more than one in three adults are considered to be obese, and about one out of every twenty adults are considered to have extreme obesity. I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  **[Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/health-statistics/Pages/overweight-obesity-statistics.aspx)**, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from **[15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories](http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/sugary-drinks-fact-sheet/)**.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it. **Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:** **You gain energy – **The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content. **Your weight stabilizes – **If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance. **You reduce your risk for chronic illness – ****[Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses](http://www.diabetes.org/)** that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life. **You’ll start disliking sugar – **Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake.
posts.html:
Sugar has been a pretty hot topic in popular culture as the United States continues to be one of the most overweight and unhealthy countries in the world.  The National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases reports that more than two in three adults are considered to be overweight or obese, more than one in three adults are considered to be obese, and about one out of every twenty adults are considered to have extreme obesity.

I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from 15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it.

Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:

*You gain energy – *The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content.

*Your weight stabilizes – *If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance.

You reduce your risk for chronic illness – *Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses* that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life.

*You’ll start disliking sugar – *Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake.

posts.title: 5 Things That You Don't Need to Justify to Anyone
posts.markdown: One of the sad truths of life is that not everyone is not always going to support your decisions.  And there will certainly be times where you find yourself at a crossroads, staring down two different paths, knowing that no one can make the choice for you but yourself.   Because at the end of the day, it’s your life.  So live it how you want to live it, because the last thing you want to regret when you’ve death looming over you is that you lived a life for someone other than yourself. Here are five things you never need to justify to anyone else: **Why you have to put yourself first** If you don’t prioritize yourself then there’s a good chance that many others will not do so either.  Investing in yourself should never been as selfish, it’s easy for many of us get caught up in putting others’ needs before our own.   Make sure that your needs and desires are being satisfied and don’t feel the need to explain why. **Wanting to express your emotions** Expressing emotion is one of the most human things a person can do.  Our emotions are there for a reason.  Never be afraid to cry, get angry or throw a fit.  It’s always better to let it out than to keep it in.  Your emotions are real.   If others judge you for doing this, they’re the ones who need an adjustment, not you.   **Your weird quirky self** We’re all weird.  Some of us more weird than others, but we’re all weird and strange in some way.  It’s kind of weird to not be weird.  So celebrate your weirdness, it’s what makes you who you are, it’s what makes you different than the next person.  Never hide it away or feel ashamed by it. **Making the decision to forgive** Forgiving a person isn’t always easy, it takes strength.  Grudges are easy to hold because it’s easy to feel like you’re owed something.  Forgiving someone means that you acknowledge what’s happened, why you felt the way you did and why you’re ready to not feel that way anymore.   You’re accepting the past and moving forward, so that you might heal and grow. **Why you’ve failed and why you’re not afraid to keep failing** Failing in life is one of the greatest gifts, as it gives us so much knowledge.  Sure, you learn a little bit when you succeed, but not compared to how much you learn when you fail.  Never let the fear of failure keep you from acting.   Learn to fail, learn to get comfortable doing it often, and then learn to grow back stronger afterward.
posts.html:
One of the sad truths of life is that not everyone is not always going to support your decisions.  And there will certainly be times where you find yourself at a crossroads, staring down two different paths, knowing that no one can make the choice for you but yourself.  

Because at the end of the day, it’s your life.  So live it how you want to live it, because the last thing you want to regret when you’ve death looming over you is that you lived a life for someone other than yourself.

Here are five things you never need to justify to anyone else:

Why you have to put yourself first

If you don’t prioritize yourself then there’s a good chance that many others will not do so either.  Investing in yourself should never been as selfish, it’s easy for many of us get caught up in putting others’ needs before our own.  

Make sure that your needs and desires are being satisfied and don’t feel the need to explain why.

Wanting to express your emotions

Expressing emotion is one of the most human things a person can do.  Our emotions are there for a reason.  Never be afraid to cry, get angry or throw a fit.  It’s always better to let it out than to keep it in.  Your emotions are real.  

If others judge you for doing this, they’re the ones who need an adjustment, not you.  

Your weird quirky self

We’re all weird.  Some of us more weird than others, but we’re all weird and strange in some way.  It’s kind of weird to not be weird.  So celebrate your weirdness, it’s what makes you who you are, it’s what makes you different than the next person.  Never hide it away or feel ashamed by it.

Making the decision to forgive

Forgiving a person isn’t always easy, it takes strength.  Grudges are easy to hold because it’s easy to feel like you’re owed something.  Forgiving someone means that you acknowledge what’s happened, why you felt the way you did and why you’re ready to not feel that way anymore.  

You’re accepting the past and moving forward, so that you might heal and grow.

Why you’ve failed and why you’re not afraid to keep failing

Failing in life is one of the greatest gifts, as it gives us so much knowledge.  Sure, you learn a little bit when you succeed, but not compared to how much you learn when you fail.  Never let the fear of failure keep you from acting.  

Learn to fail, learn to get comfortable doing it often, and then learn to grow back stronger afterward.

posts.title: This Bull Was Chained Up His Entire Life, Now Watch What Happens When He's Set Free!
posts.markdown: Cows are used for a variety of different reasons by mankind today.  When adult cattle are slaughtered for their meat, it is known as beef.  When it is a calf, it is known as veal. In fact, dairy cows are bred specifically to yield large amounts of milk. In 2008, the USDA reported 35.5 million cattle slaughtered for meat.  **[97 percent of all animals that are killed](http://www.animalliberationfront.com/Practical/FactoryFarm/USDAnumbers.htm)**in the United States are for food production. Oftentimes the living conditions that these cows are forced to live in are awful and full of despair.  They’re stuffed into small, narrow spaces, are chained up, and then subjected to abuse by their handlers. However, for one lucky bull, his life was about to change for the better.  He’s being released from his confinement and he could not be happier.  Watch has he dances about in glee of his liberation. While this is not a typical situation, it’s always nice to acknowledge one good deed in a world seemingly full of bad.
posts.html:

However, for one lucky bull, his life was about to change for the better.  He’s being released from his confinement and he could not be happier.  Watch has he dances about in glee of his liberation.

posts.title: Terrified Cow Starts Crying, Until She Realizes Where She's Headed
posts.markdown: As a highly-sensitive and empathetic individual, seeing any being or creature in pain or despair causes me to feel similarly.  Seeing the image of this poor, terrified cow, who undoubtedly feels tremendous fear about what’s going to happen to her, makes my heart hurt.   My initial thoughts were that this cow is headed to a slaughterhouse or somewhere to be disposed of, because the the typical narrative when it comes to sad stories about dairy animals. But, this isn’t that story.  This cow didn’t find herself in a slaughterhouse, trembling before meeting her maker. This dairy cow, named Emma, was loaded onto a trailer and driven to her new home at the Kuhrettung Rhein-Berg Sanctuary in Germany.  The dairy farm that was formerly her home had recently closed down, and she was slated for the chopping block at the local slaughterhouse before her rescuers intervened. At the start of the video, you can see that she is clearly in distress, shedding tears of sadness and fear.  Her heartbreaking demeanor and mannerisms are enough to shake even the most resilient of folks.  But her fears would eventually fade away, as she made her way into the spacious new pasture she would begin to call home. Filled with green grass, rolling hills and a plethora of other cows, Emma’s worst fears were finally behind her.  As she made her way around this new setting, she was greeted by the other cows, getting sniffed reassuringly. The life of a dairy cow is anything but ordinary.  In order for them to produce the milk that we go to the store and buy every so often, they need to be pregnant and give birth to a calf.  In the dairy industry, however, it is commonplace for young calves to be taken from their mothers shortly after birth in order for the mother’s milk to be collected. Emma’s retired as a dairy cow nowadays, along with the other cows that have been rescued and brought to the sanctuary.  She gets to live a happy, pregnant-free life alongside her newly found cow family. h/t **[sun gazing](http://www.sun-gazing.com/cow-terrified-started-crying-realized-headed/)**

But, this isn’t that story.  This cow didn’t find herself in a slaughterhouse, trembling before meeting her maker.

This dairy cow, named Emma, was loaded onto a trailer and driven to her new home at the Kuhrettung Rhein-Berg Sanctuary in Germany.  The dairy farm that was formerly her home had recently closed down, and she was slated for the chopping block at the local slaughterhouse before her rescuers intervened.

At the start of the video, you can see that she is clearly in distress, shedding tears of sadness and fear.  Her heartbreaking demeanor and mannerisms are enough to shake even the most resilient of folks.  But her fears would eventually fade away, as she made her way into the spacious new pasture she would begin to call home.

Filled with green grass, rolling hills and a plethora of other cows, Emma’s worst fears were finally behind her.  As she made her way around this new setting, she was greeted by the other cows, getting sniffed reassuringly.

The life of a dairy cow is anything but ordinary.  In order for them to produce the milk that we go to the store and buy every so often, they need to be pregnant and give birth to a calf.  In the dairy industry, however, it is commonplace for young calves to be taken from their mothers shortly after birth in order for the mother’s milk to be collected.

Emma’s retired as a dairy cow nowadays, along with the other cows that have been rescued and brought to the sanctuary.  She gets to live a happy, pregnant-free life alongside her newly found cow family.
