posts.title: Only Highly Intelligent People Can Pass This Test?
Only Highly Intelligent People Can Pass This Test
posts.markdown: With only 4% of the population capable of passing this test, it has quickly become a fun and interesting way to see which of your friends and family members are smart and which ones are not.   Why not take it and find out for yourself?  Maybe you’re one of the smartest people around and solve it with no troubles, or you could have no clue what’s going on and fail spectacularly. Either way, share and let us know how you did!
posts.html:
With only 4% of the population capable of passing this test, it has quickly become a fun and interesting way to see which of your friends and family members are smart and which ones are not.  

Why not take it and find out for yourself?  Maybe you’re one of the smartest people around and solve it with no troubles, or you could have no clue what’s going on and fail spectacularly.

Either way, share and let us know how you did!

posts.title: 10 Red Flags That You’re Dealing With a Manipulative Person
posts.markdown: Psychopaths can be hard to spot at times because they carry themselves in a way that mimics a normal person.  They’re often very charismatic, altruistic and sincere at first, but then turn into nightmares when they’re not getting what they want from you or when you are no longer of use to them.   Particularly when it comes to relationships, psychopaths are often in rare form; it’s where they thrive.   Here are ten signs that you’ve become involved with a manipulative person: **You’re uncomfortable being around them, but still care about them liking you** If you’re constantly brushing off their not-so-kind behavior, seeing it as accidental or playful, just so you can keep their attention and praise, you’re probably dealing with a psychopath.  They don’t really care if you take off or ignore them, they’ll just move on to the next person. **They give attention and praise only so they can take it away later** Manipulators love to shower a person with affection and attention, making them feel as though it is genuine and sincere, only to suddenly become reclusive and unresponsive later.  They make you rely on this attention, so that you crave it when you’re no longer getting it. **They tell you that you’re their soul mate almost instantly** Sure, sometimes when you know, you know. But most of the time, it takes more than two dates to figure out whether or not the two of your are soul mates.  You probably do most of the talking during dates and they can’t seem to get enough of you. **They always have an excuse** Psychopaths love to talk their way out of things, so they’ll often manifest excuses for everything, even things they don’t need to.  It’s never their fault. **They insult you in a condescending, yet playful manner** Psychopaths love to speak in half-truths and use jokes to playfully demean others.  That way, when other people react negatively, they can play it off as though it were “only a joke” and claim them to be overly sensitive. **They use social media to incite jealousy and drama** Social media can really mess with a person’s head, because of this, it is one of the psychopath’s favorite tools.  They love to post statuses and videos that instill doubt and fear in the mind of their partner. **You get accused of emotions that they are specifically trying to bring out in you** You get called jealous or distrustful after they openly flirt with an ex or another person, ignore you for days, and then become annoyed with how “clingy” or “needy” you’ve become. **They have a complete lack of empathy** Psychopaths are simply incapable of imagining what others feel when they practice their manipulative behaviors on them.  You can beg and plead for them to have empathy, but it will likely lead nowhere. **They are the most hypocritical people you will ever meet** The psychopath demands perfection from their partner; loyalty, respect, faithfulness, affection… All things that they require from you, but never plan to reciprocate, as they cheat and lie and demean. **A mastery of ‘gaslighting’** Gaslighting is when they practice manipulative or deceitful behavior, and upon being called out for their behavior, vehemently deny any wrongdoing.  They do this so that you start to doubt your sanity, or even call into question whether or not the reality you perceive is actually reality.
posts.html:
Psychopaths can be hard to spot at times because they carry themselves in a way that mimics a normal person.  They’re often very charismatic, altruistic and sincere at first, but then turn into nightmares when they’re not getting what they want from you or when you are no longer of use to them.  

Particularly when it comes to relationships, psychopaths are often in rare form; it’s where they thrive.  

Here are ten signs that you’ve become involved with a manipulative person:

You’re uncomfortable being around them, but still care about them liking you

If you’re constantly brushing off their not-so-kind behavior, seeing it as accidental or playful, just so you can keep their attention and praise, you’re probably dealing with a psychopath.  They don’t really care if you take off or ignore them, they’ll just move on to the next person.

They give attention and praise only so they can take it away later

Manipulators love to shower a person with affection and attention, making them feel as though it is genuine and sincere, only to suddenly become reclusive and unresponsive later.  They make you rely on this attention, so that you crave it when you’re no longer getting it.

They tell you that you’re their soul mate almost instantly

Sure, sometimes when you know, you know. But most of the time, it takes more than two dates to figure out whether or not the two of your are soul mates.  You probably do most of the talking during dates and they can’t seem to get enough of you.

They always have an excuse

Psychopaths love to talk their way out of things, so they’ll often manifest excuses for everything, even things they don’t need to.  It’s never their fault.

They insult you in a condescending, yet playful manner

Psychopaths love to speak in half-truths and use jokes to playfully demean others.  That way, when other people react negatively, they can play it off as though it were “only a joke” and claim them to be overly sensitive.

They use social media to incite jealousy and drama

Social media can really mess with a person’s head, because of this, it is one of the psychopath’s favorite tools.  They love to post statuses and videos that instill doubt and fear in the mind of their partner.

You get accused of emotions that they are specifically trying to bring out in you

You get called jealous or distrustful after they openly flirt with an ex or another person, ignore you for days, and then become annoyed with how “clingy” or “needy” you’ve become.

They have a complete lack of empathy

Psychopaths are simply incapable of imagining what others feel when they practice their manipulative behaviors on them.  You can beg and plead for them to have empathy, but it will likely lead nowhere.

They are the most hypocritical people you will ever meet

The psychopath demands perfection from their partner; loyalty, respect, faithfulness, affection… All things that they require from you, but never plan to reciprocate, as they cheat and lie and demean.

A mastery of ‘gaslighting’

Gaslighting is when they practice manipulative or deceitful behavior, and upon being called out for their behavior, vehemently deny any wrongdoing.  They do this so that you start to doubt your sanity, or even call into question whether or not the reality you perceive is actually reality.

posts.title: 5 Things To Quit Stressing Over As Soon As Possible
posts.markdown: Have you ever thought about all of the little (and big) things that you stress about on a regular basis?  Some worries for me include: my student loans, making enough money to support myself, making enough money to have fun, having enough time to do the things I like to do, keeping my relationships healthy and happy, keeping myself happy.. The list goes on and on. Worrying about things does absolutely nothing for us.  Think about it.  Are you achieving anything when you sit and stress over things that have yet to happen?  Worry does not relieve the burdens of tomorrow, it only limits what you are capable of today.   So, take action, be assertive, be proactive, and stop worrying about these five things immediately: **Challenges** Every single challenge you come across in life is an opportunity for growth.  What would life be without challenges?  They’re what keep our lives interesting, and we gain a sense of self by overcoming them.   When we landed a man on the moon, we did it because of the challenge.  To say that we did it.   Recognize challenges for what they are and use them to grow stronger, to live more fully. **Poor circumstances that are out of your control** Know that even during the seemingly darkest of times, you still have the ability to not only succeed, but to thrive.   We are all capable of extraordinary things, but many of us never do them because we have excuses.  The economy is bad, the weather is crappy outside today, etc.  The only thing that you have control over at the end of the day is your mind, so use it to overcome. **What everyone else is doing** I read somewhere recently that people who were not on social media tended to be less depressed than those who were because they weren’t constantly comparing their lives to others’.   Don’t let the image of others succeeding and doing well deter you from chasing your own happiness.  They are encouraging you to do the same with your life as they are doing with theirs.  Don’t let your potential fade away, start doing everything you’ve always wanted to do today. **Any hollow or shallow love interests** If you’re in a relationship with someone who you feel isn’t fully invested in you, your life and your dreams, then you don’t have time for it.  True love comes after the honeymoon period, after the initial lust that we feel when we fall.   It’s an uphill climb that takes dedicated attention, awareness, discipline, effort and compromise.  It’s loving someone even during the worst of times that matters. **Working only for the sake of money** Many people are solely focused on get-rich-quick schemes so that they can spend the rest of their lives in leisure and without worry.  What they fail to realize is that one can achieve leisure and get rid of worries by embracing the things they are passionate about in this life.   Use the things that inspire you, that move you, that motivate you, to create a wonderful life for yourself.
posts.html:
Have you ever thought about all of the little (and big) things that you stress about on a regular basis?  Some worries for me include: my student loans, making enough money to support myself, making enough money to have fun, having enough time to do the things I like to do, keeping my relationships healthy and happy, keeping myself happy.. The list goes on and on.

Worrying about things does absolutely nothing for us.  Think about it.  Are you achieving anything when you sit and stress over things that have yet to happen?  Worry does not relieve the burdens of tomorrow, it only limits what you are capable of today.  

So, take action, be assertive, be proactive, and stop worrying about these five things immediately:

Challenges

Every single challenge you come across in life is an opportunity for growth.  What would life be without challenges?  They’re what keep our lives interesting, and we gain a sense of self by overcoming them.  

When we landed a man on the moon, we did it because of the challenge.  To say that we did it.  

Recognize challenges for what they are and use them to grow stronger, to live more fully.

Poor circumstances that are out of your control

Know that even during the seemingly darkest of times, you still have the ability to not only succeed, but to thrive.  

We are all capable of extraordinary things, but many of us never do them because we have excuses.  The economy is bad, the weather is crappy outside today, etc.  The only thing that you have control over at the end of the day is your mind, so use it to overcome.

What everyone else is doing

I read somewhere recently that people who were not on social media tended to be less depressed than those who were because they weren’t constantly comparing their lives to others’.  

Don’t let the image of others succeeding and doing well deter you from chasing your own happiness.  They are encouraging you to do the same with your life as they are doing with theirs.  Don’t let your potential fade away, start doing everything you’ve always wanted to do today.

Any hollow or shallow love interests

If you’re in a relationship with someone who you feel isn’t fully invested in you, your life and your dreams, then you don’t have time for it.  True love comes after the honeymoon period, after the initial lust that we feel when we fall.  

It’s an uphill climb that takes dedicated attention, awareness, discipline, effort and compromise.  It’s loving someone even during the worst of times that matters.

Working only for the sake of money

Many people are solely focused on get-rich-quick schemes so that they can spend the rest of their lives in leisure and without worry.  What they fail to realize is that one can achieve leisure and get rid of worries by embracing the things they are passionate about in this life.  

Use the things that inspire you, that move you, that motivate you, to create a wonderful life for yourself.

posts.title: IKEA's New Indoor Garden Allows You to Grow Food Year-Round
posts.markdown: Lots of people love to garden.  It’s therapeutic and lets you grow delicious foods that you would otherwise have to buy at the grocery store.  But not all of us live in an area that allows us to have a natural garden, especially those of us in big cities.   **[IKEA recently launched](http://www.contemporist.com/2016/03/13/ikea-is-introducing-a-new-indoor-gardening-series/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+contemporist+%28CONTEMPORIST%29)** a new product that seeks to eliminate the constraints of a natural garden.  The KRYDDA/VÄXER garden system utilizes hydroponics to grow fresh produce indoors, allowing everyone the opportunity to grow their own veggies and herbs. While the price of the hydroponic garden is not set yet,**[IKEA claims](http://inhabitat.com/ikea-exec-declares-the-world-has-hit-peak-home-furnishings/)** that the setup is so simple that **[anyone can use it successfully](http://inhabitat.com/interview-inhabitat-talks-to-ikeas-chief-sustainability-officer-steve-howard/)**.  It comes with a solar lamp for those who will not have direct access to sunlight, and the growing tray features a built-in water sensor that tells you whether your plants are over-watered or under-watered, ensuring just the right amount at all times. Check out how this new hydroponic garden works in the video below!
posts.html:
Lots of people love to garden.  It’s therapeutic and lets you grow delicious foods that you would otherwise have to buy at the grocery store.  But not all of us live in an area that allows us to have a natural garden, especially those of us in big cities.  

IKEA recently launched a new product that seeks to eliminate the constraints of a natural garden.  The KRYDDA/VÄXER garden system utilizes hydroponics to grow fresh produce indoors, allowing everyone the opportunity to grow their own veggies and herbs.

While the price of the hydroponic garden is not set yet,IKEA claims that the setup is so simple that anyone can use it successfully.  It comes with a solar lamp for those who will not have direct access to sunlight, and the growing tray features a built-in water sensor that tells you whether your plants are over-watered or under-watered, ensuring just the right amount at all times.

Check out how this new hydroponic garden works in the video below!

posts.title: Stephen Hawking Has a Beautiful Message for Anyone Suffering From Depression
posts.markdown: You might have heard about a man by the name of **[Stephen Hawking](http://www.biography.com/people/stephen-hawking-9331710)**, whether it be in the media or in your social circles, because he is one of the greatest minds of our time. At the age of 21, Hawking started developing symptoms of ALS, or**[amyotrphic lateral sclerosis](http://www.alsa.org/about-als/what-is-als.html?referrer=https://www.bing.com/),** a disease that doctors claimed would take his life in about two and a half years.  Now 74, Hawking is a huge inspiration for those with disabilities, as he continues to teach, research, and provide profound wisdoms for the rest of us to ponder. After his diagnosis, Hawking says that he had absolutely no expectations for life.  But he didn’t let it deter him from doing his best to live fully and passionately.  **[He has twelve honorary degrees](http://www.biography.com/people/stephen-hawking-9331710)** and has built a life dedicated to the study of theoretical physics, including robust theories on creation, the Big Bang and the universe. Depression is a subject that Hawking recently commented on at a lecture in London at the Royal Institute, likening the condition to a black hole: “The message of this lecture is that black holes ain’t as black as they are painted. They are not the eternal prisons they were once thought. Things can get out of a black hole both on the outside and possibly to another universe. So if you feel you are in a black hole, don’t give up; there’s a way out” Furthermore, when asked about his disabilities and the effect they have on his outlook on life, he responded beautifully: “The victim should have the right to end his life, if he wants. But I think it would be a great mistake. **However bad life may seem, there is always something you can do, and succeed at.** While there’s life, there is hope.” He would further this sentiment with a heartfelt message for those with disabilities like himself: **“If you are disabled, it is probably not your fault, but it is no good blaming the world or expecting it to take pity on you.** One has to have a positive attitude and must make the best of the situation that one finds oneself in; if one is physically disabled, one cannot afford to be psychologically disabled as well. In my opinion, one should concentrate on activities in which one’s physical disability will not present a serious handicap. I am afraid that Olympic Games for the disabled do not appeal to me, but it is easy for me to say that because I never liked athletics anyway. On the other hand, science is a very good area for disabled people because it goes on mainly in the mind. Of course, most kinds of experimental work are probably ruled out for most such people, but theoretical work is almost ideal. My disabilities have not been a significant handicap in my field, which is theoretical physics. Indeed, they have helped me in a way by shielding me from lecturing and administrative work that I would otherwise have been involved in. I have managed, however, only because of the large amount of help I have received from my wife, children, colleagues and students. I find that people in general are very ready to help, but you should encourage them to feel that their efforts to aid you are worthwhile by doing as well as you possibly can.” Watch Stephen Hawking’s lecture on how to escape a black hole in the video above and remember, “while there’s life, there’s hope.”
posts.html:
You might have heard about a man by the name of Stephen Hawking, whether it be in the media or in your social circles, because he is one of the greatest minds of our time.

At the age of 21, Hawking started developing symptoms of ALS, oramyotrphic lateral sclerosis, a disease that doctors claimed would take his life in about two and a half years.  Now 74, Hawking is a huge inspiration for those with disabilities, as he continues to teach, research, and provide profound wisdoms for the rest of us to ponder.

After his diagnosis, Hawking says that he had absolutely no expectations for life.  But he didn’t let it deter him from doing his best to live fully and passionately.  He has twelve honorary degrees and has built a life dedicated to the study of theoretical physics, including robust theories on creation, the Big Bang and the universe.

Depression is a subject that Hawking recently commented on at a lecture in London at the Royal Institute, likening the condition to a black hole:

“The message of this lecture is that black holes ain’t as black as they are painted. They are not the eternal prisons they were once thought. Things can get out of a black hole both on the outside and possibly to another universe. So if you feel you are in a black hole, don’t give up; there’s a way out”

Furthermore, when asked about his disabilities and the effect they have on his outlook on life, he responded beautifully:

“The victim should have the right to end his life, if he wants. But I think it would be a great mistake. However bad life may seem, there is always something you can do, and succeed at. While there’s life, there is hope.”

He would further this sentiment with a heartfelt message for those with disabilities like himself:

“If you are disabled, it is probably not your fault, but it is no good blaming the world or expecting it to take pity on you. One has to have a positive attitude and must make the best of the situation that one finds oneself in; if one is physically disabled, one cannot afford to be psychologically disabled as well. In my opinion, one should concentrate on activities in which one’s physical disability will not present a serious handicap. I am afraid that Olympic Games for the disabled do not appeal to me, but it is easy for me to say that because I never liked athletics anyway. On the other hand, science is a very good area for disabled people because it goes on mainly in the mind. Of course, most kinds of experimental work are probably ruled out for most such people, but theoretical work is almost ideal.

My disabilities have not been a significant handicap in my field, which is theoretical physics. Indeed, they have helped me in a way by shielding me from lecturing and administrative work that I would otherwise have been involved in. I have managed, however, only because of the large amount of help I have received from my wife, children, colleagues and students. I find that people in general are very ready to help, but you should encourage them to feel that their efforts to aid you are worthwhile by doing as well as you possibly can.”

Watch Stephen Hawking’s lecture on how to escape a black hole in the video above and remember, “while there’s life, there’s hope.”

posts.title: How Colorful Is Your World? Test to See if You Have 20/20 Color Vision
posts.markdown: Have you ever tested your vision to see just how well your eyes work?  Some of us are born with great vision that continues well into adulthood, while many of us are not so lucky and require some sort of helpful spectacles. And it’s all random, just like every other one of our traits.  Thanks genetics.   But you can test to see where you stand in terms of how well you perceive color.  Try out this quick color vision test and see how you compare to those with perfect 20/20 vision!
posts.html:
Have you ever tested your vision to see just how well your eyes work?  Some of us are born with great vision that continues well into adulthood, while many of us are not so lucky and require some sort of helpful spectacles.

And it’s all random, just like every other one of our traits.  Thanks genetics.  

But you can test to see where you stand in terms of how well you perceive color.  Try out this quick color vision test and see how you compare to those with perfect 20/20 vision!
