posts.title: Are You a True Scorpio? Take This Quick Test to Find Out!
posts.markdown: The Scorpio (October 23 – November 21) is a strongly independent person who can accomplish almost anything that they set their focus on.  Their relationships are often complicated, just like they are, and they tend to be moody individuals.   At times, they can be possessive and jealous, but make up for it with their undying loyalty.   How much do you embody the deep and intense Scorpio?  Find out by taking this quick quiz!
posts.html:
The Scorpio (October 23 – November 21) is a strongly independent person who can accomplish almost anything that they set their focus on.  Their relationships are often complicated, just like they are, and they tend to be moody individuals.  

At times, they can be possessive and jealous, but make up for it with their undying loyalty.  

How much do you embody the deep and intense Scorpio?  Find out by taking this quick quiz!

posts.title: 256-Year-Old Man Reveals the Secrets of the World Just Before His Death
posts.markdown: span style=”font-weight: 400;”>Have you ever wondered what it might be like to live for hundreds of years?  While it’s almost impossible to fathom what events of the world are yet to come, living well over a hundred or even two-hundred years is something that I often think about; mainly because I want to be around to see the future of mankind. While I most likely will not live to be past 100 (150 with modern science *maybe*) years old, there is one man in history who lived to be older than 250! A 1930 New York Times article details the story of a man named Li Ching Yuen, which Imperial Chinese government documents have been found congratulating him on his 150th birthday in 1827, and then on his 200th birthday in 1877.   A New York Times correspondent noted that, in Li’s neighborhood were old men whose grandfathers knew Li when they were young boys, and that he was a grown man when they knew him. Tales of Li that are widely accepted in his province say that he was able to read and write as a child, and by ten years of age had traveled to Kansu, Shansi, Tibet, Annam, Siam and Manchuria to gather herbs.  He would gather herbs for 100 years before finally starting a small business where he sold the herbs he once gathered. **He wasn’t the oldest man to have lived, though** According to Li’s disciples, Li once came across a man who had lived to be 500 years old.  This man taught him Qigong exercises and the diet that would help Li to live for extended periods of time. But on his deathbed, Li is quoted saying, “I have done all that I have to do in this world.”   **The secret to perpetual health** Li’s only advice when asked about his secret to a long life was this: “Keep a quiet heart, sit like a tortoise, walk sprightly like a pigeon and sleep like a dog.”  These were the same words Li gave Wu Pei-Fu, the warlord who invited Li to his home, so that he might learn his ways. Li believed that looking inward, working to create a sense of calm and peacefulness through meditation and breathing techniques were the secret to incredible health.  Essentially, it is your state of mind. **Hard to believe?** Yes, this knowledge at face value will have most people skeptical, as we in the Western world have average lifespans of about 70-85 years.  The difference that we must keep in mind when pondering these ideas is that not everyone on this planet has devoted themselves to a 9 to 5 working world lifestyle. They aren’t plagued with debt, they aren’t living in crowded polluted cities, and they’re using their bodies to work regularly.  Also, they aren’t consuming refined sugars or flours, fatty meats, genetically modified foods, or the typical junk foods we like to binge on every now and then. Not to mention, they spend almost all of their time in nature, perfecting their breathing techniques and meditating, practices that have been shown to boost mental, physical and emotional wellbeing.  And finally, they get proper sleep and spend time in the sun, something that we all typically refer to as “vacation” nowadays. Treating our bodies right is the first step to living a long, happy and healthy life.  We just have to be disciplined and determined.  How long do you want to live?
posts.html:
span style=”font-weight: 400;”>Have you ever wondered what it might be like to live for hundreds of years?  While it’s almost impossible to fathom what events of the world are yet to come, living well over a hundred or even two-hundred years is something that I often think about; mainly because I want to be around to see the future of mankind.

While I most likely will not live to be past 100 (150 with modern science maybe) years old, there is one man in history who lived to be older than 250!

A 1930 New York Times article details the story of a man named Li Ching Yuen, which Imperial Chinese government documents have been found congratulating him on his 150th birthday in 1827, and then on his 200th birthday in 1877.  

A New York Times correspondent noted that, in Li’s neighborhood were old men whose grandfathers knew Li when they were young boys, and that he was a grown man when they knew him.

Tales of Li that are widely accepted in his province say that he was able to read and write as a child, and by ten years of age had traveled to Kansu, Shansi, Tibet, Annam, Siam and Manchuria to gather herbs.  He would gather herbs for 100 years before finally starting a small business where he sold the herbs he once gathered.

He wasn’t the oldest man to have lived, though

According to Li’s disciples, Li once came across a man who had lived to be 500 years old.  This man taught him Qigong exercises and the diet that would help Li to live for extended periods of time.

But on his deathbed, Li is quoted saying, “I have done all that I have to do in this world.”  

The secret to perpetual health

Li’s only advice when asked about his secret to a long life was this: “Keep a quiet heart, sit like a tortoise, walk sprightly like a pigeon and sleep like a dog.”  These were the same words Li gave Wu Pei-Fu, the warlord who invited Li to his home, so that he might learn his ways.

Li believed that looking inward, working to create a sense of calm and peacefulness through meditation and breathing techniques were the secret to incredible health.  Essentially, it is your state of mind.

Hard to believe?

Yes, this knowledge at face value will have most people skeptical, as we in the Western world have average lifespans of about 70-85 years.  The difference that we must keep in mind when pondering these ideas is that not everyone on this planet has devoted themselves to a 9 to 5 working world lifestyle.

They aren’t plagued with debt, they aren’t living in crowded polluted cities, and they’re using their bodies to work regularly.  Also, they aren’t consuming refined sugars or flours, fatty meats, genetically modified foods, or the typical junk foods we like to binge on every now and then.

Not to mention, they spend almost all of their time in nature, perfecting their breathing techniques and meditating, practices that have been shown to boost mental, physical and emotional wellbeing.  And finally, they get proper sleep and spend time in the sun, something that we all typically refer to as “vacation” nowadays.

Treating our bodies right is the first step to living a long, happy and healthy life.  We just have to be disciplined and determined.  How long do you want to live?

posts.title: If Your Partner Does Any of These 5 Things, Never Let Them Go
posts.markdown: Building a lasting, healthy relationship is never easy, but it can be made easier.  And one of the best and easiest ways to do this is to be able to recognize all of the good that your partner brings to the table. So often we get caught up in looking for the ‘ideal’ mate, which can damage our concept of love.  Most of us are simply looking for a person who we can talk to, who shares similar values in life; someone we can lean on during tough times and celebrate with during the good times.  Someone who we can lovingly build something with. If your partner does any of these five things, they’re worth holding onto: **Knowing how to deal with your anger** Anger is a natural human emotion, one that we feel regularly.  Some of us feel it more often than others and we all express it in different ways.   Having a partner who knows your anger, and how to deal with it in a healthy way, can easily be a make-or-break quality, especially for those people who have short fuses. **Your partner trusts you entirely** Trust is at the core of every successful relationship, because without it, what do you really have?  A hollow relationship that focuses on the negative instead of the positive.   Trusting your partner means knowing that he or she always has your best interests in mind, and that they will never intentionally do something to hurt you.  This means no snooping through email accounts or trying to break into phones. **Your partner believes in you** The most natural part of life is growth.  When you’re in a healthy relationship, you’re focused on growing with your partner as a couple, while also continuing your individual path of growth.  And a large part of both of these is having the unwavering support of your partner in all matters of life.   A person who keeps morale high and the spirit strong is always worth holding onto. **Respecting your friends and family** While having the acceptance and approval of friends and family members should never be 100 percent *required*, it certainly says a lot about your partner when you do have it.  Invite your partner to family gatherings and see how he or she interacts with them.   If your family and friends are visibly happy about your relationship or partner, it can only mean good things. **Your partner makes your fears and worries disappear** A good partner is a safe haven for us during times of duress, turmoil or disappointment.   They’re there to tell us that everything will be okay and show us unconditional love.  They’re the ones who tell us to drive safe during trips, who get worried when we’re not at our best–they are the lighthouses that guide us to safety as we struggle through crashing waves and the darkest of storms.   If your partner is your pillar of strength, you can be sure that he or she is a keeper.
posts.html:
Building a lasting, healthy relationship is never easy, but it can be made easier.  And one of the best and easiest ways to do this is to be able to recognize all of the good that your partner brings to the table.

So often we get caught up in looking for the ‘ideal’ mate, which can damage our concept of love.  Most of us are simply looking for a person who we can talk to, who shares similar values in life; someone we can lean on during tough times and celebrate with during the good times.  Someone who we can lovingly build something with.

If your partner does any of these five things, they’re worth holding onto:

Knowing how to deal with your anger

Anger is a natural human emotion, one that we feel regularly.  Some of us feel it more often than others and we all express it in different ways.  

Having a partner who knows your anger, and how to deal with it in a healthy way, can easily be a make-or-break quality, especially for those people who have short fuses.

Your partner trusts you entirely

Trust is at the core of every successful relationship, because without it, what do you really have?  A hollow relationship that focuses on the negative instead of the positive.  

Trusting your partner means knowing that he or she always has your best interests in mind, and that they will never intentionally do something to hurt you.  This means no snooping through email accounts or trying to break into phones.

Your partner believes in you

The most natural part of life is growth.  When you’re in a healthy relationship, you’re focused on growing with your partner as a couple, while also continuing your individual path of growth.  And a large part of both of these is having the unwavering support of your partner in all matters of life.  

A person who keeps morale high and the spirit strong is always worth holding onto.

Respecting your friends and family

While having the acceptance and approval of friends and family members should never be 100 percent required, it certainly says a lot about your partner when you do have it.  Invite your partner to family gatherings and see how he or she interacts with them.  

If your family and friends are visibly happy about your relationship or partner, it can only mean good things.

Your partner makes your fears and worries disappear

A good partner is a safe haven for us during times of duress, turmoil or disappointment.  

They’re there to tell us that everything will be okay and show us unconditional love.  They’re the ones who tell us to drive safe during trips, who get worried when we’re not at our best–they are the lighthouses that guide us to safety as we struggle through crashing waves and the darkest of storms.  

If your partner is your pillar of strength, you can be sure that he or she is a keeper.

posts.title: The Easiest Way Ever to Grow Tomato Seedlings
posts.markdown: If you’ve recently been wanting to grow your own fruits and veggies, but aren’t sure where to get started, tomato seedlings can be one of the best places to start.  And all you need are some overripe tomatoes you might have sitting in the fridge right now. While you probably don’t want to eat these overripe tomatoes, they *can* be used to grow new seedlings, and eventually new, tasty tomatoes.   The video below, created by The Wannabe Homesteader, shows exactly how we can grow tomatoes using nothing but a pot, potting soil and one tomato.  Not to mention a little bit of TLC from Mother Nature. **First,** cut your tomato up into quarter-inch thick slices.  Throw these on to a pot of compost and cover them with potting soil or more compost until the tomatoes are just barely covered.  Proceed to water the pot spontaneously over the course of 7 to 14 days.  This should yield about 50 to 60 seedlings.  Find the largest seedlings in the pot, pull them out and plant them in a separate pot using only two plants per pot.  Et voila! The **[Yale Environment 360](http://e360.yale.edu/)**organization reports that 30 to 40 percent of everything grown and raised in the United States each year is thrown away or rots in farms and kitchens.  This ends up being about 133 *billion* pounds of food.   So, before throwing out your old tomatoes, try your hand at growing some yourself.  It’s a fun little project that requires minimal effort, but yields great reward!
posts.html:
If you’ve recently been wanting to grow your own fruits and veggies, but aren’t sure where to get started, tomato seedlings can be one of the best places to start.  And all you need are some overripe tomatoes you might have sitting in the fridge right now.

While you probably don’t want to eat these overripe tomatoes, they can be used to grow new seedlings, and eventually new, tasty tomatoes.  

The video below, created by The Wannabe Homesteader, shows exactly how we can grow tomatoes using nothing but a pot, potting soil and one tomato.  Not to mention a little bit of TLC from Mother Nature.

First, cut your tomato up into quarter-inch thick slices.  Throw these on to a pot of compost and cover them with potting soil or more compost until the tomatoes are just barely covered.  Proceed to water the pot spontaneously over the course of 7 to 14 days.  This should yield about 50 to 60 seedlings.  Find the largest seedlings in the pot, pull them out and plant them in a separate pot using only two plants per pot.  Et voila!

The Yale Environment 360organization reports that 30 to 40 percent of everything grown and raised in the United States each year is thrown away or rots in farms and kitchens.  This ends up being about 133 billion pounds of food.  

So, before throwing out your old tomatoes, try your hand at growing some yourself.  It’s a fun little project that requires minimal effort, but yields great reward!

posts.title: You've Been Cleaning Your Oven Wrong This Whole Time
posts.markdown: Kitchens get dirty quick.  They’re supposed to, right?  It’s where you make all of the delicious food for yourself and friends and family.  It’s where people like to gather in anticipation, socializing and catching up while their mouths water at the thought of the feast that is to come.   Unfortunately, this also means that it’s one of the most dirtiest places in the house.  I’m looking at my stovetop area right now, and it’s not pretty.  Pieces of cooked scrambled egg are scattered here and there, oil grease from bacon and breakfast sausage coats just about every square inch of the surface, and I haven’t the slightest bit of motivation to clean it right now. But what’s even scarier is what I can’t see, and that’s inside the oven.  Ovens are notoriously tedious to clean.  You’ve got to get all up in there with your cleaner and scrubber and put in some serious work to get that thing nice and clean.  And at the end of the day, it’s the last thing you want to do. So, here’s an easy way to clean that bad boy up: Grab a bowl, a rag, some water, a spray bottle, a bit of **[baking soda](http://www.allyou.com/budget-home/live-green-save/baking-soda)**, and **[vinegar](http://www.bhg.com/homekeeping/house-cleaning/tips/cleaning-with-vinegar/)**.  These are the things you will need to get your oven looking clean and shiny. Now, remove everything from the oven, specifically the racks. Using your bowl, mix two tablespoons of baking soda into the water, so that it makes a kind of paste that should be easy to apply and spread around. Using the rag (or your hands), apply your mixture to the areas of the oven that need to be cleaned the most.  This should turn your mixture a brown color, but that’s fine.  Once you’ve applied the mixture to all of the bad spots, let it sit overnight for at least twelve hours. After you’ve done the previous step, use a wet rag to wipe down as much baking soda as you can. Fill your spray bottle with the vinegar and then spray it over the areas that you applied baking soda to. Rinse off your wet rag and continue to clean the surfaces. Put the oven racks back into the oven and then turn the oven on low for about fifteen minutes, so as to dry the inside. Finally, re-do steps one through six to clean the window area, except let it sit for about half an hour instead of twelve hours before you start wiping everything down. And voila!  You’ve got a relatively easy, safe and effective new way to clean that nasty oven.  And you didn’t have to slave away into the wee hours of the morning to do it.
posts.html:
Kitchens get dirty quick.  They’re supposed to, right?  It’s where you make all of the delicious food for yourself and friends and family.  It’s where people like to gather in anticipation, socializing and catching up while their mouths water at the thought of the feast that is to come.  

Unfortunately, this also means that it’s one of the most dirtiest places in the house.  I’m looking at my stovetop area right now, and it’s not pretty.  Pieces of cooked scrambled egg are scattered here and there, oil grease from bacon and breakfast sausage coats just about every square inch of the surface, and I haven’t the slightest bit of motivation to clean it right now.

But what’s even scarier is what I can’t see, and that’s inside the oven.  Ovens are notoriously tedious to clean.  You’ve got to get all up in there with your cleaner and scrubber and put in some serious work to get that thing nice and clean.  And at the end of the day, it’s the last thing you want to do.

So, here’s an easy way to clean that bad boy up:

Grab a bowl, a rag, some water, a spray bottle, a bit of baking soda, and vinegar.  These are the things you will need to get your oven looking clean and shiny.

Now, remove everything from the oven, specifically the racks.

Using your bowl, mix two tablespoons of baking soda into the water, so that it makes a kind of paste that should be easy to apply and spread around.

Using the rag (or your hands), apply your mixture to the areas of the oven that need to be cleaned the most.  This should turn your mixture a brown color, but that’s fine.  Once you’ve applied the mixture to all of the bad spots, let it sit overnight for at least twelve hours.

After you’ve done the previous step, use a wet rag to wipe down as much baking soda as you can.

Fill your spray bottle with the vinegar and then spray it over the areas that you applied baking soda to.

Rinse off your wet rag and continue to clean the surfaces.

Put the oven racks back into the oven and then turn the oven on low for about fifteen minutes, so as to dry the inside.

Finally, re-do steps one through six to clean the window area, except let it sit for about half an hour instead of twelve hours before you start wiping everything down.

And voila!  You’ve got a relatively easy, safe and effective new way to clean that nasty oven.  And you didn’t have to slave away into the wee hours of the morning to do it.

posts.title: Los Angeles is Turning Old Motels Into 500 Apartments for Homeless Vets
posts.markdown: If you’ve been to Los Angeles in the past five years or so, then you know just how much of a homeless problem the city has.  What’s even worse is that so many of these homeless folks are veterans who once served our country. In an effort to house these homeless veterans, the City of Los Angeles has a new plan to renovate old motels and hospitals, turning them into 500 new apartments for homeless veterans. How will it work?  First, developers purchase the rundown properties and build them into the efficiency apartments discussed above.  Then, homeless veterans will use vouchers, gained from the **[Department of Veteran Affairs](http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-motel-homeless-conversions-20160527-snap-story.html)**, to pay for their rent. The vouchers given to the homeless vets expire after 15 years, and the deal is set up so that landlords will earn a profit as well.  Not to mention, residents of these abodes are eligible for supportive services like case management and counseling. This is easily recognizable as a step in the right direction after learning, from the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority, that there were **[2,733 homeless veterans](https://documents.lahsa.org/Planning/homelesscount/2015/factsheet/LACity.pdf)** on any given night in the city last year. “Instead of allowing blighted properties to decay, let’s use them to make powerful change in our communities by giving our veterans the access to services and housing that they need and deserve,” Mayor Eric Garcetti said in a statement. The announcement of this new plan to help homeless veterans comes after the city failed to deliver on its promise to **[end veteran homelessness by the end of last year](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/steve-peck/why-garcettis-missed-dead_b_8074200.html)**.
posts.html:
If you’ve been to Los Angeles in the past five years or so, then you know just how much of a homeless problem the city has.  What’s even worse is that so many of these homeless folks are veterans who once served our country.

In an effort to house these homeless veterans, the City of Los Angeles has a new plan to renovate old motels and hospitals, turning them into 500 new apartments for homeless veterans.

How will it work?  First, developers purchase the rundown properties and build them into the efficiency apartments discussed above.  Then, homeless veterans will use vouchers, gained from the Department of Veteran Affairs, to pay for their rent.

The vouchers given to the homeless vets expire after 15 years, and the deal is set up so that landlords will earn a profit as well.  Not to mention, residents of these abodes are eligible for supportive services like case management and counseling.

This is easily recognizable as a step in the right direction after learning, from the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority, that there were 2,733 homeless veterans on any given night in the city last year.

“Instead of allowing blighted properties to decay, let’s use them to make powerful change in our communities by giving our veterans the access to services and housing that they need and deserve,” Mayor Eric Garcetti said in a statement.

The announcement of this new plan to help homeless veterans comes after the city failed to deliver on its promise to end veteran homelessness by the end of last year.

posts.title: 5 Things to Remember When Life Gets Rough
posts.markdown: If life is a series of ups and downs like everyone says it is, sometimes life has an odd way of showing it.  I know many of us are probably wondering when the ‘ups’ are going to show up and get rid of all the downs.  Life isn’t always easy.  And no one told you it was going to be.  The only thing anyone can promise is that it will be worth it. So remember these five things when life starts throwing shade your way: **Where you are right now is exactly where you should be** Being stuck in a crappy place is no fun, so much so that we will often try to avoid the reality of our situation.  We shouldn’t be here, we don’t want to be here.  But understanding that this is but one step along your path will allow you to live in the moment, happy, present and aware.   Being here now is what will get you to tomorrow. **Your attitude makes all the difference** Having a terrible attitude about your already terrible situation only compounds how terrible things really are.  Remember that you can always change your mindset or perspective on things, and doing so will help you radiate positivity.   If you want a positive life, you can’t build it with a negative attitude. **Each person’s path is unique to them** If you get caught up comparing your life to those of the people around you, try to ditch this habit immediately.  Comparing yourself to anyone is pointless.  Each person’s journey through this life is entirely unique to them. The only person you should be comparing yourself to is yourself, the person you were yesterday.  Try to be better than that person, no one else. **You must be kind to yourself** We’re always our own worst critic.  Sometimes what we do is never good enough for ourselves.  But speaking hurtful words about yourself does nothing to benefit you.  Try to give yourself the same leniency that you’d give your friends and family members.   You’re trying, you’re doing your best, and know that it’s enough. **Practicing gratitude can only benefit you** Ungrateful people will always be able to find trouble or duress in their life, regardless of how peaceful or perfect they are.  But grateful people are able to find peace during the most troubling times.   Remember that there is always something to be grateful for, and looking for things to stay positive about during negative times shows leadership and strength.
posts.html:
If life is a series of ups and downs like everyone says it is, sometimes life has an odd way of showing it.  I know many of us are probably wondering when the ‘ups’ are going to show up and get rid of all the downs.  Life isn’t always easy.  And no one told you it was going to be.  The only thing anyone can promise is that it will be worth it.

So remember these five things when life starts throwing shade your way:

Where you are right now is exactly where you should be

Being stuck in a crappy place is no fun, so much so that we will often try to avoid the reality of our situation.  We shouldn’t be here, we don’t want to be here.  But understanding that this is but one step along your path will allow you to live in the moment, happy, present and aware.  

Being here now is what will get you to tomorrow.

Your attitude makes all the difference

Having a terrible attitude about your already terrible situation only compounds how terrible things really are.  Remember that you can always change your mindset or perspective on things, and doing so will help you radiate positivity.  

If you want a positive life, you can’t build it with a negative attitude.

Each person’s path is unique to them

If you get caught up comparing your life to those of the people around you, try to ditch this habit immediately.  Comparing yourself to anyone is pointless.  Each person’s journey through this life is entirely unique to them.

The only person you should be comparing yourself to is yourself, the person you were yesterday.  Try to be better than that person, no one else.

You must be kind to yourself

We’re always our own worst critic.  Sometimes what we do is never good enough for ourselves.  But speaking hurtful words about yourself does nothing to benefit you.  Try to give yourself the same leniency that you’d give your friends and family members.  

You’re trying, you’re doing your best, and know that it’s enough.

Practicing gratitude can only benefit you

Ungrateful people will always be able to find trouble or duress in their life, regardless of how peaceful or perfect they are.  But grateful people are able to find peace during the most troubling times.  

Remember that there is always something to be grateful for, and looking for things to stay positive about during negative times shows leadership and strength.

posts.title: You Won't Beleive What Apple Cider Vinegar Does To Your Face
posts.markdown: You don’t really hear much about the benefits that **[apple cider vinegar](http://authoritynutrition.com/6-proven-health-benefits-of-apple-cider-vinegar/)** provides for your skin.  It costs less than practically every other face product on the market, yet still offers the same positive effects.  It combats acne and reduces the appearance of age spots. **[Alpha hydroxy acids](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpha_hydroxy_acid)**are one of the active molecules found in apple cider vinegar, which help to remove dead skin cells.  These acids can be found in the expensive face products, but the apple cider vinegar holds much more of its content. If you’re looking to use it for age spots, just grab a cotton ball and apply a small amount of diluted apple cider vinegar to it.  Then dab the spots with the cotton ball, leaving the substance on your face for about 20-30 minutes before rinsing it off. The acidic nature of apple cider vinegar provides natural antibacterial and antifungal properties, helping heal and prevent acne and skin infections.  It unclogs the pores, helping your skin to breathe, which in turn keeps pimples from forming.  Furthermore, it balances the pH balance of your skin, giving it a nice balance between oily and dry. Apple cider vinegar is a strong solution and it can damage your skin, so it’s important to dilute it before applying it to your person.  **You can always make your own face wash using this method:** **Ingredients – **1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar + 3 tablespoons of water **How to prepare – **Using a small bowl, mix one tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with 3 tablespoons of water.  After you wet your face with water, rub the combination all over your skin using a cotton ball.  Your best option is organic apple cider vinegar, as this type includes the natural enzymes, bacteria and minerals that provide the positive effects. (h/t [**My Life Style**](http://www.myilifestyle.com/what-happens-to-your-face-after-washing-it-with-apple-cider-vinegar-this-will-surprise-you/))
posts.html:
You don’t really hear much about the benefits that apple cider vinegar provides for your skin.  It costs less than practically every other face product on the market, yet still offers the same positive effects.  It combats acne and reduces the appearance of age spots.

Alpha hydroxy acidsare one of the active molecules found in apple cider vinegar, which help to remove dead skin cells.  These acids can be found in the expensive face products, but the apple cider vinegar holds much more of its content.

If you’re looking to use it for age spots, just grab a cotton ball and apply a small amount of diluted apple cider vinegar to it.  Then dab the spots with the cotton ball, leaving the substance on your face for about 20-30 minutes before rinsing it off.

The acidic nature of apple cider vinegar provides natural antibacterial and antifungal properties, helping heal and prevent acne and skin infections.  It unclogs the pores, helping your skin to breathe, which in turn keeps pimples from forming.  Furthermore, it balances the pH balance of your skin, giving it a nice balance between oily and dry.

Apple cider vinegar is a strong solution and it can damage your skin, so it’s important to dilute it before applying it to your person.  You can always make your own face wash using this method:

*Ingredients – *1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar + 3 tablespoons of water

*How to prepare – *Using a small bowl, mix one tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with 3 tablespoons of water.  After you wet your face with water, rub the combination all over your skin using a cotton ball.  Your best option is organic apple cider vinegar, as this type includes the natural enzymes, bacteria and minerals that provide the positive effects.

(h/t My Life Style)

posts.title: Research Says: Women Need More Sleep Than Men Because of Their Complex Brains
posts.markdown: Getting to sleep in is one of the greatest joys in this world.  Waking up, knowing that you can start your day whenever you please is an indulgence that I take as often as I can, and I actually get to do it fairly often.   My girlfriend on the other hand, not so much.  Her new job requires her to be up and alert in the early hours of the morning, and science is saying that**[she should be the one sleeping in, not me](http://dukemagazine.duke.edu/issues/050608/depgaz15.html)**. “In fact, women need 20 minutes more shut-eye than the average man.” writes study authors. “And that’s down to a woman’s busy, multi-tasking brain.” **[Professor Jim Horne](http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-1246029/Who-REALLY-needs-sleep--men-women-One-Britains-leading-sleep-experts-says-answer.html)**, director of the Sleep Research Center at Loughborough University and author of *Sleepfaring: A Journey Through The Science of Sleep*, says: “The more of your brain you use during the day, the more of it that needs to recover and, consequently, the more sleep you need. Women tend to multi-task — they do lots at once and are flexible — and so they use more of their actual brain than men do. Because of that, their sleep need is greater. A man who has a complex job that involves a lot of decision-making and lateral thinking may also need more sleep than the average male — though probably still not as much as a woman.” So, whether you’re shaking your head in disbelief, or nodding your head in agreement (as you’ve known for years that women’s brains are highly complex and nearly impossible to figure out) it would appear that women do, on average, need about 20 more minutes of sleep than men. “This is because women’s brains are wired differently from men’s and are more complex, so their sleep need will be slightly greater. The average is 20 minutes more, but some women may need slightly more or less than this.” On the other hand, however, another study looking at 210 middle-aged men and women discovered that **[women suffered greater health issues from lack of sleep than men did](http://dukemagazine.duke.edu/issues/050608/depgaz15.html).** “We found that for women, poor sleep is strongly associated with high levels of psychological distress and greater feelings of hostility, depression, and anger. In contrast, these feelings were not associated with the same degree of sleep disruption in men.” So guys, if you want a happy, healthy girlfriend or wife, make sure they’re getting the sleep they need to keep those high-functioning, complex brains of theirs well rested.
posts.html:
Getting to sleep in is one of the greatest joys in this world.  Waking up, knowing that you can start your day whenever you please is an indulgence that I take as often as I can, and I actually get to do it fairly often.  

My girlfriend on the other hand, not so much.  Her new job requires her to be up and alert in the early hours of the morning, and science is saying thatshe should be the one sleeping in, not me.

“In fact, women need 20 minutes more shut-eye than the average man.” writes study authors. “And that’s down to a woman’s busy, multi-tasking brain.”

Professor Jim Horne, director of the Sleep Research Center at Loughborough University and author of Sleepfaring: A Journey Through The Science of Sleep, says:

“The more of your brain you use during the day, the more of it that needs to recover and, consequently, the more sleep you need. Women tend to multi-task — they do lots at once and are flexible — and so they use more of their actual brain than men do. Because of that, their sleep need is greater.

A man who has a complex job that involves a lot of decision-making and lateral thinking may also need more sleep than the average male — though probably still not as much as a woman.”

So, whether you’re shaking your head in disbelief, or nodding your head in agreement (as you’ve known for years that women’s brains are highly complex and nearly impossible to figure out) it would appear that women do, on average, need about 20 more minutes of sleep than men.

“This is because women’s brains are wired differently from men’s and are more complex, so their sleep need will be slightly greater. The average is 20 minutes more, but some women may need slightly more or less than this.”

On the other hand, however, another study looking at 210 middle-aged men and women discovered that women suffered greater health issues from lack of sleep than men did.

“We found that for women, poor sleep is strongly associated with high levels of psychological distress and greater feelings of hostility, depression, and anger. In contrast, these feelings were not associated with the same degree of sleep disruption in men.”

So guys, if you want a happy, healthy girlfriend or wife, make sure they’re getting the sleep they need to keep those high-functioning, complex brains of theirs well rested.

posts.title: 5 Ways to Tell You're Being Emotionally Abused in Your Relationship
posts.markdown: Emotional abuse and manipulation happens more often than you might think.  The worst part is that sometimes you don’t even realize that it’s happening, which is what makes it so toxic.  A person who is good at it will make you miserable and confused as to why. The best things a person can do to make sure they don’t fall prey to one of these psychopaths is to learn how to spot manipulative and abusive behavior.  If any of these five signs of emotional abuse are shockingly familiar, there’s a good chance you need to end your relationship: **Their criticism, judgment, and jokes at your expense are constant** Being teased and being humiliated are two very different things.  So, if your partner has a habit of degrading you in your home and out in public, but then denies any wrongdoing after you call them out on it, you’re being emotionally abused.  Don’t let them invalidate your emotions, just leave. **You’re left feeling guilty all the time** Constantly feeling guilty and not being sure why is a good sign that your partner is making you feel this way on purpose.   If everything that goes wrong is always your fault, or they never take responsibility for their behavior or words, or if they make you feel guilty for spending time with others, your partner is using guilt to emotionally abuse you. **Their bad moods are your fault, all the time** People who enjoy emotionally abusing others are very moody, and all of their bad ones are because of you.  If your partner’s bad days are always your fault, you’re being abused.  Your partner should never hold you accountable for their own problems or troubles in life.   They only do this because they don’t want to take responsibility for where they are in life. **They’re incredibly jealous** Jealousy is a natural part of most relationships.  However, some types of jealousy are heavier than others.  If you’re flirting with another person in front of them, sure they’re probably going to get mad.  But having your partner blow up on you for something small, like a ‘like’ on a social media photo, is unacceptable. **They cheat on you or threaten to do so** What constitutes cheating is different for every couple, but it should be noted that infidelity, and the threat of infidelity, are forms of emotional abuse.  And some people use these terrible behaviors to control you and punish you. Don’t let someone dictate the direction of your relationship using a person outside of the relationship. If you need help getting out of an abusive relationship and don’t know where to start, call the **[National Domestic Violence Hotline](http://www.thehotline.org/)** at 1-800-799-7233.  Know that you are not alone and people want to help you. h/t [**Bustle**](http://www.bustle.com/articles/96624-9-signs-youre-being-emotionally-abused-in-your-relationship-because-love-shouldnt-feel-manipulative)
posts.html:
Emotional abuse and manipulation happens more often than you might think.  The worst part is that sometimes you don’t even realize that it’s happening, which is what makes it so toxic.  A person who is good at it will make you miserable and confused as to why.

The best things a person can do to make sure they don’t fall prey to one of these psychopaths is to learn how to spot manipulative and abusive behavior. 

If any of these five signs of emotional abuse are shockingly familiar, there’s a good chance you need to end your relationship:

Their criticism, judgment, and jokes at your expense are constant

Being teased and being humiliated are two very different things.  So, if your partner has a habit of degrading you in your home and out in public, but then denies any wrongdoing after you call them out on it, you’re being emotionally abused.  Don’t let them invalidate your emotions, just leave.

You’re left feeling guilty all the time

Constantly feeling guilty and not being sure why is a good sign that your partner is making you feel this way on purpose.  

If everything that goes wrong is always your fault, or they never take responsibility for their behavior or words, or if they make you feel guilty for spending time with others, your partner is using guilt to emotionally abuse you.

Their bad moods are your fault, all the time

People who enjoy emotionally abusing others are very moody, and all of their bad ones are because of you.  If your partner’s bad days are always your fault, you’re being abused.  Your partner should never hold you accountable for their own problems or troubles in life.  

They only do this because they don’t want to take responsibility for where they are in life.

They’re incredibly jealous

Jealousy is a natural part of most relationships.  However, some types of jealousy are heavier than others.  If you’re flirting with another person in front of them, sure they’re probably going to get mad.  But having your partner blow up on you for something small, like a ‘like’ on a social media photo, is unacceptable.

They cheat on you or threaten to do so

What constitutes cheating is different for every couple, but it should be noted that infidelity, and the threat of infidelity, are forms of emotional abuse.  And some people use these terrible behaviors to control you and punish you.

Don’t let someone dictate the direction of your relationship using a person outside of the relationship.

If you need help getting out of an abusive relationship and don’t know where to start, call the National Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-799-7233.  Know that you are not alone and people want to help you.

h/t Bustle

posts.title: 5 Ways To Figure Out Your True Purpose In Life
posts.markdown: As humans, one thing that comes naturally to us is the desire to produce, create, or design.  We see our work (and other services that we do) as reflections of ourselves.  We thrive on positive feedback and enjoy doing things that other people love or get excited about. Which means that when we can’t find something to be passionate about, or are lacking positive feedback on the work that we’re doing, we suffer in many ways. But, we can change our perspective and take full responsibility for our lives.  You can only understand your purpose in life once you genuinely understand who you are as a person. And here are five ways to help you get started on this journey: **List out your positive natural skills and abilities** Maybe you’re at your best when painting or writing, maybe you excel at helping and healing others, maybe you’re at your best when you’re pushing your body physically–whatever it is, figure out what you’re good at, even if you can’t transform it into a career immediately. **List out your natural interests or hobbies** For me, I’d put down things like: running, hiking, mountain biking, writing, etc.  For you it might be reading books for hours on end, or managing social media connections, or solving difficult problems using math and code.   Your natural interests say a lot about who you are and they’re important to know, because once you piece them all together, you can really start to solve the puzzle. **See if anything from the first two overlap** Living your dream life requires a few things: interest, ability, dedication and motivation.  Toss out any one of these and you are not likely to achieve it.  There’s always chance and luck, but they’re too fickle to focus on.   Focus on the things you can control: what do you want, can you do it well, and how are you going to make a living doing it. **How do you want to be remembered when you leave this world?** Death is the great equalizer for all of mankind.  So, when your final moments are upon you, do you want your loved ones to remember you for your accomplished career or how often you spent time with family and friends?  Maybe you want them to remember how kind and generous you were, or maybe you don’t want to be remembered at all. All of these things can help you figure out what you’re ‘meant’ to do in life. **Think about things you wouldn’t mind doing every single day if you had to** Think about your version of a perfect life real quick.  What would you love to spend your time doing every day if you had the choice to do *anything*.  Without taking into consideration status, titles, accolades or achievements, how would you live your life?   Try not to be concerned with how your life looks to others, if this is your focus then you are not living for yourself. h/t [**Bustle**](http://www.bustle.com/articles/107298-9-ways-to-figure-out-what-youre-meant-to-do)
posts.html:
As humans, one thing that comes naturally to us is the desire to produce, create, or design.  We see our work (and other services that we do) as reflections of ourselves.  We thrive on positive feedback and enjoy doing things that other people love or get excited about.

Which means that when we can’t find something to be passionate about, or are lacking positive feedback on the work that we’re doing, we suffer in many ways.

But, we can change our perspective and take full responsibility for our lives.  You can only understand your purpose in life once you genuinely understand who you are as a person.

And here are five ways to help you get started on this journey:

List out your positive natural skills and abilities

Maybe you’re at your best when painting or writing, maybe you excel at helping and healing others, maybe you’re at your best when you’re pushing your body physically–whatever it is, figure out what you’re good at, even if you can’t transform it into a career immediately.

List out your natural interests or hobbies

For me, I’d put down things like: running, hiking, mountain biking, writing, etc.  For you it might be reading books for hours on end, or managing social media connections, or solving difficult problems using math and code.  

Your natural interests say a lot about who you are and they’re important to know, because once you piece them all together, you can really start to solve the puzzle.

See if anything from the first two overlap

Living your dream life requires a few things: interest, ability, dedication and motivation.  Toss out any one of these and you are not likely to achieve it.  There’s always chance and luck, but they’re too fickle to focus on.  

Focus on the things you can control: what do you want, can you do it well, and how are you going to make a living doing it.

How do you want to be remembered when you leave this world?

Death is the great equalizer for all of mankind.  So, when your final moments are upon you, do you want your loved ones to remember you for your accomplished career or how often you spent time with family and friends?  Maybe you want them to remember how kind and generous you were, or maybe you don’t want to be remembered at all.

All of these things can help you figure out what you’re ‘meant’ to do in life.

Think about things you wouldn’t mind doing every single day if you had to

Think about your version of a perfect life real quick.  What would you love to spend your time doing every day if you had the choice to do anything.  Without taking into consideration status, titles, accolades or achievements, how would you live your life?  

Try not to be concerned with how your life looks to others, if this is your focus then you are not living for yourself.

h/t Bustle

posts.title: How to Make 100% Homemade Real Fruit Rollups
posts.markdown: As more and more evidence surfaces that processed sugars are absolutely terrible for the human body, people are starting to look for natural alternatives to their favorite snacks and foods.  Fruit Rollups are one such food that are quite popular with both adults and children, but that also contain corn syrup and different acetates and several food colorings; all things that we want to avoid when consuming sugar. Naturally occurring sugars, like the ones that are found in fruits and vegetables, are what the body really wants.  Many of us have cravings for sweets, which is fine, as long as they’re low in sugar and carbs, right? The ingredients used in the following recipe for homemade fruit rollups are as follows: organic fresh, dried and frozen fruits.  That’s what we like to see. **The Recipe – 100% Fruit Rollups via [Green Kitchen Stories](http://www.greenkitchenstories.com/fruit-rolls/)** Pick whichever fruits you would like, fresh, frozen or dried.  Try out some of the recommended combinations below and also experiment with some that you think would be tasty.  Easy to make and quick to set, these will quickly become a household favorite. - ****Mix the fruit.. **Into a puree.  Place your fruits into a pot on the stove to warm them and then mix them until they’re in a puree form. If you don’t want seeds in the rollups, use a sieve to remove them.** - **Spread your puree.. **Onto a baking mat or parchment paper that has been covered with an oil-based cooking spray (if you don’t coat them with some sort of non-stick, they still get stuck and be incredibly hard to remove).  Use one and a half cups of fruit puree and spread it onto the sheet.  Place in the oven at 140 degrees Fahrenheit (or the lowest heat setting possible).  Prop open the oven door just a tad to let moisture escape. - **They’re done.. **When the puree on the sheet isn’t sticky.  This typically takes anywhere from 5 to 8 hours depending on the oven and the types of fruits you used. - **Cut them with.. **A sharp pizza cutter or knife and then roll them up in the wax or parchment paper while they’re still fairly warm. - **Enjoy!** **Combo Ideas:** **Yellow – **Juice from 1 freshly squeezed orange, 200g of dried apricots, and 1 fresh mango **Purple – **Frozen blackberries, raspberries and 1 banana (typically a lot of seeds, use blueberries instead if you don’t want the seeds) **Green – **Kiwi, mango and mint leaves **Blue – **Grape juice and blueberries **Red – **The classic! Strawberries and bananas, yum. ![](http://www.loveumadly.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/fruit-roll-up1-1024x680.jpg "fruit roll-up") ![](http://www.loveumadly.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/fruit-roll-up-2-680x1024.jpg "fruit roll-up 2") ![](http://www.loveumadly.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/fruit-roll-up-3-1024x680.jpg "fruit roll-up 3")               ![](http://www.loveumadly.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/fruit-roll-up-8-1024x680.jpg "fruit roll-up 8")
posts.html:
As more and more evidence surfaces that processed sugars are absolutely terrible for the human body, people are starting to look for natural alternatives to their favorite snacks and foods.  Fruit Rollups are one such food that are quite popular with both adults and children, but that also contain corn syrup and different acetates and several food colorings; all things that we want to avoid when consuming sugar.

Naturally occurring sugars, like the ones that are found in fruits and vegetables, are what the body really wants.  Many of us have cravings for sweets, which is fine, as long as they’re low in sugar and carbs, right?

The ingredients used in the following recipe for homemade fruit rollups are as follows: organic fresh, dried and frozen fruits.  That’s what we like to see.

The Recipe – 100% Fruit Rollups via Green Kitchen Stories

Pick whichever fruits you would like, fresh, frozen or dried.  Try out some of the recommended combinations below and also experiment with some that you think would be tasty.  Easy to make and quick to set, these will quickly become a household favorite.

  • *Mix the fruit.. *Into a puree.  Place your fruits into a pot on the stove to warm them and then mix them until they’re in a puree form. If you don’t want seeds in the rollups, use a sieve to remove them.

  • *Spread your puree.. *Onto a baking mat or parchment paper that has been covered with an oil-based cooking spray (if you don’t coat them with some sort of non-stick, they still get stuck and be incredibly hard to remove).  Use one and a half cups of fruit puree and spread it onto the sheet.  Place in the oven at 140 degrees Fahrenheit (or the lowest heat setting possible).  Prop open the oven door just a tad to let moisture escape.

  • *They’re done.. *When the puree on the sheet isn’t sticky.  This typically takes anywhere from 5 to 8 hours depending on the oven and the types of fruits you used.

  • *Cut them with.. *A sharp pizza cutter or knife and then roll them up in the wax or parchment paper while they’re still fairly warm.

  • Enjoy!

Combo Ideas:

*Yellow – *Juice from 1 freshly squeezed orange, 200g of dried apricots, and 1 fresh mango

*Purple – *Frozen blackberries, raspberries and 1 banana (typically a lot of seeds, use blueberries instead if you don’t want the seeds)

*Green – *Kiwi, mango and mint leaves

*Blue – *Grape juice and blueberries

*Red – *The classic! Strawberries and bananas, yum.

posts.title: Learn the Dark Side of Each Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: You often read about all of the different positive characteristics that are associated with your Zodiac sign, but there is a less often mentioned dark side as well.  Read below to find out what yours is: **Aries** You guys are the most impulsive and impatient sign in the Zodiac.  If things aren’t happening quickly, you’re over it.  You can also be very immature, as the youngest sign, and if an idea isn’t yours, you don’t really care about it. **Taurus** The Taurus’ dark side comes in the form of materialism, stubbornness, and laziness.  They don’t like to share, are impossible to argue with and can be self-indulgent. **Gemini** Gemini are the folks with an intense love for life–so much so that it can be a bad thing sometimes.  They have multiple different personalities, meaning they are enigmatic at times.  They love to talk. And talk and talk.  And they interests are so diverse that they struggle to focus on any one thing. **Cancer** Just like the crab, Cancer are incredibly moody people.  They don’t enjoy going out of their comfort zone and can be incredibly sensitive at times.  Chin up, Cancer, it’s not that bad. **Leo** A lesson in vanity and ego.  The Leo thinks they are the most beautiful in all the land, and they’ve got the charm to go with it.  Careful when you’re around them; they’ll smooth talk you into doing things you’ve never even thought of before.  Also, they think they’re the center of the universe. **Virgo** The Virgo is the highly judgmental and pessimistic perfectionist.  Their keen sense for attention to detail keeps them busy in a world full of imperfection.  And they can be drama queens when things aren’t going their way. **Libra** Don’t hold your breath for the Libra–they like to take their sweet time weighing each and every option before committing to anything.  They’re fascinated with pretty things, which is why they spend so much time getting ready before doing anything. **Scorpio** The Scorpio can hold a grudge like no one’s business.  They will make you regret ever wronging them.  They’re master manipulators, pulling strings here and there to get what they want.  And, they enjoy brooding over the sorrowful things in life. **Sagittarius** Being honest is good to a point, but the Sagittarians often take it too far.  They don’t like to sugarcoat things, meaning they’re blunt and straight to the point, even when they shouldn’t be.  They like to think they know everything and they crave excitement, growing bored quickly with old things. **Capricorn** The Capricorn gets lost in their obsession with control.  Living life in the moment is not possible for them.  They can be manipulative in using others for their own needs and they feed off of negative energy. **Aquarius** While the Aquarius likes to think that they stand from a point of objectiveness and logic, they’re often some of the most judgmental people.  As such, they’re quick to give (what they think is) objective and logical advice, even if they don’t fully understand the situation. **Pisces** Opposite the Capricorn, the Pisces has so much “live in the moment” attitude that their lives often lack direction.  Sometimes they can be space cadets, failing to notice the happenings that surround them.  This often leaves them gullible, even if they’re supposedly the oldest and wisest of all the signs. h/t [**Mind Journal**](http://themindsjournal.com/dark-side/)
posts.html:
You often read about all of the different positive characteristics that are associated with your Zodiac sign, but there is a less often mentioned dark side as well.  Read below to find out what yours is:

Aries

You guys are the most impulsive and impatient sign in the Zodiac.  If things aren’t happening quickly, you’re over it.  You can also be very immature, as the youngest sign, and if an idea isn’t yours, you don’t really care about it.

Taurus

The Taurus’ dark side comes in the form of materialism, stubbornness, and laziness.  They don’t like to share, are impossible to argue with and can be self-indulgent.

Gemini

Gemini are the folks with an intense love for life–so much so that it can be a bad thing sometimes.  They have multiple different personalities, meaning they are enigmatic at times.  They love to talk. And talk and talk.  And they interests are so diverse that they struggle to focus on any one thing.

Cancer

Just like the crab, Cancer are incredibly moody people.  They don’t enjoy going out of their comfort zone and can be incredibly sensitive at times.  Chin up, Cancer, it’s not that bad.

Leo

A lesson in vanity and ego.  The Leo thinks they are the most beautiful in all the land, and they’ve got the charm to go with it.  Careful when you’re around them; they’ll smooth talk you into doing things you’ve never even thought of before.  Also, they think they’re the center of the universe.

Virgo

The Virgo is the highly judgmental and pessimistic perfectionist.  Their keen sense for attention to detail keeps them busy in a world full of imperfection.  And they can be drama queens when things aren’t going their way.

Libra

Don’t hold your breath for the Libra–they like to take their sweet time weighing each and every option before committing to anything.  They’re fascinated with pretty things, which is why they spend so much time getting ready before doing anything.

Scorpio

The Scorpio can hold a grudge like no one’s business.  They will make you regret ever wronging them.  They’re master manipulators, pulling strings here and there to get what they want.  And, they enjoy brooding over the sorrowful things in life.

Sagittarius

Being honest is good to a point, but the Sagittarians often take it too far.  They don’t like to sugarcoat things, meaning they’re blunt and straight to the point, even when they shouldn’t be.  They like to think they know everything and they crave excitement, growing bored quickly with old things.

Capricorn

The Capricorn gets lost in their obsession with control.  Living life in the moment is not possible for them.  They can be manipulative in using others for their own needs and they feed off of negative energy.

Aquarius

While the Aquarius likes to think that they stand from a point of objectiveness and logic, they’re often some of the most judgmental people.  As such, they’re quick to give (what they think is) objective and logical advice, even if they don’t fully understand the situation.

Pisces

Opposite the Capricorn, the Pisces has so much “live in the moment” attitude that their lives often lack direction.  Sometimes they can be space cadets, failing to notice the happenings that surround them.  This often leaves them gullible, even if they’re supposedly the oldest and wisest of all the signs.

h/t Mind Journal

posts.title: This Is What Happens To Your Body When You Stop Eating Sugar
posts.markdown: Sugar has been a pretty hot topic in popular culture as the United States continues to be one of the most overweight and unhealthy countries in the world.  The **[National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/Pages/default.aspx)** reports that more than two in three adults are considered to be overweight or obese, more than one in three adults are considered to be obese, and about one out of every twenty adults are considered to have extreme obesity. I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  **[Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems](http://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/health-statistics/Pages/overweight-obesity-statistics.aspx)**, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from **[15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories](http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/sugary-drinks-fact-sheet/)**.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it. **Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:** **You gain energy – **The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content. **Your weight stabilizes – **If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance. **You reduce your risk for chronic illness – ****[Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses](http://www.diabetes.org/)** that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life. **You’ll start disliking sugar – **Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake. h/t[** Top Health News**](http://tophealthnews.net/see-what-happens-to-your-body-when-you-quit-sugar/)
posts.html:
Sugar has been a pretty hot topic in popular culture as the United States continues to be one of the most overweight and unhealthy countries in the world.  The National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases reports that more than two in three adults are considered to be overweight or obese, more than one in three adults are considered to be obese, and about one out of every twenty adults are considered to have extreme obesity.

I hope everyone recognizes this as a problem.  Two-thirds of our population is at risk for major health problems, and we’ve all but identified the major culprits.  The main one is sugar.  Consumption of high-sugar content drinks and beverages is a major contributor to the obesity epidemic.  Your average 20-ounce soda has anywhere from 15 to 18 teaspoons of sugar in it, and around 240 calories.  It’s basically liquid candy, except you don’t feel as “full” after drinking it.

Here are four things that happen to your body when you quit sugar:

*You gain energy – *The more sugar you consume, the more inhibited your body’s ability to sustain energy at maximum levels becomes.  When this happens, our blood sugar levels become imbalanced.  Compared to a person who consumes sugar regularly, those who do not consume sugar benefit from improved ability to generate and store energy.  These people tend to eat foods that are high in energy content, but low in sugar content.

*Your weight stabilizes – *If you’re consuming sugar on a regular basis, you’re going to gain weight and there’s no getting around it.  Especially in grown adults, sugar has been seen as directly correlated with extreme weight gain and increased risk of chronic illness.  You often hear of “beer bellies” because, well, they’re actually a thing.  Beer contains a high amount of sugar, which causes fat to build up around our tummy area.  When we quit sugar, our bodies equalize and find a natural balance.

You reduce your risk for chronic illness – *Diabetes is one of the most common chronic illnesses* that is associated with obesity and unhealthy weight.  It’s main contributor is, unsurprisingly, sugar.  What’s even worse is that Diabetes can serve as a form of gateway illness, opening up the floodgates for other chronic illnesses that are at their strongest when the immune system is weak.  Quitting sugar entirely gives one the opportunity to live a chronic-illness-free life.

*You’ll start disliking sugar – *Sugar is just like any other chemical in that when you abuse it, your body becomes addicted to it.  Alcohol, tobacco, methamphetamines, uppers, downers, you name it, if you consume them in large quantities and often, your body will crave it.  While just the opposite is true as well: if you stop consuming something altogether, your craving for that substance disappears.  So, do yourself a favor and quit sugar today, or at least limit your intake.

h/t* Top Health News*

posts.title: 5 Signs You're a Highly Sensitive Individual
posts.markdown: There are those of us who simply cannot control our emotions as well as we would like to.  We’re the ones who cry when we see other people cry, simply because they’re sad and we think it’s sad that they’re sad and we don’t want them to be sad.   Highly sensitive people are often referred to as empaths.  Those who are more sensitive than your average person, those who feel *more*.  And science shows that about 15 to 20 percent of people have a gene that makes them more sensitive than others. If this sounds kind of like you, here are more signs that you’re a highly sensitive person: **Other people’s moods affect you more than they probably should** The highly sensitive person is incredibly attuned to the various different emotions, meaning they can easily sense them in others.  If you can tell exactly what kind of mood a person is in without them having to say a word, you’re likely an empath.   Empaths literally *feel* other people’s emotions, which can be harmful if you don’t know how to shield yourself from negative emotions. **Your observation skills are finely tuned** A highly sensitive person is also highly aware of the things that are happening around them.  Subtle things like tone of voice, slight facial expressions or cues, and tiny gestures provide you with a wealth of information about the setting you currently find yourself in. **You need your alone time** Highly sensitive people are constantly needing to shield and protect themselves from the various different energies and emotions surrounding them at any given time, which is exhausting. After social gatherings or extended periods of time without being alone, they’re likely to need a bit of downtime to recuperate and recharge. **You have an uncanny ability to anticipate the things that others need** For whatever reason, you simply know what a person needs in order for them to feel comfortable and at ease.  It most likely stems from your ability to recognize emotions and feelings, as well as the importance you place on the comfort and care of others. **Everything has a certain ‘feeling’ attached to it** Everything, from smells and colors to people, places, and even certain times, all have a specific ‘feeling’ to them.

Highly sensitive people are often referred to as empaths.  Those who are more sensitive than your average person, those who feel more.  And science shows that about 15 to 20 percent of people have a gene that makes them more sensitive than others.

If this sounds kind of like you, here are more signs that you’re a highly sensitive person:

The highly sensitive person is incredibly attuned to the various different emotions, meaning they can easily sense them in others.  If you can tell exactly what kind of mood a person is in without them having to say a word, you’re likely an empath.  

Empaths literally feel other people’s emotions, which can be harmful if you don’t know how to shield yourself from negative emotions.

After social gatherings or extended periods of time without being alone, they’re likely to need a bit of downtime to recuperate and recharge.

Everything, from smells and colors to people, places, and even certain times, all have a specific ‘feeling’ to them.

posts.title: Can You Solve These Brain Teasers?
posts.markdown: Okay, I went through these eleven questions with hesitation, as word problems can be tricky.  I got about three or four of them right on the first go, but otherwise, I got my butt kicked. Questions like these are similar to the ones that you would see on a **[Mensa admissions test](http://www.us.mensa.org/join/testing/)**.   If you’re not familiar with **[Mensa](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mensa_International)**, it is recognized as the largest and oldest high IQ society in the world today.  **[The organization](http://www.us.mensa.org/)**operates not for profit and is open to all people who score at the 98th percentile or higher on a standardized, supervised IQ or other approved intelligence test. How do you stack up?
