posts.title: 10 Sources of Body Pain and How They're Related to Specific Emotional States
posts.markdown: Understanding what pain is will help you tremendously on your journey through life.  First and foremost, pain is energy.  Secondly, it is perception.  And lastly, pain is the physical manifestation that you feel.   Practically every bit of pain we’ve ever felt in our body is linked to various different emotional states.  These emotional states serve as warnings, indicating that we still have areas that need to be healed and subsequently grown from.  Learning our lessons and growing is the only way to rid ourselves of the pain. Pain in the body is quite literal.  Certain experiences trigger certain pains, telling you what the problem is; all you need to do is figure out the lesson behind all of it. Here are 10 types of body pain and their related emotional states: **Muscle pains** These are often a result of getting ‘stuck’ on different aspects of our lives.  Whether it be at work, at home, or battles within, learning to ebb and flow with the ever changing currents of your life will ease these pains. **Pain in the head** Headaches are associated with the inability to make a decision.  And migraines, being the older brother of headaches, occur when you know what decision you need to make do not make it.  To ease these pains, remember to make time for yourself to relax and unwind each day. **Neck pains** Pain in the neck is linked to forgiveness, whether it be forgiving others or yourself.  Reflect on the things you love about yourself as well as the things you love about those around you; this will help you become more aware and more capable of letting go. **Gum pain** Similar to neck pain, gum pain is tied to inaction regarding decision-making.  Be assertive, be confident and make choices with purpose. **Stomach pain** Pain in our stomachs are related to a lack of feeling whole or fulfilled in life.  It is the result of a void within ourselves, one that leaves us in pain. **Lower back pain** Stress caused by anxiety over finances or even just a general lack of emotional support can cause pain in the lower back.  This could be a sign that it’s time you ask for a raise or work to manage your money more efficiently. **Pain in the elbows** Elbow pain is correlated with resistance to any change that may be happening in your life.  Stiffness is indicative of stiffness in your life.  You may want to consider rocking the boat a little bit; stir things up and see what happens.  All you can really do anyway is let the flow take you; be like water. **Pain in the arms** Arm pain means that you’re carrying a burden, whether it be your own or that of another person’s.  Take time to reflect on this burden and decide whether or not you need to keep carrying it. **Hand pain** Hand pain is associated with how often you’re reaching out to others.  If you’re experiencing hand pain, attempt to make new friends or reconnect with an old one.  Make plans with your coworkers or neighbors.  Build new connections. **Pain in the teeth** Teeth pains are connected to consistent negative thought patterns, ones that repeat how much you dislike your current situation.  If you practice positive thought patterns, ones that focus on how your experiences flow through you with ease, you can relieve this pain. h/t [**Prevent Disease**](http://preventdisease.com/news/15/060815_20-Sources-Pain-Tied-To-Specific-Emotional-States.shtml)
posts.html:
Understanding what pain is will help you tremendously on your journey through life.  First and foremost, pain is energy.  Secondly, it is perception.  And lastly, pain is the physical manifestation that you feel.  

Practically every bit of pain we’ve ever felt in our body is linked to various different emotional states.  These emotional states serve as warnings, indicating that we still have areas that need to be healed and subsequently grown from.  Learning our lessons and growing is the only way to rid ourselves of the pain.

Pain in the body is quite literal.  Certain experiences trigger certain pains, telling you what the problem is; all you need to do is figure out the lesson behind all of it.

Here are 10 types of body pain and their related emotional states:

Muscle pains

These are often a result of getting ‘stuck’ on different aspects of our lives.  Whether it be at work, at home, or battles within, learning to ebb and flow with the ever changing currents of your life will ease these pains.

Pain in the head

Headaches are associated with the inability to make a decision.  And migraines, being the older brother of headaches, occur when you know what decision you need to make do not make it.  To ease these pains, remember to make time for yourself to relax and unwind each day.

Neck pains

Pain in the neck is linked to forgiveness, whether it be forgiving others or yourself.  Reflect on the things you love about yourself as well as the things you love about those around you; this will help you become more aware and more capable of letting go.

Gum pain

Similar to neck pain, gum pain is tied to inaction regarding decision-making.  Be assertive, be confident and make choices with purpose.

Stomach pain

Pain in our stomachs are related to a lack of feeling whole or fulfilled in life.  It is the result of a void within ourselves, one that leaves us in pain.

Lower back pain

Stress caused by anxiety over finances or even just a general lack of emotional support can cause pain in the lower back.  This could be a sign that it’s time you ask for a raise or work to manage your money more efficiently.

Pain in the elbows

Elbow pain is correlated with resistance to any change that may be happening in your life.  Stiffness is indicative of stiffness in your life.  You may want to consider rocking the boat a little bit; stir things up and see what happens.  All you can really do anyway is let the flow take you; be like water.

Pain in the arms

Arm pain means that you’re carrying a burden, whether it be your own or that of another person’s.  Take time to reflect on this burden and decide whether or not you need to keep carrying it.

Hand pain

Hand pain is associated with how often you’re reaching out to others.  If you’re experiencing hand pain, attempt to make new friends or reconnect with an old one.  Make plans with your coworkers or neighbors.  Build new connections.

Pain in the teeth

Teeth pains are connected to consistent negative thought patterns, ones that repeat how much you dislike your current situation.  If you practice positive thought patterns, ones that focus on how your experiences flow through you with ease, you can relieve this pain.

h/t Prevent Disease

posts.title: 7 Things Only a Pisces Girl Will Understand
posts.markdown: Being a Pisces means a lot of different things, but mainly that you’re practical, compassionate and the most loving person you know.  If you’re a Pisces girl, then you will definitely be able to relate to these seven things! **You care a lot** The Pisces girl tends to be sort of ‘all or nothing,’ meaning that she either feels very deeply about things or doesn’t care at all.  As far as grey areas are concerned, the Pisces girl typically doesn’t deal in them. **You’re also practical and down to Earth** While you tend to feel things intensely, you never let it cloud your judgment or get the best of you.  Your pragmatism and practicality balance out your extreme emotions and feelings. **You dislike hurting other people’s feelings** Because of how much you genuinely care for others, it can be hard at times to turn people down or say no to people’s requests of you.  You’re always considerate of another person’s feelings. **You’re often the one people assume has her life together** Regardless of what’s going on with you emotionally, you always keep it together on the outside.  A calm, composed and happy demeanor leads many to believe that you rarely ever struggle with life’s problems. **Hanging out and relaxing at home is just as good as going out** A night out is always a good time, sure, but it will never compare to pajamas and movies with good food and good company.  The Pisces girl’s favorite activity is a night in with her best friends. **You’re chock-full of good ideas** Coming up with fun and creative solutions to problems is your forte as a Pisces girl.  People love hanging out with you because there’s rarely a dull moment. **You’re able to forgive and forget without even trying** Holding grudges has never been your style, and you probably couldn’t do it even if you tried.  Forgiving and moving forward is your preferred plan of action, unless that person had malicious intentions.   h/t [**Pop Xo**](http://www.popxo.com/2016/02/things-you-will-totally-get-if-you-are-a-pisces-girl/)
posts.html:
Being a Pisces means a lot of different things, but mainly that you’re practical, compassionate and the most loving person you know.  If you’re a Pisces girl, then you will definitely be able to relate to these seven things!

You care a lot

The Pisces girl tends to be sort of ‘all or nothing,’ meaning that she either feels very deeply about things or doesn’t care at all.  As far as grey areas are concerned, the Pisces girl typically doesn’t deal in them.

You’re also practical and down to Earth

While you tend to feel things intensely, you never let it cloud your judgment or get the best of you.  Your pragmatism and practicality balance out your extreme emotions and feelings.

You dislike hurting other people’s feelings

Because of how much you genuinely care for others, it can be hard at times to turn people down or say no to people’s requests of you.  You’re always considerate of another person’s feelings.

You’re often the one people assume has her life together

Regardless of what’s going on with you emotionally, you always keep it together on the outside.  A calm, composed and happy demeanor leads many to believe that you rarely ever struggle with life’s problems.

Hanging out and relaxing at home is just as good as going out

A night out is always a good time, sure, but it will never compare to pajamas and movies with good food and good company.  The Pisces girl’s favorite activity is a night in with her best friends.

You’re chock-full of good ideas

Coming up with fun and creative solutions to problems is your forte as a Pisces girl.  People love hanging out with you because there’s rarely a dull moment.

You’re able to forgive and forget without even trying

Holding grudges has never been your style, and you probably couldn’t do it even if you tried.  Forgiving and moving forward is your preferred plan of action, unless that person had malicious intentions.  

h/t Pop Xo

posts.title: 7 Easy Ways to Fortify and Balance Your Root Chakra
posts.markdown: The root chakra is widely considered to be one of the most influential chakras we have, as it is the one that connects us to the physical realm.  When the root chakra becomes imbalanced, the other chakras suffer as well.  Sitting at the base of our spines, the root chakra is connected to our hips, thighs, knees and feet. If you’re unsure as to whether or not your root chakra is healthy and balanced, see if you suffer from any of the symptoms below: - If you have an eating disorder, trouble with constipation, or issues with the knees, feet or prostate gland - If you’re struggling from financial hardship - Any family issues that might be holding you or the family back - Feelings of anger or greed - Any co-dependence you have on another person - Feelings of depression or fear - Extreme laziness **And the 7 great ways to rebalance and strengthen the Root Chakra** 1. Use oils that are known for their ability to improve the root chakra’s health.  Oils like cedar wood, myrrh, and patchouli.  A few drops on the bottoms of your feet will work great. 2. Practicing reflexology and aromatherapy.  Attention paid specifically to the feet helps the root chakra to move. 3. Spend as much time outside as possible.  Being barefoot helps build our bond with the Earth. 4. Set gemstones, like bloodstone, red jasper and black tourmaline on the center of your root chakra. 5. Consuming root foods helps to promote a healthy root chakra.  These are foods like potatoes, carrots, radishes, onions, garlic and beets. 6. Sound therapy has also been seen to aid in balancing and clearing the root chakra.   7. Finally, using positive phrases and affirmations will fortify your root chakra.  Try saying things like:1. I am deeply connected to my body. 2. I am grounded, stable and all is safe in my world. 3. I trust in the goodness of life. 4. I love and approve of myself. 5. Life supports me. h/t [**The Mystical Moon**](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/2016/03/7-ways-to-achieve-healthy-balanced-and.html)

  2. Practicing reflexology and aromatherapy.  Attention paid specifically to the feet helps the root chakra to move.

  11. Life supports me.

posts.title: Learn to Grow Lemons From Seed and Have Lemons for Life
posts.markdown: You always hear the phrase ‘when life gives you lemons..’ being said when times are tough.  But it takes on a whole new meaning after you learn how to grow your own lemon tree, because now when life gives you lemons, you simply plant and grow more lemons! Growing your own lemon tree is easy and highly rewarding, making it a fun little side project if you’re looking for something to do or simply want a steady supply of lemons. Lemon trees grow their very hardest when they’re outdoors, year-round, in a hot and sunny climate.  However, they can be grown inside during seasons with cold or not ideal climates. **To start growing your lemon tree – Procure the following items** - An organic lemon since non-organic lemons often contain non-germinating seeds - Fertile potting soil, preferably containing peat, vermiculite, perlite, and natural fertilizers - A planting pot that is six inches wide and six inches deep (will be used for sprouting) - A seedling pot that is about 24 inches wide by 12 inches deep - A sunny, indoor growing location and possibly a grow light **Use these steps to grow your lemon tree** 1. Moisten the potting soil so that it is damp, but not soaked, all the way through. 2. Fill the smaller pot with soil, all the way up to an inch below the rim. 3. Cut open your lemon and remove a seed. Remove all of the pulp from its surface. A good way to do this is to simply suck on it until it is clean. 4. Do not delay to plant. The seed must still be moist when it is buried into the soil. Plant the seed about half an inch deep in the middle of the pot. 5. Spray the soil that is directly above the seed gently with water from a spray bottle. 6. Cover the pot with clear plastic wrap, seal the edges with a good rubber band, and poke small holes in the top with a pencil. 7. Place the pot in a warm, sunny location. 8. Spray on more water occasionally, not allowing the soil to dry out. Do not cause water to puddle though. Just keep the soil somewhat moist. 9. After about two weeks, when the sproutling emerges, take the plastic covering off. If you need additional light for your lemon plant, you can use a grow light to supplement the sun’s light. 10. Take care of the young plant by keeping the soil damp, by making sure it gets at least eight full hours of light per day, and by giving it moderate doses of organic fertilizer. 11. Watch over your plant to ensure it is not attacked by bugs or diseases. Prune off brown, dead leaves when necessary. Use pesticides if you must. Protect your new lemon tree! 12. When the plant outgrows its small pot, put it in the larger pot. You will go through much the same procedure when you re-plant it as when you first planted. Younger plants need more water than older plants, but they all do need adequate water. Don’t starve your poor plant after all that work of growing it! Not only is it cheaper to grow your own lemons, but you gain real experience growing plant life, making it valuable as well as educational.  Not to mention, you pretty much have fresh lemons whenever you want them and the lemon tree is a stylish piece of home decor. So, take on a new summer project and see if you can grow your own lemon tree.  And be sure to share this fun idea with someone who loves fresh lemons and growing fruit! h/t [**EcoSnippet**](http://www.ecosnippets.com/gardening/grow-lemons-from-seed/)
posts.html:
You always hear the phrase ‘when life gives you lemons..’ being said when times are tough.  But it takes on a whole new meaning after you learn how to grow your own lemon tree, because now when life gives you lemons, you simply plant and grow more lemons!

Growing your own lemon tree is easy and highly rewarding, making it a fun little side project if you’re looking for something to do or simply want a steady supply of lemons.

Lemon trees grow their very hardest when they’re outdoors, year-round, in a hot and sunny climate.  However, they can be grown inside during seasons with cold or not ideal climates.

To start growing your lemon tree – Procure the following items

  • An organic lemon since non-organic lemons often contain non-germinating seeds
  • Fertile potting soil, preferably containing peat, vermiculite, perlite, and natural fertilizers
  • A planting pot that is six inches wide and six inches deep (will be used for sprouting)
  • A seedling pot that is about 24 inches wide by 12 inches deep
  • A sunny, indoor growing location and possibly a grow light

Use these steps to grow your lemon tree

  1. Moisten the potting soil so that it is damp, but not soaked, all the way through.
  2. Fill the smaller pot with soil, all the way up to an inch below the rim.
  3. Cut open your lemon and remove a seed. Remove all of the pulp from its surface. A good way to do this is to simply suck on it until it is clean.
  4. Do not delay to plant. The seed must still be moist when it is buried into the soil. Plant the seed about half an inch deep in the middle of the pot.
  5. Spray the soil that is directly above the seed gently with water from a spray bottle.
  6. Cover the pot with clear plastic wrap, seal the edges with a good rubber band, and poke small holes in the top with a pencil.
  7. Place the pot in a warm, sunny location.
  8. Spray on more water occasionally, not allowing the soil to dry out. Do not cause water to puddle though. Just keep the soil somewhat moist.
  9. After about two weeks, when the sproutling emerges, take the plastic covering off. If you need additional light for your lemon plant, you can use a grow light to supplement the sun’s light.
  10. Take care of the young plant by keeping the soil damp, by making sure it gets at least eight full hours of light per day, and by giving it moderate doses of organic fertilizer.
  11. Watch over your plant to ensure it is not attacked by bugs or diseases. Prune off brown, dead leaves when necessary. Use pesticides if you must. Protect your new lemon tree!
  12. When the plant outgrows its small pot, put it in the larger pot. You will go through much the same procedure when you re-plant it as when you first planted. Younger plants need more water than older plants, but they all do need adequate water. Don’t starve your poor plant after all that work of growing it!

Not only is it cheaper to grow your own lemons, but you gain real experience growing plant life, making it valuable as well as educational.  Not to mention, you pretty much have fresh lemons whenever you want them and the lemon tree is a stylish piece of home decor.

So, take on a new summer project and see if you can grow your own lemon tree.  And be sure to share this fun idea with someone who loves fresh lemons and growing fruit!

h/t EcoSnippet

posts.title: How To Cope As An Empath in Today's Society
posts.markdown: To be an empath is to be one who feels *much* more than the average person.  And when I say feel, I mean it in every aspect of the word.  Empaths possess senses that are finely tuned and easily stimulated; heightened physical senses, like touch and hearing, are accompanied by heightened awareness of emotions and energies. If this sounds like you, you could be an empath.  As one, you’re prone to absorbing the energies and feelings of those around you, which can be both good *and *bad.  Good, because being around positive people allows you to soak up positive energy, and bad for the same reason.  If you have any toxic or negative people in your life, you’re likely to reflect their mood and energy, becoming toxic and negative yourself. But don’t worry, because there are things you can do to manage your power. First, how can you tell for sure that you’re an empath?  There are numerous indicators, a few of which are listed below: - Sudden nausea after meeting someone unfamiliar or venturing into unfamiliar places - Issues with the solar plexus, including a sensitive digestive tract, stomach pains, or a sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach - You often reflect or mirror the energies and moods of those around you - Your emotions and senses confuse you - Large crowds are overwhelming, making you withdraw from the setting - You feel depressed at random times for seemingly no reason These are all traits that describe a person with a strong empathic affinity.   Now, a few methods and tips for managing your gift, so that you might not feel so exhausted and overwhelmed by the energies you face on a day-to-day basis: - Certain crystals hold energy-deflecting properties.  Try wearing jet, black tourmaline, hematite, or tiger’s eye on the right side of your body.  These help push energy outward, helping you create a protective barrier around yourself. - Bathing in salts, like pink Himalayan salt, does wonders - Develop a way to shield your solar plexus using your hands and arms while visualizing the act as well - Burn sage in and around yourself and the spaces you occupy - Practice saying “no” to people–Be honest and open when you tell them that you simply don’t have the time or cannot assist them at the moment. - Ask for energetic protection from your spiritual guides, angels, and other non-physical helpers - Saying phrases aloud that help you to visualize being protected like: “I am creating a bubble around myself for protection today,” or, “My shields are up now.” Hopefully some of these suggestions can help your empathic side exist happily and harmoniously with the rest of the world.  Be social and confident knowing that you no longer have to hide from overwhelming situations.   h/t [**Mystical Moon**](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/2014/09/how-to-cope-as-empath-in-our-society.html)
posts.html:
To be an empath is to be one who feels much more than the average person.  And when I say feel, I mean it in every aspect of the word.  Empaths possess senses that are finely tuned and easily stimulated; heightened physical senses, like touch and hearing, are accompanied by heightened awareness of emotions and energies.

If this sounds like you, you could be an empath.  As one, you’re prone to absorbing the energies and feelings of those around you, which can be both good and bad.  Good, because being around positive people allows you to soak up positive energy, and bad for the same reason.  If you have any toxic or negative people in your life, you’re likely to reflect their mood and energy, becoming toxic and negative yourself.

But don’t worry, because there are things you can do to manage your power.

First, how can you tell for sure that you’re an empath?  There are numerous indicators, a few of which are listed below:

  • Sudden nausea after meeting someone unfamiliar or venturing into unfamiliar places
  • Issues with the solar plexus, including a sensitive digestive tract, stomach pains, or a sinking feeling in the pit of your stomach
  • You often reflect or mirror the energies and moods of those around you
  • Your emotions and senses confuse you
  • Large crowds are overwhelming, making you withdraw from the setting
  • You feel depressed at random times for seemingly no reason

These are all traits that describe a person with a strong empathic affinity.  

Now, a few methods and tips for managing your gift, so that you might not feel so exhausted and overwhelmed by the energies you face on a day-to-day basis:

  • Certain crystals hold energy-deflecting properties.  Try wearing jet, black tourmaline, hematite, or tiger’s eye on the right side of your body.  These help push energy outward, helping you create a protective barrier around yourself.
  • Bathing in salts, like pink Himalayan salt, does wonders
  • Develop a way to shield your solar plexus using your hands and arms while visualizing the act as well
  • Burn sage in and around yourself and the spaces you occupy
  • Practice saying “no” to people–Be honest and open when you tell them that you simply don’t have the time or cannot assist them at the moment.
  • Ask for energetic protection from your spiritual guides, angels, and other non-physical helpers
  • Saying phrases aloud that help you to visualize being protected like: “I am creating a bubble around myself for protection today,” or, “My shields are up now.”

Hopefully some of these suggestions can help your empathic side exist happily and harmoniously with the rest of the world.  Be social and confident knowing that you no longer have to hide from overwhelming situations.  

h/t Mystical Moon

posts.title: 7 Crystals That Will Bring Peace Into Your Life
posts.markdown: Many crystal collectors have very in-depth and vast collections of crystals.  For them, each crystal has meaning, and many people like to use all of them if they can.  People wear crystals for a variety of different reasons, and as such, each crystal has specific traits and properties.  Some use them for healing, others for protection, and others for relaxation or meditation. However, out of the hundreds of crystals you can choose to wear, there are about seven that cover all the key areas.  They’re inexpensive and easy to procure, meaning everyone should have them! **Clear Quartz** This wonderful crystal is a jack-of-all-trades.  It’s widely known for it’s ability to enhance, restore and regulate energies.  It can also help one channel their inner psychic abilities, boost the effectiveness of other crystals, enhance the immune system, as well as re-align our chakras.   **Amethyst** Amethyst is used by many for it’s ability to help improve sleep, relaxation, meditation, and the opening of the crown chakra.  Additionally, it helps one to end bad habits and unhealthy addictions.  In this sense, it brings balance.  However, it also used as a psychic protection ward. **Rose Quartz** Rose Quartz is your go-to crystal if you’ve been hurt or emotionally traumatized.  It’s inherently loving and gentle, helping its wearer to channel unconditional love for not only themselves, but for others. **Selenite** A stone that builds a bridge between you and the angelic realm, it is known for purifying the mind, body and spirit.  Selenite is often used by those who struggle to make decisions, as it provides a mental clarity.  It’s also closely tied to the moon, putting you in touch with its energy. **Black Tourmaline** These stones are often placed in the corners of rooms where one wishes to remove (and prevent) any negativity or stress.  Empaths can gain a lot from this stone, as it protects the individual from the energies of emotionally toxic people.   **Fluorite** Fluorite is known for its ability to shield one’s aura from unwanted outside manipulation.  As powerful and enhancing psychic stone, it channels the upper chakras, absorbing disturbances around you. **Citrine** Predominantly an abundance crystal, this stone helps bring individuals financial stability.  Its ability to balance the solar plexus chakra helps promote an energized will power.  Others like to use it to boost creativity, and some like to use it to help find resolution during times of strife in their family or community. h/t [**Mystical Moon **](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/2015/08/these-7-crystals-are-all-you-really.html)

posts.title: 7 Astrological Traits That Every Cancer Demonstrates
posts.markdown: As the fourth sign in the zodiac, Cancers represent stability and life at home.  This can be seen in their often protective demeanor when they’re around loved ones or in their homes.  Ruled by the moon, Cancers enjoy a keen awareness of not only their own emotions, but the emotions of others. The Cancer’s symbol is the crab, and with good reason.  When they’re feeling vulnerable or insecure, Cancers enjoy the security and protection that retreating into their “shell” provides.  Don’t let their shell fool you though, as they are natural born leaders; they simply like to lead in quieter ways than others. Here are 7 traits of the Cancer: - Being a water sign, they possess imagination and creativity - Inherently psychic and highly intuitive - You have a hard time letting go of the past and are known for holding on - A high level of tenacity and willingness to fight for the things they want - Highly sensitive and prone to moodiness - Strong sense of empathy and ability to feel for others - Likes to focus on the care, comfort and protection of their friends and family h/t [**Awakening People**](http://www.awakeningpeople.com/20-astrological-traits-of-cancer.html)
posts.html:
As the fourth sign in the zodiac, Cancers represent stability and life at home.  This can be seen in their often protective demeanor when they’re around loved ones or in their homes.  Ruled by the moon, Cancers enjoy a keen awareness of not only their own emotions, but the emotions of others.

The Cancer’s symbol is the crab, and with good reason.  When they’re feeling vulnerable or insecure, Cancers enjoy the security and protection that retreating into their “shell” provides.  Don’t let their shell fool you though, as they are natural born leaders; they simply like to lead in quieter ways than others.

Here are 7 traits of the Cancer:

  • Being a water sign, they possess imagination and creativity
  • Inherently psychic and highly intuitive
  • You have a hard time letting go of the past and are known for holding on
  • A high level of tenacity and willingness to fight for the things they want

posts.title: Dealing With Heartbreak Using Your Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: If you’re going through a tough time and have had to separate from your partner recently, you might be left feeling lost and confused.  Heartbreak affects everyone differently, and your zodiac sign has a lot to do with that. Here’s a bit of insight as to how each sign handles the pain of heartbreak, so that you might grow a little easier: **Aquarius** Getting close to people is difficult for you, so when you do fall, you fall hard; which makes breaking up that much harder.  You’re not one to outwardly express the pain you’re feeling because you don’t like feeling vulnerable, so you stay busy and speak only to those who are close to you. **Pisces** You’re likely to fully embrace the sadness and sorrow accompanied with most breakups, but you do so because you are not worried about being vulnerable or showing ‘weakness.’  You know that to fully heal you must finish your grieving. **Aries** When the Aries gets hurt, they tend to look to their friends for support because of how social and outgoing they are.  Aries like to stay busy when they’re hurting; this lets them cover their pain with work and activities, pretending as if it hasn’t phased them. **Taurus** The Taurus struggles at times to adequately express how they’re feeling and what they’re thinking.  You’re quick to be set off as you occasionally let your emotions flare up, but you have only kindness in your heart, and want someone who loves as deeply as you do. **Gemini** Gemini tend to live in the moment, so a failed relationship or parting of ways is simply water under the bridge.  They like to focus on what’s happening *now*, instead of what happened yesterday. **Cancer** Cancers fall back on their career or work during times of emotional duress because they are natural leaders and enjoy working.  You like to hide your sensitive side, not letting your personal life and work life intersect.  And your friends are always the focus after a heartbreak. **Leo** Leos are traditionally both loyal and faithful people, enjoying passionate relationships with their partners.  Because of this, they are often shocked when their partner wishes to separate.  Leos will undoubtedly be hurt, but are also very understanding, wishing their partners the best as they move in a different direction. **Virgo** Virgos struggle to commit to one person, meaning they take breakups pretty hard.  But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay down for long.  They’re usually the first ones to be back in the dating scene, doing their best to move on–which they will. **Libra** The usually optimistic and upbeat Libra doesn’t stay hurt for long.  You might even be willing to stay friends with your former partner.  You will most likely spend most of your time with friends and family after a heartbreak. **Scorpio** Scorpios are quick to become reclusive, wanting to deal with their emotions by themselves.  They don’t like others seeing how hurt they are, so they simply pretend that they’re not.  You’ll likely try to stay busy to avoid thinking about it.  Scorpios are very difficult to love, but they are also the most sensitive. **Sagittarius** The Sagittarius, being the carefree and lighthearted creatures that they are, tend to shrug off most breakups or separations.  That’s because the easiest way to deal with anything is to laugh, even when things are tough or sad.  But it’s a trait that the next person will absolutely love. **Capricorn** Capricorns take time to let people into their lives, but it’s always worth it because they are the best people to love.  Anyone who has broken up with you will come to regret it.  The Capricorn simply needs to give him or herself time to heal after a nasty breakup, even if it might take a lot of it. h/t [**Puckermob**](http://www.puckermob.com/relationships/the-ways-you-deal-with-heartbreak-based-on-your-zodiac-sign)
posts.html:
If you’re going through a tough time and have had to separate from your partner recently, you might be left feeling lost and confused.  Heartbreak affects everyone differently, and your zodiac sign has a lot to do with that.

Here’s a bit of insight as to how each sign handles the pain of heartbreak, so that you might grow a little easier:

Aquarius

Getting close to people is difficult for you, so when you do fall, you fall hard; which makes breaking up that much harder.  You’re not one to outwardly express the pain you’re feeling because you don’t like feeling vulnerable, so you stay busy and speak only to those who are close to you.

Pisces

You’re likely to fully embrace the sadness and sorrow accompanied with most breakups, but you do so because you are not worried about being vulnerable or showing ‘weakness.’  You know that to fully heal you must finish your grieving.

Aries

When the Aries gets hurt, they tend to look to their friends for support because of how social and outgoing they are.  Aries like to stay busy when they’re hurting; this lets them cover their pain with work and activities, pretending as if it hasn’t phased them.

Taurus

The Taurus struggles at times to adequately express how they’re feeling and what they’re thinking.  You’re quick to be set off as you occasionally let your emotions flare up, but you have only kindness in your heart, and want someone who loves as deeply as you do.

Gemini

Gemini tend to live in the moment, so a failed relationship or parting of ways is simply water under the bridge.  They like to focus on what’s happening now, instead of what happened yesterday.

Cancer

Cancers fall back on their career or work during times of emotional duress because they are natural leaders and enjoy working.  You like to hide your sensitive side, not letting your personal life and work life intersect.  And your friends are always the focus after a heartbreak.

Leo

Leos are traditionally both loyal and faithful people, enjoying passionate relationships with their partners.  Because of this, they are often shocked when their partner wishes to separate.  Leos will undoubtedly be hurt, but are also very understanding, wishing their partners the best as they move in a different direction.

Virgo

Virgos struggle to commit to one person, meaning they take breakups pretty hard.  But that doesn’t mean they’ll stay down for long.  They’re usually the first ones to be back in the dating scene, doing their best to move on–which they will.

Libra

The usually optimistic and upbeat Libra doesn’t stay hurt for long.  You might even be willing to stay friends with your former partner.  You will most likely spend most of your time with friends and family after a heartbreak.

Scorpio

Scorpios are quick to become reclusive, wanting to deal with their emotions by themselves.  They don’t like others seeing how hurt they are, so they simply pretend that they’re not.  You’ll likely try to stay busy to avoid thinking about it.  Scorpios are very difficult to love, but they are also the most sensitive.

Sagittarius

The Sagittarius, being the carefree and lighthearted creatures that they are, tend to shrug off most breakups or separations.  That’s because the easiest way to deal with anything is to laugh, even when things are tough or sad.  But it’s a trait that the next person will absolutely love.

Capricorn

Capricorns take time to let people into their lives, but it’s always worth it because they are the best people to love.  Anyone who has broken up with you will come to regret it.  The Capricorn simply needs to give him or herself time to heal after a nasty breakup, even if it might take a lot of it.

h/t Puckermob

posts.title: 5 Ways to Tell You're Arguing With a Psychopath
posts.markdown: Mainstream media and popular culture would have us believe that most psychopathic people are similar to **[Christian Bale in ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film))*****[American Psycho](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film))**: *seemingly normal and charismatic on the outside, but a vicious killer on the inside.  The truth is that most psychopathic people are not serial killers, they’re simply manipulative people who enjoy causing harm to others.  And they do so without empathy or remorse. A psychopath is social being, able to blend perfectly into whatever setting they find themselves in.  Their dark side comes out when they feel threatened or bored, dragging you into arguments you don’t want to have and that quickly become out of control. Here are five signs that you’re engaging with a psychopath and need to leave, immediately: **They lie and have an excuse for everything – **A psychopath has more excuses than they know what to do with, and they’ll often get caught up in their lies and schemes after telling too many people a different tale.  They never follow up their words with action, so when they actually do something they said they were going to do, it’s relieving.   **They condescend and patronize – **Getting under a person’s skin is the psychopath’s favorite thing to do, and when they achieve this effect, they use it to gain the advantage in the argument.  They like to remain calm and composed throughout the argument, as if they’re confused as to why you’re getting so upset.  When you finally blow up, they like to tell you to calm down or act like they’re disappointed. **They are masters of hypocrisy – **A psychopath likes to lure you into their game.  When things become heated, one of their cheapest tricks is to blame you for acting in the same fashion that they themselves act.  Hoping to get a reaction out of you, they’ll quickly claim that you bear the same poor qualities that they do. **They have split personalities – **Arguing with a psychopath is like arguing with ten different people at once.  They like to ebb and flow back and forth between personas as the argument sees fit.  What if they sense you disengaging from their lies?  Fine, they’ll just apologize and play nice for a little bit.  Not working?  Okay, time to insult and mock again.  Feel like you’re taking crazy pills yet? **You feel that they don’t understand basic emotions – **I’m sure at this point you realize that there’s no arguing with a psychopath, it’s a battle that is lost before it’s begun.  You want to explain to them the basic understanding of human emotions so that they might get some sort of inkling as to why you’re feeling the way you’re feeling.  You think that if only they knew of empathy and compassion, they might not be so terrible.  But they do know.  They know so well that they use it to torment others. The only way to avoid these arguments altogether is to simply avoid situations with a psychopath, but if you cannot, never engage with their antics.  Do everything within your power to ignore them and continue on with your life. h/t [**The Mind Journal **](http://themindsjournal.com/6-signs-youre-arguing-with-a-psychopath/)
posts.html:
Mainstream media and popular culture would have us believe that most psychopathic people are similar to Christian Bale in American Psycho: seemingly normal and charismatic on the outside, but a vicious killer on the inside.  The truth is that most psychopathic people are not serial killers, they’re simply manipulative people who enjoy causing harm to others.  And they do so without empathy or remorse.

A psychopath is social being, able to blend perfectly into whatever setting they find themselves in.  Their dark side comes out when they feel threatened or bored, dragging you into arguments you don’t want to have and that quickly become out of control.

Here are five signs that you’re engaging with a psychopath and need to leave, immediately:

*They lie and have an excuse for everything – *A psychopath has more excuses than they know what to do with, and they’ll often get caught up in their lies and schemes after telling too many people a different tale.  They never follow up their words with action, so when they actually do something they said they were going to do, it’s relieving.  

*They condescend and patronize – *Getting under a person’s skin is the psychopath’s favorite thing to do, and when they achieve this effect, they use it to gain the advantage in the argument.  They like to remain calm and composed throughout the argument, as if they’re confused as to why you’re getting so upset.  When you finally blow up, they like to tell you to calm down or act like they’re disappointed.

*They are masters of hypocrisy – *A psychopath likes to lure you into their game.  When things become heated, one of their cheapest tricks is to blame you for acting in the same fashion that they themselves act.  Hoping to get a reaction out of you, they’ll quickly claim that you bear the same poor qualities that they do.

*They have split personalities – *Arguing with a psychopath is like arguing with ten different people at once.  They like to ebb and flow back and forth between personas as the argument sees fit.  What if they sense you disengaging from their lies?  Fine, they’ll just apologize and play nice for a little bit.  Not working?  Okay, time to insult and mock again.  Feel like you’re taking crazy pills yet?

*You feel that they don’t understand basic emotions – *I’m sure at this point you realize that there’s no arguing with a psychopath, it’s a battle that is lost before it’s begun.  You want to explain to them the basic understanding of human emotions so that they might get some sort of inkling as to why you’re feeling the way you’re feeling.  You think that if only they knew of empathy and compassion, they might not be so terrible.  But they do know.  They know so well that they use it to torment others.

The only way to avoid these arguments altogether is to simply avoid situations with a psychopath, but if you cannot, never engage with their antics.  Do everything within your power to ignore them and continue on with your life.

h/t *The Mind Journal *

posts.title: Japanese Master Controls Animals With Power of Chi
posts.markdown: While much of the modern world is dictated by science and practical figures that have basis in reality, there have been and will continue to be, ancient methods and practices of meditation that allow one to transcend normal boundaries.   You might have heard about ‘**[chi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qi)**’, or the material energy, the life force that resides within us.  It is the underlying principle in traditional Chinese medicine and martial arts, and for thousands of years people have tried to channel this energy, so as to use it to their benefit. And why not? As those who have tried to do so and been successful have gone on to accomplish great feats.  Using chi energy, individuals have been able to push the limits of concentration, longevity and strength.   The practice of cultivating this energy is known as Qigong.  Kanzawa Sensei is one such individual who is notorious for his ability to influence animals by using his mind and chi energy.  This Japanese master demonstrates his rare ability by standing close to animals and then concentrating his mind. Using his hands to manipulate chi energy, he can calm, entrance or even put these creatures to sleep, and he has done so with many different animals, including buffalo, elephant and ostriches. Master Kanzawa has even been featured on the television show, ‘Stan Lee’s Superhumans’, during which he visits an alpaca ranch in California.  Not only was he able to subdue an entire herd of alpaca, but he used his energy manipulation to help heal an injured alpaca back to full health.   This alpaca was paralyzed in her hind legs and hips and wasn’t eating, as if her jaw had been paralyzed as well.  After 20 minutes of Kanzawa’s chi manipulation, she was up and about, moving like she normally would and eating like she was hungry. Chi energy manipulation, and the healing powers that it holds within it, is testament to a Western world that has become blind to understanding that all of life is connected in subtle and not always so obvious ways. Check out the videos above that show Master Kanzawa at work.

This Japanese master demonstrates his rare ability by standing close to animals and then concentrating his mind. Master Kanzawa has even been featured on the television show, ‘Stan Lee’s Superhumans’, during which he visits an alpaca ranch in California.  Not only was he able to subdue an entire herd of alpaca, but he used his energy manipulation to help heal an injured alpaca back to full health.  

This alpaca was paralyzed in her hind legs and hips and wasn’t eating, as if her jaw had been paralyzed as well.  After 20 minutes of Kanzawa’s chi manipulation, she was up and about, moving like she normally would and eating like she was hungry.

posts.title: Test Your Mental Acuity With These 12 Incredibly Difficult Riddles
posts.markdown: Riddles and word problems are fun because they challenge us to think critically and in ways that are outside the realm of our normal thought processes.  Did you know that there’s even an entire **[high intelligence society](http://www.us.mensa.org/learn/about/)** that you can get into by completing an intelligence test at the 98th percentile? It’s time to put on your thinking cap and benchmark your brainpower with these 12 difficult riddles!

posts.title: 5 Phrases That Are Better Than Saying 'I Love You'
posts.markdown: If you’ve ever fallen in love with someone then you know that love is not the type of emotion that can be adequately conveyed with three simple words.  Love is more than lusting after physical attraction, it’s more than anything we could ever imagine.   It’s about loving someone for who they are, flaws and all.  It’s about being a pillar of strength during tough times.  It’s about showing how much you care in little ways.  And one of the easiest ways to express love for your person is by using your words.  Words that mean more than a simple ‘I love you.’ Here are five phrases that express love better than the three words we’re all used to saying so often: **‘I’m lucky to be yours’** When you’ve fallen for someone pretty hard, feeling lucky comes easy.  It happens in those moments when you’re least expecting it, when you’re suddenly overcome with an intense realization that you want this to last forever.   When you start to feel that you are unworthy of this person’s love, time, and attention, don’t forget to tell them how grateful you are to have them in your life. **‘I’m sorry’** Knowing when you’re wrong and when to apologize for your actions, words, or behaviors, is much more important than throwing out a simple ‘I love you.’  If you get caught up in a fight or make a huge mistake and know you were in the wrong, own up to it.   You don’t need to waste your time trying to prove a point if you truly care about them.  Ask for forgiveness and move forward. **‘I forgive you’** In the same way that you should apologize, also be willing to forgive.  When you know that your partner is truly sorry, and their transgressions are forgivable, don’t hesitate to forgive them.  Holding grudges and staying upset is wasted energy, energy that could be spent on building and nurturing your relationship. **‘I support you’** Encouraging, motivating, and generally supporting your partner is something that they can’t get from anyone else.  It means the world when your partner has your back during times of uncertainty or change.   Never be afraid to reassure them that they’re more than capable of achieving their goals and that you’ll be by their side every step of the way. **‘I’m committed to you, to us’** Knowing that your partner is entirely faithful and committed to the love you two share is an amazing feeling.  Never hesitate to tell them that your heart is theirs or how often you think about them.   The open expression of commitment illustrates your love and sincerity for this feeling toward them.  When you’re feeling the love, tell them! h/t [**ReRules**](http://www.relrules.com/9-phrases-more-important-than-i-love-you/5/)
posts.html:
If you’ve ever fallen in love with someone then you know that love is not the type of emotion that can be adequately conveyed with three simple words.  Love is more than lusting after physical attraction, it’s more than anything we could ever imagine.  

It’s about loving someone for who they are, flaws and all.  It’s about being a pillar of strength during tough times.  It’s about showing how much you care in little ways.  And one of the easiest ways to express love for your person is by using your words.  Words that mean more than a simple ‘I love you.’

Here are five phrases that express love better than the three words we’re all used to saying so often:

‘I’m lucky to be yours’

When you’ve fallen for someone pretty hard, feeling lucky comes easy.  It happens in those moments when you’re least expecting it, when you’re suddenly overcome with an intense realization that you want this to last forever.  

When you start to feel that you are unworthy of this person’s love, time, and attention, don’t forget to tell them how grateful you are to have them in your life.

‘I’m sorry’

Knowing when you’re wrong and when to apologize for your actions, words, or behaviors, is much more important than throwing out a simple ‘I love you.’  If you get caught up in a fight or make a huge mistake and know you were in the wrong, own up to it.  

You don’t need to waste your time trying to prove a point if you truly care about them.  Ask for forgiveness and move forward.

‘I forgive you’

In the same way that you should apologize, also be willing to forgive.  When you know that your partner is truly sorry, and their transgressions are forgivable, don’t hesitate to forgive them.  Holding grudges and staying upset is wasted energy, energy that could be spent on building and nurturing your relationship.

‘I support you’

Encouraging, motivating, and generally supporting your partner is something that they can’t get from anyone else.  It means the world when your partner has your back during times of uncertainty or change.  

Never be afraid to reassure them that they’re more than capable of achieving their goals and that you’ll be by their side every step of the way.

‘I’m committed to you, to us’

Knowing that your partner is entirely faithful and committed to the love you two share is an amazing feeling.  Never hesitate to tell them that your heart is theirs or how often you think about them.  

The open expression of commitment illustrates your love and sincerity for this feeling toward them.  When you’re feeling the love, tell them!

h/t ReRules

posts.title: Losing Hope In Humanity? This Video Made the World Cry
posts.markdown: It’s become a well known fact that a large portion of Russia’s population uses dash cams in their vehicles.  While this is mainly to capture evidence for police, should there be a car accident, they tend to capture some of the coolest and craziest things that happen across the continent.  From [meteors falling from the sky, to people squaring off with each other in bouts of road rage.](https://youtu.be/ODrDR9D28RE) What we don’t often get to see is dash cam footage showing good-natured folks doing good deeds for the people around them.  So, that’s exactly what we’ve found here.   Enjoy the video below and don’t forget to share with friends and family who would love to watch as well!

What we don’t often get to see is dash cam footage showing good-natured folks doing good deeds for the people around them.  So, that’s exactly what we’ve found here.

posts.title: Watch: This Unique Artist Uses Fire as His 'Paint'
posts.markdown: One of the most incredible things about art is that you can go about doing it in almost *any* fashion you can think of.  And of course people do just that.   From **[Maude Lebowski](https://youtu.be/FuMbc1Q2OQ4?t=34)** style zip-lining to **[virtual ballet dancers made of sand](https://vimeo.com/38840688)**, it takes on any form we manage to give it. Steve Spazuk is one of those people that creates art in brilliant and unique fashion.  In lieu of the traditional ink or paint, Steve likes to use fire. Watch his illustrations come to life on the paper that he so intricately burns. You can check out more of **[Steve’s work at his website](http://spazuk.com/fr/home-spazuk.php)**and see more creative work from [Patrick Peris on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/patrick.peris.film). *And be sure to share this video with family and friends who might want to see these works of art!*

posts.title: 6 Ways to Spot An Indigo Child
posts.markdown: You may or may not have heard about children who are labeled as “Indigo” by their parents.  The word ‘Indigo” is used in reference to any person born on the Indigo Ray vibration.  These people are thought to possess specific traits, interests, perspectives and a heightened sensitivity to energies.   Indigo children are often misunderstood because of their ability to build and fortify the global consciousness of our planet, helping us break free from old customs, norms and ways of being so that we might progress to new ones. Starting in the 1980s, there was a natural rise in the number of Indigo people, however, Indigos like Albert Einstein and Karl Jung were born before this time. **How to spot an Indigo Child** - Strong empathic affinity and heightened senses; often sensitive to abrasive or overwhelming people and environments - Struggle to do things in a routine fashion or as directed - Incredibly intuitive - Has the strange ability to predict events that have yet to happen - High level of confidence and sense of self-worth - Struggles to express frustration or anger, and has a short fuse Sound like your child?  Great, here are a few ways you can do your best to support, nurture, and connect with them, while also making sure you are not disconnecting at all. **Supporting the Indigo** - Patience is a virtue.  Strong-willed and complex, Indigos are often thinking about multiple things at once, and you trying to help them figure it all out might have the opposite effect. - Energy healing, like the practice of Reiki, helps greatly with the mind, body and spirit. - Bathing in salts, such as epsom and kosher salt, as well as regular smudgings help strengthen their auras - Wearing crystals like Hematite, Tiger’s Eye and Black Tourmaline all help shield from unwanted outside influence. - Show them how to create a protective energetic sphere around themselves when they are overwhelmed in crowded or congested places. - Let them spend a lot of time in nature and outside, as that is where they thrive. h/t [**Mystical Moon**](http://themysticalmoon.blogspot.com/2016/06/indigo-children-who-are-they-and-how.html)
posts.html:
You may or may not have heard about children who are labeled as “Indigo” by their parents.  The word ‘Indigo” is used in reference to any person born on the Indigo Ray vibration.  These people are thought to possess specific traits, interests, perspectives and a heightened sensitivity to energies.  

Indigo children are often misunderstood because of their ability to build and fortify the global consciousness of our planet, helping us break free from old customs, norms and ways of being so that we might progress to new ones.

Starting in the 1980s, there was a natural rise in the number of Indigo people, however, Indigos like Albert Einstein and Karl Jung were born before this time.

How to spot an Indigo Child

  • Strong empathic affinity and heightened senses; often sensitive to abrasive or overwhelming people and environments
  • Struggle to do things in a routine fashion or as directed
  • Incredibly intuitive
  • Has the strange ability to predict events that have yet to happen
  • High level of confidence and sense of self-worth
  • Struggles to express frustration or anger, and has a short fuse

Sound like your child?  Great, here are a few ways you can do your best to support, nurture, and connect with them, while also making sure you are not disconnecting at all.

Supporting the Indigo

  • Patience is a virtue.  Strong-willed and complex, Indigos are often thinking about multiple things at once, and you trying to help them figure it all out might have the opposite effect.
  • Energy healing, like the practice of Reiki, helps greatly with the mind, body and spirit.
  • Bathing in salts, such as epsom and kosher salt, as well as regular smudgings help strengthen their auras
  • Wearing crystals like Hematite, Tiger’s Eye and Black Tourmaline all help shield from unwanted outside influence.
  • Show them how to create a protective energetic sphere around themselves when they are overwhelmed in crowded or congested places.
  • Let them spend a lot of time in nature and outside, as that is where they thrive.

h/t Mystical Moon

posts.title: Before a Rare Disease Took His Life, Sam Revealed His 3 Secrets to Happiness
posts.markdown: Diagnosed with a rare disease called ‘progeria,’ 17-year-old Sam Berns lead anything but a normal life.  Three months before his passing, he gave an inspiring and powerful speech illustrating his struggles to overcome the obstacles he faced every day, as well as his methods to finally beat them. Progeria, the extremely rare disease that Sam suffered from, causes rapid aging and a slew of other debilitating symptoms.  But Sam never gave up on living a happy life, and he wants you to remember that you are capable of doing the same. Sam’s TEDx video is just one thing he did to try to create a better world for the people around him.  You can learn more about Sam by watching his HBO documentary, and you can learn more about Progeria at the Progeria Research Foundation.

posts.title: 5 Ways the "Old Soul" Loves Differently
posts.markdown: Ah, the ‘Old Soul.’  If you’re an old soul or have a friend who’s one, you know that we’re a little different from everyone else.  For whatever reason, we seem to handle ourselves better around older people and feel that our views on life are a little “before our time.”  This is why we enjoy spending time alone fairly often, because we’re misunderstood by our peers. However, that doesn’t mean we’re lonely people.  We’re just capable of enjoying the company we can provide ourselves.  We’re also pretty different when it comes to romance and relationships. Here are five things to know about how the old soul loves differently: **They’re homebodies** The homebody is the person who would rather stay in on Friday night instead of going out.  And they’re looking for a partner who shares this sentiment.  Bring over a bottle of wine, maybe some candles, and enjoy a relaxed night of conversation and good company. **Not too concerned with material objects** Old souls are anything but materialistic, so don’t have high expectations for a giant diamond ring or brand new luxury car.  They enjoy expressing their affection through grand gestures that have deeper meaning, like love letters or poems. **Old Souls communicate better than anyone else** Playing games is something that the old soul simply doesn’t entertain when it comes to communication.  They’re going to tell you how they honestly feel, so don’t get caught too off guard by this; they have good intentions at heart. **They only open up to select people** The old soul is almost incapable of having one night stands, simply because the only people they enjoy sleeping with are those who they’re emotionally invested in.  Sex without emotion, or a deeper connection, is meaningless, so don’t be surprised when they don’t open up immediately. **Everything is done with purpose** The old soul is constantly thinking about the big picture. Meaning, if that picture doesn’t include you, they’re not going to keep you around.  “Settling” for a person is not something they’ll do; their partner is their partner because they want it that way and they see a future with that person.   Rarely ever will an old soul do something without good reason. h/t [**Rebel Circus **](http://www.rebelcircus.com/blog/how-the-old-soul-loves-differently/)
posts.html:
Ah, the ‘Old Soul.’  If you’re an old soul or have a friend who’s one, you know that we’re a little different from everyone else.  For whatever reason, we seem to handle ourselves better around older people and feel that our views on life are a little “before our time.”  This is why we enjoy spending time alone fairly often, because we’re misunderstood by our peers.

However, that doesn’t mean we’re lonely people.  We’re just capable of enjoying the company we can provide ourselves.  We’re also pretty different when it comes to romance and relationships.

Here are five things to know about how the old soul loves differently:

They’re homebodies

The homebody is the person who would rather stay in on Friday night instead of going out.  And they’re looking for a partner who shares this sentiment.  Bring over a bottle of wine, maybe some candles, and enjoy a relaxed night of conversation and good company.

Not too concerned with material objects

Old souls are anything but materialistic, so don’t have high expectations for a giant diamond ring or brand new luxury car.  They enjoy expressing their affection through grand gestures that have deeper meaning, like love letters or poems.

Old Souls communicate better than anyone else

Playing games is something that the old soul simply doesn’t entertain when it comes to communication.  They’re going to tell you how they honestly feel, so don’t get caught too off guard by this; they have good intentions at heart.

They only open up to select people

The old soul is almost incapable of having one night stands, simply because the only people they enjoy sleeping with are those who they’re emotionally invested in.  Sex without emotion, or a deeper connection, is meaningless, so don’t be surprised when they don’t open up immediately.

Everything is done with purpose

The old soul is constantly thinking about the big picture. Meaning, if that picture doesn’t include you, they’re not going to keep you around.  “Settling” for a person is not something they’ll do; their partner is their partner because they want it that way and they see a future with that person.  

Rarely ever will an old soul do something without good reason.

h/t *Rebel Circus *

posts.title: 5 Great Benefits of Owning a Clear Quartz Crystal
posts.markdown: If you’ve been interested in the power of crystals and want to start your own collection, but aren’t entirely sure where to start, look no further!  The clear quartz crystal provides a plethora of amazing benefits for both personal and professional use. Composed of silicon and oxygen, the clear quartz crystal can be easily found all over the planet, meaning they’re not terribly expensive either! **5 Great Benefits That Clear Quartz Crystal Provides:** - It bolsters and fortifies our bio-magnetic fields, helping to prevent energy from leaving our auric fields. - The points of the quartz crystals direct energy, meaning you can place them around your home or workspace to either bring energy in, or clear energy out (depending on which way your points are facing). - They promote dream recall, helping one to better remember dreams and the messages within them. - Instead of the usual coffee break in the afternoon, try placing a clean clear quartz crystal in your drinking water to give you a needed energy boost. - It can also activate and open both your crown and soul star chakras.  Activating and opening these two chakras allows builds a strong connection between us, our intuition and our divine soul energy. Remember to regularly “clear” your crystals by saging them, placing them in a moving body of water, or by submerging them in a mixture of sea salt.  Clearing them helps them maintain their energy, as their effectiveness wanes with repeated use.   Clear your crystals at least once per month to keep the crystal energy flowing. h/t [**The Mystical Moon**](http://www.themysticalmoon.com/)
posts.html:
If you’ve been interested in the power of crystals and want to start your own collection, but aren’t entirely sure where to start, look no further!  The clear quartz crystal provides a plethora of amazing benefits for both personal and professional use.

Composed of silicon and oxygen, the clear quartz crystal can be easily found all over the planet, meaning they’re not terribly expensive either!

5 Great Benefits That Clear Quartz Crystal Provides:

  • It bolsters and fortifies our bio-magnetic fields, helping to prevent energy from leaving our auric fields.
  • The points of the quartz crystals direct energy, meaning you can place them around your home or workspace to either bring energy in, or clear energy out (depending on which way your points are facing).
  • They promote dream recall, helping one to better remember dreams and the messages within them.
  • Instead of the usual coffee break in the afternoon, try placing a clean clear quartz crystal in your drinking water to give you a needed energy boost.
  • It can also activate and open both your crown and soul star chakras.  Activating and opening these two chakras allows builds a strong connection between us, our intuition and our divine soul energy.

Remember to regularly “clear” your crystals by saging them, placing them in a moving body of water, or by submerging them in a mixture of sea salt.  Clearing them helps them maintain their energy, as their effectiveness wanes with repeated use.  

Clear your crystals at least once per month to keep the crystal energy flowing.

h/t The Mystical Moon

posts.title: 3 Critical Life Lessons Everyone Can Learn From Being Single
posts.markdown: If you’ve recently found yourself single or have been single for a while, I have some good news: you’re growing.  Being single affords you many opportunities and freedoms that people in relationships do not have.  Think about it–no one to answer to, no one else to worry about but yourself, no trying to figure out someone else’s life. A large importance is placed on relationships because, well, that’s kind of our purpose as humans; we’re meant to get together and make babies.  But that doesn’t mean you need to be in a relationship *all the time*.   Being single actually helps us learn a few important life lessons.  They can be rough lessons to learn, but you’re better off for having learned them! **Spending time alone** Sometimes when we have a partner, we get used to certain comforts and develop dependencies around them.  Sometimes we even stop doing the things that make us, us.  When you spend time alone, you remember all the things you used to spend your time doing; you know, the hobbies and activities that you call your own. Being alone also gives you the downtime necessary to reflect on the happenings of your life.  You can think about past mistakes and grow from them. **You are more than enough for yourself** One of the best things about learning to live comfortably alone is that you don’t seek out validation from anyone other than yourself.  If you gain nothing else from being alone, try to learn this.  Once you start to live life for yourself, numerous doors open up in your world, each one brimming with potential.   Because the truth is that you are the only one who knows what will make you happy.  And only you can decide what is best for you.  Remember to do right by yourself before anyone else. **Love can be found in all parts of life, not just your relationships** When you’re single, you start to discover love in different areas of your life.  You start to develop an understanding of love that is greater and much deeper than before.  This helps you to love unconditionally at all times, regardless of what is going on or who you’re with.  And in turn, you become a better version of yourself. Being single is not something to be feared or looked down upon.  It is an opportunity for growth, an opportunity to truly learn about yourself.  Remember that you are the only person you need in this world and move forward with confidence every day!
posts.html:
If you’ve recently found yourself single or have been single for a while, I have some good news: you’re growing.  Being single affords you many opportunities and freedoms that people in relationships do not have.  Think about it–no one to answer to, no one else to worry about but yourself, no trying to figure out someone else’s life.

A large importance is placed on relationships because, well, that’s kind of our purpose as humans; we’re meant to get together and make babies.  But that doesn’t mean you need to be in a relationship all the time.  

Being single actually helps us learn a few important life lessons.  They can be rough lessons to learn, but you’re better off for having learned them!

Spending time alone

Sometimes when we have a partner, we get used to certain comforts and develop dependencies around them.  Sometimes we even stop doing the things that make us, us.  When you spend time alone, you remember all the things you used to spend your time doing; you know, the hobbies and activities that you call your own.

Being alone also gives you the downtime necessary to reflect on the happenings of your life.  You can think about past mistakes and grow from them.

You are more than enough for yourself

One of the best things about learning to live comfortably alone is that you don’t seek out validation from anyone other than yourself.  If you gain nothing else from being alone, try to learn this.  Once you start to live life for yourself, numerous doors open up in your world, each one brimming with potential.  

Because the truth is that you are the only one who knows what will make you happy.  And only you can decide what is best for you.  Remember to do right by yourself before anyone else.

Love can be found in all parts of life, not just your relationships

When you’re single, you start to discover love in different areas of your life.  You start to develop an understanding of love that is greater and much deeper than before.  This helps you to love unconditionally at all times, regardless of what is going on or who you’re with.  And in turn, you become a better version of yourself.

Being single is not something to be feared or looked down upon.  It is an opportunity for growth, an opportunity to truly learn about yourself.  Remember that you are the only person you need in this world and move forward with confidence every day!

posts.title: Shocking 100-Year-Old Secret Uncovered During Remodel of This High School
posts.markdown:
See the Shocking 100-Year-Old Secret Found Hiding Behind the Chalkboards of This High School For daydreamers like myself, the ones who spend way too much time inside their heads pondering random notions and scenarios, we like to think about seemingly random and mundane things.   For example, while I’m hiking through the mountains, I’ll often pretend that I’m one of the very first explorers of the territory, blazing new trails and mapping new grounds. And there’s no harm in picturing yourself in a life so vastly different from your own.  It’s fun and it teases your brain.   So, you can imagine how excited I was when I found this story about chalkboards that were discovered during a remodel of a high school, hanging perfectly undisturbed underneath the new ones for almost 100 years.   While it might not make national headlines, stories like these are time machines.   On these chalkboards, that have been hidden away from the world for decades, lie the remnants of a culture and way of living that is long gone, giving us a glimpse into what life was like in Oklahoma City in 1917. 1917 was an interesting year.  The first jazz record was released, the Ford Model T could be seen cruising the roads, the United States would eventually find itself involved in World War I, and an Oklahoman City classroom would be given new blackboards, preserving a small moment in time.  Take a second to peruse these photos of what is now Emerson High School, as you step back in time 100 years:
![education classroom chalkboard teaching](http://cdn9.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/0b1-600x450.jpg)
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn8.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/13-600x398.png)
**“I have never seen that technique in my life,” said Emerson High School Principal, Sherry Kishore, regarding this multiplication wheel.**
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/2-600x398.png)
**Cursive penmanship has been largely forgotten about by a majority of schools, as the advancement of technology makes skills like typing much more practical.**
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn6.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/31-600x399.png)
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/41-600x399.png)
**Principal Kishore would end up showing the old chalkboards to her 85-year-old mother, saying that “She just stood there and cried [because] it was exactly like her classroom was when she was going to school.”**
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/61-600x798.png)
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn9.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/52-600x798.png)
**Emerson High School was built in 1895, meaning it’s seen its fair share of remodels and renovations over the years.  How these chalkboards have gone completely undetected is a mystery in itself.**
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn9.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/71-600x399.png)
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/81-600x399.png)
![education chalkboard oklahoma](http://cdn9.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/111-600x401.png)
**Oklahoma City and the school district are now trying to find a way to preserve these fascinating old chalkboards, so they can continue to provide a look into the past.**
![history 1900s 20th century chalkboards Oklahoma education](http://cdn7.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/91-600x399.png)
![education chalkboard oklahoma](http://cdn4.littlethings.com/app/uploads/2015/06/121-600x402.png)

See the Shocking 100-Year-Old Secret Found Hiding Behind the Chalkboards of This High School

For daydreamers like myself, the ones who spend way too much time inside their heads pondering random notions and scenarios, we like to think about seemingly random and mundane things.  

For example, while I’m hiking through the mountains, I’ll often pretend that I’m one of the very first explorers of the territory, blazing new trails and mapping new grounds.

And there’s no harm in picturing yourself in a life so vastly different from your own.  It’s fun and it teases your brain.  

So, you can imagine how excited I was when I found this story about chalkboards that were discovered during a remodel of a high school, hanging perfectly undisturbed underneath the new ones for almost 100 years.  

While it might not make national headlines, stories like these are time machines.  

On these chalkboards, that have been hidden away from the world for decades, lie the remnants of a culture and way of living that is long gone, giving us a glimpse into what life was like in Oklahoma City in 1917.

1917 was an interesting year.  The first jazz record was released, the Ford Model T could be seen cruising the roads, the United States would eventually find itself involved in World War I, and an Oklahoman City classroom would be given new blackboards, preserving a small moment in time. 

Take a second to peruse these photos of what is now Emerson High School, as you step back in time 100 years:
