posts.title: 5 Signs You're an Introvert, and Not Just Shy
posts.markdown: While introverts and shy people exhibit a lot of the same behaviors, the two personality types are worlds away from each other. Many people who are actually introverts often get described as ‘shy’ by their friends and family, but that’s simply because they don’t know the difference. Shyness is a trait that stems from a person’s fears and insecurities. Introverted folks don’t have a fear of people, it’s simply that being social is an exhausting endeavor for them. They need time alone to rejuvenate their energy and aren’t keen on talking just to talk. If you feel shy, but unafraid, you might just be an introvert. Here are five easy ways to tell: **Small talk isn’t your thing** Introverts tend to be thinkers and intellectuals, so they’re not super enthused about conversations that lack real substance. If you want to talk about big ideas, like life, ideology, theories, goals, etc., the introvert will undoubtedly open up. They’re good at listening and are good at picking up on subtle social cues. **You take your time to respond to texts or messages** If you like to take the time to develop a thoughtful reply to the texts and messages you receive, you might be introverted. They don’t like to fire off random thoughts and ideas without feeling fully invested in what’s being said, just as they’re likely to stay quiet in a social setting if they feel they have nothing important to add to the conversation. **Crowds and groups of people overwhelm you** Being around numerous people in close proximity to one another can be overstimulating for the introvert. They would much rather spend time with a few close friends, but even then, they’ll need alone time at some point to recharge. If you find yourself feeling drained after being social for prolonged periods of time, you’re definitely introverted. **Anti-social? No, *****selectively social*** Introverted people can sometimes struggle to find people they’re entirely comfortable being around. And they’re not about to invest a ton of time and energy into a person that they’re not 100 percent on board with. If you like to take the time to get to know someone before getting personal with them, you’re probably introverted. Your social circle might be small, but all of your relationships are somewhat special. **You’re a deeply loyal friend** Loyalty often tops the list of an introvert’s valuable traits. They’re highly selective nature when it comes to relationships means that they’re fully committed to the people they choose to be around. Their inner circle is a wonderful place to be, because once you’ve made it, there’s a good chance you’ve gained a lifelong loyal friend. h/t [**Life Hack**](http://www.lifehack.org/285869/24-signs-youre-introvert-not-shy)
posts.html:
While introverts and shy people exhibit a lot of the same behaviors, the two personality types are worlds away from each other. Many people who are actually introverts often get described as ‘shy’ by their friends and family, but that’s simply because they don’t know the difference.

Shyness is a trait that stems from a person’s fears and insecurities. Introverted folks don’t have a fear of people, it’s simply that being social is an exhausting endeavor for them. They need time alone to rejuvenate their energy and aren’t keen on talking just to talk.

If you feel shy, but unafraid, you might just be an introvert. Here are five easy ways to tell:

Small talk isn’t your thing

Introverts tend to be thinkers and intellectuals, so they’re not super enthused about conversations that lack real substance. If you want to talk about big ideas, like life, ideology, theories, goals, etc., the introvert will undoubtedly open up. They’re good at listening and are good at picking up on subtle social cues.

You take your time to respond to texts or messages

If you like to take the time to develop a thoughtful reply to the texts and messages you receive, you might be introverted. They don’t like to fire off random thoughts and ideas without feeling fully invested in what’s being said, just as they’re likely to stay quiet in a social setting if they feel they have nothing important to add to the conversation.

Crowds and groups of people overwhelm you

Being around numerous people in close proximity to one another can be overstimulating for the introvert. They would much rather spend time with a few close friends, but even then, they’ll need alone time at some point to recharge.

If you find yourself feeling drained after being social for prolonged periods of time, you’re definitely introverted.

Anti-social? No, *selectively social*

Introverted people can sometimes struggle to find people they’re entirely comfortable being around. And they’re not about to invest a ton of time and energy into a person that they’re not 100 percent on board with. If you like to take the time to get to know someone before getting personal with them, you’re probably introverted.

Your social circle might be small, but all of your relationships are somewhat special.

You’re a deeply loyal friend

Loyalty often tops the list of an introvert’s valuable traits. They’re highly selective nature when it comes to relationships means that they’re fully committed to the people they choose to be around.

Their inner circle is a wonderful place to be, because once you’ve made it, there’s a good chance you’ve gained a lifelong loyal friend.

h/t Life Hack

posts.title: 5 Shocking Reasons Toxic People Are Attracted To You
posts.markdown: Learning how to spot the toxic people in your life can be hard if you’re not sure what to look for. They function and look like your average person, but once they’ve made their way into your life, havoc, chaos and sorrow are often the only things they have to offer you. They enjoy latching onto happy, unsuspecting people, which is why some of the most genuine and kind folks often have to deal with toxic people the most. Here are five surprising reasons that you’re attracting toxic people in your life: **You’re really good at listening** People who are really good at listening to what others have to say are always highly valued, especially in a world that has become so distracted by the technology at our fingertips. Toxic people will use this great quality of yours as a platform to hear themselves speak. They can talk for hours about themselves (and the negative way they see the world) without showing any interest in what *you* have to say. They just like when others accept their view of the world as truth. **You give people the time of day** Generosity is undoubtedly a great quality to have, but when it comes to toxic people, it can be highly detrimental. Generosity is something that toxic individuals seek out on a regular basis, simply because they know that they can take advantage of a person who will do anything for them. They’re likely to grab hold and not let go if you’re always at their beck and call. **You have an easygoing nature** Easygoing people are fun to be around. They pretty much always keep their cool and are very good at diffusing uncomfortable situations with clever jests or kind words. They’re usually very patient and kind, a trait that stems from the inner peace that they’ve found. Unfortunately for these people, their inner peace is exactly what attracts toxic people, simply because they wish to disrupt it. **You’re good at solving conflict, building bridges** When arguments and feuds go unresolved, the bridge builder will go to great lengths to see the relationship mended. Many people love you for your ability to bring people together, and are often quite grateful. Toxic people love these types because they love to destroy bridges. Creating drama and conflict between others is something they truly enjoy. **You see humanity in a very positive light** I like to believe that most people see their fellow man as inherently good-natured and kind, just as I do. And I’d say that most people’s daily interactions with each other prove this to be true. However, every now and then we experience the dark side of folks. If you’re the type of person who has trouble finding the darkness in others, you could be inviting toxic people into your life without even realizing it. Do you put up with a crappy friend out of hope that they will change? Do you completely ignore their poor behavior and distasteful acts, choosing to hang out with them anyway? Maybe it’s time to re-evaluate your friendship. http://www.marcandangel.com/2015/08/16/7-surprising-reasons-youre-attracting-toxic-people/
posts.html:
Learning how to spot the toxic people in your life can be hard if you’re not sure what to look for. They function and look like your average person, but once they’ve made their way into your life, havoc, chaos and sorrow are often the only things they have to offer you.

They enjoy latching onto happy, unsuspecting people, which is why some of the most genuine and kind folks often have to deal with toxic people the most.

Here are five surprising reasons that you’re attracting toxic people in your life:

You’re really good at listening

People who are really good at listening to what others have to say are always highly valued, especially in a world that has become so distracted by the technology at our fingertips. Toxic people will use this great quality of yours as a platform to hear themselves speak.

They can talk for hours about themselves (and the negative way they see the world) without showing any interest in what you have to say. They just like when others accept their view of the world as truth.

You give people the time of day

Generosity is undoubtedly a great quality to have, but when it comes to toxic people, it can be highly detrimental. Generosity is something that toxic individuals seek out on a regular basis, simply because they know that they can take advantage of a person who will do anything for them.

They’re likely to grab hold and not let go if you’re always at their beck and call.

You have an easygoing nature

Easygoing people are fun to be around. They pretty much always keep their cool and are very good at diffusing uncomfortable situations with clever jests or kind words. They’re usually very patient and kind, a trait that stems from the inner peace that they’ve found.

Unfortunately for these people, their inner peace is exactly what attracts toxic people, simply because they wish to disrupt it.

You’re good at solving conflict, building bridges

When arguments and feuds go unresolved, the bridge builder will go to great lengths to see the relationship mended. Many people love you for your ability to bring people together, and are often quite grateful. Toxic people love these types because they love to destroy bridges.

Creating drama and conflict between others is something they truly enjoy.

You see humanity in a very positive light

I like to believe that most people see their fellow man as inherently good-natured and kind, just as I do. And I’d say that most people’s daily interactions with each other prove this to be true. However, every now and then we experience the dark side of folks. If you’re the type of person who has trouble finding the darkness in others, you could be inviting toxic people into your life without even realizing it.

Do you put up with a crappy friend out of hope that they will change? Do you completely ignore their poor behavior and distasteful acts, choosing to hang out with them anyway? Maybe it’s time to re-evaluate your friendship.

posts.title: Get Rid of Your Migraine Headaches Quickly Using This Simple Recipe
posts.markdown: Migraine headaches cause some of the most agonizing pain humans have ever felt. The worst ones can leave you bedridden or completely incapacitated. If you or a loved one suffer from migraines, we have some good news for you: lemon juice and salt water will clear them right up, and in record time. **What you’ll need** The solution is relatively simple to make: grab a glass of water, squeeze in as much lemon juice as you can from a lemon and then add about two teaspoons of salt. Mix the ingredients into a solution and then drink it, allowing a few minutes for the effects to kick in. One thing to be mindful of when making this drink is the type of salt you use in it. Preferably, you want to use a high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt. This type of salt has about 80 different trace minerals in it, making it perfect for clearing up migraines. Additionally, salt helps boost serotonin levels, which is good for reducing inflammation and pain. **1 out of every 10 people are affected by migraines** Which is about **[36 million people in the United States](http://tophealthnews.net/this-drink-will-stop-your-migraine-headache-within-minutes/)**. In fact, migraines are among the most common reasons that people call in sick to work. Symptoms of migraines include: - A throbbing head - Nausea - Dizziness - Increased sensitivity to smells, noises and light - Pain lasting anywhere from 2 hours to 72 hours - Numbness - Tingling **Why are you getting migraines in the first place?** Migraines happen for a lot of different reasons, so it’s not always obvious why you’re suffering from one. While we can’t say for certain why each individual migraine occurs, there is a list of known causes you can study in order to take preventative measures: - [Stress is one reason](http://www.webmd.com/migraines-headaches/guide/migraines-headaches-managing-stress). Chronic stress can cause headaches that eventually turn into the nightmares that are migraines. - The [consumption of alcohol](http://www.joybauer.com/photo-gallery/common-trigger-foods/alcohol/) has been linked to people’s development of migraines. - Allergies have been seen to set off certain reactions that can cause migraines. - Any sort of vitamin or mineral deficiency can start migraines. - The most common circumstances linked to migraines are [dehydration](http://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/dehydration-adults) and an [imbalance of electrolytes](http://www.healthline.com/health/electrolyte-disorders). Not only will you feel incredibly sluggish or lethargic, but these conditions create the perfect environment for brewing headaches.
posts.html:
Migraine headaches cause some of the most agonizing pain humans have ever felt. The worst ones can leave you bedridden or completely incapacitated.

If you or a loved one suffer from migraines, we have some good news for you: lemon juice and salt water will clear them right up, and in record time.

What you’ll need

The solution is relatively simple to make: grab a glass of water, squeeze in as much lemon juice as you can from a lemon and then add about two teaspoons of salt.

Mix the ingredients into a solution and then drink it, allowing a few minutes for the effects to kick in.

One thing to be mindful of when making this drink is the type of salt you use in it. Preferably, you want to use a high quality salt, like pink Himalayan sea salt. This type of salt has about 80 different trace minerals in it, making it perfect for clearing up migraines. Additionally, salt helps boost serotonin levels, which is good for reducing inflammation and pain.

1 out of every 10 people are affected by migraines

Which is about 36 million people in the United States. In fact, migraines are among the most common reasons that people call in sick to work.

Symptoms of migraines include:

  • A throbbing head
  • Nausea
  • Dizziness
  • Increased sensitivity to smells, noises and light
  • Pain lasting anywhere from 2 hours to 72 hours
  • Numbness
  • Tingling

Why are you getting migraines in the first place?

Migraines happen for a lot of different reasons, so it’s not always obvious why you’re suffering from one. While we can’t say for certain why each individual migraine occurs, there is a list of known causes you can study in order to take preventative measures:

  • Stress is one reason. Chronic stress can cause headaches that eventually turn into the nightmares that are migraines.
  • The consumption of alcohol has been linked to people’s development of migraines.
  • Allergies have been seen to set off certain reactions that can cause migraines.
  • Any sort of vitamin or mineral deficiency can start migraines.
  • The most common circumstances linked to migraines are dehydration and an imbalance of electrolytes. Not only will you feel incredibly sluggish or lethargic, but these conditions create the perfect environment for brewing headaches.

posts.title: 5 Reasons People Think Your Personality is Intimidating
posts.markdown: People with strong personalities are often misunderstood. There’s a large difference between being a person who intimidates people and having a personality that people perceive as intimidating. Rude, domineering, crass.. These are all words that people use to describe people with strong personality types. While I can’t speak for everyone, I can say that most strong personality types that get labeled this way don’t understand it, because on the inside, they’re big softies. The only difference between them everyone else is that they’re completely self-reliant when it comes to validation, they aren’t super competitive, and they’re not about to let anyone mistake them for a pushover. Sound familiar? Here are five signs that you have a strong, or “intimidating” personality type: **You don’t have time for excuses** As people who strive to do their best and accomplish their goals by overcoming the obstacles that are before them, strong personalities are entirely uninterested in excuses. They hate hearing people whine, because they know that energy could be better spent figuring out how to achieve. While others are worrying about all of the reasons they *can’t* do something, you’re focused on all of the ways you *can*. **You’re highly selective when it comes to letting people in** Strong people are very sure that they can handle anything life throws their way. This means that their validation and self-confidence comes from within. When you’re not interested in people telling you how to live your life, who you are and what you’re capable of, you start to do all of that for yourself. Once this happens, the need for significant others, best friends, family, coworkers, etc. starts to wane, simply because you don’t need anyone but yourself. Weaker personality types like having others around to make their lives feel validated. They like having people constantly reaffirming their life choices. You recognize that you’re not this way, but that others might need it, and that’s totally fine with you. **Attention is something you could do without** While some might think you adore having the spotlight on yourself, they couldn’t be more wrong. The truth is that strong personalities are naturally magnetic, they attract people. Usually because others need a strong personality type to lean on. They want to have you around. But, don’t be afraid to say no to social invitations. You need downtime to recharge and rejuvenate just like everyone else. Make sure your needs are being met, just as you are helping others’ needs to be met. **You view ‘fear’ differently** Many people probably see you as a fearless person, and you’ll let them believe that, because while you definitely feel fear in certain situations, you never let it stop you from moving forward. That is the big difference that people often fail to recognize. You’re not going to let fear run your life; you’re going to feel that fear and then use it as fuel. **You cannot tolerate intolerant people** Strong personality types hate being thought of as domineering because they know that domineering personalities are born from lack of knowledge or education. Strong people are the opposite of that. They enjoy using their brains and often think of themselves are fairly intellectual beings. So, it makes sense that they absolutely cannot stand people who make instantaneous judgments or criticisms on subjects that they have *zero* experience with. You don’t talk just to hear yourself talk, so unless you have something important to add to the conversation, you’re not going to. You wish others would take a little more time to think about what they’re trying to say before they open their mouths and spew ignorance. h/t [**LifeHack**](http://www.lifehack.org/345591/8-signs-you-have-strong-personality-that-might-scare-some-people)

Sound familiar? Here are five signs that you have a strong, or “intimidating” personality type:

You don’t have time for excuses

As people who strive to do their best and accomplish their goals by overcoming the obstacles that are before them, strong personalities are entirely uninterested in excuses. They hate hearing people whine, because they know that energy could be better spent figuring out how to achieve.

posts.title: How To Find Love Based on Your Zodiac Sign
posts.markdown: Falling in love is different for everyone, and our zodiac signs have a lot to do with how it happens. It makes sense though, doesn’t it? The universe will always influence who we are as people. Just as the Cancer will always be loving and caring, and the Leo proud and passionate. If you’re looking to find love, learning a bit about what your sign desires in a partner might just be the difference between a lasting, loving relationship, and a drama-filled nightmare. ## **Aries (March 21-April 19)** As a youthful fire sign, Aries have a fervent energy and enthusiasm for life. Your leadership skills often let you control the flow of any relationship, which is good because you’re usually the one who is down-to-earth and level-headed. Try not to put the cart before the horse, and people will flock to your ever burning flame. ## **Taurus (April 20-May 20)** Taurus have a weak spot for physical intimacy. When the physical side of a relationship picks up heavy and fast, you’re likely to start falling in love at the same time. This is largely because of how in tune you are sensually with your body. When you do find yourself in a faithful relationship, you’re happy just ebbing and flowing within it. Which is why your dream is to settle down together somewhere remote and secluded. ## **Gemini (May 21-June 20)** Smart, funny and always looking on the bright side, Gemini always make great partners. They’re full of unique and intelligent ideas. They’re also incredibly romantic, which means they often fall in love and stay in love when they adore their partner. While you might want nothing more than to be with your significant other 24/7, it is good to remember to give each other space, and to communicate with each other as much as possible. ## **Cancer (June 21-July 22)** While Cancers tend to fall face first into love (and hard), they keep a bit of reserved skepticism. You’re searching for someone who will be your ‘partner,’ in every sense of the word. Which is why they prefer partners who are ambitious and motivated. Once you’ve found a partner, you’re their number one fan. And your superb listening skills and sense of humor will keep them around for years to come. ## **Leo (July 23-August 22)** Because Leos are so charismatic, confident and warm, they rarely struggle to find love. But there natural ability to attract others doesn’t keep them from being completely loyal once they’ve fallen for someone. And they tend to fall in love often, and hard. As a Leo, you are naturally territorial, but it’s only because of how intense your love is. You need a bit of praise and adoration here and there to keep you happy. ## **Virgo (August 23-September 22)** Virgos sometimes forget just how easy to love they really are. And they don’t like to show any sort of vulnerability. These two notions combined mean that they typically prefer to operate under jealousy and accusations, rather than playing it cool like they so often want to do. Don’t let yourself become consumed by the idea of love. You need to give people the chance to love you. ## **Libra (September 23-October 22)** Libras are naturally independent and ambitious, which means that love is just another thing in this world that they can choose to pursue, or not pursue. This also means that when they do pick a partner, they’re nothing short of the high standards that have been set. Your high levels of self-respect often have you forcing partners to wait some time before you actually commit to anything. Once you’ve found love, your focus will shift toward stability within the relationship. ## **Scorpio (October 23-November 21)** Whoa, watch out, the Scorpio is coming through. Passionate, sexual, stubborn and intense, the Scorpio likes to follow the heart, rather than the brain. Love is highly valued by Scorpios, and they’re used to getting their way, so their relationships often include a good bit of drama. Calm and rational partners are perfect for the Scorpio; you fit best with Pisces or Cancer. ## **Sagittarius (November 22-December 21)** As the ultimate free-spirit, Sagittarius like to treat love like a journey, one that they’re not afraid to embark on. When it comes to matters of the heart, you enjoy throwing inhibition to the wind, jumping head-first into love. Fortunately, your intellectual nature attracts similar-minded partners, ones that share your enthusiasm for novelty experiences and seeing the world. Just as you want, you will likely find a partner who’s just as afraid of settling down as you are. ## **Capricorn (December 22-January 19)** Capricorns like having something to work on. This is easy for them when it comes to relationships because they’re really good at seeing big-picture type of stuff. A happy, stable life with the person that they love and call their best friend is something to work toward. You’re quite serious when it comes to life, so you expect your partner to be as well. Reckless, crazy passion has no place in your world. ## **Aquarius (January 20-February 18)** Aquarius, your big heart often reflects the type of love you desire most: passionate, intense, hot and long-lasting. If you find yourself in love with someone, don’t be afraid to be the selfless person you are. Enjoy devoting time and energy to your relationship without playing games. You’ll know when you’ve found the right person, because you’ll never want to let go once you do. ## **Pisces (February 19-March 20)** Pisces, one of the things you fear most is missing out on your chance to fall in love. You’re highly sensitive, which means your moods can be somewhat polarized at times. Good things in your relationship have you feeling happy, euphoric and carefree, while the bad things often ruin your entire day. Your naturally sweet and caring nature is redeeming, however, as you often put your partner’s needs before your own. Just remember not to sacrifice too much of your own life for the sake of theirs. h/t [**EliteDaily**](http://elitedaily.com/dating/zodiac-sign-says-love/1267932/)

If you’re looking to find love, learning a bit about what your sign desires in a partner might just be the difference between a lasting, loving relationship, and a drama-filled nightmare.

Aries (March 21-April 19)

As a youthful fire sign, Aries have a fervent energy and enthusiasm for life. Your leadership skills often let you control the flow of any relationship, which is good because you’re usually the one who is down-to-earth and level-headed.

Try not to put the cart before the horse, and people will flock to your ever burning flame.

Taurus (April 20-May 20)

Taurus have a weak spot for physical intimacy. When the physical side of a relationship picks up heavy and fast, you’re likely to start falling in love at the same time. This is largely because of how in tune you are sensually with your body.

When you do find yourself in a faithful relationship, you’re happy just ebbing and flowing within it. Which is why your dream is to settle down together somewhere remote and secluded.

Gemini (May 21-June 20)

Smart, funny and always looking on the bright side, Gemini always make great partners. They’re full of unique and intelligent ideas. They’re also incredibly romantic, which means they often fall in love and stay in love when they adore their partner.

While you might want nothing more than to be with your significant other 24/7, it is good to remember to give each other space, and to communicate with each other as much as possible.

Cancer (June 21-July 22)

While Cancers tend to fall face first into love (and hard), they keep a bit of reserved skepticism. You’re searching for someone who will be your ‘partner,’ in every sense of the word. Which is why they prefer partners who are ambitious and motivated.

Once you’ve found a partner, you’re their number one fan. And your superb listening skills and sense of humor will keep them around for years to come.

Leo (July 23-August 22)

Because Leos are so charismatic, confident and warm, they rarely struggle to find love. But there natural ability to attract others doesn’t keep them from being completely loyal once they’ve fallen for someone. And they tend to fall in love often, and hard.

As a Leo, you are naturally territorial, but it’s only because of how intense your love is. You need a bit of praise and adoration here and there to keep you happy.

Virgo (August 23-September 22)

Virgos sometimes forget just how easy to love they really are. And they don’t like to show any sort of vulnerability. These two notions combined mean that they typically prefer to operate under jealousy and accusations, rather than playing it cool like they so often want to do.

Don’t let yourself become consumed by the idea of love. You need to give people the chance to love you.

Libra (September 23-October 22)

Libras are naturally independent and ambitious, which means that love is just another thing in this world that they can choose to pursue, or not pursue. This also means that when they do pick a partner, they’re nothing short of the high standards that have been set.

Your high levels of self-respect often have you forcing partners to wait some time before you actually commit to anything.

Once you’ve found love, your focus will shift toward stability within the relationship.

Scorpio (October 23-November 21)

Whoa, watch out, the Scorpio is coming through. Passionate, sexual, stubborn and intense, the Scorpio likes to follow the heart, rather than the brain.

Love is highly valued by Scorpios, and they’re used to getting their way, so their relationships often include a good bit of drama.

Calm and rational partners are perfect for the Scorpio; you fit best with Pisces or Cancer.

Sagittarius (November 22-December 21)

As the ultimate free-spirit, Sagittarius like to treat love like a journey, one that they’re not afraid to embark on. When it comes to matters of the heart, you enjoy throwing inhibition to the wind, jumping head-first into love.

Fortunately, your intellectual nature attracts similar-minded partners, ones that share your enthusiasm for novelty experiences and seeing the world.

Just as you want, you will likely find a partner who’s just as afraid of settling down as you are.

Capricorn (December 22-January 19)

Capricorns like having something to work on. This is easy for them when it comes to relationships because they’re really good at seeing big-picture type of stuff. A happy, stable life with the person that they love and call their best friend is something to work toward.

You’re quite serious when it comes to life, so you expect your partner to be as well. Reckless, crazy passion has no place in your world.

Aquarius (January 20-February 18)

Aquarius, your big heart often reflects the type of love you desire most: passionate, intense, hot and long-lasting. If you find yourself in love with someone, don’t be afraid to be the selfless person you are. Enjoy devoting time and energy to your relationship without playing games.

You’ll know when you’ve found the right person, because you’ll never want to let go once you do.

Pisces (February 19-March 20)

Pisces, one of the things you fear most is missing out on your chance to fall in love. You’re highly sensitive, which means your moods can be somewhat polarized at times. Good things in your relationship have you feeling happy, euphoric and carefree, while the bad things often ruin your entire day.

Your naturally sweet and caring nature is redeeming, however, as you often put your partner’s needs before your own. Just remember not to sacrifice too much of your own life for the sake of theirs.

h/t EliteDaily

posts.title: Research Finds: Marrying a Smart Woman Helps Men Live Longer
posts.markdown: Men, when you go through the list of things you desire in a partner, does intelligence ever top your list? Attraction is of course multifaceted and complex, so all of us seek out different mates. But new research has found that intelligence might be the one thing we shouldn’t be ready to settle for, as **[brainy partners](http://www.simplemost.com/marrying-smart-woman-help-prolong-life/)**were found to extend lifespans and keep dementia at bay. **[Professor Lawrence Whalley](http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3529167/Marry-intelligent-woman-defeat-dementia-men-told-Experts-say-brainy-partner-acts-buffer-disease.html)**, emeritus professor of mental health in the College of Medicine and Life Sciences at the University of Aberdeen, had this to say during a talk entitled ‘Dementia: How Can We Protect Ourselves?’ “‘The thing a boy is never told he needs to do if he wants to live a longer life – but what he should do – is marry an intelligent woman. There is no better buffer (to dementia) than intelligence.” The study, which comes out of the **[University of Aberdeen](http://www.simplemost.com/marrying-smart-woman-help-prolong-life/)**, studied the health of identical twins and discovered that intelligent partners were a significant factor in how well a person was protected from degenerative brain diseases (like Alzheimer’s and dementia). It was found that men who partnered with intelligent women tended to live longer, happier lives, *and* had less risk of suffering from degenerative brain problems. This all stems from previous research showing that brain games, like **[crossword puzzles](http://iheartintelligence.com/2016/04/25/benefits-crossword-puzzles/)** for example, help stave off degenerative brain disease through stimulation of the brain. So, it would follow that a person whose brain is engaged and stimulated by their partner regularly would gain much of the same benefit. In fact, a small number of men who were married to intelligent partners *did *show signs of dementia during brain scans, but didn’t exhibit any of the symptoms, and were actually deemed “highly intelligent” and cognitively functional. Figuring out how to shift a cultural preference from beauty to intelligence is an endeavor we have yet to solve, however. It has been seen that **[girls who grow up valuing their intelligence](http://everydayfeminism.com/2014/07/girls-taught-to-avoid-smart/)** tend to be more independent, as well as empowered. Young boys who value intelligence have been seen to have stronger relationships with women and show far more support for their wives and daughters. Now, an argument can be made that choosing an intelligent wife is not only in your family’s best interest, but it is also beneficial to your overall well being and happiness!
posts.html:
Men, when you go through the list of things you desire in a partner, does intelligence ever top your list? Attraction is of course multifaceted and complex, so all of us seek out different mates. But new research has found that intelligence might be the one thing we shouldn’t be ready to settle for, as brainy partnerswere found to extend lifespans and keep dementia at bay.

Professor Lawrence Whalley, emeritus professor of mental health in the College of Medicine and Life Sciences at the University of Aberdeen, had this to say during a talk entitled ‘Dementia: How Can We Protect Ourselves?’

“‘The thing a boy is never told he needs to do if he wants to live a longer life – but what he should do – is marry an intelligent woman. There is no better buffer (to dementia) than intelligence.”

The study, which comes out of the University of Aberdeen, studied the health of identical twins and discovered that intelligent partners were a significant factor in how well a person was protected from degenerative brain diseases (like Alzheimer’s and dementia).

It was found that men who partnered with intelligent women tended to live longer, happier lives, and had less risk of suffering from degenerative brain problems. This all stems from previous research showing that brain games, like crossword puzzles for example, help stave off degenerative brain disease through stimulation of the brain.

So, it would follow that a person whose brain is engaged and stimulated by their partner regularly would gain much of the same benefit. In fact, a small number of men who were married to intelligent partners did show signs of dementia during brain scans, but didn’t exhibit any of the symptoms, and were actually deemed “highly intelligent” and cognitively functional.

Figuring out how to shift a cultural preference from beauty to intelligence is an endeavor we have yet to solve, however.

It has been seen that girls who grow up valuing their intelligence tend to be more independent, as well as empowered. Young boys who value intelligence have been seen to have stronger relationships with women and show far more support for their wives and daughters.

Now, an argument can be made that choosing an intelligent wife is not only in your family’s best interest, but it is also beneficial to your overall well being and happiness!

posts.title: The Real Reasons Women Leave the Men They Love
posts.markdown: When a woman enters into a relationship, she is dedicated to seeing it succeed.  That deep commitment means that she’s likely to trust her partner unconditionally, care for him endlessly and love him passionately.  She puts her partner before herself and is willing to give everything she has, even if it leads her in the wrong direction. Women who do not respect themselves will often end up in a hollow and harmful relationship, being manipulated and emotionally taken advantage of.  Self-respect is key to a healthy relationship, as men seek out women who are strong and independent, who recognize their worth and make sure that others recognize it as well. Self-respect also gives you perspective.  The type of perspective that allows you to see something for what it truly is.  It gives a woman the power to leave the man she loves because it becomes crystal clear that she loved him for all of the wrong reasons. Here are a few reasons that women will leave the men they fall in love with: **Failure to communicate** Women like having someone that they can talk with about things, and while they recognize that their partner cannot be with them 24/7, not being there when she needs you is a surefire way to get her to start packing her things.   Also, ‘being there’ means *actually* being there.  She wants you to listen and to give her feedback, not for you to simply nod and agree with everything she says. **A physical connection is more important than you might think** While men typically get pegged as the sexual ones in a relationship, women are just as sexual, if not more so.  Ignoring her sexual needs and desires will likely give off the impression that you’re getting your satisfaction elsewhere, or that she is unwanted.  Both of these damage the relationship. Caring about your partner’s needs in bed also says that you value the relationship and that you want it to last.  Lust will always fade, but a true kind of love means you’re naturally attracted to your partner for much longer. **Insecurity** Everyone has them, but some are better at hiding them than others.  Outwardly projecting your insecurities is a great way to turn someone off from you entirely.  If a woman’s partner doesn’t trust her, and is constantly expressing distrust in her, she sees it as a lack of love and faith.   When you truly love your partner, you trust them entirely and know that they will not do anything to harm you.  This means no snooping through phones or email accounts looking for dirt. **Lack of personal space** People absolutely need time to themselves, it’s a natural part of growing in life.  Suffocating a woman by not allowing her to spend time alone or with her friends causes resentment and unrest.  Always be sure to give her time and space to grow organically in her own way, just as you should be doing as well. **You try to change her** When you fall in love with a woman, you should be sure that you’re falling for who she is, not who you think she will become or who you can transform her into.  Every person deserves to be loved for who they are, and being with someone who is constantly trying to change every aspect about who you are will drive you insane. h/t [**RelRules**](http://www.relrules.com/why-women-leave-men-they-love/)
posts.html:
When a woman enters into a relationship, she is dedicated to seeing it succeed.  That deep commitment means that she’s likely to trust her partner unconditionally, care for him endlessly and love him passionately.  She puts her partner before herself and is willing to give everything she has, even if it leads her in the wrong direction.

Women who do not respect themselves will often end up in a hollow and harmful relationship, being manipulated and emotionally taken advantage of.  Self-respect is key to a healthy relationship, as men seek out women who are strong and independent, who recognize their worth and make sure that others recognize it as well.

Self-respect also gives you perspective.  The type of perspective that allows you to see something for what it truly is.  It gives a woman the power to leave the man she loves because it becomes crystal clear that she loved him for all of the wrong reasons.

Here are a few reasons that women will leave the men they fall in love with:

Failure to communicate

Women like having someone that they can talk with about things, and while they recognize that their partner cannot be with them 24/7, not being there when she needs you is a surefire way to get her to start packing her things.  

Also, ‘being there’ means actually being there.  She wants you to listen and to give her feedback, not for you to simply nod and agree with everything she says.

A physical connection is more important than you might think

While men typically get pegged as the sexual ones in a relationship, women are just as sexual, if not more so.  Ignoring her sexual needs and desires will likely give off the impression that you’re getting your satisfaction elsewhere, or that she is unwanted.  Both of these damage the relationship.

Caring about your partner’s needs in bed also says that you value the relationship and that you want it to last.  Lust will always fade, but a true kind of love means you’re naturally attracted to your partner for much longer.

Insecurity

Everyone has them, but some are better at hiding them than others.  Outwardly projecting your insecurities is a great way to turn someone off from you entirely.  If a woman’s partner doesn’t trust her, and is constantly expressing distrust in her, she sees it as a lack of love and faith.  

When you truly love your partner, you trust them entirely and know that they will not do anything to harm you.  This means no snooping through phones or email accounts looking for dirt.

Lack of personal space

People absolutely need time to themselves, it’s a natural part of growing in life.  Suffocating a woman by not allowing her to spend time alone or with her friends causes resentment and unrest.  Always be sure to give her time and space to grow organically in her own way, just as you should be doing as well.

You try to change her

When you fall in love with a woman, you should be sure that you’re falling for who she is, not who you think she will become or who you can transform her into.  Every person deserves to be loved for who they are, and being with someone who is constantly trying to change every aspect about who you are will drive you insane.

h/t RelRules

posts.title: This Ad About An Abandoned Children Has a Powerful Ending
posts.markdown: While the video below portrays a fictitious story, tales like this one are common all over the world. A married couple makes the decision to build their family a little bigger by adopting a little girl. At first, things were going exactly as planned. The little girl they had adopted was getting along famously with her new sister and the family was happy. But as time went on, the young girl’s place in the family came into question. She started making little mistakes at home, and began whining for attention and love. After one particularly bad mess she made, the family starts to think that maybe they made the wrong decision to adopt her. She’s not behaving like a normal child, even though they know that she has had an unfortunate past. So, the family decides that this little girl has to go. The dad takes her to a field in the middle of nowhere and leaves her there, by herself. But as he’s driving away, he sees the little girl in his rear-view mirror, and what happens next is absolutely shocking. Watch and experience this powerful video that challenges you to think about innocent beings who are abandoned every day. *And don’t forget to share with friends and family who you think would also be moved by this story* Source: [**YouTube**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMs7dkdO4YY)
posts.html:

But as time went on, the young girl’s place in the family came into question. She started making little mistakes at home, and began whining for attention and love. So, the family decides that this little girl has to go. The dad takes her to a field in the middle of nowhere and leaves her there, by herself. But as he’s driving away, he sees the little girl in his rear-view mirror, and what happens next is absolutely shocking.

posts.title: Man Takes His Dying Dog On One Last Adventure
posts.markdown: All Photos Courtesy of [**Kugler and Bella**](https://www.facebook.com/robert.kugler1). “Man’s best friend” has been the phrase used to describe our canine companions for as long as we can remember, and with good reason.  Dogs make some of the best pets and most owners come to see them as their children or members of the family.   Thus, one of the saddest parts of dog ownership is knowing that you will likely outlive your best friend, a possibility that turned into reality for Robert Kugler.   Kugler’s best friend was a chocolate labrador named Bella, and she was diagnosed with bone cancer in her leg. After her leg was amputated, Kugler hoped that would be the end of it, but the cancer had actually spread to Bella’s lungs and was now terminal. ![ ](http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160713132208-bella-cleveland-exlarge-169.jpg) “This is one of the biggest connections I’ve ever had to another living being. I don’t care that it’s a dog,” said Kugler. Kugler has been with his pup since adopting her about nine years ago, so finding out that she might not around for much longer was devastating. “I just didn’t want her to be gone one day when I came home,” he said. So, Kugler decided that he and Bella needed to take one last adventure together, their biggest one yet.  Starting out at the Marine Corps. Ball in Chicago (because Kugler is a Marine veteran), Bella and Kugler travelled to random locations around the region.   ![ ](http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160713132656-belle-niagara-falls-exlarge-169.jpg) ![ ](http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160713133115-bella-fenway-park-exlarge-169.jpg) ![ ](http://i2.cdn.turner.com/cnnnext/dam/assets/160713133331-bella-lincoln-memorial-exlarge-169.jpg) From the Niagra Falls to Fenway Park to the Lincoln Memorial, Kugler and Bella camped out of the car or couchsurfed with friends as they made their way to each new destination.   “I want to inspire people to get outside and live,” Kugler said. “Love each other for who we are and make friends.” While Bella has survived for longer than doctors had anticipated, Kugler recognizes that her time is limited. “Some days I’m completely prepared. I pictured her just swimming out to sea,” “But there’s other days when I’m like, oh my God, I can’t bear the thought of it.” “We take on these animals, which means we’re gonna take on their life and their passing,” Kugler said. “To be there with them when they pass is the greatest gift you can give anybody.” After Bella has passed, Kugler says he’ll likely try to spend more time volunteering with organizations like [Team Rubicon](http://www.teamrubiconusa.org/) and [Team Red, White & Blue](https://www.teamrwb.org/), both of which focus on helping veterans. In the meantime, Kugler hopes that everyone can be inspired by Bella’s story to “Wag more [and] bark less.” *You can keep following Kugler and Bella on social media: * *[Twitter](https://twitter.com/robkugler) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/robert.kugler1) | [Instragram](https://www.instagram.com/robkugler/)*
posts.html:
All Photos Courtesy of Kugler and Bella.

“Man’s best friend” has been the phrase used to describe our canine companions for as long as we can remember, and with good reason.  Dogs make some of the best pets and most owners come to see them as their children or members of the family.  

Thus, one of the saddest parts of dog ownership is knowing that you will likely outlive your best friend, a possibility that turned into reality for Robert Kugler.  

Kugler’s best friend was a chocolate labrador named Bella, and she was diagnosed with bone cancer in her leg. After her leg was amputated, Kugler hoped that would be the end of it, but the cancer had actually spread to Bella’s lungs and was now terminal.

“This is one of the biggest connections I’ve ever had to another living being. I don’t care that it’s a dog,” said Kugler.

Kugler has been with his pup since adopting her about nine years ago, so finding out that she might not around for much longer was devastating.

“I just didn’t want her to be gone one day when I came home,” he said.

So, Kugler decided that he and Bella needed to take one last adventure together, their biggest one yet.  Starting out at the Marine Corps. Ball in Chicago (because Kugler is a Marine veteran), Bella and Kugler travelled to random locations around the region.  

From the Niagra Falls to Fenway Park to the Lincoln Memorial, Kugler and Bella camped out of the car or couchsurfed with friends as they made their way to each new destination.  

“I want to inspire people to get outside and live,” Kugler said. “Love each other for who we are and make friends.”

While Bella has survived for longer than doctors had anticipated, Kugler recognizes that her time is limited.

“Some days I’m completely prepared. I pictured her just swimming out to sea,”

“But there’s other days when I’m like, oh my God, I can’t bear the thought of it.”

“We take on these animals, which means we’re gonna take on their life and their passing,” Kugler said. “To be there with them when they pass is the greatest gift you can give anybody.”

After Bella has passed, Kugler says he’ll likely try to spend more time volunteering with organizations like Team Rubicon and Team Red, White & Blue, both of which focus on helping veterans.

In the meantime, Kugler hopes that everyone can be inspired by Bella’s story to “Wag more [and] bark less.”

*You can keep following Kugler and Bella on social media: *

Twitter | Facebook | Instragram

posts.title: 4 Reasons That Long Distance BFFs Make the Best BFFs
posts.markdown: If you have a BFF, you’re pretty lucky. Not everyone is blessed with loving friends, let alone one good, amazing friend who always has your back no matter what. I recently stumbled across a BFF of my own and I have to say, it’s a pretty great feeling. Maybe you have a BFF, but he or she lives across the world from you, making your relationship more long distance than anything. But that’s not necessarily a bad thing! Some of the closest and most passionate relationships happen at a distance, so if you have a long distance BFF, here are four reasons that they’re so great: **You don’t have any other choice but to communicate with one another** Because your long distance BFF might not run into you at the store, make a surprise visit to your place of work for some lunch, or get to meet up with you for happy hour on Friday, you have to actually work to communicate with them. This means you set aside time specifically for them to discuss the important happenings of life. Whether it’s a big promotion at work or a crazy story from the weekend, your communication is valued and genuine. **They help you see from other perspectives** It’s incredibly easy to get so caught up in your own life that you forget there’s an entire world that exists outside of your own. Your long distance BFF, who is outside of it all, knows exactly how to bring you back to a grounded state: they’ll tell you how it is, no sugarcoating. As someone who only has your best interests in mind, the long distance BFF will always give you real advice when you need it. You don’t need to worry about them having ulterior motives or wanting to stir up drama, because they’re a thousand miles away. **The time you do get to spend together is priceless** ‘Reunited and it feels so good’ has never been more accurate than when two long distance BFFs come together after a long time apart. This is definitely one case where absence makes the heart grow fonder. Even if the two of you talk on the phone regularly, you never run out of things to say and share when you finally meet up in person. **Your relationship takes work from both of you, work you can be proud of** Every person who’s ever had a BFF knows that it’s not always sunshine and rainbows. Having good friends isn’t always easy, but it’s almost always worth it. Having that BFF be long distance only adds to the work. You have to want it in order for it work. If you’re content sending a text every now and then when you remember something funny or simply don’t have time to communicate, you’re not showing the other person that you want them in your life. Good friends are hard to come by, so if you and your friend put in the time and effort to make it work, that’s something you can both be proud of. So, take the time to let your long distance BFF know just how important they are to you!
posts.html:
If you have a BFF, you’re pretty lucky. Not everyone is blessed with loving friends, let alone one good, amazing friend who always has your back no matter what. I recently stumbled across a BFF of my own and I have to say, it’s a pretty great feeling.

Maybe you have a BFF, but he or she lives across the world from you, making your relationship more long distance than anything. But that’s not necessarily a bad thing!

Some of the closest and most passionate relationships happen at a distance, so if you have a long distance BFF, here are four reasons that they’re so great:

You don’t have any other choice but to communicate with one another

Because your long distance BFF might not run into you at the store, make a surprise visit to your place of work for some lunch, or get to meet up with you for happy hour on Friday, you have to actually work to communicate with them.

This means you set aside time specifically for them to discuss the important happenings of life. Whether it’s a big promotion at work or a crazy story from the weekend, your communication is valued and genuine.

They help you see from other perspectives

It’s incredibly easy to get so caught up in your own life that you forget there’s an entire world that exists outside of your own. Your long distance BFF, who is outside of it all, knows exactly how to bring you back to a grounded state: they’ll tell you how it is, no sugarcoating.

As someone who only has your best interests in mind, the long distance BFF will always give you real advice when you need it. You don’t need to worry about them having ulterior motives or wanting to stir up drama, because they’re a thousand miles away.

The time you do get to spend together is priceless

‘Reunited and it feels so good’ has never been more accurate than when two long distance BFFs come together after a long time apart. This is definitely one case where absence makes the heart grow fonder.

Even if the two of you talk on the phone regularly, you never run out of things to say and share when you finally meet up in person.

Your relationship takes work from both of you, work you can be proud of

Every person who’s ever had a BFF knows that it’s not always sunshine and rainbows. Having good friends isn’t always easy, but it’s almost always worth it. Having that BFF be long distance only adds to the work. You have to want it in order for it work.

If you’re content sending a text every now and then when you remember something funny or simply don’t have time to communicate, you’re not showing the other person that you want them in your life.

Good friends are hard to come by, so if you and your friend put in the time and effort to make it work, that’s something you can both be proud of. So, take the time to let your long distance BFF know just how important they are to you!

posts.title: 6 Things Introverts Will Never Tell You
posts.markdown: Being charismatic, outgoing and lively in social settings is something that most people desire, not only for themselves, but for others.  Introverts of the world often find themselves on the outside looking in, simply because they’re different than most extroverted people.   But there are a few things that they want others to know about them, so that relationships and certain situations aren’t turned into bigger deals than they actually are. Here are six things you should know about the introvert: **We’re not too concerned about your birthday** Introverts who work in your average office especially know what it’s like to not care about the happenings of birthdays.  We’re not interested in shelling out money for a birthday cake and we’re not about to show a sudden enthusiasm for your special day.  If you invite us out for drinks with 30 other people, chances are we’ll say no.  Or you cannot invite us at all, we’re fine with either, we just want to go home. **We’re not super interested in what you did this weekend** As introverts, we carefully pick and choose the people we spend our time with.  Random acquaintances and coworkers don’t often fit the bill.  We won’t judge you for how you spend your time and think that everyone needs a bit of privacy, but we can’t spend energy on you either. **Crowds are not for us** Being around a large number of people can be incredibly overwhelming, simply because there are so many different people, all unique in their own way.  And if an introvert is also somewhat empathic, they’re prone to absorbing the energies of others.  This makes crowded spaces too stimulating and chaotic for us. **We can be extroverted when we want to** Being social is not *entirely* alien to us.  We can be the charismatic and lively partygoer, and we can host social events.  But know that often times the thing getting us through these events is knowing that we’ll be able to go home afterward.   After experiences like these, we like to take a few days or weeks to recharge. **Rude, shy and uptight do not describe us** Many people get angry with introverts or feel that they cannot talk to them.  It might seem this way initially, but once you get to know us, you’ll find that we make good friends who are never lacking in good conversation or bouts of laughter.   We’re terrible at faking emotions, so our faces usually betray any attempt to stifle them. **We’re very picky about who we spend time with** Alone time is precious to us, so choosing to spend time with other people is a big deal.  If we choose the wrong person, we can be easily drained and overwhelmed.  Other introverts are a good choice because of their groundedness and sense of control, while extroverts tend to wane on us. Being around other introverts is easy because of the mutual understandings.
posts.html:
Being charismatic, outgoing and lively in social settings is something that most people desire, not only for themselves, but for others.  Introverts of the world often find themselves on the outside looking in, simply because they’re different than most extroverted people.  

But there are a few things that they want others to know about them, so that relationships and certain situations aren’t turned into bigger deals than they actually are.

Here are six things you should know about the introvert:

We’re not too concerned about your birthday

Introverts who work in your average office especially know what it’s like to not care about the happenings of birthdays.  We’re not interested in shelling out money for a birthday cake and we’re not about to show a sudden enthusiasm for your special day.  If you invite us out for drinks with 30 other people, chances are we’ll say no.  Or you cannot invite us at all, we’re fine with either, we just want to go home.

We’re not super interested in what you did this weekend

As introverts, we carefully pick and choose the people we spend our time with.  Random acquaintances and coworkers don’t often fit the bill.  We won’t judge you for how you spend your time and think that everyone needs a bit of privacy, but we can’t spend energy on you either.

Crowds are not for us

Being around a large number of people can be incredibly overwhelming, simply because there are so many different people, all unique in their own way.  And if an introvert is also somewhat empathic, they’re prone to absorbing the energies of others.  This makes crowded spaces too stimulating and chaotic for us.

We can be extroverted when we want to

Being social is not entirely alien to us.  We can be the charismatic and lively partygoer, and we can host social events.  But know that often times the thing getting us through these events is knowing that we’ll be able to go home afterward.  

After experiences like these, we like to take a few days or weeks to recharge.

Rude, shy and uptight do not describe us

Many people get angry with introverts or feel that they cannot talk to them.  It might seem this way initially, but once you get to know us, you’ll find that we make good friends who are never lacking in good conversation or bouts of laughter.  

We’re terrible at faking emotions, so our faces usually betray any attempt to stifle them.

We’re very picky about who we spend time with

Alone time is precious to us, so choosing to spend time with other people is a big deal.  If we choose the wrong person, we can be easily drained and overwhelmed.  Other introverts are a good choice because of their groundedness and sense of control, while extroverts tend to wane on us.

Being around other introverts is easy because of the mutual understandings.

posts.title: 5 Laws of Happiness That Will Change Your Life
posts.markdown: How often do you think of your happiness? Do you fantasize about the life you want to live, the job you want to work, the friends you want to have, the partner you want to be with? Maybe happiness, for you, has nothing to do with any of those things, but at least you know what it is you want. Some people live their entire lives unhappy and often have no idea why. The reality is that it’s because they’re not being truthful to themselves. They lie and lie to themselves, just to avoid their own reality, their own truth. Happiness can be hard to achieve, but it is possible. Here are five laws of happiness that will help you work toward the life you want and deserve: **Never sacrifice your integrity, for it is at the core of a happy life** Conflict is a natural part of life, it will always be something you have to deal with. What you might now know is that a majority of the conflict in your life arises when you’re not being true to yourself. Behaving differently than what we feel at our deepest being causes us tremendous grief. Focus on who you are and what truly makes you happy. It is only there that you will ever find happiness. **Happiness is born from freedom, and freedom is born from courage** Sometimes happiness is right under your nose, but you can’t get to it because you’re not willing to step outside of your comfort zone. I’m sure there are other things in your world that you have no trouble risking, so why not risk a little bit for the sake of your happiness? Don’t be afraid of vulnerability, because it is often in our most vulnerable moments that we find ourselves. **Easy doesn’t always translate into happy** Some of the most successful and happy people on the planet have come from nothing. But they followed their hearts and knew that the world was never going to open up to them if they never opened up to it. Don’t expect the perfect life to just fall into your lap one day. Build it. Acknowledge that it’s going to be hard work and then move forward with determination. **Happiness is only possible if we’re unhappy every now and then too** Fully experiencing and embracing your emotions for what they are is one step to understanding the overall picture. Once you realize that happiness simply cannot exist without sadness, you truly see that each of them serve a purpose. Light and darkness exist side-by-side in a dichotomy as old as time. **Comparing yourself to others does not promote positivity** Comparing yourself to other people is a process that comes from insecurity, jealousy, envy, doubt and fear. It never comes from a happy, loving place. So it makes absolutely no sense whatsoever to compare yourself to anyone other than *yourself*. When you start to compare yourself to others, try instead to compare yourself now to a past version of yourself. Then you can truly see how much you’ve grown and how much it took to get here. h/t [**marcandangel**](http://www.marcandangel.com/2015/09/16/12-laws-of-happiness-that-will-change-your-life/)
posts.html:
How often do you think of your happiness? Do you fantasize about the life you want to live, the job you want to work, the friends you want to have, the partner you want to be with? Maybe happiness, for you, has nothing to do with any of those things, but at least you know what it is you want.

Some people live their entire lives unhappy and often have no idea why. The reality is that it’s because they’re not being truthful to themselves. They lie and lie to themselves, just to avoid their own reality, their own truth.

Happiness can be hard to achieve, but it is possible. Here are five laws of happiness that will help you work toward the life you want and deserve:

Never sacrifice your integrity, for it is at the core of a happy life

Conflict is a natural part of life, it will always be something you have to deal with. What you might now know is that a majority of the conflict in your life arises when you’re not being true to yourself. Behaving differently than what we feel at our deepest being causes us tremendous grief.

Focus on who you are and what truly makes you happy. It is only there that you will ever find happiness.

Happiness is born from freedom, and freedom is born from courage

Sometimes happiness is right under your nose, but you can’t get to it because you’re not willing to step outside of your comfort zone. I’m sure there are other things in your world that you have no trouble risking, so why not risk a little bit for the sake of your happiness?

Don’t be afraid of vulnerability, because it is often in our most vulnerable moments that we find ourselves.

Easy doesn’t always translate into happy

Some of the most successful and happy people on the planet have come from nothing. But they followed their hearts and knew that the world was never going to open up to them if they never opened up to it.

Don’t expect the perfect life to just fall into your lap one day. Build it. Acknowledge that it’s going to be hard work and then move forward with determination.

Happiness is only possible if we’re unhappy every now and then too

Fully experiencing and embracing your emotions for what they are is one step to understanding the overall picture. Once you realize that happiness simply cannot exist without sadness, you truly see that each of them serve a purpose.

Light and darkness exist side-by-side in a dichotomy as old as time.

Comparing yourself to others does not promote positivity

Comparing yourself to other people is a process that comes from insecurity, jealousy, envy, doubt and fear. It never comes from a happy, loving place. So it makes absolutely no sense whatsoever to compare yourself to anyone other than yourself.

When you start to compare yourself to others, try instead to compare yourself now to a past version of yourself. Then you can truly see how much you’ve grown and how much it took to get here.

h/t marcandangel

posts.title: This Colorado City Created Affordable Housing Almost Overnight
posts.markdown: Housing is easily one of the most expensive parts of anyone’s budget, with most experts suggesting that you only spend about a third of your monthly income on housing, max.  But if you’re like the millions of people around the country who are currently spending at least half or more of their income on housing, you know life can be tough. **[Durango, Colorado](https://www.planning.org/events/nationalconferenceactivity/9001901/)**, is one city that was seeking a way to create affordable housing, and instead of building new infrastructure, decided to tweak some of their rules and policies.  Much of how they did this surrounds ‘Accessory Dwelling Units,’ which are basically the finished basements, above-garage studios, rebuilt carriage houses, and other similar type buildings that rest on lots typically zoned for single-family homes. City officials realized that Durango already had a plethora of ADUs in and around the city, but no one could live in them because of the restrictions put in place that tightly regulate who can live in them. Starting in 2009, Durango worked on overhauling its Land Use and Development Code.  Under their revised code, standards were put in place to guide the development of new ADUs, including a limit on how many occupants they could have (five unrelated persons), rules on how small the living space could be (550 sq. ft.), rules on owner-occupied home requirements (meaning landlords cannot be absent while renting out both their home and ADU), and bans on short-term vacation rentals like through AirBnB.   Existing ADUs were the only real problem with the new code, because no one knew what to do with them.  Most of them were considered illegal, so to bypass this with as little pain as possible, a type of “ADU amnesty” was put in place as officials asked owners of current ADUs with residents to come forward. Having an established ADU that was completely under the radar, meaning it wasn’t official in any way, landed people fines ranging from $2000 to $9000, but they got to keep their ADUs, they were just logged into the city’s inventory database. This ADU amnesty program was largely successful, as this sort of informal and underground economy was regularized with the coming forward of more and more people who were operating unofficial ADUs.   Some members of the Durango community opposed this new code, suggesting that it would turn much of the neighborhoods and residential areas into ‘slums,’ instead of viewing the work as progress toward affordable housing.   Durango’s story comes at a perfect time, as **[more and more communities](http://www.seattletimes.com/opinion/mother-in-law-units-are-key-to-housing-affordability/) from [around the country](http://www.bostonglobe.com/opinion/2016/04/30/how-grandma-can-help-housing-crunch/BBul6fbzcinQ4iEPtsmvVJ/story.html?)** struggle to address similar housing problems.   What do you think about Durango’s push to create affordable housing?  Are they doing it the right way? h/t [**City Lab**](http://www.citylab.com/design/2016/05/how-one-colorado-city-instantly-created-affordable-housing/483027/)
posts.html:
Housing is easily one of the most expensive parts of anyone’s budget, with most experts suggesting that you only spend about a third of your monthly income on housing, max.  But if you’re like the millions of people around the country who are currently spending at least half or more of their income on housing, you know life can be tough.

Durango, Colorado, is one city that was seeking a way to create affordable housing, and instead of building new infrastructure, decided to tweak some of their rules and policies.  Much of how they did this surrounds ‘Accessory Dwelling Units,’ which are basically the finished basements, above-garage studios, rebuilt carriage houses, and other similar type buildings that rest on lots typically zoned for single-family homes.

City officials realized that Durango already had a plethora of ADUs in and around the city, but no one could live in them because of the restrictions put in place that tightly regulate who can live in them.

Starting in 2009, Durango worked on overhauling its Land Use and Development Code.  Under their revised code, standards were put in place to guide the development of new ADUs, including a limit on how many occupants they could have (five unrelated persons), rules on how small the living space could be (550 sq. ft.), rules on owner-occupied home requirements (meaning landlords cannot be absent while renting out both their home and ADU), and bans on short-term vacation rentals like through AirBnB.  

Existing ADUs were the only real problem with the new code, because no one knew what to do with them.  Most of them were considered illegal, so to bypass this with as little pain as possible, a type of “ADU amnesty” was put in place as officials asked owners of current ADUs with residents to come forward.

Having an established ADU that was completely under the radar, meaning it wasn’t official in any way, landed people fines ranging from $2000 to $9000, but they got to keep their ADUs, they were just logged into the city’s inventory database.

This ADU amnesty program was largely successful, as this sort of informal and underground economy was regularized with the coming forward of more and more people who were operating unofficial ADUs.  

Some members of the Durango community opposed this new code, suggesting that it would turn much of the neighborhoods and residential areas into ‘slums,’ instead of viewing the work as progress toward affordable housing.  

Durango’s story comes at a perfect time, as more and more communities from around the country struggle to address similar housing problems.  

What do you think about Durango’s push to create affordable housing?  Are they doing it the right way?

h/t City Lab

posts.title: Dog Gets Confronted About a Giant Mess, Quickly Points Out Who Actually Did It
posts.markdown: Tattletaling is widely regarded as one of the worst things you can do to another person or creature. We all make mistakes and screw up every now and then, and no one wants to get thrown under the bus when it comes to getting in trouble! In many cultures, tattletaling is a serious party foul, and it often comes with serious repercussions. In school, if you tell on another kid, it’s pretty much considered fair game if they dole out a form of punishment on you. As we grow older the consequences can become even more grave. People in prison or part of street cultures (gangs, etc.) see “ratting someone out” as the most severe form of betrayal, and it is usually paid back in full with vicious beatings or even death! But when you’re a dog, and your dog buddy destroys the house, sometimes you just *have* to rat out your friend. Because you know that if you don’t, it could possibly be your butt on the line! Dogs have an uncanny sense of guilt. They know when they’re doing something wrong, and when they get caught, you can see it on their faces. Which is pretty much exactly the situation for this little French Bulldog. Not only did she destroy the house, but her older Bull Mastiff brother doesn’t want any part of it. He’s ready to rat her out the second he’s confronted about the mess. While it’s already pretty obvious who the culprit is, the owner of these two pups couldn’t help but ask both of them what happened. She got the answer she was looking for when the Bull Mastiff kindly pointed his paw toward his little sister, ratting her out while increasing his chances of a treat at the same time. A winning situation for him!

In many cultures, tattletaling is a serious party foul, and it often comes with serious repercussions. In school, if you tell on another kid, it’s pretty much considered fair game if they dole out a form of punishment on you.

As we grow older the consequences can become even more grave. People in prison or part of street cultures (gangs, etc.) see “ratting someone out” as the most severe form of betrayal, and it is usually paid back in full with vicious beatings or even death!

But when you’re a dog, and your dog buddy destroys the house, sometimes you just have to rat out your friend. Because you know that if you don’t, it could possibly be your butt on the line!

Dogs have an uncanny sense of guilt. They know when they’re doing something wrong, and when they get caught, you can see it on their faces.

Which is pretty much exactly the situation for this little French Bulldog. Not only did she destroy the house, but her older Bull Mastiff brother doesn’t want any part of it. He’s ready to rat her out the second he’s confronted about the mess.

She got the answer she was looking for when the Bull Mastiff kindly pointed his paw toward his little sister, ratting her out while increasing his chances of a treat at the same time.

A winning situation for him!
